name: Abdominal Abscess
definition: A localized collection of pus within the abdominal cavity, typically caused by infection or inflammation. Radiologically characterized by a fluid-filled mass with irregular margins and potential surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA)
definition: A localized dilatation of the abdominal aorta exceeding 3 cm in diameter. Radiologically identified through CT or ultrasound as a focal enlargement of the aortic vessel with potential risk of rupture.

name: Abdominal/Pelvic Abscess
definition: A purulent collection located in the abdominal or pelvic regions, often resulting from infection, surgery, or inflammatory processes. Radiologically detected as a fluid-containing mass with complex internal architecture.

name: Aberrant Right Subclavian Artery
definition: A congenital vascular anomaly where the right subclavian artery originates abnormally from the aortic arch. Radiologically identified through CT angiography or vascular imaging studies.

name: Abscess
definition: A localized collection of pus within tissue or organ spaces, typically resulting from bacterial infection. Radiologically characterized by a fluid-filled cavity with inflammatory changes.

name: Abscess (General)
definition: A generalized term for a localized collection of pus within body tissues, representing a defensive response to infection. Radiologically appears as a fluid-containing lesion with surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Abscess (Post-operative)
definition: An infectious collection developing after surgical intervention, characterized by localized pus formation at or near the surgical site. Radiologically identified as a fluid collection with potential tissue disruption.

name: Abscessed diverticulitis
definition: A severe inflammatory condition of diverticula complicated by abscess formation. Radiologically characterized by inflammatory changes in the colon with localized fluid collections.

name: Abscessed Diverticulitis (Hinchey I)
definition: An early stage of diverticular abscess with minimal inflammatory changes, typically confined to the diverticular area. Radiologically shows localized inflammation without significant fluid collection.

name: Abscesses
definition: Multiple infectious collections of pus within different body regions or tissues. Radiologically appears as multiple fluid-containing lesions with surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: AC joint arthropathy
definition: Degenerative changes affecting the acromioclavicular joint, characterized by joint space narrowing and potential osteophyte formation. Radiologically identified through X-ray or CT imaging.

name: Acalculous Cholecystitis
definition: An inflammatory condition of the gallbladder occurring without gallstones, often associated with critical illness. Radiologically characterized by gallbladder wall thickening and potential pericholecystic fluid.

name: Accessory ossicle
definition: An additional small bone or ossification center separate from the main skeletal structure. Radiologically appears as a distinct osseous fragment near normal bone.

name: Accidental trauma
definition: Unintentional physical injury resulting from external forces. Radiologically evaluated through various imaging modalities to assess tissue and skeletal damage.

name: Achalasia
definition: A motility disorder of the esophagus characterized by failure of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax. Radiologically identified through barium swallow studies showing esophageal dilation and narrowing at the gastroesophageal junction.

name: Achilles Tendinosis
definition: Degenerative condition of the Achilles tendon characterized by structural changes and potential thickening or nodularity on imaging. Radiological findings typically include tendon swelling, altered signal intensity, and potential calcifications.

name: Achilles Tendon Partial Tear
definition: Incomplete disruption of the Achilles tendon fibers, visible on imaging as a focal area of tendon discontinuity or signal abnormality. Ultrasound and MRI can demonstrate the extent and location of the partial tear.

name: Achilles Tendon Rupture (Complete Tear)
definition: Complete disruption of the Achilles tendon, demonstrable on imaging as a total separation of tendon fibers with a visible gap. Typically diagnosed through ultrasound or MRI with characteristic findings of complete tendon discontinuity.

name: Achondrogenesis
definition: Severe genetic disorder of bone and cartilage development characterized by profound skeletal abnormalities detectable through radiographic imaging. Prenatal and postnatal imaging reveals significant growth and developmental impairments.

name: Achondroplasia
definition: Genetic disorder of bone growth resulting in disproportionate short stature, characterized by specific radiographic skeletal features. Imaging reveals characteristic bone development abnormalities, particularly in long bones and skull.

name: ACL Tear
definition: Ligament injury of the anterior cruciate ligament in the knee, typically visualized through MRI showing complete or partial disruption of ligament fibers. Radiological assessment reveals signal intensity changes and potential ligament discontinuity.

name: Acquired brain injury
definition: Traumatic or non-traumatic brain damage occurring after birth, detectable through neuroimaging techniques like CT and MRI. Imaging reveals structural changes, potential hemorrhage, or tissue damage.

name: Acquired Cystic Disease of Kidney (ACDK)
definition: Progressive kidney condition characterized by multiple cyst formations in previously normal kidney tissue, identifiable through CT or ultrasound imaging. Radiological findings include multiple fluid-filled cysts of varying sizes.

name: Acquired Cystic Kidney Disease
definition: Kidney disorder involving development of multiple cysts in previously normal renal tissue, detectable through cross-sectional imaging. Radiological assessment reveals progressive cyst formation and potential kidney structural changes.

name: Acquired tonsillar ectopia
definition: Downward displacement of cerebellar tonsils through the foramen magnum, visualized on neuroimaging as abnormal cerebellar positioning. MRI reveals characteristic tonsillar herniation below the foramen magnum.

name: Active Bleeding
definition: Radiographically identifiable vascular leakage or hemorrhage within body tissues or organs. Imaging techniques like CT angiography can demonstrate active blood extravasation.

name: Active Gastrointestinal Hemorrhage
definition: Ongoing bleeding within the gastrointestinal tract, detectable through various imaging modalities like CT, endoscopy, or nuclear medicine studies. Radiological findings include active contrast extravasation or blood pool visualization.

name: Active Infection/Inflammation
definition: Radiographically observable inflammatory process characterized by tissue changes, increased vascularity, and potential fluid collections. Imaging reveals characteristic inflammatory markers and tissue alterations.

name: Active Splenic Bleeding
definition: Active hemorrhage within the spleen detectable through cross-sectional imaging techniques. CT and ultrasound can demonstrate active contrast extravasation or blood pooling within splenic parenchyma.

name: Acute abdominal emergencies like perforation
definition: Severe abdominal conditions involving potential organ perforation, detectable through various imaging modalities. CT and X-ray can reveal free air, fluid collections, or structural discontinuities indicating acute abdominal emergencies.

name: Acute Appendicitis
definition: Inflammation of the appendix characterized by acute pain and potential perforation. Radiological diagnosis typically involves CT scan showing appendiceal wall thickening, periappendiceal fat stranding, and potential abscess formation.

name: Acute Bronchiolitis
definition: Viral lower respiratory tract infection affecting small airways in infants and young children. Radiographic findings include hyperinflation, peribronchial thickening, and patchy ground-glass opacities on chest X-ray or CT.

name: Acute Cholangitis
definition: Bacterial infection of the bile ducts causing inflammation and potential biliary obstruction. Radiological imaging reveals dilated bile ducts, wall thickening, and potential abscess formation on CT or ultrasound.

name: Acute Cholecystitis
definition: Acute inflammation of the gallbladder typically caused by gallstones. Ultrasound and CT imaging show gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, and potential gallstone impaction.

name: Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis (ADEM)
definition: Inflammatory demyelinating disorder of the brain and spinal cord, characterized by widespread white matter lesions. MRI reveals multifocal, large, confluent hyperintense lesions on T2-weighted and FLAIR sequences.

name: Acute GI Bleeds
definition: Bleeding within the gastrointestinal tract detectable through various imaging modalities. CT angiography and nuclear medicine studies can localize and characterize the source and extent of bleeding.

name: Acute glomerulonephritis
definition: Inflammatory kidney condition affecting glomeruli, characterized by acute kidney dysfunction. Imaging may reveal kidney swelling, increased echogenicity on ultrasound, and potential cortical changes.

name: Acute hematoma
definition: Localized collection of blood outside blood vessels, typically following trauma. CT and MRI can precisely characterize hematoma size, location, and evolution stages.

name: Acute infarct
definition: Area of tissue death due to inadequate blood supply, typically identified through ischemic changes on imaging. CT and MRI can demonstrate early and late infarct characteristics.

name: Acute Ischemic Stroke
definition: Sudden interruption of blood supply to brain region causing neurological deficits. CT and MRI reveal early ischemic changes, hypodense lesions, and potential penumbra.

name: Acute Ischemic Stroke (AIS)
definition: Sudden interruption of blood supply to brain region causing neurological deficits. CT and MRI reveal early ischemic changes, hypodense lesions, and potential penumbra.

name: Acute Kidney Injury (AKI)
definition: Rapid decline in kidney function detectable through imaging and laboratory markers. Ultrasound and CT can reveal kidney size, parenchymal changes, and potential obstructive causes.

name: Acute Limb Ischemia
definition: Sudden reduction of blood flow to an extremity, potentially causing tissue damage. CT angiography and vascular imaging can demonstrate vascular occlusion and collateral circulation.

name: Acute Liver Failure
definition: Rapid and severe liver dysfunction with potential multi-organ implications. CT and MRI can reveal liver parenchymal changes, size alterations, and potential complications.

name: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL)
definition: Aggressive blood cancer characterized by rapid proliferation of immature lymphoid cells. CT, PET, and MRI help stage the disease and monitor treatment response.

name: Acute Mesenteric Ischemia (AMI)
definition: A critical condition of reduced blood flow to the intestines, causing potential bowel ischemia and necrosis. Radiological imaging helps identify vascular occlusion, bowel wall thickening, and potential infarction.

name: Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML)
definition: Aggressive blood cancer originating in bone marrow, characterized by abnormal white blood cell proliferation. Radiological studies help assess bone marrow infiltration, organ involvement, and treatment response.

name: Acute Obstruction
definition: Sudden blockage of a physiological pathway, preventing normal flow or passage. Radiological imaging helps identify the location, cause, and potential complications of the obstruction.

name: Acute Osteomyelitis
definition: Severe bone infection causing inflammation of bone and bone marrow. Radiological techniques help detect bone destruction, periosteal reaction, and potential abscess formation.

name: Acute Pancreatitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the pancreas causing acute swelling and potential necrosis. Radiological imaging helps assess pancreatic inflammation, fluid collections, and potential complications.

name: Acute Prostatitis
definition: Sudden inflammation of the prostate gland causing pain and urinary symptoms. Radiological studies help evaluate prostate swelling, potential abscess formation, and surrounding tissue involvement.

name: Acute Pyelonephritis
definition: Acute kidney infection involving the renal pelvis and kidney parenchyma. Radiological imaging helps detect kidney inflammation, potential abscess, and assess structural changes.

name: Acute Rejection
definition: Immune response against transplanted organ causing tissue damage. Radiological techniques help monitor organ structure, detect inflammation, and assess transplant viability.

name: Acute Stroke
definition: Sudden interruption of blood supply to the brain causing neurological deficits. Radiological imaging helps identify location, extent, and type of cerebrovascular event.

name: Acute Subdural Hematoma
definition: Rapid blood accumulation between brain surface and dura mater, often from trauma. Radiological CT scans help assess hematoma size, midline shift, and potential surgical intervention.

name: Acute TEVAR complications (aortic rupture, endoleak >5mm)
definition: Potential complications following thoracic endovascular aortic repair, including aortic rupture or significant endoleaks. Radiological monitoring helps detect and manage these critical issues.

name: Acute tubular necrosis
definition: Kidney tubule cell death typically caused by ischemia or toxic injury. Radiological imaging helps assess kidney damage, tubular structure changes, and potential recovery.

name: Acute Tubular Necrosis (ATN)
definition: Kidney tubule cell death typically caused by ischemia or toxic injury. Radiological imaging helps assess kidney damage, tubular structure changes, and potential recovery.

name: Acute Ureteral Obstruction
definition: Sudden blockage of ureter preventing urine flow from kidney to bladder. Radiological techniques help identify obstruction location, cause, and potential complications.

name: ADEM
definition: Acute inflammatory demyelinating disorder of the central nervous system, often following viral infection. Radiological MRI helps detect characteristic brain and spinal cord lesions.

name: Adenocarcinoma
definition: A type of glandular cancer that originates from glandular epithelial cells. In radiology, adenocarcinomas appear as irregular masses with potential infiltrative margins on imaging studies.

name: Adenocarcinoma of the cervix
definition: A malignant tumor of the cervix arising from glandular epithelial cells. Radiologically characterized by irregular soft tissue masses with potential invasion of surrounding structures.

name: Adenoid cystic carcinoma
definition: A rare, aggressive salivary gland tumor with distinctive cribriform pattern. Radiologically appears as a complex mass with potential perineural invasion.

name: Adenoma
definition: A benign epithelial tumor arising from glandular tissue. On imaging, typically appears as a well-circumscribed, homogeneous mass.

name: Adenomatous Polyp
definition: A benign glandular growth projecting from mucosal surfaces. Radiologically appears as a focal, pedunculated or sessile soft tissue projection.

name: Adenomyomatosis
definition: A condition characterized by abnormal proliferation of smooth muscle and glandular elements in the gallbladder. Radiologically presents with wall thickening and characteristic cholesterol cleft formations.

name: Adenomyosis
definition: A benign condition where endometrial glands and stroma invade the myometrium. On imaging, appears as uterine wall thickening with heterogeneous signal intensity.

name: Adenosis
definition: A general term for abnormal proliferation of glandular tissue. Radiologically may manifest as localized tissue changes or nodular formations.

name: Adenosquamous Carcinoma of the Cervix
definition: A rare cervical cancer subtype with mixed glandular and squamous cell characteristics. Radiologically presents as an irregular, infiltrative mass.

name: Adhesive capsulitis
definition: A painful shoulder condition causing significant joint capsule inflammation and stiffness. Radiologically characterized by capsular thickening and reduced joint space.

name: Adhesive Capsulitis (Frozen Shoulder)
definition: A painful shoulder condition causing significant joint capsule inflammation and stiffness. Radiologically characterized by capsular thickening and reduced joint space.

name: Adrenal Adenoma
definition: A benign tumor of the adrenal gland, typically small and well-circumscribed. On CT and MRI, appears as a homogeneous, low-attenuation lesion.

name: Adrenal Adenoma (Lipid-Poor)
definition: An adrenal adenoma with low lipid content, appearing more challenging to characterize on imaging studies. Requires careful radiological evaluation.

name: Adrenal Adenoma (Lipid-Rich)
definition: An adrenal adenoma with high lipid content, easily identifiable on imaging due to characteristic fat signal characteristics.

name: Adrenal adenomas
definition: Benign tumors of the adrenal gland, typically small and well-circumscribed. On CT and MRI, appear as homogeneous, low-attenuation lesions.

name: Adrenal Carcinoma
definition: A rare and aggressive malignant tumor originating from the adrenal cortex. Radiologically characterized by large, heterogeneous masses with potential invasion of surrounding structures.

name: Adrenal Cortical Carcinoma (ACC)
definition: A rare and aggressive malignant tumor originating from the adrenal cortex. Radiologically characterized by large, heterogeneous masses with potential invasion of surrounding structures.

name: Adrenal Cyst
definition: Fluid-filled sac within the adrenal gland, typically benign and detected incidentally on imaging studies. Can vary in size and appearance on CT and MRI.

name: Adrenal Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within the adrenal gland, often visible on CT as a hyperdense or heterogeneous mass. Can result from trauma, anticoagulation, or spontaneous rupture.

name: Adrenal Hyperplasia
definition: Abnormal enlargement of the adrenal glands, typically due to increased hormone production. Radiologically appears as bilaterally enlarged adrenal glands on imaging studies.

name: Adrenal Insufficiency (Addisonian Crisis)
definition: Acute, life-threatening condition of severe adrenal hormone deficiency. Radiological findings may include small, atrophic adrenal glands on CT or MRI.

name: Adrenal mass with calcification
definition: An abnormal growth in the adrenal gland containing calcium deposits. Radiologically identified as a heterogeneous mass with characteristic calcific densities.

name: Adrenal Metastases
definition: Spread of cancer from another primary site to the adrenal glands. Typically appears as multiple, often bilateral nodular lesions on CT or PET imaging.

name: Adrenal Metastasis
definition: Spread of cancer from another primary site to the adrenal gland. Typically appears as a single or multiple nodular lesions on CT or PET imaging.

name: Adrenal Myelolipoma
definition: Rare, benign adrenal tumor composed of mature adipose tissue and hematopoietic elements. Typically appears as a well-defined, heterogeneous mass on CT.

name: Adrenocortical carcinoma
definition: A rare and aggressive malignant tumor originating from the adrenal cortex. Radiologically characterized by large, heterogeneous masses with potential invasion of surrounding structures.

name: Adrenocortical Carcinoma (ACC)
definition: A rare and aggressive malignant tumor originating from the adrenal cortex. Radiologically characterized by large, heterogeneous masses with potential invasion of surrounding structures.

name: Adverse Local Tissue Reaction (ALTR)
definition: Tissue reaction or inflammatory response to medical implants or devices. Radiologically may present as soft tissue changes or inflammatory changes around the implant.

name: Agenesis of Corpus Callosum (ACC)
definition: Congenital absence or incomplete development of the corpus callosum, a brain structure connecting cerebral hemispheres. Detected through neuroimaging techniques like MRI.

name: Agenesis of the Corpus Callosum
definition: Congenital absence or incomplete development of the corpus callosum, a brain structure connecting cerebral hemispheres. Detected through neuroimaging techniques like MRI.

name: Aggressive Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL) - e.g., DLBCL
definition: Fast-growing type of non-Hodgkin lymphoma with high proliferation rate. Radiologically characterized by large, often confluent lymph node masses on CT or PET imaging.

name: Agyria
definition: A rare neurological disorder characterized by the absence of normal brain gyri, resulting in a smooth brain surface appearance on neuroimaging. Radiologically, it presents as a lack of normal cortical folding patterns.

name: Air
definition: In radiology, air represents a radiolucent substance that appears black or dark on imaging studies. It can be used to highlight anatomical structures or indicate pathological conditions like pneumothorax or bowel gas.

name: Air artifact
definition: A radiographic distortion caused by the presence of air, which can create misleading visual patterns or obscure underlying tissue details in medical imaging.

name: Air crescent sign
definition: A radiographic sign indicating lung cavity formation, typically seen in fungal infections or lung abscess. Appears as a crescent-shaped air space within a lung lesion.

name: Alcohol-Related Pancreatitis
definition: A form of pancreatic inflammation caused by chronic alcohol consumption, characterized by progressive pancreatic damage visible on CT and MRI scans.

name: Alcoholic Liver Disease
definition: A progressive liver disease caused by chronic alcohol abuse, characterized by fatty infiltration, fibrosis, and potential cirrhosis, detectable through various imaging techniques.

name: Alexander Disease
definition: A rare genetic leukodystrophy affecting white matter, characterized by progressive neurodegeneration and distinctive radiological findings of abnormal brain tissue changes.

name: Aliasing Artifact
definition: A digital imaging artifact causing distortion or misrepresentation of image details due to sampling or reconstruction errors in medical imaging systems.

name: Allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction to Aspergillus fungi in the lungs, characterized by distinctive radiographic findings of bronchial wall thickening and central bronchiectasis.

name: Alobar Holoprosencephaly
definition: A severe congenital brain malformation where the forebrain fails to divide properly, resulting in a single-lobed brain structure visible on neuroimaging.

name: Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency
definition: A genetic disorder causing decreased alpha-1 antitrypsin protein, leading to lung and liver damage detectable through various radiological investigations.

name: Alport syndrome
definition: A genetic disorder affecting kidneys and hearing, characterized by progressive renal damage and distinctive radiological findings of glomerular changes.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by brain atrophy, beta-amyloid plaques, and distinctive neuroimaging findings of cortical thinning and hippocampal shrinkage.

name: Alzheimer's Disease (AD)
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by brain atrophy, beta-amyloid plaques, and distinctive neuroimaging findings of cortical thinning and hippocampal shrinkage.

name: Alzheimer Disease (AD)
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by brain atrophy, beta-amyloid plaques, and distinctive neuroimaging findings of cortical thinning and hippocampal shrinkage.

name: AMI
definition: Acute Myocardial Infarction, a critical cardiac event characterized by sudden blood flow blockage in coronary arteries, detectable through various cardiac imaging techniques.

name: Amiodarone-induced thyroiditis
definition: A drug-induced inflammatory condition of the thyroid gland caused by amiodarone, characterized by potential destructive thyroiditis and variable imaging findings. Radiological evaluation may show heterogeneous thyroid gland changes and potential inflammation.

name: Ampullary Cancer
definition: A rare malignant tumor located at the ampulla of Vater, typically presenting with imaging features of a pancreatic or biliary tract mass. CT and MRI can help characterize the tumor's extent and potential metastasis.

name: Ampullary Carcinoma
definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from the ampulla of Vater, characterized by potential imaging findings of a focal mass with potential biliary or pancreatic involvement. Radiological assessment helps determine tumor staging and resectability.

name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) / Lou Gehrig disease / Motor Neuron Disease (MND)
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting motor neurons, with potential radiological findings of muscle atrophy, brain and spinal cord changes on MRI. Imaging helps monitor disease progression and rule out alternative diagnoses.

name: Anaplastic Thyroid Cancer
definition: An aggressive and rare thyroid malignancy with rapid progression and poor prognosis, characterized by undifferentiated cellular morphology. Radiological imaging typically shows large, invasive thyroid masses with potential extrathyroidal extension.

name: Anaplastic thyroid carcinoma
definition: A highly aggressive thyroid malignancy with undifferentiated cellular characteristics, demonstrating rapid growth and invasion. Radiological findings often include large, heterogeneous thyroid masses with potential metastatic spread.

name: Anastomotic pseudoaneurysm
definition: A localized vascular complication occurring at surgical anastomosis sites, characterized by a focal outpouching or dilation of blood vessel walls. Radiological diagnosis typically involves CT angiography or ultrasound.

name: Aneuploidy
definition: A chromosomal abnormality characterized by an abnormal number of chromosomes, which can be detected through cytogenetic imaging techniques. Radiological implications include potential associations with genetic disorders and malignancies.

name: Aneurysm
definition: A localized, abnormal dilation of a blood vessel wall, which can be detected and characterized through various imaging modalities like CT, MRI, and ultrasound. Radiological assessment helps determine size, location, and potential rupture risk.

name: Aneurysmal Bone Cyst
definition: A benign, expansile bone lesion characterized by blood-filled cystic spaces, typically identified on radiographic imaging as a lytic, potentially expansile bone tumor. CT and MRI help define the lesion's extent and characteristics.

name: Aneurysmal Bone Cyst (ABC)
definition: A benign, blood-filled bone lesion with characteristic radiographic features of expansile, multi-loculated cystic spaces. Imaging techniques like CT and MRI help differentiate it from other bone tumors.

name: Aneurysmal bone cyst (telangiectatic osteosarcoma)
definition: A rare, aggressive bone tumor with hemorrhagic characteristics, sharing imaging features with aneurysmal bone cysts. Radiological evaluation involves detailed assessment of bone structure and potential malignant transformation.

name: Aneurysmal SAH
definition: A specific type of subarachnoid hemorrhage caused by a ruptured cerebral aneurysm, characterized by blood in the subarachnoid space. Radiological diagnosis typically involves CT or MRI with specific hemorrhage patterns.

name: Aneurysms
definition: Localized, abnormal dilations of blood vessel walls that can occur in various anatomical locations. Radiological imaging helps characterize size, location, and potential risks of these vascular abnormalities.

name: Angiodysplasia
definition: A vascular malformation characterized by abnormal, fragile blood vessels in the gastrointestinal tract, typically identified through endoscopic or radiological imaging techniques. Imaging helps detect and characterize these vascular lesions.

name: Angioedema
definition: Localized swelling of the deep dermis or subcutaneous tissue caused by fluid accumulation in blood vessels. In radiology, characterized by soft tissue edema and potential airway compromise on imaging studies.

name: Angiography
definition: A medical imaging technique using X-rays and contrast agents to visualize blood vessels and vascular structures throughout the body.

name: Angiography (DSA)
definition: Digital Subtraction Angiography, an invasive imaging technique providing detailed real-time visualization of blood vessels using X-ray and contrast.

name: Angiography (DSA/MRA)
definition: A combined imaging approach using Digital Subtraction Angiography and Magnetic Resonance Angiography for comprehensive vascular assessment.

name: Angiography (Fistulogram)
definition: A radiographic technique that visualizes blood vessels by injecting contrast material to highlight vascular structures. Used to diagnose and evaluate blood vessel abnormalities, blockages, and blood flow.

name: Angiomyolipoma
definition: Rare benign renal tumor composed of blood vessels, smooth muscle, and fat cells. Radiologically appears as a heterogeneous mass with characteristic fat density on CT and MRI.

name: Angiomyolipoma (AML)
definition: Rare benign renal tumor composed of blood vessels, smooth muscle, and fat cells. Radiologically appears as a heterogeneous mass with characteristic fat density on CT and MRI.

name: Angiosarcoma
definition: Rare, aggressive malignant vascular tumor arising from endothelial cells. Radiologically presents as a heterogeneous soft tissue mass with irregular borders and potential metastatic spread.

name: Anisotropy artifact
definition: Imaging artifact in ultrasound or MRI where tissue appears different depending on the angle of insonation or imaging plane. Affects image quality and tissue characterization.

name: Ankle Fracture
definition: Disruption of bone continuity in the ankle joint, involving one or more bones. Radiographically diagnosed using X-ray, CT, or MRI to assess fracture type, displacement, and potential complications.

name: Ankle Sprain
definition: Ligament injury in the ankle caused by stretching or tearing of soft tissue. Radiologically evaluated using MRI to assess ligament integrity and grade of injury.

name: Ankle Sprain (Deltoid Ligament Injury)
definition: Injury to the deltoid ligament on the medial side of the ankle, typically caused by extreme eversion or rotational forces. Radiologically assessed using MRI to evaluate ligament damage.

name: Ankle Sprain (Lateral Ligament Injury - ATFL, CFL, PTFL)
definition: Injury to lateral ankle ligaments including Anterior Talofibular (ATFL), Calcaneofibular (CFL), and Posterior Talofibular (PTFL) ligaments. Radiologically evaluated using MRI to determine injury extent.

name: Ankylosing Spondylitis
definition: Chronic inflammatory rheumatic disease causing progressive spinal fusion and potential bone formation. Radiographically characterized by syndesmophytes, bamboo spine appearance, and sacroiliitis.

name: Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS)
definition: Chronic inflammatory rheumatic disease causing progressive spinal fusion and potential bone formation. Radiographically characterized by syndesmophytes, bamboo spine appearance, and sacroiliitis.

name: Annular Carcinoma
definition: Ring-shaped carcinoma typically found in gastrointestinal tract. Radiologically appears as a circumferential lesion with potential wall thickening and irregular margins.

name: Annular Pancreas
definition: Rare congenital pancreatic anomaly where pancreatic tissue completely encircles the duodenum. Radiologically identified through CT or MRI showing abnormal pancreatic configuration.

name: Anterior mediastinal mass
definition: Abnormal soft tissue mass located in the anterior mediastinum. Radiologically evaluated using CT or MRI to characterize size, composition, and potential malignancy.

name: Anterior Talofibular Ligament (ATFL) Tear
definition: Ligament injury involving the Anterior Talofibular Ligament in the ankle, typically caused by inversion trauma. Radiologically assessed using MRI to evaluate ligament integrity and damage extent.

name: Antral web
definition: A rare congenital gastric mucosal fold causing partial obstruction in the antrum of the stomach. Radiographically characterized by a thin membrane or web-like projection across the gastric antral lumen.

name: Antrochoanal Polyp
definition: A benign soft tissue growth originating in the maxillary sinus that extends through the sinus wall into the nasopharynx. Radiologically appears as a soft tissue mass extending from the maxillary sinus into the nasal cavity.

name: AO Fractures (Long Bone Fractures)
definition: Classification system for long bone fractures based on anatomical location and pattern. Radiographically assessed using X-ray or CT to determine fracture type, alignment, and potential surgical intervention.

name: Aortic Dissection
definition: A serious condition where the inner layer of the aorta tears, allowing blood to flow between the layers of the aortic wall. Radiologically identified by a characteristic intimal flap on CT or MRI imaging.

name: Aortic dissection flap
definition: A linear membrane visible on imaging that separates true and false lumens in an aortic dissection. Typically seen as a thin, linear structure on cross-sectional imaging studies.

name: Aortic Stenosis
definition: A narrowing of the aortic valve opening that obstructs blood flow from the left ventricle to the aorta. Radiographically characterized by valve calcification and reduced valve area on echocardiography or CT.

name: Aortic Stenosis (AS)
definition: A narrowing of the aortic valve opening that obstructs blood flow from the left ventricle to the aorta. Radiographically characterized by valve calcification and reduced valve area on echocardiography or CT.

name: Aortitis
definition: Inflammation of the aortic wall, which can be infectious or inflammatory in origin. Radiologically demonstrated by wall thickening, contrast enhancement, and potential calcification on CT or MRI.

name: Appendiceal Mucocele
definition: A rare cystic lesion of the appendix characterized by mucus accumulation and potential malignant transformation. Radiographically appears as a dilated, mucus-filled appendix on CT or ultrasound.

name: Appendicitis
definition: Inflammation of the appendix typically caused by obstruction. Radiologically characterized by appendiceal wall thickening, periappendiceal fat stranding, and potential abscess formation on CT.

name: Appendicitis (pediatric)
definition: Inflammation of the appendix in children, characterized by specific imaging findings. Radiologically shows appendiceal wall thickening, periappendiceal fat stranding, and potential abscess formation.

name: Aqueductal Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of the cerebral aqueduct that can cause hydrocephalus. Radiographically identified on MRI as a narrowed or compressed cerebral aqueduct.

name: Arachnoid cyst
definition: A benign, fluid-filled membrane typically located between the brain and skull. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, smooth-walled cystic lesion on CT or MRI.

name: Arachnoiditis
definition: Inflammation of the arachnoid membrane surrounding the brain and spinal cord. Radiologically characterized by leptomeningeal enhancement and potential adhesions on MRI.

name: Architectural Distortion
definition: Abnormal tissue arrangement or distortion in imaging, often indicating underlying pathology. Typically observed in mammography as irregular tissue patterns suggesting potential malignancy.

name: Architectural Distortion (AD)
definition: Abnormal tissue arrangement or distortion in imaging, often indicating underlying pathology. Typically observed in mammography as irregular tissue patterns suggesting potential malignancy.

name: ARDS
definition: Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) is a severe inflammatory lung condition characterized by diffuse bilateral pulmonary infiltrates and hypoxemia, typically visible on chest radiographs and CT scans as ground-glass opacities and consolidations.

name: ARPKD
definition: Autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease (ARPKD) is a genetic disorder characterized by bilateral enlarged kidneys with multiple small cysts, typically detected through prenatal or pediatric ultrasound and CT imaging.

name: Arrhythmias
definition: Cardiac rhythm disturbances that appear as irregular electrical conduction patterns on electrocardiography (ECG) and can be visualized through cardiac imaging techniques like echocardiography and cardiac CT.

name: Arterial dissection
definition: A condition where the arterial wall is torn, creating a false lumen within the vessel wall, typically diagnosed through CT angiography or MR angiography with characteristic intramural hematoma appearance.

name: Arterial dissections
definition: A condition where the arterial wall is torn, creating a false lumen within the vessel wall, typically diagnosed through CT angiography or MR angiography with characteristic intramural hematoma appearance.

name: Arterial enhancement
definition: A contrast enhancement pattern where blood vessels show increased signal intensity after contrast administration. Indicates active blood flow and tissue perfusion.

name: Arterial Injuries
definition: Traumatic or pathological damage to arterial vessels, detectable through various imaging modalities such as CT angiography, MR angiography, and digital subtraction angiography.

name: Arterial occlusion
definition: Complete blockage of an artery, visible on imaging studies as absence of blood flow or vessel continuity, typically diagnosed through CT angiography, MR angiography, or conventional angiography.

name: Arterial stenosis (e.g., carotid, renal)
definition: Narrowing of an arterial lumen, typically detected through imaging techniques like CT angiography, MR angiography, and ultrasound, which show reduced vessel diameter and potential hemodynamic changes.

name: Arterial stroke
definition: Cerebrovascular event caused by arterial blockage or rupture, characterized by focal neurological deficits and visible on brain CT or MRI as ischemic or hemorrhagic lesions.

name: Arterial tortuosity
definition: Abnormal twisting or curvature of arteries, visible on imaging studies as irregular, non-linear vessel paths, often assessed through CT angiography or MR angiography.

name: Arteriovenous Fistula (AV Fistula)
definition: Abnormal direct communication between an artery and a vein, bypassing the capillary network, typically diagnosed through angiographic imaging techniques.

name: Arteriovenous Fistula (AVF)
definition: Abnormal direct communication between an artery and a vein, bypassing the capillary network, typically diagnosed through angiographic imaging techniques.

name: Arteriovenous Fistula (AVF) Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of an arteriovenous fistula, detected through imaging techniques like ultrasound, CT angiography, and MR angiography, which show reduced vessel diameter and potential flow limitations.

name: Arteriovenous Graft (AVG) Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of an arteriovenous graft, detected through imaging techniques like ultrasound, CT angiography, and MR angiography, which show reduced vessel diameter and potential flow limitations.

name: Arteriovenous Malformation (AVM)
definition: Abnormal, tangled vascular network of arteries and veins without intervening capillaries, typically diagnosed through advanced imaging like CT angiography or MR angiography.

name: Arteriovenous Malformations (AVMs)
definition: Abnormal tangles of blood vessels with direct connections between arteries and veins, bypassing the capillary network. In radiology, AVMs appear as complex, tortuous vascular structures with potential for hemorrhage.

name: Arteritis
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting the walls of arteries, causing vessel wall thickening, narrowing, or potential occlusion. Radiologically characterized by vessel wall changes and potential luminal irregularities.

name: Arthritis
definition: Joint inflammation causing structural changes visible on imaging, characterized by joint space narrowing, bone erosions, and soft tissue swelling. Radiographic findings vary by type of arthritis.

name: Artifact
definition: Unintended visual distortion or error in medical imaging caused by equipment, patient movement, or processing issues. Artifacts can obscure or mimic pathological findings.

name: Ascending Transtentorial Herniation
definition: Severe intracranial herniation where brain tissue is displaced upward through the tentorial notch, causing compression of brainstem structures. Radiologically indicates critical neurological compromise.

name: Ascites
definition: Abnormal fluid accumulation in the peritoneal cavity, appearing as free fluid on imaging studies. Radiographically visible as fluid-filled spaces between abdominal organs.

name: Aspergilloma
definition: Fungal mass formation within lung cavities, typically caused by Aspergillus species. Radiologically appears as a rounded, mobile mass within a lung cavity.

name: Aspergilloma (mycetoma)
definition: Fungal mass formation within lung cavities, typically caused by Aspergillus species. Radiologically appears as a rounded, mobile mass within a lung cavity.

name: Aspergillus infection
definition: Fungal infection caused by Aspergillus species, with potential for various radiographic manifestations including nodules, cavities, and infiltrates.

name: Aspiration
definition: Inhalation or introduction of foreign material into the respiratory tract, potentially causing lung infiltrates or consolidation. Radiographically visible as localized or diffuse lung changes.

name: Asthma
definition: Chronic inflammatory airway disease characterized by bronchial wall thickening, hyperinflation, and potential mucus plugging. Radiographic findings include bronchial wall markings and air trapping.

name: Astrocytoma
definition: Glial cell tumor of the brain with variable grades of malignancy. Radiologically appears as a contrast-enhancing mass with potential infiltrative characteristics.

name: AT/RT (Atypical Teratoid/Rhabdoid Tumor)
definition: Rare, aggressive pediatric brain tumor with distinctive molecular and histological features. Radiographically appears as a heterogeneous, often contrast-enhancing mass.

name: Atelectasis
definition: Lung segment or lobe collapse due to air loss, appearing as increased opacity and volume reduction on imaging. Radiographically characterized by lung volume loss and shifted mediastinal structures.

name: Atelectasis (secondary to FBA)
definition: Lung segment or lobe collapse caused by foreign body aspiration, resulting in air trapping or complete airway obstruction. Radiographically shows localized volume loss and potential air trapping.

name: Atherosclerosis
definition: Progressive arterial wall thickening and hardening caused by lipid and calcium deposition. Radiologically characterized by vessel wall calcification and luminal narrowing.

name: Atherosclerosis (leading to Carotid Stenosis)
definition: Atherosclerotic narrowing of carotid arteries, typically visualized through ultrasound, CT, or MR angiography. Characterized by plaque formation reducing vessel lumen diameter.

name: Atherosclerosis (smooth, focal stenosis)
definition: Localized arterial narrowing due to atherosclerotic plaque with smooth, well-defined borders. Radiographically demonstrates consistent luminal reduction.

name: Atherosclerotic calcification
definition: Calcium deposits within arterial walls as a result of chronic atherosclerotic changes. Radiologically appears as dense, linear or punctate calcifications.

name: ATN
definition: Acute tubular necrosis, a kidney injury characterized by temporary loss of kidney function. Radiologically shows reduced renal parenchymal enhancement and potential tubular damage.

name: Atrial Myxoma
definition: Benign cardiac tumor arising from atrial endocardium, typically appearing as a mobile, pedunculated mass on cardiac imaging studies.

name: Atrial Septal Defect (ASD)
definition: Congenital heart defect characterized by an abnormal opening between the right and left atria. Radiologically demonstrated through echocardiography or cardiac MRI.

name: Atrophy
definition: Tissue or organ shrinkage and reduction in size due to decreased cell volume or number. Radiologically observed as decreased organ or tissue volume.

name: Attenuation artifact
definition: Image degradation caused by reduced signal intensity due to tissue density variations. Commonly seen in CT and nuclear medicine imaging.

name: Atypical Choroid Plexus Papilloma
definition: Rare, typically benign brain tumor originating from choroid plexus cells with atypical cellular characteristics. Radiologically appears as contrast-enhancing mass lesion.

name: Atypical Choroid Plexus Papilloma (aCPP)
definition: Rare, typically benign brain tumor originating from choroid plexus cells with atypical cellular characteristics. Radiologically appears as contrast-enhancing mass lesion.

name: Atypical ductal hyperplasia
definition: Abnormal proliferation of breast duct cells with architectural and cellular variations. Radiologically identified through mammographic or ultrasound findings.

name: Atypical Ductal Hyperplasia (ADH)
definition: Abnormal proliferation of breast duct cells with architectural and cellular variations. Radiologically identified through mammographic or ultrasound findings.

name: Atypical Lobular Hyperplasia (ALH)
definition: Abnormal proliferation of lobular breast cells with potential increased cancer risk. Radiologically detected through mammographic or MRI breast imaging.

name: Atypical Teratoid/Rhabdoid Tumor (AT/RT)
definition: Rare, aggressive pediatric brain tumor with rhabdoid features, typically occurring in young children. Radiologically appears as large, heterogeneous mass with potential hemorrhagic components.

name: Autoimmune disease
definition: A group of disorders where the immune system mistakenly attacks healthy body tissues. In radiology, these conditions often present with characteristic imaging findings that reflect inflammatory and destructive processes.

name: Autoimmune Encephalitis
definition: An inflammatory brain condition where the immune system attacks neural tissues, causing neurological dysfunction. Radiological findings typically include brain inflammation, signal changes, and potential cerebral edema.

name: Autoimmune Hepatitis
definition: A chronic liver inflammation caused by autoimmune mechanisms. Radiological imaging may reveal liver enlargement, parenchymal changes, and potential cirrhotic transformation.

name: Autoimmune pancreatitis
definition: A rare inflammatory pancreatic condition characterized by diffuse pancreatic enlargement and potential mass-like appearance. Radiological features include diffuse pancreatic swelling and potential capsule-like rim.

name: Autonomous functioning thyroid nodule
definition: A thyroid nodule that independently produces thyroid hormones without pituitary gland regulation. Radiological evaluation typically involves nuclear medicine scans showing increased metabolic activity.

name: Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease
definition: A genetic kidney disorder characterized by multiple bilateral renal cysts leading to progressive kidney dysfunction. Radiological imaging reveals multiple bilateral kidney cysts of varying sizes.

name: Autosomal Dominant Polycystic Kidney Disease (ADPKD)
definition: A genetic kidney disorder characterized by multiple bilateral renal cysts leading to progressive kidney dysfunction. Radiological imaging reveals multiple bilateral kidney cysts of varying sizes.

name: AV Fistula
definition: An abnormal direct connection between an artery and vein, bypassing normal capillary networks. Radiological evaluation often involves contrast angiography to delineate the fistulous communication.

name: AV Fistula/Pseudoaneurysm
definition: A pathological vascular condition involving an abnormal arteriovenous connection and potential false aneurysm formation. Radiological assessment requires detailed vascular imaging techniques.

name: Avascular necrosis
definition: A condition of bone tissue death due to compromised blood supply, resulting in structural breakdown. Radiological findings include bone density changes, trabecular disruption, and potential subchondral collapse.

name: Avascular Necrosis (AVN)
definition: A condition of bone tissue death due to compromised blood supply, resulting in structural breakdown. Radiological findings include bone density changes, trabecular disruption, and potential subchondral collapse.

name: Avascular Necrosis (AVN) of Scaphoid
definition: Avascular necrosis specifically affecting the scaphoid bone, typically resulting from traumatic injury or compromised blood supply. Radiological evaluation reveals progressive bone changes and potential fragmentation.

name: Avascular Necrosis (AVN) of the Femoral Head
definition: A specific form of avascular necrosis affecting the femoral head, often associated with trauma, steroid use, or underlying medical conditions. Radiological findings include progressive bone destruction and potential joint collapse.

name: Background Parenchymal Enhancement (BPE)
definition: A radiological breast imaging parameter representing the baseline parenchymal tissue enhancement observed during dynamic contrast-enhanced MRI studies.

name: Bacterial Meningitis
definition: An acute bacterial infection of the meninges causing inflammation. Radiological findings include meningeal enhancement, potential cerebral edema, and vascular changes on imaging studies.

name: Bacterial Overgrowth
definition: Excessive bacterial proliferation in the small intestine, often detected through imaging studies showing abnormal gas patterns or bowel wall changes. Can result in malabsorption and intestinal distension.

name: Bacterial Pneumonia (secondary to FBA)
definition: Lung infection characterized by inflammatory infiltrates and consolidation visible on chest radiographs and CT scans. Typically shows patchy or lobar opacities with air bronchograms.

name: Bacterial Sinusitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the paranasal sinuses caused by bacterial infection, demonstrating mucosal thickening, fluid levels, and potential air-fluid interfaces on CT and radiographic studies.

name: Bacterial tracheitis
definition: Severe bacterial infection of the trachea causing inflammation and potential airway obstruction, characterized by mucosal thickening and potential pseudomembrane formation on imaging.

name: Baker's Cyst
definition: Fluid-filled cyst located behind the knee, typically connected to the knee joint space and visible on ultrasound or MRI. Often associated with joint effusion or underlying knee pathology.

name: Balanced Ischemia
definition: Condition of reduced blood flow affecting multiple vascular territories simultaneously, typically observed in cardiovascular imaging studies showing compromised perfusion across different organ systems.

name: Bamboo spine
definition: A radiographic appearance of the spine in ankylosing spondylitis, showing continuous ossification resembling bamboo. Characterized by syndesmophytes creating a continuous, linear appearance.

name: Bankart Lesion
definition: Anterior shoulder injury involving detachment of the labrum from the glenoid rim, typically diagnosed through MRI or arthroscopic imaging techniques.

name: Barrett Esophagus
definition: Premalignant condition of the esophagus characterized by metaplastic columnar epithelium replacement, typically identified through endoscopic and radiographic imaging.

name: Basilar Artery Dolichoectasia
definition: Abnormal elongation and tortuosity of the basilar artery, often detected through neuroimaging techniques like MRA or CTA, potentially associated with increased risk of thrombosis.

name: Basilar Skull Fracture
definition: Fracture involving the base of the skull, typically identified through CT imaging showing linear or complex fracture patterns, potential bone displacement, and associated soft tissue changes.

name: Beam Hardening Artifact
definition: Radiographic artifact caused by X-ray beam hardening through dense materials, resulting in streaking or distortion in CT images, particularly around metallic or high-density structures.

name: Beam Hardening Artifacts
definition: Radiographic artifacts created by X-ray beam energy changes when passing through dense materials, causing image distortions and potential misinterpretation of tissue densities.

name: Benign Adenoma
definition: Benign epithelial tumor typically found in glandular tissues, characterized by well-defined margins and distinct imaging features on various radiographic modalities.

name: Benign biliary stricture
definition: Non-malignant narrowing of bile ducts, often detected through imaging techniques like MRCP or ERCP, showing localized luminal narrowing without underlying malignancy.

name: Benign bone lesions
definition: Non-cancerous bone abnormalities detected through radiographic imaging, typically showing distinct morphological characteristics without aggressive features.

name: Benign Bone Tumors
definition: Non-cancerous bone growths that appear as localized masses on radiographic imaging. These tumors are typically well-defined and do not invade surrounding bone tissue.

name: Benign Breast Lesion
definition: Non-cancerous growth or abnormality in breast tissue that appears as a distinct mass or area of change on mammographic or ultrasound imaging. These lesions do not typically progress to malignancy.

name: Benign Breast Lesions
definition: Multiple non-cancerous growths or changes in breast tissue that are visible on radiographic imaging. These lesions are typically stable and do not indicate cancer risk.

name: Benign Breast Lesions (BI-RADS 2)
definition: Benign breast lesions classified as Category 2 in the Breast Imaging-Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS), indicating definitively non-cancerous findings on mammography.

name: Benign calcifications
definition: Non-cancerous calcium deposits in tissue that appear as discrete, stable radiographic markers without malignant characteristics. These are typically round, smooth, and uniform in appearance.

name: Benign cervical lesions
definition: Non-cancerous abnormalities in cervical tissue that appear as localized changes on imaging studies. These lesions do not indicate malignant transformation.

name: Benign compression fracture
definition: Non-pathological fracture of a vertebral body caused by mechanical stress or osteoporosis, typically appearing as a mild vertebral height reduction on radiographic imaging.

name: Benign cyst
definition: Fluid-filled sac within tissue that appears as a well-defined, typically round or oval structure on radiographic imaging. Benign cysts have smooth borders and do not demonstrate suspicious characteristics.

name: Benign granuloma
definition: Small, localized area of inflammation or tissue reaction that appears as a discrete mass on radiographic imaging. These are typically benign and do not indicate malignancy.

name: Benign inflammatory processes
definition: Non-cancerous inflammatory conditions that appear as localized tissue changes on radiographic imaging. These processes do not indicate malignant transformation.

name: Benign Lesions
definition: Non-cancerous tissue abnormalities or growths that appear distinct on radiographic imaging. These lesions do not demonstrate characteristics of malignancy.

name: Benign Lipoma
definition: Benign fatty tumor composed of mature adipose tissue, appearing as a well-defined, homogeneous mass with fat density on radiographic imaging.

name: Benign liver lesions (cysts, hemangiomas)
definition: Non-cancerous liver growths including fluid-filled cysts and vascular malformations that appear as distinct, stable masses on radiographic imaging.

name: Benign lung lesion
definition: Non-cancerous growth or abnormality in lung tissue that appears as a localized area of change on chest radiographic imaging. These lesions do not indicate malignant potential.

name: Benign lung nodule
definition: Small, localized, non-cancerous growth in lung tissue that appears as a discrete round or oval opacity on chest radiographic imaging. These nodules are typically stable and benign.

name: Benign lymphoid hyperplasia
definition: Non-cancerous enlargement of lymphoid tissue typically seen on imaging as localized soft tissue thickening or nodular appearance. Often represents reactive lymph node changes without malignant characteristics.

name: Benign mucosal lesion
definition: Non-malignant tissue growth or abnormality within mucosal surfaces, typically appearing as localized thickening or irregular contour on radiological studies. Generally does not demonstrate aggressive or invasive features.

name: Benign nodule
definition: Small, localized, non-cancerous tissue growth visible on imaging studies. Typically round or oval-shaped with smooth margins and no evidence of malignant transformation.

name: Benign ovarian cysts
definition: Fluid-filled sacs within ovaries that appear as well-defined, thin-walled round structures on imaging. Typically resolve spontaneously and do not require intervention.

name: Benign prostatic hyperplasia
definition: Non-cancerous enlargement of prostate gland characterized by increased tissue volume, typically seen on imaging as diffuse prostate enlargement. Common in aging males and can cause urinary symptoms.

name: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH)
definition: Non-cancerous enlargement of prostate gland characterized by increased tissue volume, typically seen on imaging as diffuse prostate enlargement. Common in aging males and can cause urinary symptoms.

name: Benign soft tissue tumors
definition: Non-malignant growths originating from soft connective tissues, appearing as well-defined masses with characteristic imaging features. Generally do not demonstrate invasive behavior.

name: Benign soft tissue tumors (e.g., lipoma, fibroma)
definition: Non-malignant growths originating from soft connective tissues, appearing as well-defined masses with characteristic imaging features. Generally do not demonstrate invasive behavior.

name: Benign strictures
definition: Non-cancerous narrowing of tubular structures, typically appearing as localized luminal narrowing on imaging studies. Often associated with chronic inflammation or scarring.

name: Benign testicular masses
definition: Non-cancerous growths or abnormalities within testicular tissue, typically appearing as well-defined, stable masses on imaging without aggressive characteristics.

name: Benign Thyroid Nodule
definition: Non-cancerous growth within thyroid gland, typically appearing as a discrete, well-defined nodule on imaging. Most thyroid nodules are benign and do not require immediate intervention.

name: Benign tumor
definition: Non-cancerous tissue growth characterized by localized proliferation without invasive or metastatic potential. Typically appears as a well-defined mass on radiological studies.

name: Benign Ureteral Stricture
definition: Non-cancerous narrowing of ureter, typically appearing as localized luminal restriction on imaging studies. Often associated with chronic inflammation or scarring.

name: Benign/Idiopathic causes
definition: Medical conditions or changes arising from unknown or spontaneous origins, without clear external causative factors. Often used to describe pathological findings without definitive etiology.

name: BI-RADS 4 Lesion
definition: Mammographic classification indicating a suspicious abnormality with a 40-75% probability of malignancy. Requires further diagnostic evaluation and potential biopsy.

name: Biceps Femoris Tendinopathy
definition: A degenerative condition affecting the biceps femoris tendon, typically visible on MRI as tendon thickening, signal changes, or partial tears. Radiological findings help assess the extent of tendon pathology and guide treatment.

name: Bilateral adenomas
definition: Benign tumors occurring in pairs within an organ, typically identified through imaging techniques like CT or MRI. Radiological evaluation helps characterize size, location, and potential functional impact.

name: Bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy
definition: Symmetrical enlargement of lymph nodes at the lung hilum. Radiologically indicates potential systemic inflammatory conditions, sarcoidosis, or lymphoproliferative disorders.

name: Bile Duct Injury
definition: Damage to bile ducts detected through imaging studies such as MRCP or CT, often presenting as discontinuity, strictures, or abnormal bile flow. Radiological assessment is crucial for diagnosis and treatment planning.

name: Bile Duct Injury (BDI)
definition: Damage to bile ducts detected through imaging studies such as MRCP or CT, often presenting as discontinuity, strictures, or abnormal bile flow. Radiological assessment is crucial for diagnosis and treatment planning.

name: Bile Leak
definition: Abnormal bile leakage identified through imaging techniques like MRCP, CT, or ERCP, characterized by contrast extravasation or fluid collections outside the biliary system.

name: Biliary Atresia
definition: Congenital biliary tract disorder characterized by progressive bile duct obstruction, typically diagnosed through pediatric imaging techniques like ultrasound or hepatobiliary scintigraphy.

name: Biliary cirrhosis
definition: Liver disease characterized by bile duct inflammation and fibrosis, detectable through imaging modalities showing biliary tract changes, liver parenchymal alterations, and potential complications.

name: Biliary dyskinesia
definition: Functional disorder of bile duct motility identified through specialized imaging techniques like hepatobiliary scintigraphy, demonstrating impaired bile flow and gallbladder contractility.

name: Biliary Leak
definition: Abnormal bile leakage identified through imaging techniques like MRCP, CT, or ERCP, characterized by contrast extravasation or fluid collections outside the biliary system.

name: Biliary obstruction
definition: Blockage in bile ducts detected through imaging studies like ultrasound, CT, or MRCP, showing narrowing, filling defects, or complete interruption of bile flow.

name: Biliary Stones
definition: Calcified deposits within bile ducts or gallbladder, visualized through imaging techniques like ultrasound, CT, or X-ray, appearing as dense, radio-opaque structures.

name: Biliary Stricture (benign or malignant)
definition: Narrowing of bile ducts identified through imaging, which can be caused by various factors and may be benign or malignant. Radiological assessment helps determine etiology and potential interventions.

name: Biliary Strictures
definition: Narrowing of bile ducts identified through imaging, which can be caused by various factors and may be benign or malignant. Radiological assessment helps determine etiology and potential interventions.

name: Biliary strictures due to stones or surgery
definition: Bile duct narrowing resulting from stone impaction or surgical complications, detected through imaging techniques like MRCP, CT, or ERCP, showing localized narrowing or irregularity.

name: Biloma
definition: Localized bile fluid collection outside the biliary system, typically identified through CT or ultrasound as a well-defined fluid collection with specific imaging characteristics.

name: Binswanger's disease
definition: A type of vascular dementia characterized by extensive white matter changes and lacunar infarcts visible on neuroimaging. Radiologically, it presents with multiple small vessel ischemic lesions and periventricular white matter hyperintensities.

name: Biochemical tests/Physical examination
definition: Non-imaging diagnostic methods involving laboratory analysis of bodily fluids and physical patient assessment. Provides complementary clinical information to radiological findings.

name: Bizarre parosteal osteochondromatous proliferation (BPOP)
definition: A rare, benign bone lesion characterized by an exophytic osseous proliferation typically occurring in the metaphysis of long bones. Radiographically, it appears as a localized, sessile bone growth with mixed osseous and cartilaginous components.

name: Bladder
definition: A hollow muscular organ in the urinary system that stores urine before excretion. In radiology, it is typically visualized using ultrasound, CT, or MRI to assess its structure, size, and potential pathological conditions.

name: Bladder Cancer
definition: Malignant tumor originating in the bladder's urothelial lining. Radiologically characterized by irregular masses, wall thickening, and potential invasion of surrounding structures on CT, MRI, or ultrasound.

name: Bladder Cancer (Urothelial Carcinoma)
definition: A specific type of bladder cancer arising from the urothelial cells lining the bladder. Radiographic features include irregular masses, wall thickening, and potential metastatic spread.

name: Bladder Diverticula
definition: Abnormal outpouchings or sac-like protrusions in the bladder wall. Radiologically detected on imaging studies as focal outward bulges that can potentially harbor stones or become sites of recurrent infections.

name: Bladder Diverticulum
definition: An abnormal sac-like protrusion in the bladder wall. Radiographically identified as a localized outward bulge that can potentially cause urinary complications.

name: Bladder neck contracture
definition: A narrowing of the bladder neck region that restricts urinary flow. Radiologically characterized by reduced bladder neck diameter and potential obstruction on imaging studies.

name: Bladder outlet obstruction
definition: A condition where urinary flow is impeded at the bladder's exit point. Radiographically identified through imaging techniques showing narrowing, obstruction, or structural abnormalities preventing normal urine passage.

name: Bladder Stones
definition: Solid mineral deposits that form within the bladder. Radiologically detected as dense, calcified structures with distinct imaging characteristics on CT, X-ray, or ultrasound.

name: Blade of grass sign
definition: A radiographic finding characterized by a thin, linear opacity resembling a blade of grass, typically seen in certain lung conditions or chest imaging studies.

name: Blake's Pouch Cyst
definition: A developmental cyst located in the chorioretinal region, typically observed during fetal imaging. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, fluid-filled structure near the optic nerve.

name: Bleeding disorders
definition: Medical conditions affecting blood's ability to clot properly. Radiologically relevant in assessing potential hemorrhagic risks and interpreting imaging findings related to spontaneous bleeding.

name: Blood clot
definition: A semi-solid mass of coagulated blood formed within a blood vessel or tissue. Radiologically identified as a dense, localized area of increased attenuation on imaging studies.

name: Blood clots
definition: Aggregates of coagulated blood that can form within blood vessels. Radiologically detected as dense, localized areas of increased attenuation on various imaging modalities.

name: Blunt Trauma
definition: Physical injury caused by non-penetrating force or impact. Radiologically assessed through various imaging techniques to evaluate internal organ damage, fractures, and soft tissue injuries.

name: Bone
definition: Rigid connective tissue forming the skeletal structure of the body. In radiology, bones are evaluated for structural integrity, density, and potential pathological changes.

name: Bone abscess
definition: Localized collection of pus within bone tissue, typically appearing as a destructive lesion with surrounding inflammatory changes on imaging studies.

name: Bone biopsy
definition: A minimally invasive procedure where a needle is used to extract a small sample of bone tissue for microscopic examination. Helps diagnose bone disorders, tumors, and infections.

name: Bone infarct
definition: Area of bone tissue with compromised blood supply, resulting in localized cell death and characteristic radiographic appearance of decreased density or sclerotic changes.

name: Bone lesions
definition: Abnormal areas or changes within bone tissue detectable through radiographic imaging, potentially indicating various pathological processes.

name: Bone marrow biopsy
definition: A diagnostic procedure involving extraction of bone marrow tissue using a specialized needle to evaluate blood cell production and detect hematological disorders.

name: Bone marrow changes
definition: Alterations in bone marrow signal intensity or appearance on imaging studies, potentially indicating underlying disease processes or systemic conditions.

name: Bone Marrow Edema
definition: Increased fluid content within bone marrow spaces, appearing as increased signal intensity on MRI and indicating potential inflammatory or traumatic processes.

name: Bone Metastases
definition: Spread of cancerous cells to bone tissue, typically appearing as destructive lesions or areas of abnormal density on radiographic imaging.

name: Bone Metastases/Fracture/Infection
definition: Comprehensive radiological assessment of bone-related pathological conditions involving metastatic spread, potential fractures, and infectious processes.

name: Bone Metastasis
definition: Spread of cancerous cells to bone tissue, typically appearing as destructive lesions or areas of abnormal density on radiographic imaging.

name: Bone Scan
definition: Nuclear medicine imaging technique using radioactive tracers to detect bone abnormalities, metabolic changes, and potential pathological processes.

name: Bone Scan, PET/CT
definition: Nuclear medicine imaging technique using radioactive tracers to detect bone metabolism, identify bone metastases, fractures, and inflammatory conditions.

name: Bone tumor
definition: Abnormal growth of cells within bone tissue, which can be benign or malignant, detected and characterized through various radiographic imaging techniques.

name: Boot-shaped heart
definition: A distinctive cardiac silhouette on chest radiography where the heart appears triangular or pointed, often associated with certain congenital heart diseases like Tetralogy of Fallot.

name: Bowel injury
definition: Damage or trauma to the intestinal wall, detectable through various radiographic imaging techniques such as CT or contrast studies.

name: Bowel ischemia
definition: Compromised blood supply to intestinal tissue, resulting in potential tissue damage or necrosis, identifiable through vascular and contrast imaging studies.

name: Bowel Obstruction
definition: Blockage or interruption of normal intestinal transit, typically visualized through contrast studies, CT, or X-ray imaging.

name: Bowel Perforation
definition: Breach or rupture of the intestinal wall, detectable through contrast studies, CT imaging, or pneumoperitoneum identification.

name: Bowel Trauma
definition: Damage or injury to the intestinal tract, often detected through CT scans showing bowel wall disruption, free air, or contrast extravasation. Radiological assessment is critical for determining the extent and location of trauma.

name: BPH
definition: Benign prostatic enlargement typically seen on imaging as prostate gland volume increase and potential urinary tract obstruction. Ultrasound and MRI can demonstrate prostate size and structural changes.

name: Brain abnormalities
definition: Structural or functional variations in brain tissue detected through neuroimaging techniques like CT and MRI. Radiological findings can include structural changes, lesions, or abnormal tissue characteristics.

name: Brain Abscess
definition: Localized brain infection characterized by a focal collection of pus within brain parenchyma, typically appearing as ring-enhancing lesions on contrast CT or MRI scans.

name: Brain bleed
definition: Intracranial hemorrhage detected through CT or MRI, showing blood accumulation within brain tissue or surrounding spaces. Radiological assessment helps determine hemorrhage type, location, and potential intervention.

name: Brain Death
definition: Irreversible cessation of brain function, confirmed through neuroimaging demonstrating complete absence of cerebral blood flow and brain activity.

name: Brain Metastases
definition: Secondary brain tumors originating from cancers in other body regions, typically appearing as multiple contrast-enhancing lesions on neuroimaging studies.

name: Brain Tumor
definition: Abnormal tissue growth within brain parenchyma, detected through CT or MRI as space-occupying lesions with distinct imaging characteristics.

name: Brain Tumors
definition: Multiple or singular abnormal tissue growths within brain tissue, characterized by distinct radiological features on neuroimaging studies.

name: Branch Atheromatous Disease (BAD)
definition: Atherosclerotic disease affecting smaller cerebral blood vessel branches, typically identified through advanced neuroimaging techniques showing vessel wall changes.

name: Branchial Cleft Cyst
definition: Congenital neck mass originating from embryological remnants, typically appearing as fluid-filled cystic lesions on neck imaging studies.

name: Branchial Cleft Cyst (2nd)
definition: Specific type of branchial cleft cyst located in the lateral neck region, typically identified through ultrasound or CT imaging.

name: Branchial Cleft Cyst (BCC)
definition: Congenital neck cyst arising from branchial cleft embryological development, detectable through neck imaging techniques.

name: Breast Abscess
definition: Localized infection within breast tissue, appearing as fluid collections or inflammatory changes on mammography, ultrasound, or MRI.

name: Breast Calcifications (Benign vs. Malignant)
definition: Calcium deposits within breast tissue detected on mammography, with distinct radiological features differentiating between benign and potentially malignant characteristics.

name: Breast Calcifications (Benign)
definition: Small, dense deposits of calcium in breast tissue visible on mammography. Benign calcifications are typically round, smooth, and clustered in a specific pattern.

name: Breast Cancer
definition: Malignant tumor originating in breast tissue, characterized by uncontrolled cell growth and potential for metastasis. Detected through mammography, ultrasound, and other imaging techniques.

name: Breast Cancer (implied)
definition: Malignant tumor originating in breast tissue, characterized by uncontrolled cell growth and potential for metastasis. Detected through mammography, ultrasound, and other imaging techniques.

name: Breast Cancer (including Invasive Ductal Carcinoma)
definition: Malignant breast tumor originating in milk ducts that has potential to invade surrounding breast tissue. Characterized by abnormal cell proliferation and potential for metastasis.

name: Breast Cancer (Invasive)
definition: Breast cancer that has spread beyond the original tumor site and invaded surrounding breast tissue. Typically detected through imaging studies showing tissue infiltration.

name: Breast Cancer with Nodal Metastases
definition: Breast cancer that has spread to lymph nodes, indicating advanced disease stage. Characterized by cancer cells present in regional lymph node tissue.

name: Breast Carcinoma
definition: Malignant tumor arising in breast tissue, characterized by abnormal cell growth and potential for spreading to other body parts. Detected through various imaging modalities.

name: Breast Cysts
definition: Fluid-filled sacs within breast tissue, typically benign and visible on ultrasound or mammography. Can be simple or complex in appearance.

name: Breast Hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment or incomplete growth of breast tissue, potentially visible through imaging studies showing reduced breast volume or density.

name: Breast Implant Rupture
definition: Structural compromise or tear in breast implant, detectable through imaging techniques like ultrasound or MRI showing implant integrity disruption.

name: Breast Lesion (BI-RADS 4-5)
definition: Suspicious breast abnormality with moderate to high probability of malignancy, classified as BI-RADS 4-5 requiring further investigation.

name: Breast lesions
definition: Abnormal tissue formations or changes within breast tissue, detectable through various imaging modalities and requiring radiological assessment.

name: Breast Malignancy
definition: Cancerous growth or tumor in breast tissue with potential for invasive behavior and metastasis, identified through radiological imaging.

name: Breast Mass
definition: Abnormal tissue growth or lump in breast tissue, detectable through mammography, ultrasound, or other imaging techniques.

name: Breast MRI
definition: Advanced magnetic resonance imaging technique specifically designed to evaluate breast tissue with high sensitivity, particularly useful for detecting breast cancer in high-risk patients.

name: Breast Papilloma
definition: Benign epithelial tumor of breast ducts, typically appearing as a well-defined lesion on imaging studies.

name: Brodie's Abscess (Subacute OM)
definition: A localized bone infection characterized by a chronic, circumscribed abscess within the bone, typically seen in the metaphysis of long bones. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, sclerotic lesion with a central radiolucent area.

name: Brodie Abscess
definition: A localized bone infection characterized by a chronic, circumscribed abscess within the bone, typically seen in the metaphysis of long bones. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, sclerotic lesion with a central radiolucent area.

name: Bronchial-Pulmonary Artery Shunts
definition: Abnormal vascular connections between bronchial arteries and pulmonary arteries, which can be visualized on CT angiography and may cause hemodynamic alterations in the lung vasculature.

name: Bronchial Artery Hypertrophy
definition: Enlargement of bronchial arteries, often seen in chronic lung diseases, visible on chest CT as increased bronchial artery diameter and wall thickness.

name: Bronchial rupture
definition: A traumatic or pathological tear in the bronchial wall, typically identified on CT imaging as an irregular discontinuity of the bronchial wall with potential surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Bronchiectasis
definition: A chronic lung condition characterized by permanent abnormal dilation of bronchi, visible on CT as bronchial wall thickening, increased bronchial diameter, and potential mucus impaction.

name: Bronchiolitis
definition: An inflammatory condition of the small airways (bronchioles), typically seen in children, characterized on chest radiographs and CT by hyperinflation, peribronchial thickening, and patchy ground-glass opacities.

name: Bronchiolitis Obliterans
definition: A rare lung disease characterized by progressive fibrosis and scarring of small airways, visible on CT as mosaic attenuation, air trapping, and bronchial wall thickening.

name: Bronchitis
definition: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes, radiographically demonstrated by bronchial wall thickening, increased mucus, and potential peribronchial infiltrates on chest imaging.

name: Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia (BPD)
