definition: A chronic lung disease in premature infants characterized by abnormal lung development and scarring, visible on chest radiographs as hyperinflation, cystic changes, and irregular lung parenchyma.

name: Bronchoscopy
definition: An endoscopic procedure allowing direct visualization of airways using a flexible instrument with a camera, enabling diagnostic and therapeutic interventions in the respiratory system.

name: Brown tumor of hyperparathyroidism
definition: A bone lesion associated with hyperparathyroidism, appearing on radiographs as a lytic, expansile bone tumor with decreased bone density and potential pathological fracture.

name: Bucket handle fracture
definition: A specific type of meniscal tear where the torn fragment is displaced centrally, resembling a bucket handle, typically identified on MRI as a displaced linear tear.

name: Bucket handle meniscal tear
definition: A specific type of meniscal tear where the torn fragment is displaced centrally, resembling a bucket handle, typically identified on MRI as a displaced linear tear.

name: Buckle (torus) fracture
definition: A pediatric fracture characterized by cortical buckling or compression without complete disruption, typically seen in children's long bones and appearing as a subtle cortical deformity on radiographs.

name: Budd-Chiari Syndrome
definition: A hepatic venous outflow obstruction syndrome characterized by thrombosis of hepatic veins, visible on imaging as hepatic congestion, caudate lobe hypertrophy, and potential inferior vena cava narrowing.

name: Budd-Chiari Syndrome (BCS)
definition: A rare vascular disorder characterized by hepatic venous outflow obstruction, typically seen on imaging as hepatic congestion, ascites, and potential collateral vessel formation. Radiological findings include hepatic vein thrombosis or stenosis.

name: Buford Complex
definition: An anatomical variant of the anterior shoulder involving a single, thick, cord-like middle glenohumeral ligament that replaces the typical anterior band configuration. Significant in shoulder imaging and orthopedic assessments.

name: Bullae
definition: Thin-walled air-filled spaces within lung parenchyma, typically larger than 1 cm, representing areas of localized lung destruction. Radiographically visible on chest CT and chest X-rays as round, thin-walled lucent spaces.

name: Burst fracture
definition: A severe spinal fracture involving vertebral body compression and potential posterior element disruption, characterized by significant height loss and potential retropulsion of bone fragments. Typically identified on CT and MRI with characteristic radiographic findings.

name: C. difficile Colitis (Pseudomembranous Colitis)
definition: Inflammatory bowel condition caused by Clostridioides difficile infection, characterized by mucosal inflammation and pseudomembrane formation. Radiologically evident through colonic wall thickening and mucosal irregularity on CT and ultrasound.

name: CADASIL
synonyms: Cerebral Autosomal Dominant Arteriopathy with Subcortical Infarcts and Leukoencephalopathy
definition: Hereditary cerebrovascular disorder causing progressive small vessel disease, characterized by recurrent strokes and dementia. Neuroimaging reveals characteristic white matter changes and small vessel abnormalities.

name: Calcaneofibular Ligament (CFL) Tear
definition: Ligamentous injury involving the lateral ankle's calcaneofibular ligament, typically seen in ankle sprains. Radiological assessment includes MRI and ultrasound to evaluate ligament integrity and potential tear.

name: Calcification
definition: Abnormal deposition of calcium in soft tissues or organs, appearing as dense, white areas on radiographic imaging. Can indicate various pathological processes or degenerative changes.

name: Calcifications (Breast)
definition: Mineral deposits within breast tissue, detectable on mammography as white spots or specks. Can indicate benign or potentially malignant changes in breast tissue.

name: Calcified adenoma (Pituitary Stone)
definition: A rare, benign pituitary gland lesion characterized by calcium deposits within the tumor. Typically identified through CT or X-ray imaging as dense, calcified regions.

name: Calcified lymph nodes
definition: Lymph nodes with calcium deposits, often indicating prior infections, inflammation, or malignancy. Radiographically visible as dense, white areas within lymph node structures.

name: Calcium Pyrophosphate Deposition (CPPD)
definition: A metabolic disorder involving calcium pyrophosphate crystal deposition in joints, visible on radiographs as calcifications in cartilage and soft tissues. Commonly associated with degenerative joint changes.

name: Calculi
definition: Solid, stone-like formations that can develop in various body systems, such as kidneys, gallbladder, or urinary tract. Radiologically identified as dense, well-defined structures on imaging studies.

name: Canavan Disease
definition: A rare, inherited neurological disorder characterized by spongy degeneration of the brain's white matter. Neuroimaging reveals characteristic brain tissue changes and progressive cerebral deterioration.

name: Cancer
definition: Abnormal cellular growth with potential to invade surrounding tissues, characterized by uncontrolled cell proliferation. Radiological assessment involves various imaging modalities to detect, stage, and monitor tumor progression.

name: Cancer-Related Pain (Metastatic Spinal Lesions)
definition: Pain resulting from metastatic spinal lesions, typically visualized through radiographic imaging techniques like CT and MRI. These lesions can cause structural bone damage and neurological compression.

name: Cancer risk
definition: Probability of developing cancer, often assessed through genetic markers, family history, and radiological screening techniques. Imaging can help identify potential precancerous or high-risk conditions.

name: Capillary telangiectasia
definition: Small, dilated blood vessels within the central nervous system, typically identified through advanced neuroimaging techniques like MRI. These vascular malformations can appear as small, enhancing lesions.

name: Capsular contracture
definition: Abnormal hardening and tightening of tissue surrounding breast implants, detectable through imaging techniques like ultrasound and MRI. Can cause distortion and potential implant displacement.

name: Capsular laxity
definition: Excessive looseness or weakness of joint capsules, identifiable through radiographic imaging such as X-ray or MRI. Can indicate joint instability or potential structural compromise.

name: Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
definition: Toxic condition caused by carbon monoxide inhalation, detectable through chest radiography and CT scans showing potential lung parenchymal changes and diffuse pulmonary abnormalities.

name: Carcinoid
definition: Slow-growing neuroendocrine tumor typically identified through CT, MRI, and nuclear imaging techniques. Often found in gastrointestinal tract and can metastasize to liver.

name: Carcinomatous Meningitis
definition: Malignant infiltration of the meninges by cancer cells, visualized through contrast-enhanced MRI showing leptomeningeal enhancement and potential cerebrospinal fluid abnormalities.

name: Cardiac abnormalities
definition: Structural or functional irregularities of the heart, detectable through various imaging modalities including echocardiography, CT, and MRI. Can range from congenital defects to acquired conditions.

name: Cardiac Amyloid
definition: Protein deposition within cardiac tissue, characterized by distinctive imaging features on cardiac MRI and nuclear scans. Typically shows increased myocardial thickness and altered signal intensity.

name: Cardiac Arrhythmias (e.g., Atrial Fibrillation)
definition: Irregular heart rhythms detectable through electrocardiography and advanced cardiac imaging techniques. Can present with structural heart changes visible on imaging studies.

name: Cardiac causes of hepatic congestion
definition: Liver congestion resulting from cardiac dysfunction, identifiable through abdominal imaging techniques like ultrasound and CT. Shows characteristic venous engorgement and potential hepatic changes.

name: Cardiac CT
definition: Non-invasive computed tomography imaging of the heart to evaluate cardiac anatomy, coronary arteries, and detect cardiovascular diseases.

name: Cardiac Dyssynchrony
definition: Abnormal coordination of cardiac muscle contraction, visualized through advanced cardiac imaging like cardiac MRI and echocardiography. Shows asynchronous muscle movement.

name: Cardiac MRI
definition: Advanced magnetic resonance imaging technique providing detailed visualization of cardiac structure, function, and blood flow without radiation exposure.

name: Cardiac Rhabdomyoma
definition: Benign cardiac tumor typically occurring in children, identifiable through echocardiography and cardiac MRI. Characterized by distinctive imaging features and potential functional implications.

name: Cardiogenic pulmonary edema
definition: Fluid accumulation in lungs due to cardiac dysfunction, visualized through chest radiography and CT scans. Shows characteristic bilateral infiltrates and potential vascular redistribution.

name: Cardiomyopathy
definition: A group of heart muscle diseases characterized by structural and functional abnormalities of the myocardium. Radiological imaging can reveal cardiac chamber enlargement, wall thickening, and reduced cardiac function.

name: Caroli Disease
definition: A rare congenital disorder involving cystic dilatation of the intrahepatic bile ducts. Radiological imaging typically shows multiple, saccular bile duct dilations within the liver.

name: Caroli Disease (Type V Choledochal Cyst)
definition: A specific type of choledochal cyst characterized by extensive bile duct dilatation and potential malignant transformation. Radiological imaging reveals significant bile duct abnormalities and potential complications.

name: Carotid Artery Dissection
definition: A tear in the inner lining of the carotid artery causing blood to enter the arterial wall. Imaging techniques like CT and MR angiography can visualize the dissection and associated vascular changes.

name: Carotid Body Tumor (Paraganglioma, Chemodectoma)
definition: A rare, typically benign tumor arising from the carotid body near the carotid artery bifurcation. Radiological imaging can help characterize the tumor's size, location, and potential vascular involvement.

name: Carotid Canal Involvement
definition: Radiological evidence of pathological changes or lesions within the carotid canal of the skull. Imaging can reveal bone erosion, tumor invasion, or inflammatory processes.

name: Carpal boss
definition: A bony prominence on the dorsal aspect of the hand's carpus, typically seen as an incidental finding on radiographs. Can be visualized on standard hand X-rays.

name: Carpal Bossing (Wrist)
definition: A bony protrusion or thickening at the dorsal wrist region, often visible on radiographic imaging. Can be associated with degenerative changes or repetitive stress.

name: Carpal Instability
definition: Abnormal movement or misalignment of carpal bones, detectable through radiographic imaging techniques. Can involve abnormal joint kinematics and potential ligamentous disruption.

name: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome (CTS)
definition: Compression of the median nerve at the wrist, often visible through imaging showing tunnel narrowing or soft tissue changes. Ultrasound and MRI can demonstrate nerve swelling and compression.

name: Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer (CRPC)
definition: Advanced prostate cancer that continues to progress despite androgen deprivation therapy. Radiological imaging can track metastatic spread and tumor progression.

name: Cataract formation
definition: Progressive clouding of the eye's natural lens, observable through various imaging modalities. Radiological techniques can assess lens density and potential surgical intervention requirements.

name: Cataracts
definition: Progressive clouding of the eye's lens leading to vision impairment. Imaging can help evaluate lens density, location, and potential surgical planning.

name: Catheter Angio
definition: Invasive vascular imaging technique using a catheter inserted into blood vessels to obtain detailed images of arterial and venous systems.

name: Catheter Angiography
definition: Invasive vascular imaging technique using a catheter inserted into blood vessels to obtain detailed images of arterial and venous systems.

name: Catheter Kinking/Malfunction
definition: Mechanical complications in medical catheters causing potential obstruction or improper positioning. Radiological imaging can detect and assess catheter positioning and potential malfunction.

name: Catheter occlusion
definition: Complete or partial blockage of a medical catheter, detectable through radiographic contrast studies or imaging techniques. Can impede medical treatment or intervention.

name: Catheter Tip Migration
definition: Displacement of a catheter from its intended anatomical position, which can be detected on radiographic imaging. Misplacement can lead to potential complications or ineffective medical intervention.

name: Catheter Venography
definition: Specialized catheter-based imaging technique to evaluate venous structures, diagnose venous thrombosis, and assess blood flow in veins.

name: Cavernous malformation
definition: Abnormal vascular malformation characterized by clusters of dilated capillaries and venous channels with minimal intervening neural tissue. Often appears as a well-defined lesion on MRI with distinctive signal characteristics.

name: CE-MRA
definition: Contrast-enhanced magnetic resonance angiography technique providing high-resolution images of blood vessels after contrast material injection.

name: Cecal diverticulitis
definition: Inflammatory condition involving inflammation of a diverticulum in the cecum, typically visualized on CT scans with characteristic signs of wall thickening, pericolonic fat stranding, and potential abscess formation.

name: Cecal Volvulus
definition: Twisting of the cecum around its mesenteric axis, causing bowel obstruction, which can be identified on radiographic imaging as a dilated, twisted cecal segment with potential signs of bowel wall ischemia.

name: Celiac Disease
definition: Autoimmune disorder causing small intestinal mucosal damage in response to gluten, characterized by characteristic intestinal changes visible on radiographic and endoscopic imaging.

name: Celiac Disease (Gluten-sensitive Enteropathy)
definition: Autoimmune disorder causing small intestinal mucosal damage in response to gluten, characterized by characteristic intestinal changes visible on radiographic and endoscopic imaging.

name: Cellulitis
definition: Bacterial skin infection characterized by inflammation and redness of soft tissue, which may show soft tissue edema and increased density on radiographic imaging.

name: Cement Pulmonary Embolism (Cement PE)
definition: Complication occurring when bone cement enters the pulmonary vasculature during orthopedic procedures, visible on chest radiographs as radiopaque embolic material within pulmonary vessels.

name: Central Herniation
definition: Severe brain herniation where brain tissue is displaced through the tentorial notch, typically identified on CT or MRI as a critical neurological finding with significant midline shift.

name: Central Neurocytoma
definition: Rare, typically benign intraventricular brain tumor composed of neurocytic cells, usually detected on MRI with characteristic signal intensity and location.

name: Central Pontine Myelinolysis (CPM)
definition: Demyelinating condition of the pons characterized by destruction of myelin sheaths, typically identified on MRI with specific signal changes and potential hemorrhagic components.

name: Central Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of the central spinal canal causing potential neurological compression, visible on radiographic imaging as reduced canal diameter and potential associated soft tissue or bony changes.

name: Central Venous Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of central venous structures, typically detected through venography or cross-sectional imaging, which can impede blood flow and cause potential vascular complications.

name: Central Venous Stenosis (CVS)
definition: Narrowing of central venous structures, typically detected through venography or cross-sectional imaging, which can impede blood flow and cause potential vascular complications.

name: Cerebral Amyloid Angiopathy (CAA)
definition: Amyloid protein deposition in cerebral blood vessel walls, causing potential hemorrhagic and ischemic complications, typically identified on MRI with characteristic vascular changes.

name: Cerebral Aneurysm
definition: A localized, abnormal dilation or ballooning of a cerebral blood vessel wall, which appears as a saccular or fusiform outpouching on imaging studies. Radiology plays a crucial role in detecting, characterizing, and monitoring these potentially life-threatening vascular abnormalities.

name: Cerebral Arterial Dissection
definition: A tear or separation within the layers of a cerebral artery wall, causing potential blood flow disruption and potential stroke risk. Radiological imaging is essential for identifying the location, extent, and potential complications of the dissection.

name: Cerebral atrophy
definition: Progressive loss of brain tissue volume characterized by shrinkage of brain structures, typically seen as widened sulci and ventricles on imaging studies. Radiological assessment helps quantify and monitor the progression of brain tissue loss.

name: Cerebral Cavernous Malformation (CCM)
definition: A cluster of abnormally formed blood vessels in the brain with a high risk of bleeding, appearing as distinctive lesions on MRI with characteristic signal characteristics. Radiological detection is crucial for monitoring potential hemorrhagic risks.

name: Cerebral Edema
definition: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in brain tissue, causing swelling and increased intracranial pressure, visible as altered tissue density on CT and signal changes on MRI. Radiological evaluation is critical for assessing type, extent, and potential underlying causes.

name: Cerebral herniation
definition: Displacement of brain tissue through anatomical openings due to increased intracranial pressure, visible as structural shifts and compression on imaging studies. Radiological identification is crucial for urgent medical intervention.

name: Cerebral Microbleeds
definition: Small, punctate hemorrhagic lesions in brain tissue, typically detected on gradient-echo or susceptibility-weighted MRI sequences. These are important markers of underlying vascular pathology or neurological conditions.

name: Cerebral vasculitis
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting cerebral blood vessels, causing vessel wall changes and potential vessel narrowing or occlusion, detectable through various imaging modalities. Radiological assessment helps evaluate disease extent and progression.

name: Cerebral Venous Thrombosis
definition: Formation of blood clots in cerebral venous structures, potentially causing significant brain tissue damage, visible through various imaging techniques. Radiological diagnosis is critical for immediate management and preventing complications.

name: Cervical Cancer
definition: Malignant neoplasm originating in the cervix, characterized by abnormal tissue growth detectable through various imaging modalities. Radiological techniques are essential for staging, treatment planning, and monitoring.

name: Cervical polyps
definition: Benign, soft tissue growths extending from the cervical surface, typically identified during gynecological imaging studies. Radiological assessment helps characterize size, location, and potential clinical significance.

name: Cervical radiculopathy
definition: Nerve root compression or irritation in the cervical spine, causing pain and neurological symptoms, detectable through advanced imaging techniques. Radiological evaluation helps identify the precise location and extent of nerve root involvement.

name: Cervical Spine Injury
definition: Traumatic damage to cervical spine structures, potentially involving vertebrae, ligaments, or spinal cord, critically assessed through radiological imaging for extent and potential neurological implications.

name: Cervical spondylotic myelopathy
definition: Degenerative condition causing spinal cord compression in the cervical region, characterized by progressive neurological dysfunction, detectable through advanced imaging techniques. Radiological assessment is crucial for diagnosis and surgical planning.

name: CEUS
definition: Ultrasound imaging technique using contrast agents to enhance visualization of blood flow and tissue characteristics.

name: Charcot arthropathy
definition: Progressive joint destruction associated with neurological disorders, typically affecting weight-bearing joints, characterized by distinctive radiological findings of bone and joint changes.

name: Charcot neuroarthropathy
definition: A progressive joint and bone degenerative condition characterized by joint destruction, bone resorption, and abnormal joint architecture, typically seen in patients with neurological disorders like diabetes or syphilis. Radiographically demonstrates joint disorganization, fragmentation, and pathological changes.

name: Chemical Shift Artifact
definition: A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) artifact caused by the chemical shift difference between fat and water protons, resulting in misalignment or signal loss at tissue interfaces. Appears as a dark or bright band adjacent to fat-water boundaries.

name: Chemotherapy-induced cardiotoxicity
definition: Radiation and chemotherapy-induced cardiac damage characterized by myocardial dysfunction, reduced ejection fraction, and potential heart failure. Imaging techniques like echocardiography and cardiac MRI can detect structural and functional cardiac changes.

name: Chest X-ray
definition: Standard radiographic imaging of the chest, used to evaluate lung, heart, and thoracic structures for various pathological conditions.

name: Chest X-ray, CT
definition: A radiographic imaging technique that uses low-dose X-rays to visualize the chest cavity, lungs, heart, and surrounding structures. Chest X-rays are a primary screening tool for detecting lung diseases, cardiac conditions, and chest abnormalities.

name: Chiari I Malformation
definition: Congenital brain malformation characterized by downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils through the foramen magnum, without significant brainstem involvement. Radiologically identified through MRI showing tonsillar herniation below the foramen magnum.

name: Chiari II Malformation
definition: More severe congenital brain malformation involving downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils, brainstem, and fourth ventricle, often associated with myelomeningocele. Characterized by significant anatomical changes visible on neuroimaging.

name: Chiari Malformation
definition: Congenital structural brain abnormality involving downward displacement of cerebellar structures through the foramen magnum, with varying degrees of severity and associated neurological complications. Diagnosed through detailed neuroimaging studies.

name: Chiasmatic/Hypothalamic Glioma
definition: A rare central nervous system tumor located in the chiasmatic or hypothalamic region, typically affecting children. Radiologically characterized by infiltrative growth pattern and potential involvement of adjacent brain structures.

name: Child abuse
definition: Physical trauma inflicted upon a child, involving intentional injury causing physical harm. Radiological findings may include fractures, soft tissue injuries, and characteristic patterns of injury inconsistent with accidental trauma.

name: Child abuse (fractures)
definition: Traumatic bone injuries in children resulting from non-accidental trauma, often presenting with specific radiographic patterns indicating intentional injury. Characterized by fractures inconsistent with developmental stage or reported mechanism.

name: Child abuse (metaphyseal corner fractures)
definition: Specific type of fracture near the growth plate in children, often associated with abusive trauma. Radiographically appears as small, triangular bone fragments at metaphyseal regions, suggesting non-accidental injury.

name: Childhood cancer
definition: Malignant neoplasms occurring in pediatric populations, characterized by abnormal cell growth and potential metastasis. Radiological evaluation crucial for diagnosis, staging, and treatment monitoring.

name: Cholangiocarcinoma
definition: Malignant tumor arising from bile duct epithelial cells, typically located in the liver or bile ducts. Radiologically characterized by infiltrative growth, potential biliary obstruction, and metastatic spread.

name: Cholangiocarcinoma (CCA)
definition: Malignant bile duct tumor with specific radiographic characteristics, involving epithelial cells of the biliary system. Typically identified through advanced imaging techniques like CT and MRI.

name: Cholangiocarcinoma (Klatskin Tumor)
definition: Specific type of cholangiocarcinoma located at the hepatic bile duct confluence, characterized by distinctive radiological appearance and potential surgical challenges.

name: Cholangitis
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting bile ducts, characterized by infection and potential biliary obstruction. Radiologically demonstrated through imaging showing ductal wall thickening, dilation, and potential abscess formation.

name: Cholecystitis
definition: Inflammation of the gallbladder typically characterized by wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, and potential gallstones on imaging studies. Radiological findings often include ultrasound or CT evidence of gallbladder wall edema and potential perforation.

name: Cholecystitis with complications
definition: Advanced stage of cholecystitis with potential additional radiological findings such as abscess formation, perforation, emphysematous changes, or gangrenous transformation of the gallbladder wall.

name: Choledochal Cyst
definition: Congenital dilation of the bile duct, typically appearing as a cystic lesion on imaging studies. Radiological evaluation often involves ultrasound, CT, or MRCP to characterize the cyst's size, location, and potential complications.

name: Choledochal Cysts
definition: Congenital dilation of the bile duct, typically appearing as multiple cystic lesions on imaging studies. Radiological evaluation often involves ultrasound, CT, or MRCP to characterize the cysts' sizes, locations, and potential complications.

name: Choledocholithiasis
definition: Presence of gallstones within the common bile duct, typically detected through imaging techniques like ultrasound, CT, or MRCP. Radiological findings often include dilated bile ducts and visible stone(s) obstructing bile flow.

name: Cholelithiasis
definition: Presence of gallstones within the gallbladder, typically detected through ultrasound imaging. Radiological findings include hyperechoic foci with acoustic shadowing within the gallbladder lumen.

name: Cholesteatoma
definition: Benign epithelial tumor typically occurring in the middle ear, characterized by keratinizing squamous epithelium. Radiological evaluation using CT or MRI helps assess extent and potential bone erosion.

name: Chondroblastoma
definition: Benign cartilage-forming tumor typically occurring in the epiphysis of long bones, characterized by characteristic radiographic appearance of lytic lesion with potential calcifications.

name: Chondroid Lesions
definition: Radiological term describing lesions with cartilaginous characteristics, typically evaluated using multiple imaging modalities to assess composition and potential malignancy.

name: Chondrosarcoma
definition: Malignant cartilage-forming tumor with distinct radiological features including destructive bone changes, soft tissue extension, and potential calcifications on CT and MRI.

name: Chordoma
definition: Rare, slow-growing bone tumor typically occurring at the skull base or spine, characterized by distinctive radiological appearance with destructive bone changes and soft tissue components.

name: Choroid Plexus Carcinoma
definition: Rare, aggressive brain tumor originating from choroid plexus cells, typically occurring in children. Radiological evaluation using MRI reveals contrast-enhancing intraventricular mass with potential hydrocephalus.

name: Choroid Plexus Carcinoma (CPC)
definition: Rare, aggressive brain tumor originating from choroid plexus cells, typically occurring in children. Radiological evaluation using MRI reveals contrast-enhancing intraventricular mass with potential hydrocephalus.

name: Choroid Plexus Papilloma
definition: Benign tumor originating from choroid plexus cells, typically occurring in children. Radiological evaluation using MRI reveals well-defined, contrast-enhancing intraventricular mass.

name: Choroid Plexus Papilloma (CPP)
definition: Benign tumor originating from choroid plexus cells, typically occurring in children. Radiological evaluation using MRI reveals well-defined, contrast-enhancing intraventricular mass.

name: Choroid Plexus Tumors
definition: Rare tumors arising from the choroid plexus of the brain's ventricles, which can be benign or malignant. Radiologically characterized by contrast enhancement and potential calcifications on CT and MRI.

name: Chromophobe RCC
definition: A subtype of renal cell carcinoma characterized by pale/clear cells with distinct cell borders. On imaging, typically appears as a solid renal mass with variable enhancement patterns.

name: Chronic Cholecystitis
definition: Long-standing inflammation of the gallbladder characterized by wall thickening, fibrosis, and potential calcifications. Radiologically identified through ultrasound and CT imaging showing gallbladder wall changes.

name: Chronic Diverticulitis
definition: Persistent inflammation of diverticula in the colon, characterized by bowel wall thickening, pericolonic fat stranding, and potential abscess formation on CT imaging.

name: Chronic Hepatitis B
definition: Persistent hepatic inflammation caused by hepatitis B virus, showing characteristic imaging findings of liver parenchymal changes, potential fibrosis, and nodularity on CT/MRI.

name: Chronic infarct
definition: An area of brain tissue permanently damaged by prolonged lack of blood supply, appearing as a well-defined hypodense lesion on CT or hyperintense area on T2 MRI sequences.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD)
definition: Progressive kidney damage characterized by reduced glomerular filtration rate, showing radiological signs of kidney size reduction, cortical thinning, and increased echogenicity on ultrasound.

name: Chronic Low Back Pain
definition: Persistent lower back pain lasting more than 12 weeks, often associated with degenerative changes visible on radiographic imaging such as disc narrowing, facet joint arthritis, and potential vertebral compression.

name: Chronic Mesenteric Ischemia
definition: Reduced blood flow to the intestinal vasculature causing chronic abdominal pain, with radiological findings of vessel stenosis, calcifications, and potential bowel wall changes on CT angiography.

name: Chronic Mesenteric Ischemia (CMI)
definition: Reduced blood flow to the intestinal vasculature causing chronic abdominal pain, with radiological findings of vessel stenosis, calcifications, and potential bowel wall changes on CT angiography.

name: Chronic Nonbacterial Osteomyelitis (CNO)
definition: Non-infectious inflammatory bone condition characterized by multifocal bone lesions with variable marrow edema and potential cortical destruction, identifiable through MRI and nuclear medicine imaging.

name: Chronic Obstruction
definition: Persistent blockage or narrowing of a physiological pathway, detectable through various imaging modalities showing reduced luminal diameter or complete occlusion.

name: Chronic Osteomyelitis
definition: Long-standing bone infection characterized by persistent inflammatory changes, bone destruction, and potential sequestrum formation, visible through multiple imaging techniques including X-ray, CT, and MRI.

name: Chronic Pancreatitis
definition: Progressive pancreatic inflammation leading to permanent structural changes, characterized by ductal dilation, calcifications, and parenchymal atrophy on CT and MRI imaging.

name: Chronic PE
definition: Persistent pulmonary embolism with organized thrombus formation, showing radiological evidence of vessel wall changes, potential scarring, and reduced vessel caliber on CT pulmonary angiography.

name: Chronic prostatitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the prostate gland characterized by persistent pain and urinary symptoms. Radiological findings may include prostate gland enlargement, heterogeneous signal intensity, and potential calcifications.

name: Chronic Rejection
definition: Long-term immune-mediated damage to transplanted organ characterized by progressive tissue destruction. Radiological features include structural changes, reduced organ perfusion, and potential fibrotic transformation.

name: Chronic subdural hematoma
definition: Slow accumulation of blood between the brain's surface and its outer protective membrane, typically in older adults. Radiologically appears as crescent-shaped hypodense or isodense extra-axial fluid collection on CT/MRI.

name: Chronic Temporal Lobe Epilepsy
definition: Persistent seizure disorder originating in temporal lobe with long-term neurological changes. Radiological findings may include hippocampal sclerosis, cortical atrophy, and potential signal intensity alterations.

name: Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension (CTEPH)
definition: Chronic pulmonary vascular disease resulting from organized thrombotic material obstructing pulmonary arteries. Radiological features include enlarged pulmonary arteries, mosaic perfusion patterns, and potential right ventricular hypertrophy.

name: Chronic Ureteral Obstruction
definition: Prolonged blockage of ureter causing progressive kidney damage. Radiological signs include hydronephrosis, renal parenchymal thinning, and potential calcifications or obstruction.

name: Chylothorax
definition: Accumulation of lymphatic fluid in pleural space due to lymphatic system disruption. Radiologically characterized by bilateral pleural effusions with high protein content and milky appearance.

name: Chylous Ascites
definition: Accumulation of lymphatic fluid in peritoneal cavity. Radiological findings include complex fluid collections with specific density characteristics and potential septations.

name: Cirrhosis
definition: Advanced liver scarring characterized by extensive fibrosis and nodular transformation. Radiological features include nodular liver surface, altered liver architecture, and potential vascular changes.

name: Clear cell RCC
definition: Renal cell carcinoma subtype with distinctive clear cell appearance. Radiologically appears as heterogeneous renal mass with potential hemorrhagic or necrotic components.

name: Clear Cell Sarcoma
definition: Rare soft tissue sarcoma typically occurring in extremities with melanocytic features. Radiologically presents as soft tissue mass with potential aggressive local invasion.

name: Cleft Lip/Palate
definition: Congenital facial malformation involving incomplete fusion of oral and facial structures. Radiological findings include disrupted facial bone and soft tissue development.

name: Clinical
definition: A systematic medical assessment involving patient evaluation, observation, and interpretation of symptoms and signs. In radiology, clinical assessment provides context and guidance for imaging studies.

name: Clinical and biochemical evaluation
definition: A comprehensive medical evaluation combining physical examination, patient history, and laboratory tests to diagnose and understand a patient's medical condition. This approach provides comprehensive diagnostic information complementing radiological findings.

name: Clinical assessment
definition: A structured medical evaluation involving patient examination, symptom analysis, and preliminary diagnostic reasoning. In radiology, clinical assessment helps determine appropriate imaging studies and interpret results.

name: Clinical assessment (Portal Pressure Gradient measurement)
definition: A specialized diagnostic technique measuring pressure gradients within the portal venous system, typically used to assess liver disease severity and portal hypertension. This method provides quantitative hemodynamic information.

name: Clinical Diagnosis
definition: A diagnostic process involving systematic evaluation of patient symptoms, medical history, and physical findings to determine a medical condition. In radiology, clinical diagnosis guides imaging selection and interpretation.

name: Clinical Diagnosis (PTC/PTBD is a treatment)
definition: A diagnostic approach involving medical assessment and potential interventional procedures like Percutaneous Transhepatic Cholangiography (PTC) or Percutaneous Transhepatic Biliary Drainage (PTBD) for evaluating biliary system disorders.

name: Clinical Diagnosis/Endoscopy
definition: A diagnostic method combining clinical evaluation with endoscopic visualization to assess internal body structures and potential pathological conditions. This approach provides direct visual and diagnostic information.

name: Clinical Evaluation
definition: A systematic medical assessment involving patient history, physical examination, and preliminary diagnostic reasoning. In radiology, clinical evaluation helps determine appropriate imaging strategies.

name: Clinical exam
definition: A comprehensive physical examination involving direct patient assessment, symptom analysis, and initial diagnostic reasoning. In radiology, clinical exams provide critical context for imaging interpretation.

name: Clinical exam/Biopsy
definition: A diagnostic approach combining clinical examination with tissue sampling through biopsy. This method provides both clinical assessment and definitive pathological diagnosis.

name: Clinical Exam/MRI
definition: A diagnostic method integrating clinical examination with Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) for comprehensive patient assessment. This approach combines physical evaluation with advanced imaging techniques.

name: Clinical History
definition: A detailed patient background investigation involving past medical events, family history, and previous health conditions. In radiology, clinical history provides essential context for imaging interpretation.

name: Clinical/Lab
definition: A comprehensive diagnostic approach combining clinical assessment with laboratory testing. This method provides multifaceted diagnostic information complementing radiological findings.

name: Clinical/Mammography/US
definition: A comprehensive diagnostic approach integrating clinical assessment with multiple imaging modalities including mammography and ultrasound. This method provides comprehensive diagnostic information across different imaging techniques.

name: Clinical/MRI
definition: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) used for diagnostic medical imaging. Utilizes magnetic fields and radio waves to generate detailed cross-sectional images of body structures.

name: Clinical/US
definition: Ultrasound imaging technique using high-frequency sound waves to produce real-time images of internal body structures. Non-invasive diagnostic method with no radiation exposure.

name: CMC arthritis
definition: Degenerative joint condition affecting carpometacarpal joint at base of thumb. Radiological signs include joint space narrowing, osteophyte formation, and potential subchondral sclerosis.

name: CMV
definition: Viral infection caused by cytomegalovirus with potential systemic manifestations. Radiological findings may include organ-specific inflammatory changes and potential tissue necrosis.

name: CMV Colitis
definition: Inflammatory bowel condition caused by cytomegalovirus infection. Radiological features include bowel wall thickening, mucosal irregularity, and potential ulcerations.

name: CMV Encephalitis
definition: Cytomegalovirus infection causing inflammation of the brain, typically seen in immunocompromised patients. Radiologically characterized by diffuse white matter changes and potential areas of enhancement on MRI.

name: CMV Infection
definition: Viral infection caused by cytomegalovirus that can affect multiple organ systems. Radiological findings may include organ-specific changes and potential inflammatory responses.

name: CNS Lymphoma
definition: Malignant lymphoma involving the central nervous system, typically appearing as enhancing lesions on neuroimaging with potential mass effect and surrounding edema.

name: CNS Tuberculosis
definition: Tuberculosis infection affecting the central nervous system, characterized by granulomatous lesions, potential meningeal enhancement, and characteristic basal meningeal involvement on neuroimaging.

name: CNS Vasculitis
definition: Inflammatory condition causing blood vessel wall inflammation in the central nervous system. Radiologically presents with vessel wall thickening, enhancement, and potential luminal narrowing.

name: Coagulative Necrosis
definition: Cellular death characterized by preservation of tissue architecture with loss of cellular nuclei. Radiologically appears as areas of tissue necrosis with maintained structural outline.

name: Coagulopathy
definition: Disorder of blood clotting mechanism leading to impaired coagulation. Radiologically may manifest as increased bleeding risk or abnormal vascular findings.

name: Coarctation of aorta
definition: Congenital narrowing of the aortic arch, typically occurring distal to the left subclavian artery. Radiologically characterized by discrete narrowing on CT or MR angiography.

name: Coarctation of the Aorta
definition: Congenital narrowing of the aortic arch, typically occurring distal to the left subclavian artery. Radiologically characterized by discrete narrowing on CT or MR angiography.

name: Cobblestone Cortex
definition: Characteristic brain cortical appearance with irregular, bumpy surface seen in certain neurological conditions. Radiologically identified on high-resolution brain imaging.

name: Cobra head sign
definition: A radiographic sign depicting a serpentine or curved vascular configuration resembling a cobra's head, typically observed in specific vascular pathologies or contrast studies.

name: Cochlear Fibrosis
definition: Scarring and fibrotic changes within the cochlea, potentially affecting hearing. Radiologically characterized by altered cochlear architecture on temporal bone imaging.

name: Coffee bean sign
definition: A radiographic appearance of an oval or bean-shaped opacity, often seen in abdominal or chest imaging studies representing specific pathological conditions.

name: Coil Migration
definition: Displacement of a medical coil from its intended anatomical location. Radiologically detected through comparative imaging studies showing altered coil position.

name: Colloid Cyst
definition: Benign, fluid-filled cyst typically located in the third ventricle of the brain. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, rounded lesion on neuroimaging.

name: Colloid nodule
definition: Thyroid nodule with fluid-like characteristics, typically benign. Radiologically identified on ultrasound with specific sonographic features.

name: Colocutaneous Fistula
definition: Abnormal communication between the colon and cutaneous surface, allowing direct passage between these structures. Radiologically confirmed through contrast studies or cross-sectional imaging.

name: Colonic atresia
definition: A congenital condition where a portion of the colon fails to develop properly, resulting in a complete or partial blockage. Radiological imaging helps diagnose the extent and location of the atresia.

name: Colorectal cancer
definition: A malignant tumor originating in the colon or rectum, characterized by abnormal cell growth. Radiological techniques like CT, MRI, and colonoscopy are crucial for detection, staging, and monitoring.

name: Colorectal Cancer (CRC)
definition: A malignant tumor originating in the colon or rectum, characterized by abnormal cell growth. Radiological techniques like CT, MRI, and colonoscopy are crucial for detection, staging, and monitoring.

name: Colorectal Liver Metastases (CRLM)
definition: Secondary cancerous tumors that have spread from colorectal cancer to the liver. Radiological imaging is essential for identifying, characterizing, and monitoring these metastatic lesions.

name: Colorectal Metastases (to the liver)
definition: Secondary cancerous tumors that have spread from colorectal cancer to the liver. Radiological imaging is essential for identifying, characterizing, and monitoring these metastatic lesions.

name: Comet Tail Artifact
definition: An ultrasound artifact appearing as a comet-like tail behind a highly reflective interface, typically seen with materials like calcifications or metallic objects.

name: Communicating Hydrocephalus
definition: A condition where cerebrospinal fluid circulation is unobstructed but abnormal, leading to ventricular enlargement. Radiological techniques like CT and MRI help diagnose and monitor the condition.

name: Compartment Syndrome
definition: A serious condition where increased pressure within a muscle compartment compromises blood flow and nerve function. Radiological imaging can help assess muscle and tissue changes.

name: Complete Achilles Tendon Rupture
definition: A total disruption of the Achilles tendon, typically visible on imaging as a complete separation of tendon fibers. Ultrasound and MRI are key diagnostic tools.

name: Complete obstruction
definition: A total blockage of a tubular structure, such as the intestine or urinary tract, preventing any passage through the affected area. Radiological imaging helps identify the location and cause of obstruction.

name: Complete Tear (Long Head of Biceps Tendon - LHBT)
definition: A total tear of the long head of the biceps tendon, typically visible on MRI as a complete disruption of tendon fibers. Imaging helps confirm the extent of the injury.

name: Complete ureteral duplication with obstruction
definition: A congenital condition where both ureters are duplicated, with at least one ureter experiencing a blockage. Radiological techniques like CT and ultrasound help diagnose the anatomical variations.

name: Complex Cyst
definition: A cyst with internal septations, solid components, or irregular walls that requires further investigation. Radiological evaluation is crucial to determine potential malignancy.

name: Complex Cysts (Bosniak)
definition: A radiological classification system for kidney cysts, categorizing them based on complexity and potential malignant risk. Used primarily in CT and ultrasound imaging.

name: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)
definition: A chronic pain condition affecting limb function, often characterized by neurological and vascular changes. Radiological imaging helps rule out other causes and assess associated tissue changes.

name: Complicated diverticulitis
definition: Advanced stage of diverticulitis with evidence of abscess, perforation, or fistula formation, typically visible on CT or MRI imaging. Characterized by inflammatory changes and potential complications in the colon wall and surrounding tissues.

name: Complications of therapy
definition: Adverse or unintended medical consequences resulting from therapeutic interventions, detectable through various imaging modalities. These can include treatment-related injuries, side effects, or unexpected physiological changes.

name: Component Malalignment/Rotation
definition: Radiographic assessment of improper alignment or rotational positioning of anatomical components, often evaluated in orthopedic or surgical imaging studies. Misalignment can indicate structural abnormalities or procedural errors.

name: Compression
definition: Radiological observation of tissue or organ compression, typically characterized by reduced volume, displacement, or flattening of anatomical structures. Can be caused by tumors, external forces, or pathological processes.

name: Compression Fracture
definition: Radiographic finding of bone structural collapse or fracture, typically in vertebral bodies, resulting from mechanical stress, osteoporosis, or traumatic injury. Commonly visualized on X-ray, CT, or MRI.

name: Computed Tomography
definition: Advanced medical imaging technique using X-ray technology and computer processing to generate detailed cross-sectional body images. Provides high-resolution anatomical visualization.

name: Conduit Calcification
definition: Radiological detection of calcium deposits within vascular or surgical conduits, indicating chronic changes or potential atherosclerotic processes. Typically identified through CT or X-ray imaging.

name: Congenital abnormalities
definition: Radiographically observable structural or developmental anomalies present from birth, detectable through various imaging techniques. These represent inherent anatomical variations from standard developmental patterns.

name: Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia (CAH)
definition: Genetic endocrine disorder characterized by adrenal gland abnormalities, typically involving enzyme deficiencies affecting hormone production. Radiological findings may include adrenal gland morphological changes.

name: Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia (CDH)
definition: Congenital malformation involving abnormal diaphragm development, allowing abdominal contents to protrude into the chest cavity. Radiographically characterized by mediastinal shift and lung volume alterations.

name: Congenital Heart Disease
definition: Broad category of structural heart abnormalities present from birth, detectable through various imaging modalities like echocardiography, CT, and MRI. Encompasses multiple potential cardiac structural variations.

name: Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)
definition: Identical to Congenital Heart Disease, representing structural heart abnormalities present from birth. Commonly abbreviated as CHD in medical imaging and cardiology contexts.

name: Congenital Hepatic Fibrosis
definition: Rare genetic disorder characterized by abnormal liver development and fibrotic changes, detectable through imaging techniques like ultrasound and CT. Involves progressive hepatic structural modifications.

name: Congenital Pulmonary Airway Malformation (CPAM)
definition: Rare developmental lung malformation characterized by abnormal bronchial tree and lung tissue formation. Radiographically identified through chest imaging techniques showing atypical lung architecture.

name: Congenital Syphilis
definition: Radiographically detectable manifestation of syphilis infection acquired during fetal development, potentially showing characteristic bone and soft tissue changes.

name: Congestion
definition: Radiological observation of fluid or blood accumulation in tissues or organs, indicating increased vascular permeability or impaired fluid drainage. Typically visualized through various imaging modalities.

name: Congestive splenomegaly
definition: Pathological enlargement of the spleen due to venous congestion, often associated with portal hypertension or cardiac conditions. Radiologically characterized by increased splenic size and altered parenchymal density.

name: Conn Syndrome
definition: Endocrine disorder characterized by primary hyperaldosteronism caused by adrenal adenoma. Radiological imaging helps identify the adenoma and assess adrenal gland morphology.

name: Conn Syndrome (Aldosterone-secreting adenoma)
definition: Benign adrenal tumor that autonomously produces excessive aldosterone, causing hormonal imbalance. Radiological evaluation typically involves CT or MRI to characterize the adenoma.

name: Conn Syndrome (Aldosterone-secreting Adrenal Adenoma)
definition: Benign adrenal tumor causing autonomous aldosterone production, detectable through cross-sectional imaging. Radiological studies help localize and characterize the adenoma.

name: Constitutional growth delay
definition: A developmental variation in growth pattern characterized by delayed pubertal development and skeletal maturation. Radiological assessment involves bone age studies and growth potential evaluation.

name: Constrictive bronchiolitis
definition: Inflammatory lung condition causing narrowing of small airways, visible on high-resolution CT as bronchial wall thickening and air trapping.

name: Constrictive Pericarditis
definition: Pathological thickening and scarring of the pericardium, reducing cardiac compliance. Radiological findings include pericardial calcification and reduced cardiac chamber mobility.

name: Contact dermatitis
definition: Inflammatory skin reaction caused by direct exposure to irritants or allergens. Radiological relevance includes potential skin changes and differential diagnosis.

name: Contrast-Enhanced MRI
definition: MRI imaging technique involving intravenous administration of contrast agent to improve visualization of anatomical structures and enhance diagnostic accuracy.

name: Contrast-Induced Nephropathy (CIN)
definition: Kidney injury potentially occurring after intravenous contrast administration, characterized by acute renal dysfunction. Radiological monitoring involves assessing renal function and contrast protocols.

name: Contrast Enema
definition: Radiographic examination of the large intestine using contrast material introduced via rectal insertion. Used to evaluate colon structure and identify potential abnormalities.

name: Contrast Extravasation
definition: Unintended leakage of contrast material outside intended vascular space during imaging procedures. Radiological assessment involves recognizing and managing potential complications.

name: Contrast Leakage
definition: Unintended spread of contrast material beyond intended vascular boundaries during radiological procedures. Requires careful monitoring and potential intervention.

name: Contrast Reaction (Allergic-like)
definition: Adverse immunological response to contrast media during radiological procedures, potentially causing systemic symptoms. Requires immediate recognition and management.

name: Contrast Study
definition: Radiographic examination using contrast agents to enhance visualization of internal body structures and improve diagnostic accuracy.

name: Contusion
definition: Soft tissue injury caused by blunt force, characterized by tissue damage without skin breach. Radiological evaluation helps assess extent of internal tissue trauma.

name: COPD
definition: Chronic progressive lung disease characterized by airflow limitation, visible on chest imaging as hyperinflation, emphysematous changes, and bronchial wall thickening.

name: COPD/Asthma
definition: Combined respiratory condition involving chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and asthmatic components, presenting complex radiological findings of airway obstruction and inflammation.

name: Cord compression
definition: Compression of the spinal cord by external structures causing neurological impairment, typically visible on MRI or CT imaging as narrowing or displacement of the spinal cord. Radiological findings help determine the location, extent, and potential cause of compression.

name: Cord infarction
definition: A rare condition of spinal cord tissue death due to interruption of blood supply, characterized by localized signal changes and potential cavitation on MRI. Radiological evaluation helps identify the extent and location of infarction.

name: Corkscrew duodenum
definition: A radiographic finding of a twisted or spiraled duodenum, typically indicating abnormal intestinal rotation or underlying gastrointestinal pathology.

name: Coronary artery disease
definition: Progressive narrowing and blockage of coronary arteries, typically visualized through angiography, CT coronary calcium scoring, or cardiac MRI. Radiological imaging helps assess plaque burden, stenosis, and potential cardiovascular risk.

name: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD)
definition: Progressive narrowing and blockage of coronary arteries, typically visualized through angiography, CT coronary calcium scoring, or cardiac MRI. Radiological imaging helps assess plaque burden, stenosis, and potential cardiovascular risk.

name: Coronary Artery Spasm
definition: Temporary, sudden constriction of coronary arteries causing reduced blood flow, visible through dynamic cardiac imaging techniques. Radiological assessment helps identify transient arterial narrowing and potential ischemic changes.

name: Coronoid Process Fracture
definition: Fracture involving the coronoid process of the ulna, typically identified through X-ray, CT, or MRI. Radiological evaluation helps assess fracture type, displacement, and potential associated joint injuries.

name: Corpus Luteum Cyst
definition: Functional ovarian cyst formed after ovulation, typically appearing as a fluid-filled structure on ultrasound or CT. Radiological findings help distinguish it from other ovarian masses.

name: Cortical Necrosis
definition: Localized tissue death in the cortical region, often visible as signal changes or atrophy on MRI or CT. Radiological imaging helps identify the extent and potential underlying cause of cortical destruction.

name: Corticobasal Degeneration
definition: Neurodegenerative disorder characterized by asymmetric brain changes, typically identified through advanced neuroimaging techniques like MRI. Radiological findings show progressive cortical and basal ganglia atrophy.

name: CPA Epidermoid Cyst
definition: Benign cystic tumor located in the cerebellopontine angle, typically appearing as a well-defined, non-enhancing mass on MRI. Radiological evaluation helps characterize its size, location, and potential impact on surrounding structures.

name: CPPD (Pseudogout)
definition: Calcium pyrophosphate crystal deposition disease causing joint calcifications, visible on X-ray as linear or punctate calcifications. Radiological findings help diagnose and differentiate from other arthropathies.

name: Craniopharyngioma
definition: Rare brain tumor arising near the pituitary gland, typically identified through MRI or CT with characteristic calcifications and cystic components. Radiological imaging helps assess tumor size, location, and potential complications.

name: Craniopharyngioma (Adamantinomatous type)
definition: Specific subtype of craniopharyngioma with distinctive adamantinomatous features, characterized by calcifications and cystic components on neuroimaging. Radiological evaluation helps differentiate from other sellar/suprasellar masses.

name: Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease (CJD)
definition: Rapidly progressive neurodegenerative prion disease causing brain tissue destruction, characterized by characteristic signal changes and atrophy on MRI. Radiological findings show distinctive cortical and deep gray matter alterations.

name: Crohn's disease
definition: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease causing transmural intestinal inflammation, typically evaluated through CT enterography or MR enterography. Radiological imaging helps assess bowel wall thickening, strictures, and complications.

name: Crossed fused renal ectopia
definition: A rare congenital kidney malformation where both kidneys are fused on the same side of the body, typically with one kidney located lower than the other. Radiological imaging can help diagnose and characterize the abnormal kidney positioning and fusion.

name: Croup
definition: A viral respiratory infection causing inflammation of the larynx, trachea, and bronchi, characterized by a distinctive barking cough. Radiographic findings often include subglottic narrowing and potential hyperinflation on chest imaging.

name: Croup (Laryngotracheobronchitis)
definition: A viral respiratory infection causing inflammation of the larynx, trachea, and bronchi, characterized by a distinctive barking cough. Radiographic findings often include subglottic narrowing and potential hyperinflation on chest imaging.

name: Cryptococcus neoformans infection
definition: A fungal infection caused by Cryptococcus neoformans that can affect immunocompromised patients, often presenting with pulmonary and central nervous system involvement. Radiological findings may include lung nodules, infiltrates, and potential cryptococcal meningitis.

name: CSF Leak
definition: Abnormal leakage of cerebrospinal fluid through a defect in the dura, often detected through imaging studies like CT or MRI. Radiological techniques can help identify the location and extent of the leak.

name: CSF Pseudocyst
definition: A rare complication characterized by a fluid collection adjacent to a previous CSF leak site, typically identified through neuroimaging techniques. Radiological evaluation helps distinguish it from other fluid collections.

name: CT
definition: Computed Tomography imaging technique using X-rays and computer processing to generate detailed cross-sectional body images. Provides high-resolution anatomical visualization.

name: CT (Contrast-Enhanced)
definition: CT scan performed with intravenous contrast agent to improve visualization of vascular structures and enhance diagnostic accuracy.

name: CT (DECT)
definition: Advanced CT imaging technique using multiple energy levels to differentiate tissue types and provide more detailed diagnostic information.

name: CT Abdomen/Pelvis
definition: CT imaging focused on examining abdominal and pelvic regions to evaluate internal organs, detect abnormalities, and assess potential pathological conditions.

name: CT and Fluoroscopy
definition: Combined imaging technique integrating CT scanning with real-time fluoroscopic guidance for precise diagnostic and interventional procedures.

name: CT Angiography
definition: Specialized CT imaging technique focusing on visualizing blood vessels and vascular structures using contrast agents.

name: CT Angiography (CTA)
definition: Specialized CT imaging technique focusing on visualizing blood vessels and vascular structures using contrast agents.

name: CT Angiography (Gold Standard)
definition: Considered the most accurate non-invasive method for comprehensive vascular imaging, providing detailed visualization of arterial and venous structures.

name: CT Angiography/Venography
definition: Advanced CT imaging technique combining arterial and venous system visualization using contrast agents for comprehensive vascular assessment.

name: CT Chest
definition: Computed tomography (CT) imaging of the chest to evaluate lung, mediastinal, and pleural structures. Provides detailed cross-sectional images of thoracic anatomy and can detect various pathologies.

name: CT Colonography
definition: Non-invasive CT screening technique for colorectal cancer and polyp detection. Uses specialized CT imaging to visualize the colon's internal structure without direct endoscopic insertion.

name: CT Colonography/MRI/PET-CT
definition: Comprehensive multi-modality imaging approach combining CT, MRI, and PET-CT for detailed diagnostic evaluation. Provides complementary anatomical and functional imaging information.

name: CT Enterography
definition: Specialized CT imaging technique focused on evaluating the small bowel's structure and pathology. Uses contrast enhancement to provide detailed visualization of intestinal walls and potential abnormalities.

name: CT Enterography (CTE) / MR Enterography (MRE)
definition: Advanced cross-sectional imaging techniques for detailed small bowel evaluation using CT (CTE) or MRI (MRE). Provides high-resolution images to assess intestinal inflammation, tumors, and structural abnormalities.

name: CT findings for diverticulitis
definition: CT imaging findings in diverticulitis typically include bowel wall thickening, pericolonic fat stranding, diverticular outpouchings, and potential abscess formation in the colon. These features help diagnose and assess the severity of the inflammatory condition.

name: CT Trauma
definition: CT imaging specifically designed for comprehensive evaluation of traumatic injuries. Provides rapid, detailed assessment of potential fractures, internal bleeding, and soft tissue damage.

name: CT Trauma, Spine MRI
definition: Combined imaging approach using CT for overall trauma assessment and MRI for detailed spinal cord and vertebral imaging. Provides comprehensive evaluation of traumatic injuries.

name: CT Urography
definition: Specialized CT imaging technique focusing on the urinary system. Uses contrast enhancement to visualize kidneys, ureters, and bladder, helping diagnose structural abnormalities and urological conditions.

name: CT Venography
definition: CT imaging technique specifically designed to evaluate venous structures. Uses contrast agents to visualize veins and detect potential abnormalities like thrombosis or vascular malformations.

name: CT Venography (CTV)
definition: CT imaging technique focused on detailed visualization of venous structures using contrast enhancement. Helps diagnose venous disorders and vascular pathologies.

name: CT Venography/US
definition: Combined imaging approach using CT venography and ultrasound for comprehensive vascular evaluation. Provides complementary imaging techniques for detailed diagnostic assessment.

name: CT, MRI
definition: Comprehensive imaging approach combining CT and MRI for detailed diagnostic evaluation. Provides complementary anatomical information using different imaging modalities.

name: CT, MRI, PET/CT
definition: Advanced multi-modality imaging approach combining CT, MRI, and PET-CT. Provides comprehensive anatomical, structural, and functional diagnostic information.

name: CT, PET/CT
definition: Combined imaging technique using CT and PET-CT for comprehensive diagnostic evaluation. Provides anatomical and metabolic information about potential pathologies.

name: CT/Imaging
definition: Broad term encompassing various computed tomography imaging techniques. Refers to diagnostic imaging using X-ray computed tomography for detailed cross-sectional visualization.

name: CT/MRI
definition: Computed Tomography (CT) and Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) are advanced medical imaging techniques that provide detailed cross-sectional images of the body's internal structures. These modalities use different technologies to create high-resolution diagnostic images.

name: CT/MRI/US
definition: Medical imaging modalities including Computed Tomography (CT), Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI), and Ultrasound (US). These techniques provide different visualization methods for diagnostic evaluation of body structures.

name: CT/MRI/Venography
definition: Imaging techniques that combine CT or MRI with venography to visualize blood vessels, particularly for evaluating venous structures and potential vascular abnormalities.

name: CT/XR
definition: Combination of Computed Tomography (CT) and X-ray imaging techniques for comprehensive diagnostic visualization of body structures.

name: CTA
definition: Computed Tomography Angiography (CTA) is a specialized imaging technique that uses CT scanning with contrast material to visualize blood vessels in detail.

name: CTA Chest
definition: Computed Tomography Angiography of the chest, specifically focusing on visualizing the blood vessels and cardiovascular structures in the thoracic region.

name: CTA/MRA
definition: Combined Computed Tomography Angiography (CTA) and Magnetic Resonance Angiography (MRA) techniques for comprehensive vascular imaging.

name: CTA/MRA/DSA
definition: Comprehensive vascular imaging technique combining Computed Tomography Angiography (CTA), Magnetic Resonance Angiography (MRA), and Digital Subtraction Angiography (DSA).

name: CTA/US
definition: Combination of Computed Tomography Angiography (CTA) and Ultrasound (US) imaging techniques for vascular evaluation.

name: CTE/CT Abdomen
definition: Computed Tomography Enterography (CTE) focusing on imaging the abdomen, providing detailed visualization of abdominal structures and potential pathologies.

name: CTPA
definition: Computed Tomography Pulmonary Angiography, a specialized imaging technique used to evaluate the pulmonary arteries and detect potential pulmonary embolism.

name: CTV
definition: Computed Tomography Venography (CTV) is an imaging technique that uses CT scanning with contrast to visualize venous structures in detail.

name: Cuff Tear Arthropathy
definition: A degenerative shoulder condition characterized by rotator cuff tear and associated glenohumeral joint changes, visible through radiographic imaging as joint space narrowing, osteophyte formation, and potential bone erosions.

name: Currarino Syndrome
definition: A rare congenital syndrome involving sacral anomalies, presacral mass, and anorectal malformations, typically diagnosed through comprehensive radiological imaging of the pelvis and spine.

name: Cushing's syndrome
definition: A hormonal disorder caused by prolonged exposure to high cortisol levels, with characteristic radiological findings including central obesity, thin extremities, and potential adrenal or pituitary adenomas.

name: Cushing Syndrome
definition: A hormonal disorder caused by prolonged exposure to high cortisol levels, with characteristic radiological findings including central obesity, thin extremities, and potential adrenal or pituitary adenomas.

name: Cushing Syndrome (Cortisol-secreting adenoma)
definition: A specific type of Cushing's syndrome caused by a cortisol-secreting pituitary adenoma, characterized by radiological evidence of a pituitary tumor and associated hormonal changes.

name: Cushing Syndrome (Cortisol-secreting Adrenal Adenoma)
definition: A specific type of Cushing's syndrome caused by a cortisol-secreting adrenal adenoma, characterized by radiological evidence of an adrenal tumor and associated hormonal changes.

name: Cutaneous Melanoma
definition: A malignant skin cancer originating from melanocytes, characterized by radiological findings of primary tumor, potential metastatic lesions, and lymph node involvement.

name: CVC Malposition
definition: Improper positioning of a central venous catheter, detected through radiographic imaging, which can lead to potential complications such as vessel perforation or incorrect catheter placement.

name: CXR
definition: Chest X-ray, a basic radiographic imaging technique that provides a two-dimensional view of the chest and thoracic structures.

name: CXR/CT
definition: Combined Chest X-ray and Computed Tomography imaging for comprehensive evaluation of chest and thoracic structures.

name: Cyclic breast pain
definition: Cyclical breast pain associated with hormonal changes during menstrual cycle, typically affecting both breasts. Radiologically characterized by normal breast tissue without specific imaging findings.

name: Cyclosporine toxicity
definition: Medication-induced tissue damage from cyclosporine, potentially causing renal, hepatic, or neurological changes visible on imaging studies. Radiographic findings may include kidney atrophy or vascular calcifications.

name: Cyst
definition: Fluid-filled, well-defined, round or oval soft tissue lesion with smooth borders. Typically appears as a hypoechoic or anechoic structure on ultrasound and low-density area on CT.

name: Cystadenoma
definition: Benign epithelial tumor characterized by fluid-filled cystic spaces, commonly found in ovaries or pancreas. Radiologically appears as multilocular cystic mass with potential solid components.

name: Cystic Breast Mass
definition: Fluid-containing breast mass that may be benign or malignant. Characterized by well-defined borders, variable internal echogenicity on ultrasound, and potential complex features.

name: Cystic duct obstruction without acute inflammation
definition: Obstruction of bile flow through cystic duct without active inflammation, potentially causing biliary dilation. Radiographically identified through imaging techniques like ultrasound or MRCP.

name: Cystic fibrosis
definition: Genetic disorder causing thick mucus production, affecting multiple organ systems. Radiologically characterized by bronchiectasis, lung cysts, and pancreatic changes on CT imaging.

name: Cystic Hygroma (Lymphatic Malformation)
definition: Congenital lymphatic malformation appearing as multilocular cystic mass, typically in neck region. Characterized by complex fluid-filled spaces on imaging studies.

name: Cystic neoplasms of the pancreas
definition: Pancreatic lesions with cystic components, ranging from benign to potentially malignant. Radiologically identified through CT or MRI with various morphological characteristics.

name: Cystic nerve sheath tumor
definition: Rare tumor arising from nerve sheath with cystic components. Radiographically appears as complex soft tissue mass with mixed solid and cystic features.

name: Cysts
definition: Fluid-filled sacs or spaces that can occur in various body tissues. Radiologically characterized by well-defined, round or oval structures with distinct borders.

name: Cytomegalovirus (CMV)
definition: Viral infection causing cellular changes, potentially detectable through imaging studies showing tissue inflammation or organ-specific abnormalities.

name: D-transposition of great arteries
definition: Congenital heart defect where great arteries are abnormally positioned, causing altered cardiac anatomy. Radiographically identified through cardiac imaging techniques.

name: Dagger sign
definition: A radiographic sign characterized by a sharp, pointed configuration or linear opacity resembling a dagger, often seen in specific imaging studies.

name: Dandy-Walker Malformation
definition: Congenital brain malformation characterized by incomplete cerebellar development and enlarged posterior fossa. Radiologically identified through MRI showing specific anatomical variations.

name: Dandy-Walker Malformation (DWM)
definition: Congenital brain malformation characterized by incomplete cerebellar development and enlarged posterior fossa. Radiologically identified through MRI showing specific anatomical variations.

name: DAT-SPECT
definition: Dopamine Transporter Single-Photon Emission Computed Tomography, a nuclear medicine imaging technique used to evaluate dopamine function in the brain.

name: DaTSCAN (SPECT)
definition: A nuclear medicine imaging technique using a radioactive tracer to evaluate dopamine transporter activity in the brain. Primarily used to diagnose Parkinson's disease and differentiate essential tremor from parkinsonian syndromes.

name: DBT
definition: Digital breast tomosynthesis, an advanced mammography technique that creates multiple thin-slice images of the breast. Provides more detailed breast imaging with reduced tissue overlap compared to traditional 2D mammography.

name: DCIS
definition: Non-invasive breast cancer confined to the milk ducts. On mammography and imaging, appears as calcifications or architectural distortions within breast tissue.

name: DCIS (Ductal Carcinoma In Situ)
definition: Non-invasive breast cancer confined to the milk ducts. On mammography and imaging, appears as calcifications or architectural distortions within breast tissue.

name: De Quervain Tenosynovitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the thumb's tendons causing pain and swelling at the radial styloid process. Radiographs may show soft tissue swelling around the first dorsal compartment.

name: DECT
definition: Dual-energy computed tomography, an advanced CT imaging technique that uses two different X-ray energy levels to generate enhanced tissue characterization and material discrimination.

name: Deep sulcus sign
definition: A radiographic sign indicating fluid or abnormal collection in the pleural space, typically seen as a deep or extended sulcus on chest imaging.

name: Deep vein thrombosis
definition: Blood clot formation within deep venous system, typically in lower extremities. Imaging reveals venous obstruction, wall thickening, and potential filling defects on ultrasound or CT.

name: Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)
definition: Blood clot formation within deep venous system, typically in lower extremities. Imaging reveals venous obstruction, wall thickening, and potential filling defects on ultrasound or CT.

name: Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) sequelae
definition: Long-term complications resulting from deep vein thrombosis, including chronic venous insufficiency, post-thrombotic syndrome, and potential venous valve damage.

name: Deep Venous Thrombosis (DVT)
definition: Blood clot formation within deep venous system, typically in lower extremities. Imaging reveals venous obstruction, wall thickening, and potential filling defects on ultrasound or CT.

name: Degenerating fibroadenoma
definition: Benign breast tumor undergoing age-related changes, characterized by increased fibrosis and potential calcifications on mammographic imaging.

name: Degenerative changes
definition: Progressive age-related structural alterations in tissues and joints, typically observed as joint space narrowing, osteophyte formation, and soft tissue changes on radiographic imaging.

name: Degenerative Disc Disease (DDD)
definition: Progressive disc degeneration in the spine characterized by disc height loss, disc signal changes, and potential osteophyte formation on MRI and radiographic studies.

name: Degenerative Spondylolisthesis
definition: Vertebral slippage caused by degenerative changes in facet joints and ligaments, typically observed in older patients with progressive spinal instability on radiographic imaging.

name: Delayed Onset Muscle Soreness (DOMS)
definition: Muscle pain and stiffness occurring 24-72 hours after unaccustomed or intense exercise, characterized by microscopic muscle fiber damage.

name: Delayed union
definition: Prolonged healing process of bone fractures beyond the expected normal timeframe, potentially visible through radiographic assessment of incomplete bone union.

name: Deltoid Ligament Injury
definition: Ligament damage on the medial side of the ankle, typically assessed through MRI to evaluate extent of soft tissue injury and potential associated structural changes.

name: Demyelinating disease
definition: Autoimmune condition causing progressive destruction of myelin sheaths surrounding nerve fibers, typically evaluated through MRI showing characteristic white matter lesions.

name: Demyelinating Lesion
definition: Radiological finding characterized by loss of myelin sheath around nerve fibers, appearing as hyperintense lesions on T2-weighted MRI. These lesions indicate damage to the white matter of the central nervous system.

name: Demyelination
definition: Pathological process involving the destruction or damage of the myelin sheath surrounding nerve fibers, visible on imaging as areas of signal intensity changes in white matter.

name: Demyelination (e.g., Multiple Sclerosis)
definition: Progressive neurological condition characterized by multiple demyelinating lesions in the brain and spinal cord, appearing as hyperintense white matter lesions on MRI scans.

name: Dense Breast Tissue
definition: Breast tissue with a high proportion of glandular and connective tissue, appearing white or light on mammographic imaging and potentially obscuring underlying pathology.

name: Dense Breasts
