definition: Primary brain tumor originating from glial cells, with varying degrees of malignancy. Radiologically characterized by abnormal signal intensity, mass effect, and potential contrast enhancement.

name: Glomerular Disease
definition: Kidney disorder affecting the glomeruli, potentially causing impaired filtration and renal dysfunction. Radiologically demonstrated through changes in kidney size, texture, and potential structural abnormalities.

name: Glomus Vagale
definition: Rare paraganglioma located in the vagal region, typically arising from neural crest cells. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, potentially vascular mass near the skull base.

name: Glucagonoma
definition: Rare pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor producing excessive glucagon, causing metabolic disturbances. Radiologically characterized by pancreatic mass with potential metastatic lesions.

name: Glycogen storage disease
definition: Metabolic disorder affecting glycogen metabolism, potentially causing structural changes in various organs. Radiologically demonstrated through organ-specific alterations like hepatomegaly or muscle changes.

name: Growth Disorders (Short Stature)
definition: Pathological condition characterized by subnormal height and growth potential, often evaluated through skeletal imaging and growth charts. Radiological assessment involves measuring bone age, analyzing growth plates, and identifying potential underlying skeletal abnormalities.

name: Growth Disorders (Tall Stature)
definition: Pathological condition characterized by excessive height beyond normal developmental ranges, typically assessed through skeletal imaging and comparative growth measurements. Radiological evaluation focuses on identifying potential endocrine or genetic causes.

name: Gynecomastia
definition: Benign enlargement of male breast tissue, detectable through soft tissue imaging techniques like ultrasound and mammography. Radiological assessment helps differentiate between physiological and pathological causes.

name: Haglund Deformity
definition: Bony prominence at the posterior superior calcaneal tuberosity, visible on lateral foot radiographs and often associated with soft tissue inflammation. Radiological findings help diagnose potential mechanical complications.

name: Hair loss
definition: Pathological reduction or absence of hair, potentially revealing underlying scalp or systemic conditions through imaging techniques. Radiological evaluation may include assessing potential inflammatory or autoimmune processes.

name: Hamartoma
definition: Benign tumor-like malformation composed of normal tissue elements arranged in a disorganized manner, often detected incidentally during imaging studies. Radiological characteristics help distinguish from neoplastic lesions.

name: Hampton hump
definition: A radiographic sign of pulmonary embolism characterized by a wedge-shaped pleural-based opacity representing a small pulmonary infarct. Typically seen on chest X-ray or CT scan as a peripheral, triangular-shaped density.

name: Hangman's Fracture
definition: Bilateral fracture of the C2 vertebra's pedicles, typically resulting from hyperextension and axial loading mechanisms. Radiological diagnosis involves detailed cervical spine imaging to assess fracture configuration and potential neurological compromise.

name: HBV/HCV
definition: Viral hepatitis infections detectable through various imaging modalities, with radiological findings potentially revealing liver parenchymal changes, cirrhosis, or hepatocellular complications.

name: HCC
definition: Primary liver malignancy arising from hepatocytes, characterized by distinct radiological features on CT, MRI, and ultrasound. Imaging helps assess tumor size, location, vascular invasion, and potential metastatic spread.

name: Head and Neck Cancer (Oral Cavity)
definition: Malignant neoplasm originating in oral cavity tissues, detectable through cross-sectional imaging techniques that evaluate tumor extent, lymph node involvement, and potential metastatic spread.

name: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)
definition: Malignant epithelial tumor of head and neck regions, characterized by specific radiological features demonstrating tumor invasion, lymph node metastasis, and potential extracapsular spread.

name: Head Trauma
definition: Traumatic brain injury detectable through various neuroimaging techniques, including CT and MRI, which assess intracranial hemorrhage, skull fractures, and potential neurological complications.

name: Head/Neck Cancer with Nodal Metastases
definition: Advanced head and neck malignancy characterized by spread to regional lymph nodes, evaluated through detailed cross-sectional imaging to determine extent of nodal involvement and potential treatment strategies.

name: Head/Neck Masses (Benign vs. Malignant)
definition: Heterogeneous group of head and neck lesions requiring comprehensive radiological evaluation to differentiate between benign and malignant characteristics through multimodal imaging techniques.

name: Head/neck SCC
definition: Malignant epithelial tumor of squamous cell origin in head and neck regions, characterized by specific radiological features demonstrating tumor invasion and potential metastatic progression.

name: Healed Granulomas
definition: Calcified or fibrotic lesions representing healed inflammatory responses, typically seen as small, round, dense nodules on imaging studies. Commonly associated with prior infections like tuberculosis or fungal diseases.

name: Heart Failure
definition: A clinical syndrome characterized by the heart's inability to pump blood effectively, resulting in fluid accumulation and reduced cardiac output. Radiological findings include cardiomegaly, pulmonary edema, and pleural effusions.

name: Hemangioblastoma
definition: A rare, benign vascular tumor typically occurring in the central nervous system, often associated with von Hippel-Lindau syndrome. Radiologically appears as a well-circumscribed, highly vascular lesion on MRI and CT.

name: Hemangioblastoma (HGB)
definition: A rare, benign vascular tumor typically occurring in the central nervous system, often associated with von Hippel-Lindau syndrome. Radiologically appears as a well-circumscribed, highly vascular lesion on MRI and CT.

name: Hemangioma
definition: A benign vascular tumor composed of proliferating blood vessels, typically appearing as a well-defined, hyperemic lesion on imaging studies. Can occur in various organs and tissues.

name: Hemangioma (Liver)
definition: A benign vascular tumor of the liver, typically appearing as a hyperechoic or hypervascular lesion on ultrasound and CT/MRI. Often asymptomatic and discovered incidentally.

name: Hematoma
definition: A localized collection of blood outside blood vessels, typically appearing as a well-defined, hyperdense area on CT or with signal intensity variations on MRI depending on age and stage of blood breakdown.

name: Hemimegalencephaly
definition: A rare congenital neurological disorder characterized by unilateral hemispheric overgrowth of brain tissue, typically detected on neuroimaging with asymmetric brain enlargement and cortical malformations.

name: Hemimegalencephaly (HMEG)
definition: A rare congenital neurological disorder characterized by unilateral hemispheric overgrowth of brain tissue, typically detected on neuroimaging with asymmetric brain enlargement and cortical malformations.

name: Hemobilia
definition: A condition of blood in the biliary system, typically appearing on imaging as abnormal intrahepatic or extrahepatic bile duct findings with potential vascular complications.

name: Hemochromatosis
definition: A genetic disorder of iron metabolism causing excessive iron deposition in multiple organs, characterized on imaging by increased tissue density and signal changes in liver, pancreas, and other organs.

name: Hemochromatosis (Primary/Hereditary)
definition: A genetic disorder of iron metabolism causing excessive iron deposition in multiple organs, characterized on imaging by increased tissue density and signal changes in liver, pancreas, and other organs.

name: Hemochromatosis (Secondary/Hemosiderosis)
definition: A condition of iron overload caused by repeated blood transfusions or chronic diseases, characterized on imaging by increased tissue density and signal changes in liver, pancreas, and other organs.

name: Hemodialysis Access Dysfunction (Stenosis)
definition: Narrowing or obstruction of hemodialysis access sites, typically detected through imaging techniques like ultrasound, showing reduced blood flow and vessel stenosis in arteriovenous fistulas or grafts.

name: Hemodialysis Access Stenosis (AV Fistulas and Grafts)
definition: Narrowing or obstruction of hemodialysis access sites, typically detected through imaging techniques like ultrasound, showing reduced blood flow and vessel stenosis in arteriovenous fistulas or grafts.

name: Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome (HUS)
definition: A rare kidney disorder characterized by destruction of red blood cells, leading to acute kidney injury and potential thrombotic microangiopathy. Radiological findings typically include kidney swelling and potential calcifications.

name: Hemoperitoneum
definition: Presence of blood within the peritoneal cavity, often detected through imaging as free fluid or increased density in the abdominal space. Can result from trauma, ruptured organs, or surgical complications.

name: Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding from blood vessels into surrounding tissues or body spaces, characterized radiologically by increased density, fluid collections, or signal changes depending on imaging modality.

name: Hemorrhage/Hematoma
definition: Accumulation of blood outside blood vessels, appearing as a localized collection of fluid or increased density on imaging studies. Hematomas can be acute or chronic and vary in appearance based on age.

name: Hemorrhagic Cholecystitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the gallbladder with significant bleeding within the gallbladder wall or lumen, typically appearing as complex fluid or increased density on imaging studies.

name: Hemorrhagic cyst
definition: A fluid-filled sac containing blood, typically appearing as a complex cystic lesion with internal echogenicity or signal changes on imaging studies.

name: Hemothorax
definition: Accumulation of blood in the pleural space, typically appearing as increased density or fluid collection on chest radiographs and CT scans.

name: Hepatic Abscess
definition: Localized infection within the liver parenchyma, appearing as a complex fluid collection with potential rim enhancement or surrounding inflammatory changes on imaging studies.

name: Hepatic abscess rupture
definition: Spontaneous or traumatic breach of a hepatic abscess into surrounding anatomical spaces, characterized by fluid tracking and potential inflammatory changes on imaging.

name: Hepatic Adenoma
definition: Benign liver tumor composed of hepatocytes, typically appearing as a well-defined, homogeneous mass on imaging with potential risk of hemorrhage or malignant transformation.

name: Hepatic Adenoma (HA)
definition: Benign liver tumor composed of hepatocytes, typically appearing as a well-defined, homogeneous mass on imaging with potential risk of hemorrhage or malignant transformation.

name: Hepatic Artery Thrombosis (HAT)
definition: Obstruction or blockage of the hepatic artery, potentially leading to liver ischemia or infarction, detectable through vascular imaging techniques.

name: Hepatic Cellular Carcinoma (HCC)
definition: Primary liver cancer originating from hepatocytes, typically appearing as a heterogeneous mass with characteristic arterial enhancement and portal venous washout on dynamic imaging.

name: Hepatic Cyst
definition: Fluid-filled sac within the liver parenchyma, typically appearing as a well-defined, anechoic or simple cystic lesion on imaging studies.

name: Hepatic cysts
definition: Multiple fluid-filled sacs within the liver parenchyma, typically appearing as well-defined, anechoic or simple cystic lesions on imaging studies.

name: Hepatic Encephalopathy
definition: A neuropsychiatric syndrome caused by liver dysfunction, characterized by altered mental status and cognitive impairment. Radiological findings may include cerebral edema and signal changes in brain imaging.

name: Hepatic Encephalopathy (Acute)
definition: Acute manifestation of hepatic encephalopathy with rapid onset of neurological symptoms due to sudden liver dysfunction. Imaging may reveal acute brain changes and potential cerebral edema.

name: Hepatic Encephalopathy (Chronic)
definition: Progressive neurological disorder resulting from long-standing liver disease, showing persistent cognitive and neurological impairments. Chronic imaging may demonstrate cumulative brain changes.

name: Hepatic Fibrosis
definition: Liver scarring characterized by excessive extracellular matrix deposition, leading to architectural distortion. Radiological features include increased liver density and altered parenchymal texture.

name: Hepatic Hemangioma
definition: Benign vascular tumor of the liver composed of blood vessels, typically appearing as well-defined hyperechoic lesions on imaging studies.

name: Hepatic Hydrothorax
definition: Pleural effusion resulting from liver disease, characterized by fluid accumulation in the pleural space. Radiographic findings include unilateral or bilateral pleural effusions.

name: Hepatic Inflammation
definition: Liver tissue inflammation characterized by cellular infiltration and potential tissue damage. Radiological signs include altered liver texture, potential edema, and heterogeneous enhancement.

name: Hepatic Steatosis
definition: Accumulation of fat within liver cells, appearing as increased echogenicity on ultrasound and decreased attenuation on CT imaging. Represents early stage of potential liver disease.

name: Hepatic Steatosis (Fatty Liver)
definition: Excessive fat accumulation in liver cells, causing increased liver echogenicity and potential metabolic dysfunction. Radiologically characterized by decreased liver density and altered parenchymal appearance.

name: Hepatic vein occlusion
definition: Blockage or narrowing of hepatic veins, resulting in impaired venous drainage. Imaging reveals potential venous wall thickening, reduced flow, and potential parenchymal changes.

name: Hepatic Veno-Occlusive Disease (Sinusoidal Obstruction Syndrome)
definition: Obstruction of hepatic sinusoids causing liver damage, typically associated with chemotherapy or radiation. Radiological findings include liver congestion, potential fibrosis, and altered parenchymal architecture.

name: Hepaticojejunostomy stricture
definition: Narrowing or scarring at the surgical connection between hepatic bile ducts and jejunum. Radiological features include biliary tree dilation and potential stricture visualization.

name: Hepatitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the liver characterized by cellular infiltration and potential tissue damage. Radiological signs include altered liver texture and potential parenchymal changes.

name: Hepatitis B
definition: Viral infection of the liver caused by Hepatitis B virus, potentially leading to chronic liver disease. Imaging may reveal liver parenchymal changes, fibrosis, and potential complications.

name: Hepatoblastoma
definition: Rare pediatric liver tumor originating from immature liver cells, typically occurring in children under three years old. Radiologically characterized by well-defined mass with variable enhancement patterns.

name: Hepatocellular Carcinoma
definition: Primary liver cancer originating from hepatocytes, typically appearing as a hypervascular mass on imaging with characteristic arterial enhancement and portal venous washout. Radiologically identified through CT, MRI, and ultrasound with specific contrast patterns.

name: Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)
definition: Primary liver cancer originating from hepatocytes, typically appearing as a hypervascular mass on imaging with characteristic arterial enhancement and portal venous washout. Radiologically identified through CT, MRI, and ultrasound with specific contrast patterns.

name: Hepatopulmonary Shunting
definition: Abnormal vascular communication between hepatic and pulmonary circulation causing arterial hypoxemia, typically visualized through contrast-enhanced CT or pulmonary angiography. Characterized by intrapulmonary vascular dilatations.

name: Hepatorenal Syndrome
definition: Progressive renal dysfunction associated with advanced liver disease, characterized by impaired renal perfusion and hemodynamic alterations. Radiologically identified through renal and hepatic imaging showing functional changes.

name: HER2 Positive Breast Cancer
definition: Breast cancer subtype characterized by overexpression of HER2 protein, typically identified through molecular imaging and immunohistochemical techniques. Radiologically significant for targeted treatment planning.

name: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia (HHT/Osler-Weber-Rendu)
definition: Genetic vascular disorder characterized by multiple telangiectasias, visualized through advanced imaging techniques like CT angiography and MRI. Involves abnormal blood vessel formation in multiple organ systems.

name: Herniated Disc
definition: Protrusion of intervertebral disc material beyond its normal anatomical boundaries, typically visualized through MRI or CT scans. Radiologically characterized by disc displacement and potential neural compression.

name: Herniation
definition: Abnormal protrusion or displacement of an anatomical structure through a normal or abnormal opening, typically identified through cross-sectional imaging techniques.

name: Herpes Simplex Encephalitis
definition: Viral brain inflammation caused by herpes simplex virus, characterized by distinctive imaging findings on MRI including temporal lobe involvement and potential hemorrhagic changes.

name: Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV-2)
definition: Sexually transmitted viral infection potentially causing neurological complications, identifiable through advanced imaging techniques when neurological manifestations occur.

name: Heterotopia
definition: Presence of tissue in an abnormal location, typically identified through detailed cross-sectional imaging techniques showing misplaced cellular structures.

name: Hiatal Hernia
definition: Anatomical condition where stomach protrudes through diaphragmatic opening, typically visualized through contrast radiography or cross-sectional imaging techniques.

name: Hibernating Myocardium
definition: Viable but metabolically suppressed myocardial tissue with reduced function, identifiable through specialized cardiac imaging techniques like PET and SPECT.

name: High-grade Glioma
definition: Aggressive primary brain tumor with high malignancy, characterized by distinctive radiological features on MRI including irregular margins and heterogeneous enhancement.

name: High-Grade Glioma (GBM)
definition: Most aggressive form of brain tumor with distinctive radiological characteristics, typically showing complex enhancement patterns and infiltrative margins on advanced imaging techniques.

name: High-risk prostate cancer
definition: Prostate cancer with high-grade features indicating aggressive potential, typically characterized by high Gleason scores, extensive tumor volume, or high PSA levels. Radiological findings often show extracapsular extension or suspicious lymph node involvement.

name: Highly Suspicious Breast Lesions (BI-RADS 5)
definition: Breast lesions with extremely high probability of malignancy (>95% chance) on mammographic imaging. These lesions demonstrate highly suspicious morphological characteristics requiring immediate biopsy.

name: Hip dysplasia
definition: Developmental disorder of the hip joint where the acetabulum is abnormally shallow, causing improper femoral head coverage. Radiographic findings typically show inadequate socket depth and potential joint subluxation.

name: Hip Fracture
definition: Traumatic bone disruption of the proximal femur or acetabular region, typically visible on X-ray or CT as a discontinuity of bone integrity. Radiological assessment is crucial for determining fracture type and potential surgical intervention.

name: Hip impingement
definition: Mechanical abnormality of hip joint causing abnormal contact between femoral head/neck and acetabular rim. Radiographic findings often show altered joint morphology and potential bone deformities.

name: Hip Labral Tear
definition: Traumatic or degenerative injury to the fibrocartilaginous labrum surrounding the hip socket. Radiological diagnosis typically involves MRI to visualize labral disruption or detachment.

name: Hip osteoarthritis
definition: Progressive degenerative joint disease of the hip characterized by cartilage breakdown and bone remodeling. Radiographic findings include joint space narrowing, osteophyte formation, and subchondral sclerosis.

name: Hippocampal Sclerosis
definition: Pathological hippocampal changes characterized by neuronal loss and gliosis, typically associated with temporal lobe epilepsy. MRI reveals characteristic hippocampal atrophy and signal intensity alterations.

name: Hirschsprung Disease
definition: Congenital intestinal disorder characterized by absence of ganglion cells in the distal colon, causing functional intestinal obstruction. Radiographic findings include bowel dilation and abnormal colonic segmentation.

name: Histopathology
definition: Histopathology is the microscopic examination of tissue samples to diagnose diseases by evaluating cellular characteristics, structural changes, and pathological processes. In radiology, it provides crucial correlative information for imaging findings.

name: Histopathology (Liver Biopsy)
definition: Microscopic examination of liver tissue obtained through a biopsy procedure to evaluate cellular structure, detect pathological changes, and diagnose liver diseases. Provides detailed cellular-level insights beyond imaging techniques.

name: HIV encephalopathy
definition: HIV-related brain pathology causing progressive neurological deterioration. Neuroimaging reveals cerebral atrophy, white matter changes, and potential opportunistic infections.

name: Hodgkin Lymphoma
definition: Lymphoid malignancy originating in lymphatic system, characterized by characteristic radiological patterns of lymph node involvement and potential extranodal spread.

name: Hodgkin Lymphoma (HL)
definition: Lymphoid malignancy originating in lymphatic system, characterized by characteristic radiological patterns of lymph node involvement and potential extranodal spread.

name: Holoprosencephaly
definition: Congenital brain malformation resulting from incomplete forebrain development, characterized by various degrees of cerebral structural abnormalities. Radiological findings include midline structural defects and potential craniofacial anomalies.

name: Holoprosencephaly (HPE)
definition: Congenital brain malformation resulting from incomplete forebrain development, characterized by various degrees of cerebral structural abnormalities. Radiological findings include midline structural defects and potential craniofacial anomalies.

name: Honeycombing
definition: A radiographic pattern of lung tissue characterized by clustered small cystic spaces resembling a honeycomb. Typically indicates advanced interstitial lung disease with irreversible lung parenchymal changes.

name: Hook of Hamate Fracture
definition: Uncommon carpal bone fracture involving the hook of the hamate, typically seen in athletes or manual laborers. Radiographic diagnosis often requires specialized views or advanced imaging techniques.

name: Horseshoe Kidney
definition: A congenital renal malformation where the lower poles of the kidneys are fused, creating a U-shaped kidney. Radiologically characterized by a continuous renal parenchyma across the midline with abnormal vascular and collecting system anatomy.

name: HSG
definition: Radiographic examination of the uterus and fallopian tubes using contrast material to evaluate fertility, detect structural abnormalities, and assess tubal patency.

name: HSV-1 Encephalitis
definition: A viral brain infection caused by Herpes Simplex Virus Type 1, characterized by hemorrhagic and necrotizing encephalitis. Radiologically presents with temporal lobe edema, hemorrhage, and signal changes on MRI.

name: Hutch Diverticulum
definition: A rare urological condition where a diverticulum forms at the ureterovesical junction, typically associated with vesicoureteral reflux. Radiologically identified through contrast studies showing an outpouching near the ureter.

name: Hydatid cyst
definition: A parasitic cyst caused by Echinococcus tapeworm, characterized by fluid-filled lesions with a distinctive laminated wall. Radiologically appears as well-defined, multi-layered cystic structures in various organs.

name: Hydatid disease (liver)
definition: A parasitic infection of the liver caused by Echinococcus granulosus, presenting as multiple cystic lesions. Radiologically characterized by multi-compartment cysts with calcified walls and potential daughter cysts.

name: Hydatidiform Mole (Complete)
definition: A type of abnormal pregnancy where placental tissue develops without a viable fetus, characterized by diffuse cystic changes. Radiologically shows a grape-like appearance with multiple cystic spaces and no fetal structures.

name: Hydatidiform Mole (Partial)
definition: A partial molar pregnancy with focal placental changes and some fetal tissue present. Radiologically shows mixed cystic and solid areas with partial fetal development.

name: Hydranencephaly
definition: A rare congenital disorder where cerebral hemispheres are replaced by fluid-filled sacs. Radiologically characterized by near-total absence of cerebral tissue with fluid-filled cranial vault.

name: Hydrocele
definition: A fluid-filled sac surrounding the testicle, typically in the scrotum. Radiologically appears as a hypoechoic or anechoic fluid collection around the testicle on ultrasound.

name: Hydrocephalus
definition: An abnormal accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid within the brain's ventricles, causing increased intracranial pressure. Radiologically shows enlarged ventricles and potential midline shift.

name: Hydrocephalus (Shunt Failure)
definition: A complication of cerebrospinal fluid shunt where drainage mechanism fails, leading to recurrent hydrocephalus. Radiologically shows shunt malfunction with persistent or worsening ventricular enlargement.

name: Hydrocephalus Ex-Vacuo (Cerebral Atrophy)
definition: Ventricular enlargement secondary to brain tissue loss from atrophy. Radiologically characterized by proportional ventricular expansion compensating for brain parenchymal volume reduction.

name: Hydrocephalus ex vacuo (atrophy)
definition: Ventricular enlargement secondary to brain tissue loss from atrophy. Radiologically characterized by proportional ventricular expansion compensating for brain parenchymal volume reduction.

name: Hydromyelia
definition: A condition involving abnormal dilation of the central canal of the spinal cord. Radiologically shows expanded central canal with potential associated syringomyelia.

name: Hydronephrosis
definition: Kidney swelling due to urine accumulation caused by obstruction of urinary outflow. Radiologically shows kidney enlargement, calyceal dilation, and potential parenchymal thinning.

name: Hydronephrosis of Pregnancy
definition: Dilation of the renal pelvis and calyces during pregnancy due to hormonal and mechanical changes. Radiologically characterized by enlarged renal collecting system with potential urinary tract obstruction.

name: Hydrosalpinx
definition: Fluid-filled dilation of the fallopian tube, typically seen on imaging as a tubular, cystic structure with hydrosalpinx appearance. Often associated with inflammation or prior infection.

name: Hyperacute Rejection
definition: Acute, severe immune-mediated rejection of transplanted organ occurring within minutes to hours after transplantation. Radiologically shows rapid vascular compromise and tissue damage.

name: Hyperdynamic state (e.g., anemia)
definition: Physiological state characterized by increased cardiac output and blood flow, often seen in conditions like anemia. Radiologically manifests as increased vascular prominence and cardiac enlargement.

name: Hyperinflation
definition: A radiographic finding of increased lung volume beyond normal, characterized by increased lung lucency and flattened diaphragm on chest imaging. Often associated with conditions like emphysema or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

name: Hyperparathyroidism
definition: Endocrine disorder characterized by excessive parathyroid hormone production. Radiologically shows bone demineralization, potential kidney stones, and soft tissue calcifications.

name: Hyperparathyroidism (HPT)
definition: Endocrine disorder characterized by excessive parathyroid hormone production. Radiologically shows bone demineralization, potential kidney stones, and soft tissue calcifications.

name: Hyperplastic Polyp
definition: Benign epithelial growth in the gastrointestinal tract characterized by increased cell proliferation. Radiologically appears as a focal mucosal thickening or soft tissue mass.

name: Hypersensitivity pneumonitis
definition: Inflammatory lung condition caused by repeated exposure to organic dust or allergens. Radiologically shows diffuse ground-glass opacities, interstitial changes, and potential nodular infiltrates.

name: Hypertension
definition: Chronic elevation of blood pressure affecting multiple organ systems. Radiologically characterized by vascular changes, cardiac enlargement, and potential end-organ damage.

name: Hypertensive nephrosclerosis
definition: Kidney damage resulting from chronic hypertension. Radiologically shows kidney volume reduction, increased echogenicity, and potential vascular changes.

name: Hyperthyroidism
definition: Endocrine disorder with excessive thyroid hormone production. Radiologically shows enlarged thyroid gland, potential nodules, and increased vascularity.

name: Hyperthyroidism (Graves' disease, toxic nodule)
definition: Endocrine disorder with excessive thyroid hormone production, often due to autoimmune or nodular changes. Radiologically shows enlarged thyroid gland, potential nodules, and increased vascularity.

name: Hypertriglyceridemia
definition: Metabolic disorder characterized by elevated triglyceride levels. Radiologically may show fatty liver, potential pancreatic changes, and increased cardiovascular risk.

name: Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy
definition: Cardiac condition with abnormal thickening of heart muscle, particularly left ventricular walls. Radiologically shows increased myocardial wall thickness and potential obstruction.

name: Hypertrophic Pyloric Stenosis (HPS)
definition: Congenital condition causing pyloric muscle thickening in infants, leading to gastric outlet obstruction. Radiologically shows thickened, elongated pyloric muscle.

name: Hypervascular liver mass
definition: A liver mass with increased blood supply and prominent vascularity on imaging studies. These masses appear bright and well-perfused during contrast-enhanced CT or MRI scans.

name: Hypervascular liver metastases
definition: Metastatic liver lesions characterized by significant blood supply and increased vascularity on radiological imaging. These metastases typically appear bright and well-enhanced during contrast studies.

name: Hypervascular metastasis
definition: A metastatic lesion with abnormally high blood supply and increased vascularity, appearing bright and well-perfused on contrast-enhanced imaging studies.

name: Hypervascularity
definition: A radiological finding indicating increased blood supply or vascular density within a tissue or organ. Characterized by enhanced blood flow and prominent vascularity on imaging studies.

name: Hypochondroplasia
definition: A genetic disorder characterized by disproportionate short stature with mild skeletal dysplasia, detectable through radiographic skeletal measurements and imaging studies.

name: Hypoplastic Left Heart Syndrome (HLHS)
definition: A congenital heart defect where the left side of the heart is underdeveloped, visible through cardiac imaging techniques like echocardiography and MRI.

name: Hypothermia
definition: A physiological state of abnormally low body temperature, detectable through thermal imaging and clinical radiographic assessments.

name: Hypothyroidism (Hashimoto's thyroiditis)
definition: An endocrine disorder characterized by reduced thyroid hormone production, identifiable through thyroid imaging techniques like ultrasound and nuclear medicine scans.

name: Hypoxic-Ischemic Encephalopathy (HIE)
definition: A brain injury resulting from reduced oxygen and blood flow, visible through neuroimaging techniques like CT and MRI showing characteristic brain tissue changes.

name: Hypoxic-ischemic injury
definition: Tissue damage caused by insufficient oxygen and blood supply, detectable through various imaging modalities showing cellular and structural changes.

name: Hypoxic Ischemic Injury (HII) / Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy (HIE)
definition: A neurological condition caused by reduced oxygen and blood flow to the brain, characterized by specific imaging findings of tissue damage and cellular changes.

name: I-123 Scan
definition: Nuclear medicine imaging technique using Iodine-123 to evaluate thyroid function, detect thyroid disorders, and assess metabolic activity of thyroid tissue.

name: I-131 Scintigraphy
definition: Nuclear medicine imaging procedure using radioactive Iodine-131 to diagnose and treat thyroid conditions, particularly thyroid cancer and hyperthyroidism.

name: Iatrogenic Bile Duct Injury
definition: Accidental damage to bile ducts during medical procedures, detectable through imaging techniques like MRCP or CT cholangiography.

name: Iatrogenic Injury
definition: Unintended harm or damage caused during medical treatment, identifiable through various radiological and imaging techniques.

name: IBD
definition: Inflammatory bowel disease detectable through various imaging techniques like CT, MRI, and ultrasound showing characteristic intestinal changes.

name: ICA dissection
definition: A tear or separation in the internal carotid artery wall, visible through advanced imaging techniques like CT angiography and MR angiography.

name: ICA Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of the internal carotid artery, typically detected through imaging techniques like CT angiography or MRA. Stenosis can reduce blood flow and increase stroke risk.

name: ICAD
definition: Intracranial atherosclerotic disease involving narrowing or blockage of brain blood vessels. Radiologically characterized by vessel wall thickening and luminal stenosis.

name: Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension (IIH)
definition: Condition of increased intracranial pressure without a clear cause, typically diagnosed through neuroimaging showing normal brain structures and ventricle characteristics.

name: Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension (IIH) / Pseudotumor Cerebri
definition: Neurological disorder characterized by increased intracranial pressure without identifiable cause, often seen in imaging as normal brain parenchyma with potential papilledema.

name: Idiopathic intracranial hypotension
definition: Rare condition of decreased cerebrospinal fluid pressure, potentially visible through imaging as brain sagging or subdural fluid collections.

name: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF)
definition: Progressive lung disease characterized by scarring and fibrosis, visible on chest radiographs and CT scans as reticular or honeycomb patterns.

name: IgA nephropathy
definition: Kidney disease characterized by IgA antibody deposits in glomeruli, detectable through renal biopsy and imaging showing potential kidney changes.

name: IgG4-related cholangiopathy
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting biliary system with characteristic radiological findings of bile duct wall thickening and potential strictures.

name: IgG4-related cholangitis
definition: Inflammatory biliary tract condition characterized by specific radiological features of bile duct inflammation and potential stricturing.

name: IgG4-related sclerosing cholangitis
definition: Inflammatory biliary tract disorder with distinctive radiological appearance of bile duct wall thickening and potential strictures.

name: ILC
definition: Invasive lobular carcinoma, a type of breast cancer with characteristic radiological appearance on mammography and ultrasound.

name: Ileus
definition: Intestinal obstruction characterized by impaired bowel motility, visible on radiographs as dilated bowel loops and air-fluid levels.

name: Iliofemoral DVT
definition: Deep vein thrombosis involving the iliofemoral region, detectable through ultrasound or CT venography showing vessel occlusion or narrowing.

name: Iliotibial Band Syndrome
definition: Overuse injury of the iliotibial band causing lateral knee pain, potentially visible through imaging showing soft tissue inflammation.

name: Image Artifacts
definition: Errors or distortions in medical imaging that can obscure or misrepresent anatomical structures, requiring careful interpretation.

name: Image noise
definition: Random variations in pixel intensity that degrade image quality in radiographic imaging. Image noise reduces the clarity and diagnostic accuracy of medical images.

name: Imaging
definition: Broad term encompassing various medical visualization techniques used to create detailed internal body representations for diagnostic and monitoring purposes.

name: Imaging/Biopsy
definition: Combined diagnostic approach involving both imaging techniques and tissue sampling to provide comprehensive evaluation of a specific anatomical region or suspected pathology.

name: Immunodeficiency
definition: A condition characterized by compromised immune system function, often detectable through imaging studies showing increased susceptibility to infections or abnormal lymphoid tissue.

name: Impingement (THA)
definition: Mechanical compression or restriction of anatomical structures, typically observed in total hip arthroplasty (THA) imaging as narrowing or abnormal contact between bone and soft tissue.

name: Implant Contracture
definition: Abnormal hardening or tightening of tissue surrounding a medical implant, visible on radiographic imaging as increased density and reduced flexibility.

name: Implant Displacement
definition: Abnormal movement or shifting of a medical implant from its original anatomical position, detectable through radiographic imaging techniques.

name: Implant migration
definition: Unintended movement of a medical implant from its original surgical placement, observable through radiographic imaging as positional changes.

name: Implant Rupture
definition: Structural breach or failure of a medical implant, identifiable through radiographic imaging as discontinuity or compromise of the device's integrity.

name: Implant Rupture (Extracapsular)
definition: Implant rupture occurring outside the capsular region, detectable through radiographic imaging as material leakage or structural discontinuity.

name: Implant Rupture (Intracapsular)
definition: Implant rupture occurring within the capsular region, identifiable through radiographic imaging as internal material compromise.

name: Implant Rupture (Silicone/Saline)
definition: Structural failure of silicone or saline-based medical implants, characterized by material leakage or integrity loss detectable through radiographic imaging.

name: Incidentaloma
definition: Unexpected, asymptomatic mass or lesion discovered incidentally during radiographic imaging, often requiring further investigation.

name: Increased cancer risk
definition: Elevated potential for malignancy development, potentially identifiable through radiographic imaging showing specific risk markers or predisposing conditions.

name: Indeterminate Liver Masses
definition: Liver lesions with uncertain characteristics on radiographic imaging, requiring additional diagnostic evaluation to determine malignant or benign nature.

name: Indolent Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL) - e.g., Follicular Lymphoma
definition: A slow-progressing type of non-Hodgkin lymphoma with minimal symptoms, often characterized by indolent growth patterns observable through radiographic imaging.

name: Infantile Hemangioma
definition: Benign vascular tumor commonly found in infants, typically appearing as well-defined soft tissue lesions on radiographic imaging.

name: Infarct
definition: A localized area of tissue death caused by lack of blood supply, typically visualized on imaging as an area of altered signal intensity or density. In radiology, infarcts are characterized by their location, size, and age.

name: Infarction
definition: The process of tissue death resulting from inadequate blood supply, typically appearing as a well-defined area of tissue damage on radiological imaging. Infarctions can occur in various organs and have distinct imaging characteristics.

name: Infarction of the ipsilateral occipital lobe and inferior temporal lobe
definition: A specific type of brain infarction involving the occipital and inferior temporal lobes, characterized by localized tissue death in these brain regions. Radiologically identified through MRI or CT imaging showing altered tissue signal and potential volume loss.

name: Infarction of the medial frontal/parietal lobes
definition: A brain infarction affecting the medial frontal and parietal lobes, demonstrating localized tissue death in these specific brain regions. Radiological findings include signal changes, potential volume loss, and altered tissue density.

name: Infarcts
definition: Multiple areas of tissue death caused by inadequate blood supply, typically identified on imaging as discrete regions of altered signal or density. Infarcts can occur in various organs and have distinct radiological characteristics.

name: Infection
definition: Pathological process involving microbial invasion of body tissues, characterized by inflammatory response. In radiology, infections are identified through various imaging modalities showing characteristic changes in tissue structure, density, or signal intensity.

name: Infection (Arthroplasty)
definition: Microbial contamination of a joint replacement site, detectable through radiological imaging showing inflammatory changes, potential hardware involvement, and surrounding tissue alterations.

name: Infection (e.g., abscess)
definition: Localized collection of infectious material, typically appearing as a well-defined fluid or soft tissue collection on imaging. Abscesses demonstrate characteristic radiological features such as rim enhancement and central low-density areas.

name: Infection (osteomyelitis)
definition: Inflammatory bone infection involving bone marrow and surrounding structures, characterized on imaging by bone destruction, soft tissue changes, and potential sequestrum formation.

name: Infection (related to tunneled catheter)
definition: Infectious complication associated with indwelling catheters, detectable through imaging showing inflammatory changes, potential catheter tract involvement, and surrounding tissue alterations.

name: Infection Imaging
definition: Radiological techniques and methods used to detect, characterize, and evaluate infectious processes in various body systems. Involves multiple imaging modalities to identify pathological changes.

name: Infections
definition: Multiple infectious processes occurring simultaneously or in different body regions, identifiable through various radiological imaging techniques showing inflammatory changes.

name: Infectious colitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the colon caused by infectious agents, characterized on imaging by mucosal thickening, wall edema, and potential complications.

name: Infectious discitis/osteomyelitis
definition: Infectious inflammatory process involving intervertebral disc and adjacent bone structures, demonstrating characteristic radiological findings of disc space narrowing, bone destruction, and potential abscess formation.

name: Infectious enteritis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the small intestine caused by infectious agents, characterized on imaging by mucosal changes, wall thickening, and potential complications.

name: Infectious spondylitis
definition: Infection of the vertebral column causing destruction and potential deformity of spinal bones. Radiologically characterized by vertebral body destruction, disc space narrowing, and potential abscess formation.

name: Infiltrative disease (Lymphoma/Leukemia, Storage Diseases, Amyloidosis)
definition: Pathological process where abnormal cells or substances infiltrate and replace normal tissue, often seen radiographically as diffuse tissue replacement or abnormal signal intensity.

name: Inflammation
definition: Tissue response to injury or infection characterized by increased blood flow, cellular infiltration, and potential tissue swelling. Radiologically manifests as tissue edema, increased density, or altered signal intensity.

name: Inflammatory Aneurysm
definition: Vascular wall inflammation leading to aneurysm formation, typically characterized by wall thickening and potential surrounding soft tissue changes on imaging.

name: Inflammatory Arthritis
definition: Joint disease characterized by inflammatory changes causing joint destruction and deformity. Radiographically shows joint space narrowing, erosions, and potential periarticular osteopenia.

name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease
definition: Chronic intestinal inflammatory condition affecting the gastrointestinal tract. Radiologically characterized by bowel wall thickening, mucosal irregularity, and potential strictures or fistulas.

name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
definition: Chronic intestinal inflammatory condition affecting the gastrointestinal tract. Radiologically characterized by bowel wall thickening, mucosal irregularity, and potential strictures or fistulas.

name: Inflammatory breast cancer
definition: Aggressive breast cancer subtype presenting with diffuse breast skin changes and erythema. Radiographically shows skin thickening, trabecular disruption, and often no discrete mass.

name: Inflammatory Breast Cancer (IBC)
definition: Aggressive breast cancer subtype presenting with diffuse breast skin changes and erythema. Radiographically shows skin thickening, trabecular disruption, and often no discrete mass.

name: Inflammatory Carcinoma
definition: Aggressive cancer type characterized by significant inflammatory changes and tissue infiltration. Radiologically presents with diffuse tissue involvement and potential skin/soft tissue changes.

name: Inflammatory gallbladder disease
definition: Inflammatory condition of the gallbladder causing wall thickening, potential stones, and surrounding inflammatory changes. Radiographically shows gallbladder wall edema and potential pericholecystic fluid.

name: Inflammatory mass
definition: Localized area of inflammatory tissue showing increased density or signal intensity on imaging, often representing a focal inflammatory process.

name: Inflammatory processes
definition: Tissue or organ-specific inflammatory changes observable through various imaging modalities, characterized by increased cellular activity and potential structural alterations.

name: Inflammatory processes with SSTR expression
definition: Inflammatory conditions demonstrating somatostatin receptor (SSTR) expression, potentially detectable through molecular imaging techniques.

name: Insufficiency Fracture
definition: Bone fracture resulting from repetitive stress or weakened bone structure, often seen in osteoporotic or metabolically compromised patients. Radiographically shows subtle fracture lines in areas of reduced bone density.

name: Insufficient Future Liver Remnant (FLR)
definition: A condition where the remaining liver volume after planned resection is insufficient to support liver function. Radiologists assess future liver remnant volume and predict potential post-operative liver failure.

name: Insulinoma
definition: A rare neuroendocrine tumor of the pancreas that produces excessive insulin. Radiologists use CT and MRI to locate and characterize these small, often challenging-to-detect tumors.

name: Intact implant
definition: A radiological assessment of a medical implant showing no signs of damage, displacement, or compromise. Commonly evaluated in breast, orthopedic, and cardiac implant imaging.

name: Intermediate breast calcifications
definition: Breast calcifications with features between benign and suspicious characteristics, requiring careful radiographic evaluation and potential follow-up imaging.

name: Internal Carotid Artery (ICA) Dissection
definition: A tear or separation in the internal carotid artery wall, potentially causing blood flow disruption. Radiologists use CT and MR angiography to diagnose and assess severity.

name: Internal Hernia
definition: An abnormal protrusion of intestinal contents through a defect in the abdominal wall or mesentery. Radiologists use CT and X-ray to diagnose and characterize these hernias.

name: Internal Hernia (Post-operative)
definition: A hernia occurring after surgical intervention, often in the abdominal cavity. Radiologists use cross-sectional imaging to identify potential post-surgical hernia complications.

name: Intersection syndrome
definition: A rare condition causing pain and inflammation in the forearm's extensor compartment. Radiologists may use ultrasound or MRI to evaluate soft tissue changes.

name: Intestinal-Type Adenocarcinoma
definition: A type of adenocarcinoma typically originating in the intestinal tract, characterized by glandular differentiation. Radiologists use various imaging modalities to detect and stage this cancer.

name: Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH)
definition: Bleeding within the brain parenchyma, often caused by hypertension or trauma. Radiologists use CT and MRI to locate, measure, and assess the extent of hemorrhage.

name: Intracranial Atherosclerotic Disease (ICAD)
definition: Progressive narrowing and hardening of intracranial arteries due to plaque buildup. Radiologists use angiography and other imaging techniques to evaluate vessel stenosis.

name: Intracranial Dermoid
definition: A benign congenital tumor composed of ectodermal elements within the brain. Radiologists identify these lesions through characteristic imaging features on CT and MRI.

name: Intracranial Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within the skull, which can occur in various locations and from different causes. Radiologists use CT and MRI to characterize hemorrhage type, location, and extent.

name: Intracranial hypotension
definition: A condition of decreased cerebrospinal fluid pressure, often causing characteristic headaches. Radiologists use MRI to detect signs of meningeal enhancement and brain sagging.

name: Intracranial Lipoma
definition: A benign fatty tumor located within the intracranial space, typically congenital. Radiologists identify these lesions through characteristic fat-density appearances on CT and MRI.

name: Intracranial Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of blood vessels within the brain, typically caused by atherosclerosis or other inflammatory processes. Radiologically characterized by reduced vessel diameter and potential flow limitations on imaging studies.

name: Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasm (IPMN)
definition: Pancreatic cystic neoplasm arising from the pancreatic duct, characterized by mucin-producing epithelial cells. Radiologically detected through CT or MRI with potential malignant transformation.

name: Intraductal Papilloma
definition: Benign epithelial tumor occurring within ductal systems, most commonly in breast tissue. Radiologically appears as a small, well-defined mass with potential calcifications.

name: Intradural meningeal cyst (Type III)
definition: Rare meningeal cyst located within the dural space, typically asymptomatic and identified incidentally on neuroimaging studies. Characterized by fluid-filled sac within intracranial meninges.

name: Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma
definition: Malignant tumor originating from bile duct epithelial cells within the liver parenchyma. Radiologically appears as irregular, often hypovascular mass on CT and MRI.

name: Intramammary lymph node
definition: Lymph node located within breast tissue, typically identified on mammographic or ultrasound imaging. Represents normal lymphatic drainage within mammary gland.

name: Intramedullary AVM (SCAVM - Type II)
definition: Arteriovenous malformation occurring within the spinal cord, characterized by abnormal vascular connections. Radiologically detected through MRI with potential signal changes and flow voids.

name: Intramuscular Myxoma
definition: Rare, benign soft tissue tumor composed of myxoid material, typically occurring within muscle groups. Radiologically appears as well-defined, often homogeneous soft tissue mass.

name: Intraparenchymal Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within brain parenchyma, characterized by localized hemorrhagic area. Radiologically appears as hyperdense region on CT with potential mass effect.

name: Intrarenal mass
definition: A radiographic finding of an abnormal growth or lesion within the kidney parenchyma, detected on CT, MRI, or ultrasound. Can represent various pathologies including tumors, cysts, or inflammatory processes.

name: Intrauterine pregnancy
definition: Confirmed pregnancy located within the uterine cavity, typically visualized through transvaginal ultrasound with gestational sac and embryonic structures.

name: Intraventricular Hemorrhage (IVH)
definition: Bleeding within the brain's ventricular system, commonly seen in premature infants. Radiologically detected through CT or ultrasound with characteristic intraventricular fluid density changes.

name: Intraventricular Meningioma
definition: Rare meningioma tumor occurring within the brain's ventricular system. Radiologically characterized by contrast-enhancing mass within ventricular spaces.

name: Intussusception
definition: Telescoping of one segment of bowel into another, causing potential obstruction. Radiologically identified through various imaging modalities showing bowel segment invagination.

name: Intussusception (barium)
definition: Radiographic technique using barium contrast to visualize intussusception, highlighting bowel segment interactions and potential obstructive patterns.

name: Intussusception with trapped tracer
definition: Specific radiological finding where a diagnostic tracer becomes entrapped within an intussuscepted bowel segment, indicating potential pathological changes.

name: Invasive Cancer (Breast)
definition: A type of breast cancer where malignant cells have invaded surrounding breast tissue beyond the original site of origin. Radiologically characterized by irregular margins, architectural distortion, and potential microcalcifications.

name: Invasive Carcinoma
definition: A cancer type where malignant cells have broken through the original tissue layer and invaded surrounding tissues. Radiologically identified by abnormal tissue boundaries and potential metastatic spread.

name: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma
definition: A common breast cancer originating in milk ducts that has spread into surrounding breast tissue. Radiographically appears as spiculated mass with irregular margins and potential calcifications.

name: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma (IDC)
definition: A common breast cancer originating in milk ducts that has spread into surrounding breast tissue. Radiographically appears as spiculated mass with irregular margins and potential calcifications.

name: Invasive Lobular Carcinoma
definition: A breast cancer type originating in milk-producing lobules that has spread into surrounding breast tissue. Radiologically characterized by subtle, often poorly defined margins.

name: Invasive Lobular Carcinoma (ILC)
definition: A breast cancer type originating in milk-producing lobules that has spread into surrounding breast tissue. Radiologically characterized by subtle, often poorly defined margins.

name: Invasive Mole/Choriocarcinoma
definition: A rare gestational trophoblastic neoplasm characterized by malignant proliferation of placental tissue. Radiographically may show complex mass with potential hemorrhagic components.

name: Inverted Papilloma (IP)
definition: A benign epithelial tumor typically found in the sinonasal tract, characterized by papillary growth pattern. Radiologically appears as soft tissue mass with potential internal calcifications.

name: IPMN
definition: A cystic pancreatic neoplasm involving the main pancreatic duct. Radiographically characterized by dilated pancreatic duct with multiple cystic components and potential mural nodules.

name: Ischemia
definition: Inadequate blood supply to tissues resulting in potential cellular damage. Radiologically manifests as reduced perfusion, tissue density changes, and potential signal alterations.

name: Ischemia-Reperfusion Injury
definition: Tissue damage occurring when blood supply is restored after a period of ischemia, causing additional cellular injury. Radiographically shows progressive tissue changes and potential inflammatory response.

name: Ischemic bowel
definition: Condition of compromised blood supply to intestinal segments, potentially leading to tissue necrosis. Radiologically characterized by bowel wall thickening, pneumatosis, and potential vascular compromise.

name: Ischemic Cardiomyopathy
definition: Heart muscle dysfunction resulting from chronic reduced blood supply. Radiographically shows regional wall motion abnormalities, reduced cardiac function, and potential scarring.

name: Ischemic Changes
definition: Radiographic evidence of tissue damage due to inadequate blood supply. Typically manifests as signal intensity alterations, tissue density changes, and potential structural modifications.

name: Ischemic Colitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the colon caused by compromised blood supply. Radiologically shows bowel wall thickening, mucosal irregularity, and potential pneumatosis.

name: Ischemic Colitis (IC)
definition: Inflammatory condition of the colon caused by reduced blood flow, resulting in mucosal and submucosal ischemia. Radiographic findings typically include bowel wall thickening, mucosal irregularity, and potential pneumatosis intestinalis.

name: Ischemic Stroke
definition: Neurological event caused by disrupted blood supply to brain tissue, characterized by focal neurological deficits. Radiological diagnosis involves CT and MRI scans showing areas of infarction, hemorrhage, or vascular occlusion.

name: IVC Filter Fracture
definition: Mechanical failure of an inferior vena cava (IVC) filter, where the device breaks into fragments. Radiographic evaluation reveals structural discontinuity or fragmentation of the filter.

name: IVC Filter Malposition/Migration
definition: Abnormal positioning or movement of an IVC filter from its intended anatomical location. Radiological assessment identifies deviation from the expected filter placement.

name: IVC Filter Migration
definition: Unintended movement of an IVC filter from its original placement, potentially causing vascular complications. Imaging techniques can track and confirm filter displacement.

name: IVC Filter Penetration
definition: Pathological condition where an IVC filter breaches the vessel wall, potentially causing serious vascular injury. Radiographic evidence shows filter extending beyond normal vascular boundaries.

name: IVC Occlusion
definition: Complete blockage of the inferior vena cava, preventing blood flow through the vessel. Radiological findings include total vessel obstruction on imaging studies.

name: IVC Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of the inferior vena cava lumen, reducing blood flow capacity. Radiographic evaluation reveals reduced vessel diameter and potential hemodynamic changes.

name: IVC Thrombosis
definition: Formation of blood clot within the inferior vena cava, obstructing normal blood flow. Imaging techniques can detect and characterize the extent of thrombotic involvement.

name: IVC Thrombosis/Occlusion
definition: Combined condition of blood clot formation and complete vessel blockage in the inferior vena cava. Radiological assessment reveals both thrombotic material and vessel obstruction.

name: IVP
definition: Radiographic examination of the urinary system using contrast material to evaluate kidney function, detect structural abnormalities, and assess urinary tract pathologies.

name: IVUS
definition: Intravascular ultrasound imaging technique providing detailed visualization of blood vessel walls, plaque composition, and arterial structure from within the vessel.

name: Jefferson fracture
definition: Fracture of the first cervical vertebra (C1) involving the ring-like structure, often associated with high-energy trauma. Radiographic diagnosis requires detailed CT or MRI evaluation.

name: Jejunal atresia
definition: Congenital intestinal malformation characterized by complete obstruction of the jejunum. Radiographic findings include proximal bowel dilation and absence of distal bowel gas.

name: Jejunoileal Atresia (JIA)
definition: Congenital intestinal developmental disorder involving complete obstruction of the jejunum and ileum. Radiological diagnosis involves identifying bowel discontinuity and proximal dilation.

name: Jones Fracture
definition: Fracture of the fifth metatarsal bone, typically occurring at the metaphyseal-diaphyseal junction. Radiographic evaluation involves detailed foot and ankle imaging.

name: Joubert Syndrome
definition: Rare genetic disorder characterized by distinctive midbrain-hindbrain malformation, visible on neuroimaging as a molar tooth sign on brain MRI.

name: Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA)
definition: Chronic inflammatory joint disorder affecting children, characterized by persistent joint inflammation and potential long-term joint damage. Radiographic findings include joint space narrowing, soft tissue swelling, and potential bone erosions.

name: Juvenile Nasopharyngeal Angiofibroma (JNA)
definition: Rare, benign vascular tumor typically occurring in adolescent males, originating in the nasopharyngeal region. Radiologically characterized by a soft tissue mass with significant vascularity and potential bone erosion.

name: Juvenile Pilocytic Astrocytoma (JPA)
definition: Slow-growing, typically benign brain tumor occurring in children and young adults, most commonly located in the cerebellum. Radiographic imaging shows a well-defined, often cystic lesion with potential contrast enhancement.

name: Kawasaki Disease (KD) / Mucocutaneous Lymph Node Syndrome
definition: Acute, self-limited vasculitis affecting children, characterized by widespread inflammation of blood vessels. Radiographic findings may include coronary artery aneurysms and potential cardiac complications.

name: Kawasaki disease coronary aneurysms
definition: Dilated or aneurysmal segments of coronary arteries resulting from Kawasaki disease inflammation. Radiologically identified through cardiac imaging techniques showing abnormal coronary vessel morphology.

name: Keloids
definition: Abnormal fibrous tissue overgrowth beyond original wound boundaries, characterized by excessive collagen production. Radiographically may appear as raised, irregular soft tissue masses.

name: Keyhole sign
definition: A radiographic sign characterized by a focal dilatation of the renal pelvis resembling a keyhole shape. Often associated with ureteropelvic junction obstruction or hydronephrosis.

name: Kidney Cancer
definition: Malignant tumor originating in kidney tissue, with various subtypes including clear cell, papillary, and chromophobe renal cell carcinomas. Radiological diagnosis typically involves CT, MRI, and ultrasound imaging.

name: Kienbcks Disease (AVN of Lunate) (Wrist)
definition: Avascular necrosis of the lunate bone in the wrist, causing progressive bone collapse and potential carpal instability. Radiographically characterized by lunate bone density changes and potential fragmentation.

name: Klippel-Trenaunay Syndrome
definition: Congenital vascular disorder characterized by cutaneous hemangiomas, varicose veins, and soft tissue hypertrophy. Radiological findings include vascular malformations and potential limb length discrepancies.

name: Known Cancer (BI-RADS 6)
definition: BI-RADS category indicating a confirmed malignancy that has already been diagnosed through previous biopsy. Used in breast imaging to denote a known cancer requiring specific follow-up imaging.

name: Kohler Disease
definition: Avascular necrosis of the tarsal navicular bone in children, typically causing foot pain and potential bone deformity. Radiographically shows progressive changes in navicular bone structure.

name: Korsakoff Syndrome
definition: Chronic memory disorder characterized by severe anterograde and retrograde memory impairment, typically associated with chronic alcoholism. Neuroimaging may show brain atrophy and white matter changes.

name: Krabbe Disease (Globoid Cell Leukodystrophy)
definition: Rare, inherited lysosomal storage disorder causing progressive destruction of myelin in the nervous system. Neuroimaging reveals white matter demyelination and potential brain atrophy.

name: Kmmell's disease (Osteonecrosis of vertebral body)
definition: Osteonecrosis of the vertebral body, typically resulting from trauma or compromised blood supply. Radiographically characterized by vertebral body collapse and potential deformity.

name: Lab
definition: Medical facility or department responsible for conducting diagnostic tests, analyzing biological samples, and providing clinical diagnostic information.

name: Lab values
definition: Quantitative measurements of various physiological and biochemical parameters obtained through blood, urine, or other biological sample analysis.

name: Labral Tear
definition: Soft tissue injury involving damage to the fibrocartilaginous rim surrounding joint sockets, most commonly in shoulder and hip joints. Radiologically detected through specialized imaging techniques like MRI or arthrography.

name: Labral Tear/Avulsion (Shoulder)
definition: A tear or avulsion of the shoulder labrum, typically involving the glenoid labrum. Radiologically characterized by labral detachment, signal abnormality, or discontinuity on MRI.

name: Labyrinthine Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within the inner ear's labyrinth, typically detected on MRI as signal abnormalities. Can result from trauma, infection, or vascular disorders.

name: Lactating Adenoma
definition: A benign breast tumor occurring during lactation, characterized by proliferative changes in breast tissue. Typically appears as a well-defined mass on mammography and ultrasound.

name: Lactational Abscess
definition: A localized collection of pus within breast tissue during lactation, typically appearing as a hypoechoic or complex fluid collection on ultrasound.

name: Lactational Mastitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the breast during lactation, radiologically presenting as increased breast tissue density, edema, and potential fluid collections.

name: Lacunar Infarction
definition: Small, deep cerebral infarcts typically affecting the deep white matter and basal ganglia. Characterized by small, punctate lesions on CT and MRI.

name: Lacunar Infarcts
definition: Multiple small, deep cerebral infarcts typically affecting the deep white matter and basal ganglia. Characterized by multiple punctate lesions on CT and MRI.

name: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis
definition: A rare disorder characterized by abnormal proliferation of Langerhans cells, causing multisystem involvement. Radiologically presents with bone lesions, lung infiltrates, and potential soft tissue involvement.

name: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis (LCH)
definition: A rare disorder characterized by abnormal proliferation of Langerhans cells, causing multisystem involvement. Radiologically presents with bone lesions, lung infiltrates, and potential soft tissue involvement.

name: Large bowel obstruction
definition: Mechanical blockage of the large intestine, radiologically characterized by dilated bowel loops, air-fluid levels, and potential transition points on CT or X-ray.

name: Large Bowel Obstruction (LBO)
definition: Mechanical blockage of the large intestine, radiologically characterized by dilated bowel loops, air-fluid levels, and potential transition points on CT or X-ray.

name: Large territorial infarcts
definition: Extensive brain infarcts involving major cerebral arterial territories, typically appearing as large hypodense or hyperintense regions on CT and MRI.

name: Laryngeal Cancer
definition: Malignant tumor of the larynx, radiologically characterized by soft tissue masses, potential cartilage destruction, and lymph node involvement on CT and MRI.

name: Lateral Collateral Ligament (LCL) Injury
definition: Injury to the lateral collateral ligament of a joint, typically the knee. Radiologically assessed through MRI, showing ligament discontinuity, signal abnormality, or potential avulsion.

name: Lateral Epicondylitis (Tennis Elbow)
definition: Chronic inflammation of the lateral epicondyle of the elbow, radiologically showing soft tissue thickening, potential calcifications, and tendon abnormalities.

name: Lateral Ligament Injury
definition: Damage or stretching of the lateral ligament complex, typically involving the lateral collateral ligament. Radiographic findings may include ligament discontinuity, signal intensity changes, and potential joint instability.

name: Lateral Meniscus Tear
definition: Tear or disruption of the lateral meniscus in the knee joint, typically visualized on MRI as signal intensity changes, discontinuity, or abnormal meniscal morphology.

name: LCIS (Lobular Carcinoma In Situ)
definition: Non-invasive precancerous condition of the breast characterized by abnormal cell growth within the milk-producing lobules. Radiographically detected through mammography or breast MRI as subtle architectural changes.

name: LCL Injury
definition: Injury to the lateral collateral ligament, typically involving partial or complete ligament disruption. Radiographic imaging can reveal ligament discontinuity, signal changes, and potential joint instability.

name: LCL sprain
definition: Mild stretching or partial tear of the lateral collateral ligament without complete disruption. Radiographic findings include subtle signal intensity changes and potential ligament thickening.

name: Leak
definition: Abnormal fluid or substance escaping from its intended anatomical compartment or structure. Radiographic detection involves various imaging modalities to identify fluid extravasation or abnormal fluid collections.

name: Left-sided brain tumors
definition: Tumors located in the left hemisphere of the brain, detectable through CT, MRI, or other neuroimaging techniques. Characterized by space-occupying lesions with potential mass effect and signal intensity variations.

name: Left bundle branch block
definition: Electrical conduction abnormality in the heart's left bundle branch, characterized by prolonged ventricular activation. Diagnosed through electrocardiography and potentially visible on cardiac imaging studies.

name: Legg-Calv-Perthes (LCP) Disease
definition: Childhood hip disorder involving avascular necrosis of the femoral head, characterized by disrupted blood supply and potential deformity. Radiographically demonstrated through progressive changes in femoral head morphology.

name: Legg-Calv-Perthes Disease (LCPD)
definition: Childhood hip disorder involving avascular necrosis of the femoral head, characterized by disrupted blood supply and potential deformity. Radiographically demonstrated through progressive changes in femoral head morphology.

name: Leiomyoma
definition: Benign smooth muscle tumor typically occurring in the uterus, characterized by well-defined masses with distinct imaging features on ultrasound, CT, and MRI.

name: Leiomyomas (Fibroids)
definition: Benign smooth muscle tumors of the uterus, characterized by multiple well-defined masses with distinct imaging features on ultrasound, CT, and MRI.

name: Leiomyosarcoma
definition: Malignant smooth muscle tumor with potential for metastasis, characterized by aggressive imaging features and irregular margins on radiographic studies.

name: Lepidic adenocarcinoma
definition: A subtype of lung adenocarcinoma characterized by minimal invasive growth pattern, typically detected through high-resolution CT and characterized by specific radiographic features.

name: Leukemia
definition: Malignant blood cancer characterized by abnormal proliferation of white blood cells, detectable through various imaging techniques showing bone marrow changes, lymph node enlargement, and potential organ infiltration.

name: Leukemia (Testicular)
definition: A rare form of testicular cancer originating from white blood cells, typically appearing as a mass on imaging studies with potential infiltration of testicular tissue. Radiological evaluation often involves ultrasound, CT, or MRI to assess tumor extent and metastasis.

name: Lewy Body Dementia
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by abnormal protein deposits (Lewy bodies) in brain regions, detectable through neuroimaging techniques like MRI and PET scans showing specific patterns of brain atrophy and reduced metabolism.

name: Lewy Body Dementia (LBD)
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by abnormal protein deposits (Lewy bodies) in brain regions, detectable through neuroimaging techniques like MRI and PET scans showing specific patterns of brain atrophy and reduced metabolism.

name: Leydig/Sertoli cell tumors
definition: Rare testicular tumors originating from Leydig or Sertoli cells, typically appearing as discrete masses on ultrasound or CT imaging with variable enhancement characteristics and potential heterogeneous internal architecture.

name: Lhermitte-Duclos disease
definition: A rare cerebellar gangliocytoma characterized by abnormal cortical thickening of the cerebellar hemisphere, typically appearing as a dysplastic lesion on MRI with distinctive signal characteristics and potential mass effect.

name: LI-RADS LR-5 Lesion
definition: A standardized classification for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) lesions with high probability of malignancy, characterized by specific imaging features on contrast-enhanced CT or MRI that indicate a high likelihood of hepatic cancer.

name: Ligamentous injury
definition: Damage or disruption of ligaments, typically visualized through MRI or CT imaging, showing abnormal ligament continuity, signal intensity changes, and potential associated soft tissue or bone injuries.

name: Ligamentum teres tear
definition: A tear or injury of the ligamentum teres (round ligament) in the liver, typically identified through cross-sectional imaging like CT or MRI, showing discontinuity or abnormal signal intensity of the ligament.

name: Limbic Encephalitis (LE)
definition: An autoimmune inflammatory condition affecting the limbic system, characterized by brain inflammation detectable through MRI showing characteristic signal changes, enhancement patterns, and potential hippocampal involvement.

name: Linear Skull Fracture
definition: A type of skull fracture appearing as a single, non-branching fracture line on CT or X-ray imaging, typically involving a relatively straight break in the skull without significant displacement.

name: Linitis Plastica
definition: A pathological condition of the stomach characterized by diffuse infiltrative growth, appearing on imaging as a thickened, rigid stomach wall with reduced distensibility and potential malignant transformation.

name: Lipedema
definition: A chronic fat distribution disorder characterized by symmetrical, disproportionate fat accumulation in extremities, typically evaluated through specialized imaging techniques showing distinctive soft tissue changes.

name: Lipoma
definition: A benign soft tissue tumor composed of mature adipose tissue, typically appearing as a well-circumscribed, homogeneous, low-density mass on CT and MRI with characteristic signal characteristics.

name: Lipoma of the corpus callosum
definition: A rare benign lipoma located within the corpus callosum, typically identified on MRI as a well-defined, homogeneous fatty mass with signal characteristics consistent with adipose tissue.

name: Lipomyelocele
definition: A congenital spinal dysraphism involving a lipoma extending through a neural tube defect, typically visualized on MRI as a fatty mass associated with spinal cord malformation.

name: Lipomyelomeningocele
definition: A rare congenital spinal malformation where fatty tissue protrudes through a defect in the posterior elements of the spine, often visible on MRI as a soft tissue mass extending from the spinal canal. Radiological assessment helps evaluate neural compression and associated anomalies.

name: Liposarcoma
definition: A malignant soft tissue tumor originating from fat cells, typically appearing as a heterogeneous mass with variable fat content on imaging studies. CT and MRI are crucial for characterizing tumor extent, invasion, and staging.

name: Lisfranc Injury
definition: A complex foot injury involving disruption of the tarsometatarsal joint complex, typically diagnosed through weight-bearing radiographs, CT, or MRI. Imaging helps assess joint alignment, ligamentous injury, and potential fracture patterns.

name: Lissencephaly
definition: A rare neuronal migration disorder characterized by a smooth, abnormally developed cerebral cortex, typically identified on brain MRI as a markedly simplified gyral pattern. Radiological findings are critical for diagnosis and understanding developmental brain anomalies.

name: Liver Abscess
definition: A localized collection of pus within the liver parenchyma, typically appearing as a complex, rim-enhancing fluid collection on CT and MRI. Imaging helps differentiate from other hepatic lesions and guide potential intervention.

name: Liver Cancer
definition: Malignant neoplastic growth originating in the liver, characterized by various imaging features depending on the specific type. CT, MRI, and ultrasound are essential for detection, characterization, and staging.

name: Liver Cancer (Hepatocellular Carcinoma - HCC)
definition: A primary liver cancer arising from hepatocytes, typically appearing as a hypervascular mass on contrast-enhanced CT and MRI. Radiological features help distinguish HCC from other liver lesions and assess tumor extent.

name: Liver Fibrosis
definition: Progressive liver scarring characterized by increased hepatic echogenicity and architectural distortion on imaging studies. Ultrasound, CT, and MRI are used to assess fibrosis severity and potential complications.

name: Liver Flukes (*Opisthorchis/Clonorchis*)
definition: Parasitic liver infection caused by flatworms, typically identified through specialized imaging techniques that may reveal biliary tract changes, calcifications, and associated inflammatory responses.

name: Liver Flukes (Opisthorchis/Clonorchis)
