definition: Parasitic liver infection caused by flatworms, typically identified through specialized imaging techniques that may reveal biliary tract changes, calcifications, and associated inflammatory responses.

name: Liver Injury
definition: Traumatic damage to the liver parenchyma, classified by severity on imaging studies. CT is the primary modality for assessing hepatic trauma, grading injury, and detecting active bleeding.

name: Liver Iron Overload
definition: Excessive iron accumulation in liver tissue, visualized through MRI signal intensity changes and quantitative techniques like T2* mapping. Radiological assessment helps monitor iron deposition and potential organ damage.

name: Liver Lesions
definition: Various abnormal hepatic tissue alterations detected through multiple imaging modalities, including cysts, tumors, and inflammatory changes. Comprehensive radiological evaluation is crucial for differential diagnosis.

name: Liver Malignancies (Unresectable Primary and Metastatic)
definition: Advanced liver tumors that cannot be surgically removed, characterized by complex imaging features demonstrating extensive involvement. Multimodal imaging helps assess tumor boundaries, metastatic spread, and potential treatment strategies.

name: Liver Metastases
definition: Secondary liver tumors originating from cancers in other organs, typically appearing as multiple, often heterogeneous lesions on CT and MRI. Imaging helps characterize metastatic pattern, number, and potential treatment approach.

name: Liver Metastases (most commonly Colorectal Cancer (CRC))
definition: Secondary liver tumors originating from colorectal cancer that appear as multiple, often round hypodense lesions on CT or MRI. These metastases typically demonstrate peripheral enhancement and can vary in size and number.

name: Liver Metastasis
definition: Secondary tumors that spread to the liver from primary cancers in other organs, characterized by distinct lesions with different imaging characteristics depending on the origin cancer.

name: Liver Metastasis (from CRC)
definition: Specific liver metastases arising from colorectal cancer, typically appearing as multiple hypodense nodules with characteristic peripheral enhancement on contrast-enhanced imaging studies.

name: Liver Trauma
definition: Damage to the liver caused by external physical force, often visible on imaging as parenchymal disruption, hematomas, or vascular injuries on CT or ultrasound.

name: Lobar Holoprosencephaly
definition: Congenital brain malformation characterized by incomplete separation of cerebral hemispheres, typically identified through detailed neuroimaging showing abnormal midline brain development.

name: Lobular Carcinoma In Situ (LCIS)
definition: Non-invasive breast condition characterized by abnormal cell growth within milk-producing lobules, typically detected through mammographic or MRI findings.

name: Localized Intravascular Coagulopathy (LIC)
definition: Localized blood clotting disorder affecting specific vascular regions, potentially visible through imaging studies showing microvascular changes or thrombotic patterns.

name: Locally Advanced Breast Cancer (Stage III/IV)
definition: Advanced breast cancer that has spread locally but not to distant sites, characterized by extensive tumor involvement and potential chest wall or regional lymph node invasion.

name: Locally Advanced Pancreatic Cancer (LAPC)
definition: Pancreatic cancer that has extensively invaded surrounding tissues but not yet metastasized, typically showing complex imaging features with vascular involvement.

name: Loculated Peritoneal Fluid
definition: Abnormal fluid collection within peritoneal cavity that is compartmentalized or walled off, typically identified through ultrasound or CT imaging.

name: Longitudinal Temporal Bone Fracture
definition: Temporal bone fracture running parallel to the long axis of the petrous pyramid, often associated with otic capsule disruption and detected through CT imaging.

name: Loosening
definition: Progressive separation or displacement of medical implants or prosthetic devices from their original position, potentially visible through radiographic imaging.

name: Loosening (Arthroplasty)
definition: Gradual separation of orthopedic implant from surrounding bone without active infection, typically identified through radiographic evidence of gap formation.

name: Loosening (Aseptic Loosening)
definition: Non-infectious separation of orthopedic prosthesis from bone interface, characterized by radiographic signs of gap formation and potential osteolysis.

name: Low-contrast lesions
definition: Subtle radiographic findings with minimal density or contrast differences that require specialized imaging techniques or advanced visualization methods to detect.

name: Low-grade chondrosarcoma
definition: A slow-growing, low-grade malignant bone tumor arising from cartilage cells, typically appearing as a lytic or mixed lytic-sclerotic lesion on radiographic imaging. Characterized by minimal cellular atypia and low potential for metastasis.

name: Low-grade myxofibrosarcoma
definition: A rare, low-grade soft tissue sarcoma characterized by spindle cells and myxoid background, typically appearing as a poorly defined, infiltrative mass on radiological studies with variable signal intensity on MRI.

name: Lower Gastrointestinal Bleeding (LGIB)
definition: Bleeding originating from the lower gastrointestinal tract (distal to the ligament of Treitz), detectable through various imaging techniques such as CT angiography or nuclear medicine studies.

name: Lower GI Bleed
definition: Bleeding originating from the lower gastrointestinal tract (distal to the ligament of Treitz), detectable through various imaging techniques such as CT angiography or nuclear medicine studies.

name: Lower GI Bleeding
definition: Bleeding originating from the lower gastrointestinal tract (distal to the ligament of Treitz), detectable through various imaging techniques such as CT angiography or nuclear medicine studies.

name: Lower GI Bleeding (LGIB)
definition: Bleeding originating from the lower gastrointestinal tract (distal to the ligament of Treitz), detectable through various imaging techniques such as CT angiography or nuclear medicine studies.

name: Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms (LUTS)
definition: A group of urinary symptoms related to bladder and urethral function, often evaluated through urodynamic studies and imaging techniques like ultrasound or cystography.

name: Lumbar radiculopathy
definition: A condition involving nerve root compression or irritation in the lumbar spine, typically visualized through MRI or CT scans showing nerve root impingement or herniated disc.

name: Lung abscess
definition: A localized area of lung tissue necrosis and infection, appearing as a cavitary lesion on chest radiographs or CT scans, often with air-fluid levels and surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Lung Cancer
definition: Malignant neoplasm of lung tissue, typically detected through chest radiographs, CT scans, and PET imaging, showing various patterns of mass, nodules, or infiltrative changes.

name: Lung Cancer (Adenocarcinoma, Squamous Cell Carcinoma)
definition: Two primary subtypes of lung cancer with distinct radiological and pathological characteristics, typically identified through CT and PET imaging showing different growth patterns and cellular compositions.

name: Lung Cancer (Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer)
definition: A major category of lung cancer characterized by larger, slower-growing tumors, typically detected through chest imaging techniques like CT and PET scans showing distinct radiological features.

name: Lung carcinoma
definition: Malignant neoplasm of lung tissue, typically detected through chest radiographs, CT scans, and PET imaging, showing various patterns of mass, nodules, or infiltrative changes.

name: Lung malignancies
definition: A broad term encompassing various types of lung cancers, detectable through multiple imaging modalities showing different tumor characteristics and stages.

name: Lung Malignancies (Stage I NSCLC or oligometastatic disease)
definition: Early-stage or limited lung malignancies with minimal metastatic spread, typically identified through precise imaging techniques like CT, PET, and high-resolution scans.

name: Lung Malignancy (Stage I NSCLC or oligometastatic disease)
definition: Early-stage non-small cell lung cancer or limited metastatic lung cancer detected through imaging techniques like CT or PET scans. Typically characterized by small, localized tumor growth with potential for targeted treatment.

name: Lung mass
definition: Abnormal soft tissue density or lesion in the lung larger than 3 cm, typically identified on chest radiographs or CT scans. Can represent various pathological processes including tumors, infections, or inflammatory conditions.

name: Lung nodule
definition: Small, round opacity in the lung less than 3 cm in diameter, typically detected on chest imaging. Can be benign or malignant and requires careful radiological evaluation.

name: Lung nodules
definition: Multiple small, round opacities in the lung less than 3 cm in diameter, detected on chest imaging. Can indicate various pathological processes and require comprehensive radiological assessment.

name: Lunotriquetral ligament tear
definition: Injury or disruption of the ligament connecting the lunate and triquetral bones in the wrist, typically identified through MRI or specialized imaging techniques.

name: Lyme disease
definition: Tick-borne infectious disease that can cause multisystem inflammatory responses, detectable through various imaging modalities showing potential organ involvement.

name: Lyme Neuroborreliosis (LNB)
definition: Neurological manifestation of Lyme disease affecting the central and peripheral nervous systems, potentially identifiable through neuroimaging techniques.

name: Lymph Node
definition: Small, bean-shaped structures in the lymphatic system that filter lymph and play a crucial role in immune response, detectable through various imaging techniques.

name: Lymph node (Benign)
definition: Non-cancerous lymph node without signs of malignant transformation, typically showing normal size and characteristics on imaging studies.

name: Lymph node metastasis from thyroid cancer
definition: Spread of thyroid cancer cells to nearby or distant lymph nodes, detectable through imaging techniques like ultrasound, CT, or PET scans.

name: Lymph node uptake
definition: Increased metabolic activity or contrast enhancement of lymph nodes on imaging studies, potentially indicating inflammatory or malignant processes.

name: Lymphadenopathy
definition: Abnormal enlargement or changes in lymph nodes detectable through imaging, potentially indicating infection, inflammation, or malignancy.

name: Lymphangiography
definition: Radiographic technique using contrast material to visualize lymphatic vessels, evaluate lymphatic system structure, and detect potential abnormalities or blockages.

name: Lymphatic leaks/Chylous fistulas
definition: Abnormal leakage of lymphatic fluid through fistulous connections, potentially identifiable through specialized lymphographic imaging techniques.

name: Lymphedema
definition: Soft tissue swelling caused by lymphatic system blockage or dysfunction, detectable through imaging techniques like MRI or lymphoscintigraphy.

name: Lymphocele
definition: Fluid-filled collection within the lymphatic system, typically identified through ultrasound or CT imaging as a well-defined, cystic lesion.

name: Lymphocytic Hypophysitis
definition: An autoimmune inflammatory condition affecting the pituitary gland, characterized by infiltration of lymphocytes and potential gland enlargement or destruction. Radiologically presents with sellar/suprasellar mass and potential glandular enhancement.

name: Lymphoma
definition: Malignant neoplasm originating from lymphatic system cells, characterized by uncontrolled lymphocyte proliferation. Radiographic findings typically include lymph node enlargement, soft tissue masses, and potential organ infiltration.

name: Lymphoma (Hodgkin's)
definition: A specific type of lymphoma characterized by Reed-Sternberg cells, typically presenting with predictable lymph node involvement. Radiologically demonstrates characteristic mediastinal and nodal enlargement patterns.

name: Lymphoma (Primary Bone)
definition: A rare lymphoma variant primarily originating within bone tissue, presenting with destructive bone lesions and potential soft tissue extension. Radiographic findings include osteolytic changes and potential pathological fractures.

name: Lymphoma (Testicular)
definition: A rare extranodal lymphoma specifically occurring in testicular tissue, characterized by malignant lymphocyte proliferation. Radiologically presents as testicular mass with potential heterogeneous enhancement.

name: Lymphoma/GBM
definition: A complex pathological condition involving concurrent lymphoma and glioblastoma multiforme, presenting with challenging radiographic characteristics of mixed neoplastic processes.

name: Lynch Syndrome (HNPCC)
definition: Hereditary cancer syndrome characterized by increased colorectal cancer risk due to DNA mismatch repair gene mutations. Radiologically involves surveillance for potential neoplastic developments.

name: Lytic bone lesion
definition: Radiographic finding of bone destruction characterized by decreased bone density and potential cavitary lesions. Typically indicates underlying pathological process like tumor, infection, or metabolic disorder.

name: Macrocephaly due to hydrocephalus
definition: Abnormal head enlargement resulting from excessive cerebrospinal fluid accumulation within ventricles, causing increased intracranial pressure. Radiologically demonstrates ventricular dilation and potential brain parenchymal changes.

name: Macrocephaly due to skull thickening
definition: Abnormal head enlargement caused by generalized skull bone thickening, potentially indicating underlying metabolic or genetic conditions. Radiographically shows increased skull bone density and volume.

name: Madelung Deformity
definition: Congenital wrist deformity characterized by radial-sided carpal bone abnormal development, typically involving radius and scaphoid. Radiographically demonstrates characteristic angular and positional changes.

name: Maffucci Syndrome
definition: Rare genetic disorder characterized by multiple enchondromas and hemangiomas. Radiologically presents with multiple benign cartilaginous tumors and vascular malformations.

name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging
definition: Advanced medical imaging technique using powerful magnetic fields and radio waves to generate detailed cross-sectional images of body structures with exceptional soft tissue contrast.

name: Malabsorption Syndrome
definition: Condition characterized by impaired nutrient absorption in gastrointestinal tract, leading to potential nutritional deficiencies. Radiographically may show intestinal mucosal changes and potential structural abnormalities.

name: Male Breast Cancer
definition: Rare malignant breast neoplasm occurring in male breast tissue. Radiologically presents as discrete mass with potential architectural distortion and calcifications.

name: Malignancy
definition: Broad term describing uncontrolled cellular proliferation with potential invasive and metastatic characteristics. Radiographically demonstrates abnormal tissue growth, potential infiltration, and structural changes.

name: Malignancy (General)
definition: A pathological condition characterized by uncontrolled cell growth and potential for invasion and metastasis. In radiology, malignancies are typically identified through abnormal tissue density, irregular margins, and heterogeneous enhancement patterns.

name: Malignancy (GIST, colon cancer)
definition: A rare mesenchymal tumor of the gastrointestinal tract with potential for malignant transformation. Radiologically characterized by heterogeneous mass with irregular borders and potential areas of necrosis or hemorrhage.

name: Malignancy (GIST/Colon Cancer)
definition: Malignant neoplasm of the colon with potential for local invasion and metastatic spread. Radiographic features include irregular wall thickening, luminal narrowing, and potential extraluminal extension.

name: Malignancy (Metastases, Multiple Myeloma)
definition: Systemic plasma cell malignancy with widespread bone involvement and potential metastatic lesions. Radiologically characterized by multiple lytic bone lesions, soft tissue masses, and diffuse marrow infiltration.

name: Malignancy (Peritoneal Carcinomatosis)
definition: Widespread malignant spread of cancer cells across the peritoneal surface. Radiologically identified by multiple nodular peritoneal implants, omental thickening, and ascites.

name: Malignant biliary obstruction
definition: Blockage of bile ducts caused by malignant tumor growth. Radiologically characterized by biliary tree dilation, irregular wall thickening, and potential mass effect.

name: Malignant Breast Lesions
definition: Malignant tumors of breast tissue with potential for local and distant spread. Radiologically identified through irregular masses, architectural distortion, microcalcifications, and suspicious enhancement patterns.

name: Malignant fibrous histiocytoma
definition: Rare, aggressive soft tissue sarcoma with high metastatic potential. Radiologically characterized by large, heterogeneous soft tissue mass with infiltrative margins.

name: Malignant Fluid Collection
definition: Pathological fluid accumulation associated with malignant processes, potentially indicating advanced disease progression. Radiologically observed through imaging-guided fluid collections with suspicious characteristics.

name: Malignant MCA Infarct
definition: Cerebral infarct in the middle cerebral artery territory with potential malignant transformation or associated with underlying malignancy. Characterized by significant tissue edema and mass effect.

name: Malignant Obstructions (Ureteral)
definition: Urinary tract obstruction caused by malignant tumor growth. Radiologically identified through ureteral narrowing, irregular wall thickening, and potential soft tissue masses.

name: Malignant Papillary Carcinoma
definition: Malignant thyroid tumor with distinct papillary architectural pattern. Radiologically characterized by irregular nodular lesions with microcalcifications and potential extrathyroidal extension.

name: Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor (MPNST)
definition: Rare malignant tumor arising from peripheral nerve sheaths. Radiologically characterized by large, infiltrative soft tissue masses with potential neural involvement.

name: Malignant Stricture
definition: Pathological narrowing of a tubular structure caused by malignant tumor infiltration. Radiologically identified through irregular luminal narrowing and potential soft tissue masses.

name: Malignant Thyroid Nodule
definition: Malignant growth within the thyroid gland with potential for local and distant spread. Radiologically characterized by irregular nodules, microcalcifications, and suspicious enhancement patterns.

name: Malignant tumor
definition: A cancerous growth characterized by uncontrolled cell division and potential to invade surrounding tissues and metastasize. In radiology, malignant tumors typically appear with irregular margins, heterogeneous density, and potential signs of local invasion or metastatic spread.

name: Malignant vertebral fracture
definition: A vertebral fracture associated with malignant tumor involvement, often indicating pathological bone destruction or metastatic disease. Radiologically characterized by vertebral body collapse, irregular fracture lines, and potential soft tissue extension.

name: Malignant Vertebral Metastases
definition: Cancerous lesions that have spread to vertebral bones from primary tumors elsewhere in the body. Radiographically identified by destructive bone changes, irregular margins, and potential soft tissue involvement.

name: Malrotation
definition: Abnormal rotation or positioning of an organ during embryonic development, typically affecting the intestinal tract. Radiologically detected through abnormal anatomical positioning and potential associated complications.

name: Malrotation and Midgut Volvulus
definition: A severe congenital intestinal malformation where the bowel twists around its mesenteric axis, potentially causing obstruction. Radiographically characterized by abnormal bowel positioning and potential signs of intestinal compromise.

name: Mammography
definition: Specialized X-ray imaging technique focused on examining breast tissue to detect, diagnose, and monitor breast-related pathologies, particularly breast cancer.

name: Mammography (Film-Screen, Digital, DBT)
definition: Breast imaging technique utilizing different technological approaches including traditional film-screen, digital, and digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT) to provide comprehensive breast visualization.

name: Mammography, AB-MRI
definition: Advanced breast imaging technique combining anatomical MRI with specialized protocols to enhance breast cancer detection and characterization.

name: Mammography, Ultrasound
definition: Mammography is a specialized medical imaging technique using low-dose X-rays to examine breast tissue for early detection of breast cancer. It provides detailed images of breast structures to identify potential abnormalities.

name: Mammography, Ultrasound, MRI
definition: Ultrasound is a non-invasive imaging technique using high-frequency sound waves to create real-time images of internal body structures. MRI uses strong magnetic fields and radio waves to generate detailed cross-sectional images of body tissues.

name: Mammography/MRI
definition: Mammography and MRI are complementary breast imaging techniques used for comprehensive breast examination and cancer screening. MRI provides additional detailed soft tissue visualization compared to standard mammography.

name: Mammography/US
definition: Mammography and ultrasound are combined breast imaging techniques that provide comprehensive evaluation of breast tissue. Ultrasound can help characterize mammographic findings and assess breast abnormalities.

name: Mammography/US/MRI
definition: Mammography, ultrasound, and MRI represent a comprehensive multi-modal approach to breast imaging. These techniques provide complementary information for detailed breast tissue evaluation and potential abnormality detection.

name: Manganese exposure
definition: Pathological changes resulting from excessive manganese exposure, potentially affecting neurological and pulmonary systems. Radiologically may present with specific signal changes in brain imaging.

name: Manometry
definition: Manometry is a diagnostic technique measuring pressure within body cavities or organs using specialized pressure-sensing equipment. In radiology, it helps assess functional characteristics of various physiological systems.

name: Maple syrup urine disease
definition: A rare inherited metabolic disorder affecting amino acid metabolism, characterized by distinctive neurological and metabolic complications. Radiologically may show brain imaging changes indicating neurological involvement.

name: MARS (Metal Artifact Reduction Sequence)
definition: MARS is an advanced MRI sequence designed to reduce metal artifacts and improve image quality around metallic implants or foreign bodies. It helps minimize signal distortion and provides clearer visualization of surrounding tissues.

name: Masses
definition: Abnormal growths or lesions detected in various body tissues, potentially representing tumors, cysts, or other pathological entities. Radiologically characterized by distinct spatial and density characteristics.

name: Massive Hemoptysis
definition: Significant and potentially life-threatening bleeding into the respiratory tract, characterized by large volume hemoptysis. Radiologically identified through chest imaging showing extensive pulmonary hemorrhage.

name: Massive rotator cuff tear
definition: Complete or near-complete disruption of rotator cuff tendons, typically involving multiple muscle groups. Radiologically characterized by tendon discontinuity and potential muscle atrophy.

name: Mastalgia (Breast Pain)
definition: Breast pain or discomfort without specific underlying pathological cause. Radiologically may require additional imaging to rule out potential structural abnormalities.

name: Mastitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of breast tissue, typically infectious in origin. Radiologically characterized by tissue edema, potential abscess formation, and inflammatory changes.

name: Mastoiditis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the mastoid air cells in the temporal bone, typically resulting from middle ear infection. Radiologically identified through CT imaging showing bone destruction and inflammatory changes.

name: Mature Cystic Teratoma (Dermoid)
definition: A benign ovarian tumor composed of multiple tissue types, typically containing hair, teeth, and skin elements. Radiologically characterized by complex cystic mass with characteristic calcifications and heterogeneous components.

name: May-Thurner Syndrome
definition: Venous compression syndrome where the left iliac vein is compressed by the right iliac artery, potentially causing deep vein thrombosis. Radiologically identified through specific venous imaging and anatomical variations.

name: MCL sprain
definition: Injury to the Medial Collateral Ligament (MCL) of the knee, typically caused by lateral stress or trauma. Radiological assessment involves evaluating ligament integrity and potential associated soft tissue damage.

name: Mechanical bioeffects (Cavitation)
definition: Ultrasound-induced physical phenomenon involving rapid formation and collapse of microscopic bubbles in tissue, potentially causing localized mechanical stress and tissue disruption.

name: Mechanical gastric outlet obstruction
definition: Obstruction of the gastric outlet caused by physical blockage or mechanical impediment, which can be visualized through radiographic imaging techniques like CT or fluoroscopy.

name: Mechanical loosening
definition: Progressive separation or displacement of a prosthetic implant from its original position, detectable through radiographic imaging showing progressive gap or misalignment.

name: Meckel's Diverticulum
definition: Congenital gastrointestinal outpouching in the small intestine, typically located in the ileum. Radiological evaluation can reveal potential complications like inflammation or bleeding.

name: Meckel's Diverticulum (MD)
definition: Congenital gastrointestinal outpouching in the small intestine, typically located in the ileum. Radiological evaluation can reveal potential complications like inflammation or bleeding.

name: Meckel Diverticulum
definition: Congenital gastrointestinal outpouching in the small intestine, typically located in the ileum. Radiological evaluation can reveal potential complications like inflammation or bleeding.

name: Meconium Aspiration Syndrome (MAS)
definition: Respiratory condition in newborns characterized by lung inflammation and respiratory distress due to meconium aspiration, detectable through chest radiographs showing characteristic infiltrates.

name: Meconium ileus
definition: Intestinal obstruction in newborns caused by thick, sticky meconium blocking the ileum, typically associated with cystic fibrosis and identifiable through radiographic imaging.

name: Meconium ileus/Ileal atresia
definition: Severe intestinal obstruction in newborns caused by meconium blockage or congenital intestinal atresia, detectable through various radiographic techniques.

name: Medial Collateral Ligament (MCL) Injury
definition: Injury or tear of the Medial Collateral Ligament in the knee, typically assessed through MRI or ultrasound to evaluate ligament integrity and grade of injury.

name: Medial epicondylitis
definition: Inflammatory condition causing pain at the medial epicondyle of the humerus, often visible through radiographic assessment of soft tissue changes and potential calcifications.

name: Medial Epicondylitis (Golfer's Elbow)
definition: Inflammatory condition causing pain at the medial epicondyle of the humerus, often visible through radiographic assessment of soft tissue changes and potential calcifications.

name: Medial Meniscus Tear
definition: Tear or damage to the medial meniscus in the knee joint, typically evaluated through MRI to assess extent and characteristics of the meniscal injury.

name: Median Nerve Entrapment (Elbow)
definition: Compression or entrapment of the median nerve at the elbow, potentially visible through advanced imaging techniques like MRI or ultrasound showing nerve compression.

name: Mediastinal mass
definition: An abnormal growth or mass located in the mediastinum, the central compartment of the thoracic cavity. Radiological imaging helps characterize the mass's size, location, and potential malignancy.

name: Medication-induced delayed emptying (e.g., opioids, anticholinergics)
definition: A condition where medications slow or impair gastric emptying, resulting in delayed transit of food through the digestive system. Radiological studies can help visualize and assess the extent of delayed gastric emptying.

name: Medication-induced xerostomia
definition: A medication-induced condition characterized by extreme dryness of the mouth due to reduced saliva production. Radiological techniques can help assess salivary gland function and structural changes.

name: Medullary Carcinoma of the Cervix
definition: A rare type of cervical cancer originating in the medullary region of the cervix. Radiological imaging is crucial for diagnosis, staging, and treatment planning.

name: Medullary cystic kidney disease
definition: A genetic kidney disorder characterized by cyst formation in the medullary region of the kidney. Radiological imaging helps identify and monitor cystic changes and kidney structure.

name: Medullary Sponge Kidney (MSK) / Cacchi-Ricci Disease
definition: A congenital kidney disorder characterized by dilated and cystic collecting tubules in the medullary region. Radiological techniques like CT and ultrasound are essential for diagnosis and characterization.

name: Medullary Thyroid Cancer (MTC)
definition: A rare type of thyroid cancer originating in the medullary cells of the thyroid gland. Radiological imaging plays a critical role in diagnosis, staging, and monitoring treatment response.

name: Medullary Thyroid Carcinoma
definition: A rare type of thyroid cancer originating in the medullary cells of the thyroid gland. Radiological imaging plays a critical role in diagnosis, staging, and monitoring treatment response.

name: Medulloblastoma
definition: A highly malignant brain tumor typically occurring in the cerebellum, most common in children. Radiological imaging is crucial for diagnosis, staging, and treatment planning.

name: Mega-Cava
definition: An abnormal dilation or enlargement of the inferior vena cava. Radiological imaging helps assess the extent and potential underlying causes of the vascular abnormality.

name: Mega Cisterna Magna
definition: A congenital variation characterized by an enlarged or prominent cisterna magna in the posterior cranial fossa. Radiological imaging helps evaluate potential neurological implications.

name: Megacalyces
definition: An anatomical variation characterized by abnormally enlarged kidney calyces. Radiological techniques help identify and characterize the structural kidney changes.

name: Megalencephaly
definition: A neurological condition characterized by abnormally large brain size. Radiological imaging is essential for measuring brain volume and identifying associated structural changes.

name: Megalencephaly (MEG)
definition: A neurological condition characterized by abnormally large brain size. Radiological imaging is essential for measuring brain volume and identifying associated structural changes.

name: Megalencephaly with Leukoencephalopathy with subcortical Cysts (MLC) / Van der Knaap disease
definition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by megalencephaly and progressive leukoencephalopathy with subcortical cysts. Radiological imaging is crucial for tracking disease progression and brain changes.

name: Megaureter
definition: Abnormal dilation of the ureter, often detected on imaging studies like CT or ultrasound. Characterized by increased ureter diameter and potential urinary tract obstruction.

name: Melanoma
definition: Aggressive malignant skin cancer originating from melanocytes, typically appearing as irregular pigmented lesions on imaging studies. Radiological assessment helps evaluate tumor size, spread, and metastases.

name: Melanoma with Nodal Metastases
definition: Advanced stage of melanoma with spread to regional lymph nodes, detectable through CT, PET, or MRI scans. Imaging helps assess extent of nodal involvement and potential distant metastases.

name: Membranous nephropathy
definition: Kidney disorder characterized by thickening of glomerular basement membrane, typically identified through renal imaging techniques like ultrasound or CT. Often associated with proteinuria and potential kidney dysfunction.

name: Menetrier's Disease
definition: Rare hyperplastic gastropathy characterized by massive gastric mucosal hypertrophy, detectable through endoscopic and radiological imaging. Typically shows enlarged gastric folds and potential protein-losing enteropathy.

name: Meningioma
definition: Typically benign brain tumor arising from meninges, often slow-growing and detected through CT or MRI scans. Characterized by distinct imaging features and potential mass effect on surrounding brain structures.

name: Meningitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of brain and spinal cord meninges, identifiable through neuroimaging techniques like MRI or CT. Typically shows characteristic enhancement and potential complications.

name: Meningocele
definition: Congenital neural tube defect where meninges protrude through a spinal column opening, visible on radiological imaging. Typically observed in pediatric neuroimaging studies.

name: Meniscal degeneration
definition: Progressive degenerative changes in knee meniscus, detectable through MRI scans. Characterized by signal intensity changes, structural alterations, and potential cartilage breakdown.

name: Meniscal tear
definition: Partial or complete disruption of meniscal tissue in the knee, typically identified through MRI imaging. Shows characteristic signal abnormalities and potential displacement of meniscal fragments.

name: Meniscal Tear (mimicked by artifact)
definition: Potential false-positive meniscal tear appearance caused by imaging artifacts, requiring careful radiological interpretation to distinguish from actual meniscal pathology.

name: Mesenteric adenitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of mesenteric lymph nodes, typically identified through abdominal CT or ultrasound. Often associated with viral infections or inflammatory processes.

name: Mesenteric Avulsion
definition: Traumatic separation of mesentery from intestinal wall, detectable through abdominal imaging techniques. Indicates potential severe abdominal trauma with vascular and intestinal complications.

name: Mesenteric Ischemia
definition: Compromised blood flow to the mesenteric circulation, identified through CT angiography or vascular imaging. Characterized by reduced intestinal perfusion and potential tissue necrosis.

name: Mesenteric Panniculitis
definition: Rare inflammatory condition of mesenteric fat, typically detected through CT or MRI scans. Characterized by inflammatory changes and potential fibrotic transformation of mesenteric adipose tissue.

name: Mesial Temporal Sclerosis (MTS) / Hippocampal Sclerosis
definition: A chronic hippocampal pathology characterized by neuronal loss, gliosis, and hippocampal atrophy, commonly associated with temporal lobe epilepsy. On MRI, it presents as hippocampal volume loss and increased T2/FLAIR signal intensity.

name: Mesoblastic nephroma
definition: A rare renal tumor of infancy characterized by cellular proliferation of mesenchymal cells, typically appearing as a solid mass on imaging studies with variable echogenicity and contrast enhancement.

name: Metabolic Bone Disease
definition: A group of conditions causing abnormal bone mineral density and structural changes, typically characterized by decreased bone mass and altered bone microarchitecture visible on radiographic imaging.

name: Metabolic disorders
definition: A broad category of genetic and acquired conditions affecting metabolic processes, often presenting with systemic radiographic findings involving multiple organ systems.

name: Metachromatic Leukodystrophy (MLD)
definition: A rare inherited lysosomal storage disorder causing progressive white matter degeneration, characterized by demyelination and signal abnormalities on neuroimaging.

name: Metal Artifact
definition: Imaging artifacts caused by metallic objects that create signal distortion, beam hardening, and local signal loss on radiographic studies.

name: Metal Artifacts
definition: Imaging artifacts caused by metallic objects that create signal distortion, beam hardening, and local signal loss on radiographic studies.

name: Metallic foreign bodies (ocular shrapnel)
definition: Foreign metallic objects within the eye that can be detected and characterized through various imaging modalities, potentially causing local tissue damage.

name: Metaphyseal chondrodysplasia
definition: A group of genetic disorders affecting bone growth and development, characterized by metaphyseal abnormalities visible on radiographic imaging.

name: Metastases
definition: Secondary tumors that spread from a primary cancer site to other organs, typically appearing as distinct lesions with characteristic imaging features.

name: Metastases (Melanoma, Lung, Breast)
definition: Secondary tumors from melanoma, lung, or breast cancers that spread to various organs, characterized by distinct radiographic lesions with specific imaging patterns.

name: Metastases to Liver, Lungs, and Bone
definition: Secondary tumors that spread to liver, lungs, and bone, presenting as distinct lesions with characteristic radiographic appearances in multiple organ systems.

name: Metastasis
definition: Secondary tumor that spreads from a primary cancer site to another location, typically appearing as a distinct lesion on imaging studies.

name: Metastasis (Liver)
definition: Secondary tumor that spreads to the liver, typically appearing as distinct hypodense or heterogeneous lesions on CT or MRI studies.

name: Metastasis to adrenal gland
definition: Secondary tumor that spreads to the adrenal gland, often appearing as a distinct mass or nodule on imaging studies.

name: Metastasis to the gallbladder
definition: Spread of cancerous cells from another organ to the gallbladder, typically detected through imaging studies like CT or MRI. Represents an advanced stage of malignancy with potential visualization of secondary tumor deposits.

name: Metastatic Bladder Cancer
definition: Spread of bladder cancer cells to distant organs or lymph nodes, characterized by secondary tumor formations visible on radiological imaging techniques. Indicates advanced stage of bladder malignancy.

name: Metastatic Calcification
definition: Abnormal calcium deposition in soft tissues due to metabolic disturbances, often seen as calcific changes in radiographic studies. Typically associated with systemic diseases or metabolic disorders.

name: Metastatic Disease
definition: Spread of cancer from its primary site to other body regions, detectable through various imaging modalities like CT, MRI, and PET scans. Represents advanced stage of malignancy with multiple organ involvement.

name: Metastatic Disease (Axillary Lymph Node)
definition: Cancerous spread to axillary lymph nodes, commonly observed in breast cancer staging and radiological assessment. Typically evaluated through imaging techniques to determine extent of lymph node involvement.

name: Metastatic Disease (Breast, Lung, Prostate)
definition: Spread of cancer from breast, lung, or prostate to other body regions, characterized by secondary tumor formations visible on radiological imaging. Indicates advanced stage of malignancy with multiple organ involvement.

name: Metastatic Disease (e.g., breast, prostate, lung cancer)
definition: Spread of cancer from primary sites like breast, prostate, or lung to other body regions, detectable through various imaging modalities. Represents advanced stage of malignancy with multiple organ involvement.

name: Metastatic disease (Prostate, Breast)
definition: Spread of cancer from prostate or breast to other body regions, characterized by secondary tumor formations visible on radiological imaging. Indicates advanced stage of malignancy.

name: Metastatic fracture
definition: Bone fracture occurring at a site weakened by metastatic cancer, typically visible on radiographic studies as a pathological fracture with underlying bone destruction.

name: Metastatic Liver Disease
definition: Spread of cancer to the liver, characterized by multiple secondary tumor deposits visible on imaging studies like CT or MRI. Represents advanced stage of malignancy with hepatic involvement.

name: Metastatic Liver Tumors (e.g., from colorectal cancer)
definition: Secondary liver tumors originating from colorectal cancer, typically appearing as multiple distinct lesions on radiological imaging. Represents metastatic spread to the liver.

name: Metastatic node (SCC)
definition: Lymph node involvement by squamous cell carcinoma, characterized by enlarged or abnormal lymph nodes visible on imaging studies. Indicates potential cancer spread.

name: Metastatic prostate cancer/Paget
definition: Advanced prostate cancer with spread to other body regions, characterized by secondary tumor formations visible on radiological imaging. Often associated with Paget's disease manifestations.

name: Metastatic Testicular Cancer
definition: Spread of testicular cancer to distant organs or lymph nodes, detectable through various imaging modalities. Represents advanced stage of testicular malignancy.

name: MG
definition: MG (Mammography) is a specialized radiographic technique for breast imaging, using low-dose X-rays to detect potential breast abnormalities and screen for breast cancer.

name: MIBG Scintigraphy
definition: MIBG Scintigraphy is a nuclear medicine imaging technique using radioactive metaiodobenzylguanidine to evaluate neuroendocrine tumors and assess sympathetic nervous system function.

name: MIBG SPECT/CT
definition: MIBG SPECT/CT combines nuclear medicine MIBG imaging with computed tomography for precise localization and anatomical correlation of neuroendocrine tumors.

name: Microcalcifications
definition: Small calcium deposits within breast tissue, typically detected on mammography and used as potential indicators of early-stage breast pathology or cancer.

name: Microcephaly
definition: Congenital condition characterized by an abnormally small head circumference, typically detected on neuroimaging studies. Radiological findings often include reduced brain volume and abnormal cortical development.

name: Microcephaly with Simplified Gyral Pattern (MSG)
definition: Rare neurological disorder with simplified brain gyral pattern visible on MRI or CT scans. Characterized by reduced cortical complexity and abnormal neuronal migration.

name: Micrognathia
definition: Congenital condition featuring an abnormally small lower jaw, typically identified through craniofacial radiographic imaging. Often associated with airway and dental developmental abnormalities.

name: Microlissencephaly
definition: Severe neurological disorder characterized by extremely small brain size and simplified cortical architecture, detectable through neuroimaging techniques like MRI.

name: Microvascular dysfunction
definition: Radiological finding of impaired small blood vessel function, often detected through advanced imaging techniques like perfusion studies or contrast-enhanced imaging.

name: Midgut malrotation
definition: Congenital intestinal developmental anomaly where the midgut fails to rotate normally, visible on abdominal imaging studies. Can lead to potential intestinal complications.

name: Midgut Volvulus
definition: Serious intestinal condition where the midgut twists on its mesenteric axis, causing potential obstruction, detectable through radiographic imaging techniques.

name: Migraine
definition: Neurological disorder characterized by recurrent headaches, with potential neuroimaging findings of vascular changes or cortical alterations during acute episodes.

name: Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI)
definition: Cognitive decline stage detectable through neuroimaging techniques, representing a transitional state between normal aging and dementia. Often identified through structural brain changes.

name: Milk-of-calcium
definition: Radiological finding of calcified material with a milk-like appearance, typically seen in soft tissues or cystic structures during imaging studies.

name: Mirizzi syndrome
definition: Biliary tract condition characterized by gallbladder neck compression, detectable through advanced imaging techniques like CT or ultrasound.

name: Mitral Stenosis
definition: Cardiac valvular disorder characterized by narrowing of the mitral valve, identifiable through echocardiography and cardiac imaging techniques.

name: Molar pregnancy
definition: Abnormal pregnancy condition featuring placental changes, detectable through ultrasound imaging with characteristic grape-like vesicular appearance.

name: Monckeberg Sclerosis
definition: Arterial calcification disorder characterized by medial arterial calcification, visible on radiographic imaging as vessel wall calcifications.

name: Mondor's Disease
definition: Rare condition involving thrombophlebitis of superficial veins, typically detectable through ultrasound or venographic imaging techniques.

name: Morbid Obesity
definition: A severe form of obesity characterized by body mass index (BMI) over 40 kg/m, which can significantly impact medical imaging by reducing image quality and patient positioning challenges. Radiological evaluations often require specialized equipment and techniques.

name: Motion Artifact
definition: Blurring or distortion in medical imaging caused by patient movement during scanning, which can degrade image quality and create false appearances of anatomical structures. Occurs commonly in MRI and CT scans.

name: Motion Artifacts
definition: Blurring or distortion in medical imaging caused by patient movement during scanning, which can degrade image quality and create false appearances of anatomical structures. Occurs commonly in MRI and CT scans.

name: Moyamoya Disease
definition: A rare, progressive cerebrovascular disorder characterized by bilateral stenosis or occlusion of internal carotid arteries, resulting in distinctive 'smoke-like' collateral blood vessel formations visible on angiographic imaging.

name: Moyamoya Syndrome
definition: A rare cerebrovascular condition with progressive narrowing of internal carotid arteries, causing characteristic collateral vessel development visible on imaging. Often associated with underlying conditions like genetic disorders or autoimmune diseases.

name: MPNST
definition: Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor, a rare soft tissue sarcoma arising from peripheral nerves or showing nerve sheath differentiation. Radiologically characterized by complex, heterogeneous masses with potential infiltrative features.

name: MR Angiography
definition: MR Angiography is a non-invasive magnetic resonance imaging technique specifically designed to visualize blood vessels and assess vascular structures without using ionizing radiation.

name: MR Arthro
definition: MR Arthrography is an advanced MRI technique involving joint injection of contrast material to enhance visualization of internal joint structures and detect subtle soft tissue abnormalities.

name: MR Arthrography
definition: MR Arthrography is an advanced MRI technique involving joint injection of contrast material to enhance visualization of internal joint structures and detect subtle soft tissue abnormalities.

name: MRA
definition: MRA (Magnetic Resonance Angiography) is a specialized MRI technique for detailed visualization of blood vessels, providing comprehensive vascular imaging without radiation exposure.

name: MRCP
definition: MRCP (Magnetic Resonance Cholangiopancreatography) is a non-invasive MRI technique specifically designed to image the biliary and pancreatic ductal systems with high resolution.

name: MRI
definition: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) uses strong magnetic fields and radio waves to generate detailed cross-sectional images of body structures. It provides excellent soft tissue contrast without ionizing radiation.

name: MRI (DWI)
definition: Diffusion-Weighted Imaging (DWI) is an MRI technique that measures the random Brownian motion of water molecules in biological tissues. It helps detect cellular density changes and is particularly useful in identifying acute stroke and tumor characterization.

name: MRI (for rectal cancer staging), CT (for colon cancer staging and distant mets)
definition: Advanced cross-sectional imaging techniques used for comprehensive cancer staging, providing detailed anatomical and functional information about tumor extent, lymph node involvement, and potential metastases.

name: MRI (indirect assessment via SAR)
definition: Specialized MRI technique using Specific Absorption Rate (SAR) measurements to indirectly assess tissue characteristics and potential thermal effects during imaging.

name: MRI (indirect assessment)
definition: MRI technique that uses indirect or secondary imaging parameters to infer tissue characteristics without direct visualization.

name: MRI (screening), Catheter Angiography (DSA - diagnosis)
definition: Advanced vascular imaging techniques combining screening MRI with definitive catheter-based digital subtraction angiography for comprehensive vascular evaluation.

name: MRI Abdomen
definition: Comprehensive abdominal MRI examination providing detailed cross-sectional imaging of abdominal organs, structures, and potential pathologies.

name: MRI Clues for Diverticulitis
definition: Radiographic indicators of diverticulitis on MRI include bowel wall thickening, pericolonic fat stranding, inflammatory changes, and potential abscess formation. These findings help differentiate acute from chronic inflammatory processes.

name: MRI with MRV
definition: MRI technique combined with Magnetic Resonance Venography to visualize venous structures and blood flow characteristics.

name: MRI/CT
definition: Combined cross-sectional imaging modalities using both Magnetic Resonance Imaging and Computed Tomography for comprehensive diagnostic evaluation.

name: MRI/MRCP
definition: Magnetic Resonance Cholangiopancreatography (MRCP) is a non-invasive MRI technique specifically designed to visualize biliary and pancreatic ductal systems.

name: MRS
definition: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (MRS) is an advanced imaging technique that provides biochemical information about tissue composition beyond standard anatomical imaging.

name: MRV
definition: Magnetic Resonance Venography (MRV) is a specialized imaging technique focused on visualizing venous structures and blood flow without invasive contrast injection.

name: MSK tumor
definition: Musculoskeletal tumor affecting bones, soft tissues, or connective tissue structures. Radiological evaluation typically involves multiple imaging modalities to characterize tumor location, size, and potential malignancy.

name: Mucinous Cystadenoma
definition: A benign cystic tumor typically found in ovaries, characterized by mucin-producing epithelial cells. Radiologically appears as a complex, multilocular cystic mass with potential solid components.

name: Mucinous cystic neoplasm
definition: A type of pancreatic cystic neoplasm characterized by mucin-producing cells, typically occurring in the pancreatic body or tail. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, mucin-containing cystic lesion.

name: Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm (MCN)
definition: A type of pancreatic cystic neoplasm characterized by mucin-producing cells, typically occurring in the pancreatic body or tail. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, mucin-containing cystic lesion.

name: Mucinous Lesions
definition: Radiological findings of fluid-filled or mucin-containing lesions across various anatomical locations, characterized by specific imaging features such as complex cystic structures or mucin-rich appearances.

name: Mucoepidermoid carcinoma
definition: A malignant salivary gland tumor composed of mucus-producing and epidermoid cells. Radiologically presents as a complex mass with variable signal characteristics on different imaging modalities.

name: Mucormycosis
definition: A rare, aggressive fungal infection caused by Mucorales fungi, often affecting immunocompromised patients. Radiologically characterized by invasive soft tissue changes, potential bone destruction, and sinus involvement.

name: Mucosal Disruption
definition: Radiographic evidence of breach or discontinuity in mucosal surfaces, typically observed in gastrointestinal or respiratory tract imaging. Indicates potential inflammatory, traumatic, or neoplastic processes.

name: Mucus plug
definition: A thick, viscous secretion that can obstruct airways or passages, visible on imaging as a dense, opaque material blocking bronchial or other tubular structures. Radiologically significant in respiratory and pulmonary evaluations.

name: Multi-Organ Failure
definition: A severe systemic condition where multiple organ systems progressively fail, characterized by widespread organ dysfunction detectable through various imaging modalities. Radiographic findings often include diffuse organ changes and potential complications.

name: Multicystic dysplastic kidney
definition: A congenital kidney disorder characterized by multiple non-communicating cysts replacing normal renal parenchyma, typically appearing as a cluster of fluid-filled spaces on ultrasound or CT imaging.

name: Multicystic Dysplastic Kidney (MCDK)
definition: A congenital kidney disorder characterized by multiple non-communicating cysts replacing normal renal parenchyma, typically appearing as a cluster of fluid-filled spaces on ultrasound or CT imaging.

name: Multiphasic Liver CT
definition: Advanced CT imaging of the liver using multiple contrast phases to comprehensively evaluate hepatic lesions, vascularity, and potential pathologies.

name: Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia type 1 (MEN1)
definition: A rare genetic syndrome causing tumors in multiple endocrine glands, detectable through various radiological techniques like CT, MRI, and nuclear medicine scans.

name: Multiple Myeloma
definition: A plasma cell malignancy characterized by bone lesions and marrow infiltration, typically appearing as multiple destructive bone lesions on radiographic imaging.

name: Multiple renal cysts
definition: A radiographic finding of multiple fluid-filled sacs within the kidney, typically detected on ultrasound or CT. Can be associated with inherited conditions like polycystic kidney disease.

name: Multiple Sclerosis
definition: A demyelinating neurological disease characterized by brain and spinal cord lesions visible on MRI as distinctive white matter plaques or hyperintense regions.

name: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
definition: A demyelinating neurological disease characterized by brain and spinal cord lesions visible on MRI as distinctive white matter plaques or hyperintense regions.

name: Multiple Sclerosis (MS) Plaques
definition: Characteristic white matter brain lesions in multiple sclerosis, appearing as hyperintense regions on T2-weighted MRI sequences, representing areas of demyelination and inflammation.

name: Multiple System Atrophy
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting multiple brain systems, characterized by distinctive neuroimaging findings involving basal ganglia and brainstem changes.

name: Multiple System Atrophy (MSA)
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting multiple brain systems, characterized by distinctive neuroimaging findings involving basal ganglia and brainstem changes.

name: Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer
definition: A bladder cancer that has invaded the muscle layer, detectable through various imaging techniques like CT, MRI, and ultrasound showing wall thickening and potential extravesical spread.

name: Muscle Abscess
definition: A localized collection of infectious material within muscle tissue, appearing as a fluid-filled or complex mass on ultrasound, CT, or MRI with characteristic inflammatory changes.

name: Muscle Contusion
definition: A soft tissue injury causing bleeding within muscle fibers, visible on imaging as soft tissue swelling, edema, and potential hemorrhage on ultrasound or MRI.

name: Muscle Rupture
definition: A complete or partial tear of muscle fibers, radiologically characterized by discontinuity of muscle tissue, edema, and potential hematoma formation on imaging studies.

name: Muscle strain
definition: A soft tissue injury involving stretching or tearing of muscle fibers. In radiology, muscle strains are typically evaluated using ultrasound or MRI to assess the extent of muscle damage and identify specific areas of injury.

name: Musculoskeletal US
definition: Ultrasound imaging focused on evaluating musculoskeletal structures, including muscles, tendons, ligaments, and joints.

name: Mycotic Aneurysm
definition: An abnormal blood vessel dilation caused by fungal infection, typically seen as a localized outpouching or saccular enlargement of an artery. Radiology helps identify these potentially life-threatening vascular lesions through CT and MR angiography.

name: Myelocele
definition: A congenital neural tube defect where spinal cord tissue protrudes through a vertebral defect. Radiological imaging like MRI is crucial for evaluating the extent of neural tissue herniation and associated spinal abnormalities.

name: Myelolipoma
definition: A rare benign tumor composed of mature adipose tissue and hematopoietic elements, most commonly found in the adrenal gland. CT and MRI are primary imaging modalities for detecting and characterizing myelolipomas.

name: Myeloma
definition: A malignant plasma cell disorder characterized by abnormal proliferation of plasma cells in bone marrow. Radiological techniques like PET/CT and MRI are essential for staging and monitoring myeloma progression.

name: Myelomeningocele
definition: A severe neural tube defect involving protrusion of spinal cord, meninges, and neural elements through a vertebral defect. Radiological imaging is critical for assessing the anatomical extent and potential complications.

name: Myeloproliferative Disorders
definition: A group of bone marrow disorders characterized by abnormal proliferation of blood cell precursors. Radiological techniques help evaluate bone marrow changes, organ involvement, and disease progression.

name: Myocardial Bridging
definition: A congenital cardiac anomaly where a segment of coronary artery tunnels through the myocardium, potentially causing transient myocardial ischemia. Cardiac CT and MRI are used to visualize and characterize myocardial bridging.

name: Myocardial Fibrosis
definition: Replacement of functional heart muscle with fibrous scar tissue, typically detected through cardiac MRI with late gadolinium enhancement. Imaging helps assess the extent and location of myocardial fibrosis.

name: Myocardial infarction
definition: A region of heart muscle death due to prolonged lack of blood supply, typically identified through various imaging techniques like CT, MRI, and nuclear medicine studies showing perfusion defects.

name: Myocardial infarction without ischemia
definition: A cardiac condition where myocardial damage occurs without apparent coronary ischemia, often detected through advanced cardiac imaging techniques that reveal tissue changes.

name: Myocardial Ischemia
definition: Reduced blood flow to heart muscle resulting in potential tissue damage, typically evaluated through perfusion imaging, stress tests, and cardiac CT/MRI to assess coronary circulation.

name: Myocardial Necrosis
definition: Irreversible death of heart muscle tissue, characterized by cellular destruction and inflammatory response. Radiological techniques help identify and quantify the extent of myocardial necrosis.

name: Myocardial Perfusion Defect
definition: An area of reduced or absent blood flow in heart muscle, typically identified through nuclear medicine imaging techniques like SPECT or PET.

name: Myocardial Perfusion Imaging
definition: A diagnostic technique using radioactive tracers to evaluate blood flow and function of heart muscle, typically performed with nuclear medicine technologies like SPECT or PET.

name: Myocardial scar
definition: An area of scarred cardiac muscle tissue typically appearing as a region of altered signal intensity or reduced contractility on cardiac imaging. Myocardial scars represent permanent tissue damage from prior myocardial infarction or other cardiac injuries.

name: Myocardial Viability
definition: The assessment of cardiac muscle tissue's metabolic activity and potential for functional recovery using imaging techniques. Determines whether a specific region of heart muscle can potentially regain contractile function after injury.

name: Myocarditis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the heart muscle characterized by imaging findings of myocardial edema, potential wall motion abnormalities, and increased signal intensity on specific MRI sequences.

name: Myositis
definition: Inflammatory condition of skeletal muscle tissues presenting with muscle swelling, increased signal intensity on MRI, and potential muscle edema or fatty infiltration.

name: Myositis Ossificans
definition: A rare condition where soft tissue progressively transforms into bone, typically appearing as heterotopic ossification within muscle tissues on radiographic imaging.

name: Myositis Ossificans (MO)
definition: A rare condition where soft tissue progressively transforms into bone, typically appearing as heterotopic ossification within muscle tissues on radiographic imaging.

name: Myxofibrosarcoma
definition: A rare, aggressive soft tissue sarcoma characterized by complex imaging features including infiltrative margins and mixed signal intensities on MRI.

name: Myxoid Liposarcoma
definition: A rare soft tissue sarcoma with distinctive imaging characteristics of fat-containing tumor with myxoid components, typically showing specific signal patterns on MRI.

name: N/A
definition: Not applicable or no specific imaging modality defined.

name: NAFLD/NASH
definition: Spectrum of liver fat accumulation disorders characterized by radiographic evidence of hepatic steatosis, ranging from simple fatty liver to inflammatory liver disease.

name: Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma (NPC)
definition: Malignant epithelial tumor originating in nasopharyngeal region, typically demonstrating specific contrast enhancement patterns and infiltrative characteristics on imaging studies.

name: Necrosis
definition: Localized cell death characterized by tissue breakdown and loss of cellular architecture, appearing as regions of signal intensity changes or structural alterations on imaging.

name: Necrotic Lymph Node
definition: Lymph node showing complete cellular destruction or breakdown, typically appearing as a non-enhancing or centrally hypodense structure on imaging studies.

name: Necrotic Metastasis
definition: Metastatic lesion exhibiting central tissue death or breakdown, often presenting with complex imaging features of peripheral enhancement and central non-enhancement.

name: Necrotic tumor
definition: Malignant tumor region showing central tissue death or breakdown, characterized by complex imaging features of peripheral enhancement and central non-enhancing areas.

name: Necrotizing Enterocolitis (NEC)
definition: Serious inflammatory bowel condition in newborns characterized by intestinal wall inflammation and potential tissue necrosis, demonstrating specific radiographic signs of bowel wall changes.

name: Necrotizing fasciitis
definition: A severe, rapidly progressing soft tissue infection characterized by widespread inflammation and necrosis of fascia and subcutaneous tissue. Radiological findings typically include gas in soft tissues, fascial thickening, and potential abscess formation.

name: Neonatal Adrenal Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within the adrenal glands of newborns, often detected through imaging studies. Radiographically appears as hemorrhagic masses or abnormal adrenal gland appearance on ultrasound or CT.

name: Neonatal hepatitis
definition: Inflammatory liver condition in newborns causing hepatic dysfunction, detectable through imaging techniques showing hepatomegaly, parenchymal changes, and potential structural abnormalities.

name: Neonatal Pneumonia
definition: Lung infection in newborns characterized by inflammatory changes in lung parenchyma. Radiographic findings include patchy infiltrates, consolidation, and potential air space opacities.

name: Neoplasm
definition: An abnormal tissue growth characterized by uncontrolled cell proliferation, detectable through various imaging modalities showing mass lesions, irregular margins, and potential metastatic spread.

name: Neoplasms
definition: Multiple abnormal tissue growths characterized by uncontrolled cell proliferation, detectable through various imaging modalities showing multiple mass lesions with irregular margins.

name: Nephrogenic Systemic Fibrosis (NSF)
definition: A rare condition associated with gadolinium-based contrast agent exposure in patients with kidney disease, characterized by progressive skin and systemic fibrosis. Radiological findings include soft tissue thickening and potential dermal changes.

name: Nephrolithiasis (Kidney Stones)
definition: Formation of mineral deposits within kidney, detectable through CT, X-ray, and ultrasound as dense calcific structures within the renal collecting system.

name: Nephrolithiasis (Renal Stones)
definition: Formation of mineral deposits within kidney, detectable through CT, X-ray, and ultrasound as dense calcific structures within the renal collecting system.

name: Nephrostomy Tube Placement
definition: Surgical procedure creating a percutaneous access route to the kidney for drainage or intervention, visualized radiographically to confirm proper tube placement and positioning.

name: Nephrotic syndrome
definition: Kidney disorder characterized by significant protein loss, detectable through imaging showing potential renal parenchymal changes, increased kidney size, and potential complications.

name: Nerve Entrapment Syndrome
definition: Condition involving compression or irritation of peripheral nerves, often detectable through MRI showing nerve swelling, compression, or structural abnormalities.

name: Nerve Root Edema
definition: Swelling of nerve root tissue, typically visualized on MRI as increased signal intensity and potential inflammation around nerve root structures.

name: Neuroblastoma
definition: Pediatric neural crest tumor typically originating in adrenal glands or sympathetic nervous system, characterized by distinct radiological features including calcifications and heterogeneous mass appearance.

name: Neurocutaneous Melanosis
definition: Rare congenital condition involving melanocytic proliferation in skin and central nervous system, detectable through MRI and dermatological imaging showing characteristic pigmented lesions.

name: Neurocysticercosis (NCC)
definition: Parasitic infection of the central nervous system caused by the larval stage of Taenia solium. Radiologically characterized by cystic lesions with varying stages of calcification and enhancement in brain parenchyma.

name: Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Cervix
definition: Rare malignant tumor of the cervix originating from neuroendocrine cells. Radiologically presents as a mass with potential metastatic spread and characteristic imaging features.

name: Neuroendocrine Tumor (NET)
definition: Tumors arising from neuroendocrine cells that can occur in various organs. Radiologically characterized by specific enhancement patterns and potential metastatic behavior.

name: Neuroendocrine tumors
definition: Tumors arising from neuroendocrine cells that can occur in various organs. Radiologically characterized by specific enhancement patterns and potential metastatic behavior.

name: Neuroendocrine Tumors (NETs)
definition: Tumors arising from neuroendocrine cells that can occur in various organs. Radiologically characterized by specific enhancement patterns and potential metastatic behavior.

name: Neuroferritinopathy
definition: Rare genetic disorder characterized by iron accumulation in the brain. Radiologically shows characteristic iron deposition and signal changes in basal ganglia.

name: Neurofibroma
definition: Benign tumor arising from nerve sheath cells. Radiologically appears as a soft tissue mass with characteristic imaging features and potential growth.

name: Neurofibromatosis Type 1 (NF1)
definition: Genetic disorder characterized by multiple benign and malignant tumors of nervous system. Radiologically shows multiple nerve sheath tumors, caf-au-lait spots, and characteristic bone changes.

name: Neurofibromatosis type 2 (NF2)
definition: Genetic disorder characterized by bilateral vestibular schwannomas and other nervous system tumors. Radiologically shows multiple intracranial and spinal tumors.

name: Neurogenic Bladder
definition: Bladder dysfunction caused by neurological conditions affecting nerve signals. Radiologically evaluated through urodynamic studies and imaging of underlying neurological pathology.

name: Neuromyelitis Optica
definition: Autoimmune disorder causing inflammation of optic nerves and spinal cord. Radiologically characterized by longitudinally extensive transverse myelitis and optic nerve inflammation.

name: Neuromyelitis Optica (NMO)
definition: Autoimmune disorder causing inflammation of optic nerves and spinal cord. Radiologically characterized by longitudinally extensive transverse myelitis and optic nerve inflammation.

name: Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)
definition: Broader spectrum of autoimmune disorder involving central nervous system inflammation. Radiologically shows characteristic MRI findings of optic nerve and spinal cord involvement.

name: Neuronal Migration Disorders (NMDs)
definition: Developmental brain disorders resulting from abnormal neuronal migration during fetal development. Radiologically characterized by cortical malformations and abnormal brain architecture.

name: Neurosarcoidosis
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting the nervous system as part of systemic sarcoidosis. Radiologically shows characteristic granulomatous lesions in brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

name: NM
definition: Nuclear Medicine (NM) is a medical imaging specialty that uses small amounts of radioactive tracers to diagnose and treat diseases. It allows visualization of physiological processes and metabolic activity within the body.

name: NM (Bone Scan), PET/CT, MRI
definition: A hybrid imaging technique combining Positron Emission Tomography (PET) with Computed Tomography (CT) that provides both functional metabolic information and detailed anatomical images. It is particularly useful for cancer staging, monitoring treatment response, and detecting metastases.

name: NM (Gamma Camera)
definition: A specialized nuclear medicine imaging device that detects gamma radiation emitted by radioactive tracers to create two-dimensional images of physiological processes within the body.

name: NM (GI Bleeding Scintigraphy)
definition: A nuclear medicine procedure used to detect and localize gastrointestinal bleeding by injecting radioactive tracers that can identify the source and location of bleeding in the digestive tract.

name: NM (In-111 WBC Scan)
definition: A nuclear medicine scan using indium-111 labeled white blood cells to detect and localize areas of infection or inflammation in the body.

name: NM (Scintigraphy)
definition: A nuclear medicine imaging technique that uses radioactive tracers to create images showing physiological processes and metabolic activity in various body systems.

name: NM (SPECT)
definition: Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT) is a nuclear medicine tomographic imaging technique that uses gamma rays to create three-dimensional images of metabolic processes in the body.

name: NM (SPECT/CT)
definition: A hybrid imaging technique combining Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT) with Computed Tomography (CT) to provide both functional and anatomical information in a single examination.

name: NM (Tc-99m Sestamibi SPECT/CT)
definition: A nuclear medicine SPECT/CT technique using Technetium-99m Sestamibi to evaluate cardiac perfusion, detect myocardial ischemia, and assess cardiac function.

name: Non-Accidental Trauma (NAT) / Child Abuse
definition: Physical injury intentionally inflicted on a child, often detectable through radiographic evidence of multiple fractures, healing stages, or specific injury patterns. Radiologists play a crucial role in identifying and documenting potential child abuse.

name: Non-Alcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH)
definition: Progressive liver disease characterized by fat accumulation, inflammation, and potential fibrosis, detectable through various imaging modalities like ultrasound, CT, and MRI. Radiographic findings include hepatic steatosis and potential parenchymal changes.

name: Non-aneurysmal SAH from other causes
definition: Subarachnoid hemorrhage occurring from non-aneurysmal causes, identifiable through CT or MRI scans showing blood in subarachnoid spaces without a specific aneurysmal source.

name: Non-contrast CT
definition: A CT scan performed without the administration of intravenous, oral, or rectal contrast material, typically used to evaluate bone, lung, and certain acute conditions.

name: Non-cyclic breast pain
definition: Breast pain not related to menstrual cycle, potentially evaluated through mammographic or ultrasound imaging to rule out underlying pathology.

name: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
definition: Malignant lymphoma originating from lymphoid tissues, characterized by various radiographic appearances in CT, PET, and MRI scans showing lymph node enlargement and potential extranodal involvement.

name: Non-Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer
definition: Early-stage bladder cancer confined to the mucosal or submucosal layers, detectable through various imaging techniques like CT urography and MRI.

name: Non-obstructive hydronephrosis
definition: Kidney swelling not caused by urinary tract obstruction, identifiable through ultrasound or CT imaging with characteristic renal dilation patterns.

name: Non-obstructive hydronephrosis (e.g., vesicoureteral reflux)
definition: Kidney swelling caused by vesicoureteral reflux, characterized by retrograde urine flow detectable through specialized radiographic studies like voiding cystourethrogram.

name: Non-Ossifying Fibroma (NOF)
definition: Benign bone tumor typically found in children, appearing as a well-defined lytic lesion in radiographic imaging with characteristic eccentric location.

name: Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor (NSGCT)
definition: Testicular malignancy composed of multiple cell types, detectable through ultrasound, CT, and MRI with potential metastatic spread.

name: Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumors
definition: Testicular malignancies derived from germ cells, showing varied radiographic appearances and potential metastatic patterns.

name: Non-Target Embolization
definition: Unintended embolization occurring during medical procedures, identifiable through angiographic and interventional radiology techniques.

name: Non-Thrombotic Budd-Chiari Syndrome
definition: Hepatic venous outflow obstruction not caused by thrombosis, detectable through various imaging modalities showing characteristic hepatic vascular changes.

name: Noncontrast CT
definition: A CT scan performed without the administration of intravenous, oral, or rectal contrast material, typically used to evaluate bone, lung, and certain acute conditions.

name: None (diagnosis is clinical/lab-based)
definition: Indicates that a specific condition or diagnosis is determined through clinical assessment, laboratory tests, or other non-imaging methods.

name: Nontraumatic GI perforation
definition: Gastrointestinal perforation occurring without direct traumatic injury, identifiable through CT and X-ray imaging showing free air or contrast extravasation.

name: Nonunion
definition: Bone fracture that fails to heal properly, detectable through radiographic imaging showing incomplete bone union and potential pseudarthrosis.

name: Normal Aging
definition: Expected structural and functional changes in tissues and organs that occur with advancing age, typically characterized by gradual tissue atrophy and reduced cellular regeneration. In radiology, aging changes are observed through progressive anatomical modifications visible on imaging studies.

name: Normal Bone Density
definition: Standard bone mineral density consistent with healthy skeletal structure and minimal risk of osteoporosis. Radiologically characterized by uniform bone trabecular pattern and appropriate calcium density on imaging studies.

name: Normal fetal ventricular size
definition: Ventricular dimensions within expected range for fetal developmental stage, indicating appropriate brain fluid compartment size during prenatal growth. Typically assessed through ultrasound or fetal MRI measurements.

name: Normal Implant
definition: Medical device or prosthetic positioned correctly within anatomical structures without evidence of displacement, infection, or structural compromise. Radiologically confirmed through appropriate imaging alignment and surrounding tissue response.

name: Normal liver
definition: Hepatic organ with standard size, texture, and parenchymal characteristics without focal lesions, vascular abnormalities, or structural irregularities. Typically demonstrated through uniform density and smooth contours on imaging studies.

name: Normal PICC line position
definition: Peripherally Inserted Central Catheter (PICC) positioned correctly within central venous system, typically terminating at cavoatrial junction. Radiographically confirmed through precise anatomical placement and alignment.

name: Normal pressure hydrocephalus
definition: Chronic neurological condition characterized by progressive ventricular enlargement without increased intracranial pressure. Radiologically identified through disproportionate ventricular dilation relative to brain parenchyma.

name: Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (NPH)
definition: Chronic neurological condition characterized by progressive ventricular enlargement without increased intracranial pressure. Radiologically identified through disproportionate ventricular dilation relative to brain parenchyma.

name: Normal sutures
