definition: Cranial fibrous joints between skull bones with standard anatomical configuration and appropriate interdigitation. Radiologically assessed for expected width, continuity, and absence of premature fusion.

name: Normal variant
definition: Anatomical or physiological finding that deviates from typical presentation but does not indicate pathology or require intervention. Represents benign structural difference observable through imaging.

name: Normal variant conus position
definition: Standard positioning of conus medullaris within spinal canal, typically terminating at L1-L2 vertebral levels. Radiologically confirmed through appropriate anatomical location and relationship to surrounding structures.

name: Normal variation
definition: Anatomical or physiological finding that deviates from typical presentation but does not indicate pathology or require intervention. Represents benign structural difference observable through imaging.

name: Northern exposure sign
definition: A radiographic sign in chest imaging where the lung apex appears abnormally prominent or elevated. Often associated with specific pathological conditions or lung abnormalities.

name: Nuclear
definition: Referring to medical imaging and treatment techniques that use radioactive materials to diagnose and treat diseases.

name: Nuclear Medicine (Gastric Emptying Study)
definition: A nuclear medicine procedure that measures gastric emptying rate by tracking the movement of a radioactive meal through the digestive system.

name: Nursemaid Elbow (Radial Head Subluxation)
definition: Partial displacement of radial head from annular ligament, commonly occurring in young children during sudden arm traction. Radiographically characterized by subtle joint space irregularities and potential soft tissue swelling.

name: Nutcracker esophagus
definition: Esophageal motility disorder characterized by high-amplitude, non-peristaltic contractions during swallowing. Radiologically observed through abnormal esophageal muscle movement patterns during contrast studies.

name: Nutcracker Syndrome
definition: Vascular compression syndrome where left renal vein is compressed between aorta and superior mesenteric artery, potentially causing clinical symptoms. Radiologically diagnosed through specific vascular anatomical relationships.

name: Obstruction
definition: A blockage or hindrance in a tubular structure that prevents normal passage of contents. In radiology, obstruction can be visualized through various imaging techniques to identify the location and cause of blockage.

name: Obstructive hydrocephalus
definition: A condition where cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) flow is blocked within the ventricular system, leading to increased intracranial pressure. Radiological imaging can help identify the specific location and cause of the obstruction.

name: Obstructive Hydrocephalus (Non-communicating)
definition: A type of hydrocephalus where CSF cannot flow between ventricles due to a physical blockage. Radiology helps visualize the exact site of obstruction within the ventricular system.

name: Obstructive hydrocephalus (non-shunt related)
definition: Hydrocephalus caused by a blockage in CSF flow that does not require surgical intervention. Radiological techniques can help determine the underlying cause and extent of the obstruction.

name: Obstructive hydrocephalus from other causes (tumor, cyst)
definition: Hydrocephalus resulting from space-occupying lesions like tumors or cysts that block normal CSF circulation. Imaging is crucial for identifying and characterizing these obstructive masses.

name: Obstructive Uropathy
definition: A condition where urinary tract obstruction leads to impaired kidney function and potential damage. Radiological imaging helps identify the location and nature of the urinary tract blockage.

name: Obturator Internus Syndrome
definition: A rare condition involving pain and dysfunction of the obturator internus muscle. Radiology can help assess muscle and surrounding tissue abnormalities.

name: Occult Fracture
definition: A fracture that is not immediately visible on initial radiographic imaging. Advanced imaging techniques like MRI or CT are often required for detection.

name: Occult Fractures
definition: Multiple fractures that are not readily apparent on standard radiographs. Advanced imaging modalities are crucial for comprehensive diagnosis.

name: Occult Fractures (Lateral Talar Process, 5th Metatarsal Base)
definition: Specific fractures of the lateral talar process and 5th metatarsal base that may be challenging to detect on initial imaging. Specialized radiographic views and advanced imaging are often necessary.

name: Oil cyst
definition: A fluid-filled cavity within fatty tissue, typically seen in radiological imaging as a well-defined, low-density lesion.

name: Olecranon Fracture
definition: A fracture involving the bony prominence at the proximal end of the ulna. Radiography is essential for accurate diagnosis and treatment planning.

name: Oligodendroglioma
definition: A type of brain tumor originating from oligodendrocyte cells, typically appearing as a distinct mass on neuroimaging studies.

name: Oligodendroglioma (Low-Grade)
definition: A low-grade, slower-growing variant of oligodendroglioma with relatively indolent characteristics. Radiological features help distinguish its grade and potential progression.

name: Oligohydramnios
definition: A condition characterized by significantly reduced amniotic fluid volume, detectable through ultrasound imaging during prenatal assessment.

name: Ollier's Disease (Multiple Enchondromatosis)
definition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by multiple benign cartilaginous tumors (enchondromas) in bones, typically affecting long bones and causing asymmetric skeletal growth and potential malignant transformation. Radiographically presents with multiple radiolucent lesions within bones.

name: Ollier disease
definition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by multiple benign cartilaginous tumors (enchondromas) in bones, typically affecting long bones and causing asymmetric skeletal growth and potential malignant transformation. Radiographically presents with multiple radiolucent lesions within bones.

name: Omphalocele
definition: A congenital abdominal wall defect where intestines, liver, and other abdominal organs protrude outside the body through the umbilical region, covered by a translucent membrane. Radiographically visible as an external abdominal wall protrusion with herniated viscera.

name: Oncocytoma
definition: A rare benign tumor composed of large, granular, mitochondria-rich cells, commonly found in kidneys and salivary glands. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, homogeneous mass with specific imaging characteristics.

name: Onion skin periosteal reaction
definition: A radiographic finding of layered periosteal reaction resembling an onion's concentric rings. Typically indicates chronic inflammatory or neoplastic bone processes.

name: Onocytic renal tumor
definition: A rare renal tumor composed of large, granular, mitochondria-rich cells, typically benign and found in the kidney. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, homogeneous renal mass with specific imaging characteristics.

name: Optic Nerve Drusen
definition: Calcified deposits within the optic nerve head, often asymptomatic and detected incidentally on imaging. Radiographically visible as hyperechoic or calcified lesions within the optic nerve.

name: Optic Nerve Glioma
definition: A rare, typically benign tumor arising from glial cells of the optic nerve, often associated with neurofibromatosis type 1. Radiographically appears as a fusiform enlargement of the optic nerve with potential intracranial extension.

name: Optic Nerve Sheath Meningioma
definition: A rare tumor originating from the meningeal cells surrounding the optic nerve sheath. Radiographically presents as a thickened, enhancing optic nerve sheath with potential compression of the optic nerve.

name: Optic Neuritis
definition: An inflammatory condition of the optic nerve, often associated with multiple sclerosis or autoimmune disorders. Radiographically shows optic nerve swelling, enhancement, and potential signal changes on MRI.

name: Oral Cavity Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCCa)
definition: A malignant epithelial tumor arising in the oral cavity, typically presenting as an ulcerative or proliferative lesion. Radiographically appears as an irregular, infiltrative mass with potential bone invasion and lymph node metastasis.

name: Orbital Cellulitis (complication of Sinusitis)
definition: An acute infection of the soft tissues surrounding the orbit, often secondary to sinusitis. Radiographically shows soft tissue inflammation, edema, and potential abscess formation involving orbital structures.

name: Orbital Lymphoma
definition: A malignant lymphoproliferative disorder occurring within the orbital soft tissues. Radiographically presents as a well-defined, homogeneous soft tissue mass with specific imaging characteristics.

name: Orbital Muscle Entrapment
definition: A condition where orbital muscles become trapped or compressed, typically following orbital wall fractures. Radiographically shows muscle displacement, thickening, and potential restricted muscle movement.

name: Orbital Pseudotumor (Idiopathic Orbital Inflammation)
definition: A non-specific inflammatory condition of the orbit with unknown etiology, presenting as a mass-like lesion. Radiographically appears as a soft tissue inflammatory process with potential involvement of orbital structures.

name: Orbital Pseudotumor (Idiopathic Orbital Inflammatory Syndrome - IOIS)
definition: A non-specific inflammatory condition of the orbit with unknown etiology, presenting as a mass-like lesion. Radiographically appears as a soft tissue inflammatory process with potential involvement of orbital structures.

name: Orchitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the testicle characterized by swelling, pain, and potential imaging findings of testicular enlargement and edema. Radiological evaluation typically involves ultrasound to assess inflammation and rule out complications.

name: Organ perfusion abnormalities (e.g., liver, kidneys)
definition: Abnormal blood flow or perfusion within organ tissues, detectable through various imaging techniques like CT, MRI, or nuclear medicine scans. Indicates compromised tissue oxygenation and potential pathological processes.

name: Organizing pneumonia
definition: Inflammatory lung condition characterized by patchy consolidation and ground-glass opacities on chest radiographs and CT scans. Represents a non-specific inflammatory process affecting lung parenchyma.

name: Oropharyngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCCa)
synonyms: head and neck squamous cell carcinoma
definition: Malignant epithelial tumor arising in the oropharyngeal region, typically visualized through CT, MRI, and PET scans to assess tumor extent, lymph node involvement, and metastasis.

name: Os acromiale
definition: Developmental anomaly of the acromion process of the scapula where a separate ossification center fails to fuse, potentially visible on shoulder radiographs and potentially causing biomechanical issues.

name: Os odontoideum
definition: Congenital or acquired abnormality of the odontoid process (dens) of the second cervical vertebra, characterized by separation from the vertebral body and visible on cervical spine radiographs.

name: Osgood-Schlatter disease
definition: Painful knee condition affecting adolescents, characterized by inflammation and fragmentation of the tibial tuberosity, typically diagnosed through radiographic evaluation of knee joint.

name: Osgood-Schlatter Disease (OSD)
definition: Painful knee condition affecting adolescents, characterized by inflammation and fragmentation of the tibial tuberosity, typically diagnosed through radiographic evaluation of knee joint.

name: Osmotic Demyelination Syndrome (ODS)
definition: Neurological disorder caused by rapid osmotic shifts leading to demyelination, potentially detectable through MRI showing characteristic brain signal changes in specific regions.

name: Ossicular Disruption
definition: Traumatic separation or damage to the ossicular chain in the middle ear, detectable through specialized radiological and imaging techniques assessing middle ear structures.

name: Ossification of the Posterior Longitudinal Ligament (OPLL)
definition: Spinal condition characterized by calcification and ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament, visible on spine radiographs and causing potential neurological compression.

name: Osteitis Fibrosa Cystica
definition: Metabolic bone disorder associated with hyperparathyroidism, characterized by bone cystic lesions and potential radiographic findings of bone resorption and fibrous tissue replacement.

name: Osteoarthritis
definition: Degenerative joint disease characterized by progressive cartilage breakdown and joint space narrowing, typically evaluated through radiographic assessment of joint surfaces and bone margins.

name: Osteoarthritis (OA)
definition: Degenerative joint disease characterized by progressive cartilage breakdown and joint space narrowing, typically evaluated through radiographic assessment of joint surfaces and bone margins.

name: Osteoblastoma
definition: Rare, benign bone tumor typically occurring in the spine or long bones, characterized by aggressive but usually non-metastatic growth, evaluated through radiographic and CT imaging.

name: Osteochondral Defect (OCD) of Capitellum (Elbow)
definition: A focal area of cartilage and bone damage in the capitellum of the elbow joint, typically seen in young athletes. Radiographically characterized by focal lesions with potential bone fragmentation and joint surface irregularity.

name: Osteochondral Lesion
definition: A localized defect involving both cartilage and underlying bone, typically seen in joints. Radiographically appears as a focal area of disruption in the articular surface with potential bone and cartilage involvement.

name: Osteochondral Lesion (OCL)
definition: A localized defect involving both cartilage and underlying bone, typically seen in joints. Radiographically appears as a focal area of disruption in the articular surface with potential bone and cartilage involvement.

name: Osteochondral Lesion of the Talus (OLT)
definition: A specific osteochondral lesion located in the talus bone of the ankle joint, often causing pain and potential joint dysfunction. Radiographically characterized by focal bone and cartilage abnormalities in the talus.

name: Osteochondroma
definition: A benign bone tumor composed of cartilage and bone, typically arising from the surface of a bone. Radiographically appears as a sessile or pedunculated bony projection with a cartilage cap.

name: Osteogenesis Imperfecta
definition: A genetic disorder characterized by fragile bones prone to fractures and abnormal bone development. Radiographically shows multiple bone deformities, thin bone density, and recurrent fractures.

name: Osteogenesis Imperfecta (OI)
definition: A genetic disorder characterized by fragile bones prone to fractures and abnormal bone development. Radiographically shows multiple bone deformities, thin bone density, and recurrent fractures.

name: Osteoid Osteoma
definition: A benign bone tumor typically occurring in children and young adults, characterized by a small, painful lesion with central nidus. Radiographically appears as a small, well-defined radiolucent lesion with surrounding sclerosis.

name: Osteolysis
definition: Progressive bone tissue destruction or resorption, often seen in various pathological conditions. Radiographically characterized by bone density reduction and potential structural changes.

name: Osteomalacia
definition: A metabolic bone disorder characterized by inadequate bone mineralization due to vitamin D deficiency. Radiographically shows reduced bone density, potential bone deformities, and decreased bone mineralization.

name: Osteomyelitis
definition: A serious bone infection involving bone and bone marrow, often caused by bacterial invasion. Radiographically shows bone destruction, periosteal reaction, and potential abscess formation.

name: Osteomyelitis (OM)
definition: A serious bone infection involving bone and bone marrow, often caused by bacterial invasion. Radiographically shows bone destruction, periosteal reaction, and potential abscess formation.

name: Osteonecrosis
definition: Death of bone tissue due to compromised blood supply, leading to bone structural changes. Radiographically characterized by bone density changes, potential fractures, and joint surface irregularities.

name: Osteopenia
definition: Reduced bone mineral density below normal levels, but not as severe as osteoporosis. Radiographically shows decreased bone density with potential increased fracture risk.

name: Osteoporosis
definition: A metabolic bone disorder characterized by significant bone density reduction and increased fracture risk. Radiographically shows severely decreased bone density, potential trabecular thinning, and increased bone fragility.

name: Osteoporotic fracture
definition: A fracture occurring in bones weakened by osteoporosis, typically characterized by low bone mineral density and increased fragility. These fractures commonly occur in the spine, hip, and wrist.

name: Osteoporotic Fractures
definition: A fracture occurring in bones weakened by osteoporosis, typically characterized by low bone mineral density and increased fragility. These fractures commonly occur in the spine, hip, and wrist.

name: Osteoporotic Vertebral Compression Fractures (OVCFs)
definition: Fractures of the vertebral bodies caused by osteoporosis, resulting in loss of vertebral height and potential spinal deformity. These fractures are often seen on lateral spine radiographs and can cause significant pain and disability.

name: Osteoporotic vertebral fracture
definition: A fracture of a vertebral body caused by weakened bone structure due to osteoporosis. These fractures can lead to vertebral height loss and potential spinal deformity.

name: Osteosarcoma
definition: A malignant bone tumor originating from osteoblasts, typically occurring in long bones and characterized by aggressive growth and potential metastasis. Radiographically, it often shows mixed lytic and sclerotic lesions.

name: Other adnexal masses
definition: Abnormal growths or tumors located in the adnexal regions of the body, which can be benign or malignant. These masses are typically evaluated through imaging techniques like ultrasound or CT.

name: Other adrenal masses
definition: Abnormal growths or tumors located in the adrenal glands, which can be benign or malignant. These masses are typically characterized and evaluated through cross-sectional imaging techniques.

name: Other arthritides
definition: Various inflammatory joint conditions beyond the most common forms of arthritis, characterized by different pathological processes affecting joint structures. These conditions are often diagnosed and monitored through radiographic imaging.

name: Other artifacts
definition: Unintended visual distortions or anomalies in medical imaging that are not part of the original anatomical structure. These can result from equipment, patient movement, or processing errors.

name: Other benign salivary gland tumors
definition: Non-malignant tumors occurring in salivary glands that are not classified under primary salivary gland tumor types. These are typically evaluated through imaging techniques like ultrasound or CT.

name: Other bilateral symmetric thalamic or brainstem lesions
definition: Symmetrical lesions occurring in the thalamus or brainstem that do not fit standard diagnostic categories. These are typically evaluated through neuroimaging techniques like MRI.

name: Other bowel activity
definition: Various types of intestinal activity or conditions beyond standard diagnostic categories. These are often assessed through imaging techniques like CT or MRI.

name: Other breast cancer subtypes
definition: Breast cancer types that do not fall under primary classification systems, representing diverse molecular and pathological characteristics. These are typically characterized through imaging and molecular testing.

name: Other breast cancers
definition: Various types of breast cancer beyond standard classification, representing diverse molecular and pathological characteristics. These are typically characterized through imaging and molecular testing.

name: Other C1 fractures
definition: Fractures involving the first cervical vertebra (atlas), which can result from various traumatic mechanisms. These fractures are critical to identify due to potential neurological implications.

name: Other C2 fractures
definition: Fractures of the C2 vertebra (axis) that do not fit standard classification systems. These fractures can involve various parts of the C2 vertebra and may require detailed radiographic assessment for accurate diagnosis and treatment planning.

name: Other causes of Acute Kidney Injury (AKI)
definition: Various pathological conditions that can cause sudden impairment of kidney function, detectable through radiological imaging techniques such as ultrasound, CT, or MRI.

name: Other causes of Acute Kidney Injury (sepsis, hypotension, other nephrotoxins)
definition: Specific pathological conditions causing acute kidney injury, including sepsis-related kidney damage, hypotension-induced renal dysfunction, and nephrotoxin-induced kidney injury, which can be evaluated through various radiological imaging modalities.

name: Other causes of altered mental status
definition: Multiple underlying conditions that can cause changes in mental status, potentially detectable through neuroimaging techniques like CT and MRI of the brain.

name: Other causes of bilateral basal ganglia lesions
definition: Various pathological processes that can cause bilateral lesions in the basal ganglia, identifiable through neuroimaging techniques such as CT and MRI.

name: Other causes of bowel ischemia
definition: Multiple pathological conditions that can lead to reduced blood flow and potential damage to the intestinal tissue, detectable through various radiological imaging techniques.

name: Other causes of bowel obstruction
definition: Various pathological conditions that can cause blockage or impaired movement of intestinal contents, identifiable through radiological imaging such as X-ray, CT, and ultrasound.

name: Other causes of bowel wall thickening
Other causes of chronic pelvic pain (e.g., endometriosis, adenomyosis, fibroids)
definition: Multiple gynecological and non-gynecological conditions that can cause chronic pelvic pain, detectable through various radiological imaging techniques like ultrasound, CT, and MRI.

name: Other causes of Cushing's and virilization
Other causes of heart failure
definition: Various underlying conditions that can cause cardiac dysfunction and reduced heart performance, identifiable through cardiac imaging techniques like echocardiography, CT, and MRI.

name: Other causes of hydrocephalus
definition: Multiple pathological conditions that can cause abnormal cerebrospinal fluid accumulation in the brain's ventricles, detectable through neuroimaging techniques like CT and MRI.

name: Other causes of hyperthermia
definition: Various pathological conditions that can cause elevated body temperature beyond normal physiological ranges, potentially detectable through imaging techniques.

name: Other causes of liver disease
definition: Multiple underlying conditions that can cause liver dysfunction or damage, identifiable through various radiological imaging techniques like ultrasound, CT, and MRI.

name: Other causes of malabsorption
definition: Various pathological conditions that can impair nutrient absorption in the gastrointestinal tract, potentially detectable through radiological imaging techniques.

name: Other causes of mesenteric edema
definition: Multiple pathological conditions that can cause fluid accumulation and swelling in the mesentery, identifiable through radiological imaging techniques like CT and ultrasound.

name: Other causes of stroke
definition: Various underlying conditions that can cause interruption of blood flow to the brain, detectable through neuroimaging techniques like CT, MRI, and angiography.

name: Other causes of vasoconstriction
definition: Conditions causing narrowing of blood vessels beyond primary vascular disorders, observable through various imaging techniques like CT or MRI. These can result from medications, systemic diseases, or localized pathological processes.

name: Other causes of white matter injury
definition: Pathological processes causing damage to white matter tracts in the brain, detectable through neuroimaging techniques like MRI. These can include non-primary demyelinating conditions, toxic exposures, or metabolic disorders.

name: Other congenital brain malformations
definition: Rare developmental brain malformations not classified under primary known categories, identifiable through advanced neuroimaging techniques. These can involve structural anomalies in brain formation, connectivity, or organization.

name: Other endocrine disorders
definition: Endocrine pathologies beyond standard diagnostic categories, detectable through various imaging modalities like CT, MRI, or nuclear medicine studies. These can involve complex hormonal dysregulations or rare glandular abnormalities.

name: Other Germ Cell Tumors
definition: Rare or unclassified tumors originating from germ cells, identifiable through cross-sectional imaging techniques. These can occur in various anatomical locations with distinct radiographic characteristics.

name: Other GU conditions
definition: Genitourinary conditions not falling under primary diagnostic categories, observable through ultrasound, CT, or MRI. These can involve complex urological or reproductive system pathologies.

name: Other GU malignancies
definition: Rare or unclassified malignant tumors affecting genitourinary systems, detectable through advanced imaging techniques. These can present with unique radiographic features and complex clinical presentations.

name: Other gynecological malignancies
definition: Uncommon or rare malignant tumors originating in female reproductive organs, identifiable through various imaging modalities. These can involve complex neoplastic processes beyond standard gynecological cancers.

name: Other high-density materials (e.g., contrast)
definition: Radiographic contrast agents or dense materials with unique imaging characteristics, used to enhance visualization of anatomical structures or pathological processes during diagnostic imaging.

name: Other hypervascular tumors
definition: Rare or unclassified tumors with increased blood vessel density, detectable through vascular imaging techniques. These can present with distinctive enhancement patterns and complex vascularity.

name: Other indolent lymphomas
definition: Less aggressive lymphoma subtypes with slower progression, identifiable through cross-sectional and nuclear medicine imaging techniques. These can present with unique radiographic characteristics.

name: Other inflammatory conditions
definition: Complex inflammatory conditions not falling under standard diagnostic categories, observable through various imaging modalities. These can involve multiple organ systems with unique radiographic presentations.

name: Other interstitial lung diseases
definition: Uncommon lung diseases affecting the interstitial spaces, detectable through high-resolution CT and other advanced imaging techniques. These can involve complex pulmonary parenchymal changes.

name: Other leukodystrophies
definition: Rare genetic or acquired disorders affecting white matter metabolism and structure, identifiable through advanced neuroimaging techniques. These can involve complex demyelinating or metabolic processes.

name: Other malignancies
definition: Rare or unclassified malignant tumors across different organ systems, detectable through various advanced imaging techniques. These can present with unique radiographic features and complex clinical presentations.

name: Other malignancies with liver, lung, and bone metastases
Other malignancies with metastases
definition: Cancerous lesions that have spread from their primary site to other parts of the body, detectable through various imaging modalities such as CT, MRI, and PET scans. These metastases can appear as distinct nodules or infiltrative changes in different organs.

name: Other malignancies with PSMA expression (e.g., renal cell carcinoma)
definition: Malignant tumors that demonstrate prostate-specific membrane antigen (PSMA) expression, which can be visualized through specialized nuclear medicine imaging techniques. Renal cell carcinoma is one example of such a tumor with potential PSMA uptake.

name: Other marrow infiltration processes
definition: Pathological processes that infiltrate and replace normal bone marrow, detectable through MRI, CT, and nuclear medicine studies. These processes can include metastases, lymphoma, and other hematologic disorders.

name: Other mesenteric masses
definition: Abnormal soft tissue masses located in the mesentery, identifiable through cross-sectional imaging like CT and MRI. These can include lymphomas, metastases, and primary tumors.

name: Other metabolic bone diseases
definition: Non-neoplastic bone disorders characterized by alterations in bone metabolism, structure, and mineral density, typically evaluated through radiographic techniques like X-ray, DEXA scan, and CT.

name: Other non-seminomatous germ cell tumors
definition: Heterogeneous group of testicular tumors derived from primitive germ cells, excluding seminomas, which can be characterized through various imaging modalities like CT, MRI, and ultrasound.

name: Other overgrowth syndromes
definition: Genetic conditions characterized by excessive growth of body tissues, often detectable through radiographic and cross-sectional imaging techniques that reveal abnormal tissue development.

name: Other pancreatic masses
definition: Diverse mass lesions within the pancreas, identifiable through CT, MRI, and ultrasound, which can include benign and malignant neoplasms, cystic lesions, and inflammatory processes.

name: Other primary liver tumors
definition: Hepatic neoplasms originating within the liver, excluding metastatic lesions, detectable through various imaging modalities such as ultrasound, CT, and MRI.

name: Other primary malignancies
definition: Diverse malignant neoplasms originating in different organ systems, identifiable through various imaging techniques that reveal abnormal tissue growth and potential metastatic spread.

name: Other renal masses
definition: Heterogeneous lesions within the kidney, detectable through CT, MRI, and ultrasound, which can include benign and malignant tumors, cysts, and inflammatory processes.

name: Other skeletal dysplasias
definition: Genetic disorders characterized by abnormal skeletal development and morphology, typically evaluated through radiographic techniques that reveal structural bone variations.

name: Other soft tissue sarcomas
definition: Rare malignant tumors originating in connective tissues, identifiable through cross-sectional imaging like CT and MRI, which reveal soft tissue masses with distinct characteristics.

name: Other syndromes with macrocephaly
definition: Genetic conditions characterized by abnormally large head circumference, detectable through neuroimaging techniques that reveal associated brain and skull variations.

name: Other tumors expressing somatostatin receptors
definition: Tumors that demonstrate uptake of somatostatin receptors, identifiable through specialized nuclear medicine imaging techniques like somatostatin receptor scintigraphy.

name: Other tumors with SSTR expression
definition: Tumors expressing somatostatin receptors (SSTR) that can be detected and potentially targeted by molecular imaging techniques. These tumors may have specific radiotracer uptake patterns on PET or SPECT imaging.

name: Other types of stroke
definition: Various types of cerebrovascular events causing brain tissue damage, detectable through neuroimaging techniques like CT and MRI. Different stroke types present distinct radiological characteristics and patterns of brain tissue involvement.

name: Other vertebral body fractures
definition: Structural breaks or disruptions in the vertebral body's bony architecture, visible on radiographic imaging such as X-ray, CT, or MRI. These fractures can result from trauma, osteoporosis, or pathological processes.

name: Other Viral Encephalitides
definition: Inflammatory brain conditions caused by viral infections, characterized by specific imaging findings on CT and MRI such as brain parenchymal changes, edema, and potential contrast enhancement.

name: Other viral encephalitis
definition: Inflammatory brain conditions caused by viral infections, characterized by specific imaging findings on CT and MRI such as brain parenchymal changes, edema, and potential contrast enhancement.

name: Otic Capsule-Violating Temporal Bone Fracture
definition: A specific type of temporal bone fracture that breaches the otic capsule, potentially causing significant inner ear and neurological complications. Radiologically characterized by complex fracture lines involving the temporal bone's inner structures.

name: Otosclerosis
definition: A progressive hearing disorder characterized by abnormal bone remodeling in the middle ear, typically diagnosed through high-resolution CT imaging showing characteristic bony changes and ossicular chain involvement.

name: Ovarian Cancer
definition: Malignant neoplasm originating in the ovarian tissue, detectable through various imaging modalities like ultrasound, CT, and MRI. Radiological assessment helps in staging, characterizing tumor extent, and monitoring treatment response.

name: Ovarian Cyst
definition: Fluid-filled sac or pocket within the ovary, typically identified through transvaginal ultrasound or CT imaging. Cysts can vary in size, composition, and potential pathological significance.

name: Ovarian cyst rupture
definition: Spontaneous or traumatic rupture of an ovarian cyst, detectable through imaging techniques showing free fluid in the peritoneal cavity, potential hemorrhage, and associated inflammatory changes.

name: Ovarian fibroma
definition: Benign ovarian tumor composed of fibrous tissue, typically appearing as a solid mass on imaging studies with distinct radiological characteristics distinguishing it from other ovarian neoplasms.

name: Ovarian Necrosis
definition: Localized tissue death within the ovary, potentially caused by torsion, ischemia, or inflammatory processes. Radiologically characterized by areas of non-perfusion and tissue breakdown.

name: Ovarian Teratoma
definition: Rare ovarian tumor containing tissues from multiple embryonic layers, typically identified through complex imaging features showing diverse tissue components and calcifications.

name: Ovarian torsion
definition: Twisting of the ovary around its vascular pedicle, causing potential ischemia and tissue damage. Radiologically characterized by ovarian swelling, altered blood flow, and potential hemorrhagic changes.

name: Overdrainage (Slit Ventricle Syndrome/Subdural Hematoma)
definition: Complication following cerebrospinal fluid shunt procedures, characterized by excessive drainage leading to potential subdural hematoma formation. Radiologically identified through imaging showing abnormal ventricular size and intracranial fluid collections.

name: Pachygyria
definition: A neurological developmental disorder characterized by abnormally thick and smooth cerebral cortex with reduced number of cortical folds. On imaging, it appears as broad, simplified gyri with reduced cortical complexity.

name: Paget's Disease
definition: A chronic bone disorder characterized by abnormal bone remodeling, resulting in enlarged, deformed bones with increased bone turnover. Radiographically presents with mixed lytic and sclerotic bone changes.

name: Paget Disease
definition: A chronic bone disorder characterized by abnormal bone remodeling, resulting in enlarged, deformed bones with increased bone turnover. Radiographically presents with mixed lytic and sclerotic bone changes.

name: Paget Disease of Bone (Osteitis Deformans)
definition: A chronic bone disorder characterized by abnormal bone remodeling, resulting in enlarged, deformed bones with increased bone turnover. Radiographically presents with mixed lytic and sclerotic bone changes.

name: Paget Disease of the Nipple
definition: A rare form of breast cancer involving the nipple and areola, characterized by eczematoid skin changes. Radiologically may show skin thickening and underlying architectural distortion.

name: Painless thyroiditis
definition: A rare, self-limiting thyroid inflammation characterized by transient thyroid dysfunction without pain. Imaging typically shows reduced thyroid uptake and potential glandular swelling.

name: Pancreatic adenocarcinoma
definition: An aggressive malignant tumor of the pancreas with high mortality, typically appearing as a hypoechoic mass on imaging with potential invasion of surrounding structures.

name: Pancreatic Cancer
definition: An aggressive malignant tumor of the pancreas with high mortality, typically appearing as a hypoechoic mass on imaging with potential invasion of surrounding structures.

name: Pancreatic Cysts
definition: Fluid-filled sacs within the pancreas that can be benign or potentially precancerous. Radiologically characterized by well-defined, fluid-containing lesions with variable internal complexity.

name: Pancreatic cysts (Complex)
definition: Advanced pancreatic cysts with complex internal features, potentially indicating increased malignant potential. Radiologically show septations, mural nodules, or calcifications.

name: Pancreatic Head Adenocarcinoma
definition: A specific type of pancreatic adenocarcinoma located in the head of the pancreas, often causing biliary obstruction. Radiologically appears as a mass with potential ductal and vascular involvement.

name: Pancreatic Insufficiency (Cystic Fibrosis)
definition: Pancreatic exocrine dysfunction associated with cystic fibrosis, characterized by reduced enzyme production. Imaging may show pancreatic atrophy and ductal dilation.

name: Pancreatic lesions
definition: Various abnormal growths or changes within the pancreatic tissue, which can be benign or malignant. Radiologically diverse in appearance and characteristics.

name: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor
definition: A rare, typically slower-growing pancreatic tumor originating from hormone-producing cells. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, potentially hypervascular mass.

name: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor (PNET)
definition: A rare, typically slower-growing pancreatic tumor originating from hormone-producing cells. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, potentially hypervascular mass.

name: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumors (PNET)
definition: Rare neuroendocrine neoplasms arising from pancreatic islet cells, characterized by varied imaging appearances and potential malignant transformation. Radiological evaluation typically involves CT, MRI, and nuclear medicine techniques for detection and staging.

name: Pancreatic pseudocyst
definition: Fluid-filled, non-epithelial lined collection within or adjacent to the pancreas, typically resulting from acute or chronic pancreatitis. Radiologically identified on CT and ultrasound as well-defined, round or oval fluid collections.

name: Pancreatic Transection
definition: Complete or partial disruption of pancreatic tissue, often resulting from blunt abdominal trauma or surgical intervention. Radiologically characterized by discontinuity of pancreatic parenchyma on CT or MRI.

name: Pancreatic Trauma
definition: Injury to pancreatic tissue caused by external force, resulting in contusions, lacerations, or complete pancreatic disruption. Radiologically assessed using contrast-enhanced CT for extent and severity of damage.

name: Pancreatitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the pancreas characterized by pancreatic tissue damage and potential necrosis. Radiological findings include pancreatic enlargement, peripancreatic inflammation, and potential fluid collections on CT and MRI.

name: Pantothenate kinase-associated neurodegeneration (PKAN)
synonyms: Neurodegeneration with brain iron accumulation type I
definition: Rare genetic neurological disorder characterized by iron accumulation in the basal ganglia, detectable through brain MRI with distinctive signal changes. Radiological hallmark is central nervous system iron deposition.

name: Papillary Carcinoma
definition: Malignant epithelial neoplasm with characteristic papillary architectural pattern, commonly occurring in thyroid, kidney, and other organs. Radiologically identified through characteristic morphological features on imaging studies.

name: Papillary RCC
definition: Subtype of renal cell carcinoma with distinct papillary architecture, characterized by specific radiological features on CT and MRI. Typically shows low-enhancement and heterogeneous appearance.

name: Papillary Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC)
definition: Kidney cancer originating from renal tubular epithelium with papillary growth pattern. Radiologically characterized by complex solid and cystic components on cross-sectional imaging.

name: Papillary thyroid carcinoma
definition: Well-differentiated thyroid malignancy with distinctive papillary architecture, typically detected through ultrasound and confirmed with cross-sectional imaging. Often shows microcalcifications and irregular margins.

name: Papilledema
definition: Swelling of optic disc due to increased intracranial pressure, detectable through fundoscopic examination and neuroimaging techniques like MRI and CT.

name: Papilloma
definition: Benign epithelial tumor with finger-like projections, typically identified through imaging and pathological examination. Can occur in various organ systems with distinct radiological characteristics.

name: Paraduodenal Hernia (Left)
definition: Rare congenital hernia occurring on the left side of the mesentery, characterized by abnormal bowel herniation. Radiologically identified through CT or contrast studies showing bowel displacement.

name: Paraduodenal Hernia (Right)
definition: Rare congenital hernia occurring on the right side of the mesentery, characterized by abnormal bowel herniation. Radiologically detected through CT or contrast studies showing bowel displacement.

name: Paraganglioma
definition: Rare neuroendocrine tumor arising from extra-adrenal chromaffin cells, typically found in head, neck, and paraganglia regions. Radiologically characterized by distinctive enhancement patterns on CT and MRI.

name: Paraganglioma (Glomus Tumor)
definition: A rare neuroendocrine tumor arising from extra-adrenal paraganglia, typically found in head, neck, and thoracoabdominal regions. Radiologically characterized by characteristic enhancement patterns and potential malignant transformation.

name: Paraneoplastic Syndromes (Cushing's and Virilization)
definition: Systemic clinical syndromes associated with underlying malignancy, causing remote effects not directly related to tumor mass. Radiological findings often include identifying the primary tumor and associated paraneoplastic manifestations.

name: Parapelvic Cysts
definition: Benign fluid-filled cystic lesions located adjacent to the renal pelvis, typically discovered incidentally during imaging studies. Radiographically appear as well-defined, thin-walled cystic structures near kidney.

name: Parathyroid Adenoma
definition: Benign tumor of parathyroid gland causing excessive hormone production, typically detected through imaging showing localized glandular enlargement. Radiological evaluation helps precisely locate and characterize the lesion.

name: Parathyroid Carcinoma
definition: Rare malignant neoplasm of parathyroid glands characterized by aggressive local invasion and potential metastasis. Radiological findings include irregular margins, local infiltration, and potential distant spread.

name: Parathyroid Hyperplasia
definition: Diffuse enlargement of parathyroid glands causing excessive hormone production. Radiologically manifests as multiple glandular enlargements rather than discrete, well-defined tumors.

name: Parenchymal Fibrosis
definition: Progressive replacement of functional tissue with fibrous connective tissue, leading to organ dysfunction. Radiologically characterized by increased tissue density and architectural distortion.

name: Parenchymal Hemorrhage
definition: Localized bleeding within organ parenchyma, visible on imaging as areas of increased density or signal intensity. Radiological assessment helps determine extent and potential complications.

name: Parkinson's Disease
definition: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting movement, characterized by dopaminergic neuronal loss. Radiological findings include basal ganglia changes and potential brain structural alterations.

name: Parkinson's Disease (PD)
definition: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting movement, characterized by dopaminergic neuronal loss. Radiological findings include basal ganglia changes and potential brain structural alterations.

name: Parkinson Disease
definition: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting movement, characterized by dopaminergic neuronal loss. Radiological findings include basal ganglia changes and potential brain structural alterations.

name: Parosteal osteosarcoma
definition: Low-grade surface osteosarcoma arising from periosteal surface, typically occurring near long bone metaphyses. Radiologically characterized by cortical-based lesion with minimal soft tissue involvement.

name: Parotid duct cysts
definition: Benign cystic lesions occurring within parotid salivary gland ductal system. Radiologically appear as well-defined, fluid-filled structures within glandular tissue.

name: Parotid Tumors
definition: Neoplastic growths occurring within parotid gland, ranging from benign to malignant. Radiological evaluation helps characterize tumor type, size, and potential local invasion.

name: Partial Achilles Tendon Tear
definition: Incomplete disruption of Achilles tendon fibers, typically involving partial fiber discontinuity. Radiological assessment using ultrasound or MRI helps determine tear extent and severity.

name: Partial ACL tear
definition: A partial tear of the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) where some fibers remain intact. Radiologically characterized by signal intensity changes and partial discontinuity of ligament fibers on MRI.

name: Partial obstruction
definition: A blockage or narrowing of a tubular structure that allows some passage of material or fluid. In radiology, typically identified through imaging techniques showing partial blockage of vessels, intestines, or other tubular structures.

name: Partial Tear (Long Head of Biceps Tendon - LHBT)
definition: A partial tear or injury of the long head of the biceps tendon, characterized by signal changes and potential fiber discontinuity on MRI imaging.

name: Particle Disease
definition: A condition involving accumulation or presence of foreign particles within body tissues, potentially causing inflammatory or reactive changes visible on imaging studies.

name: PASH
definition: Pseudoangiomatous stromal hyperplasia (PASH), a benign breast lesion characterized by complex stromal proliferation with interconnecting channels, typically identified on mammographic or ultrasound imaging.

name: Patellar Instability
definition: A condition characterized by abnormal tracking or displacement of the patella, often associated with recurrent dislocations or subluxations. Radiologically assessed through various imaging techniques to evaluate patellar alignment and joint mechanics.

name: Patellar Tendinopathy
definition: Degenerative condition of the patellar tendon characterized by structural changes, signal alterations, and potential thickening or thinning visible on MRI.

name: Patellar tendon rupture
definition: Complete disruption of the patellar tendon, typically showing a complete discontinuity and separation of tendon fibers on imaging studies.

name: Patellar tendon tear
definition: A partial or complete tear of the patellar tendon, characterized by signal changes, fiber discontinuity, and potential retraction on MRI.

name: Patellar tendonitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the patellar tendon characterized by signal changes, potential thickening, and increased vascularity on imaging studies.

name: Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA)
definition: A congenital heart condition where the ductus arteriosus fails to close after birth, resulting in abnormal blood flow between the pulmonary artery and aorta. Radiologically identified through cardiac imaging techniques.

name: Pathologic fracture
definition: A fracture occurring in an area of weakened bone due to underlying disease, typically caused by conditions like osteoporosis, cancer, or metabolic disorders.

name: Pathologic Fracture (e.g., due to malignancy)
definition: A fracture occurring in bone weakened by malignant processes, characterized by disruption of bone architecture and potential tumor involvement.

name: Pathologic fracture (Malignancy)
definition: A fracture occurring in bone compromised by malignant processes, typically associated with metastatic lesions or multiple myeloma.

name: Pathologic fracture (metastasis, multiple myeloma)
definition: A fracture occurring in bone weakened by metastatic cancer or multiple myeloma, characterized by significant bone destruction and increased fracture risk.

name: Pathologic fracture (metastatic disease, multiple myeloma)
definition: A fracture occurring in a bone weakened by underlying pathological conditions such as cancer metastases or multiple myeloma. Radiographic findings typically show bone destruction, pathological bone changes, and potential soft tissue involvement.

name: Pathologic Nipple Discharge (PND)
definition: Abnormal discharge from the nipple that may indicate underlying breast pathology. Radiological evaluation often includes mammography and ultrasound to assess potential underlying lesions.

name: Patient movement
definition: Unintended motion of a patient during medical imaging that can cause image artifacts, blurring, and reduced diagnostic quality. Movement can significantly compromise the accuracy of radiographic studies.

name: PCA Ischemic Stroke
definition: An ischemic stroke occurring in the posterior cerebral artery (PCA) territory, characterized by specific neurological deficits and distinctive radiological findings on CT or MRI.

name: PCL Injury
definition: Injury to the posterior cruciate ligament (PCL) of the knee, typically detected through MRI or radiographic imaging showing ligament disruption or abnormal positioning.

name: PCL tear
definition: Complete or partial rupture of the posterior cruciate ligament, visualized through MRI with characteristic signal changes and potential associated bone bruising.

name: PE with RV strain
definition: Pulmonary embolism with right ventricular (RV) strain, characterized by radiographic signs of RV enlargement, interventricular septal flattening, and potential pulmonary arterial dilatation.

name: Pediatric Abusive Head Trauma (AHT)
definition: Non-accidental head trauma in children, characterized by intracranial hemorrhages, skull fractures, and retinal hemorrhages detected through CT and MRI imaging.

name: Pediatric Hip abnormalities
definition: Various developmental and pathological conditions affecting pediatric hip joints, detectable through radiographic techniques like X-ray, ultrasound, and MRI.

name: Pelvic Congestion Syndrome (PCS)
definition: Chronic pelvic pain caused by varicose veins in the pelvic region, diagnosed through venography, CT, or MRI showing dilated pelvic venous plexuses.

name: Pelvic fractures
definition: Traumatic breaks in pelvic bones, typically assessed through CT, X-ray, and sometimes MRI to evaluate bone integrity, displacement, and potential soft tissue involvement.

name: Pelvic inflammatory disease
definition: Inflammatory condition of the female reproductive organs, diagnosed through imaging techniques showing potential fluid collections, tubo-ovarian abscesses, or inflammatory changes.

name: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID)
definition: Inflammatory condition of the female reproductive organs, diagnosed through imaging techniques showing potential fluid collections, tubo-ovarian abscesses, or inflammatory changes.

name: Pelvic Insufficiency Fractures
definition: Fractures occurring in weakened bone due to reduced bone density, commonly seen in elderly patients, typically detected through bone density scans and radiographic imaging.

name: Penetrating Trauma
definition: Injury caused by foreign object entering the body, requiring comprehensive radiographic evaluation to assess internal damage, trajectory, and potential organ involvement.

name: Penile Cancer
definition: Malignant neoplasm of the penis, typically detected through imaging studies like CT, MRI, or ultrasound to assess tumor size, local invasion, and metastasis.

name: Penile Fracture
definition: Traumatic rupture of the penile erectile tissue, typically diagnosed through ultrasound or MRI to evaluate the extent of tissue damage and potential surgical intervention.

name: Penile pathology
definition: Broad category of medical conditions affecting the penis, evaluated through various imaging modalities to diagnose structural, inflammatory, or neoplastic changes.

name: Peptic Stricture
definition: Narrowing of the esophagus or stomach due to chronic inflammation, typically assessed through barium studies, CT, or endoscopic imaging to evaluate the extent and location of the stricture.

name: Peptic Ulcer
definition: Mucosal erosion in the stomach or duodenum, visualized through endoscopy, CT, or contrast studies to assess size, location, and potential complications.

name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
definition: Chronic condition characterized by recurrent peptic ulcers, evaluated through multiple imaging techniques to monitor ulcer progression and potential complications.

name: Peptic Ulcer Disease (PUD)
definition: Chronic condition characterized by recurrent peptic ulcers, evaluated through multiple imaging techniques to monitor ulcer progression and potential complications.

name: Perforated Cholecystitis
definition: Acute inflammation of the gallbladder with perforation, detected through CT or ultrasound to assess the extent of inflammation and potential surgical intervention.

name: Perforated Diverticulitis (Hinchey II-IV)
definition: Severe stage of diverticulitis with bowel wall perforation, characterized by imaging findings of free air, abscess formation, or peritoneal inflammation.

name: Perforated Gallbladder
definition: Complete rupture of the gallbladder wall, typically identified through CT or ultrasound to evaluate the extent of inflammation and potential surgical management.

name: Perforated peptic ulcer
definition: Serious complication of peptic ulcer disease involving complete breach of the stomach or duodenal wall, detected through CT or contrast studies.

name: Perforation
definition: Breach or rupture of an organ's wall, identified through various imaging modalities to assess the extent of damage and potential complications.

name: Perihilar Cholangiocarcinoma (Klatskin tumor)
definition: Malignant tumor located at the hepatic hilum, typically diagnosed through CT, MRI, and ultrasound to evaluate tumor extent and potential metastasis.

name: Perimesencephalic SAH (pnSAH)
definition: Non-aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage localized around the brainstem, typically detected through CT or MRI neuroimaging.

name: Peripheral Arterial Disease (PAD)
definition: Systemic arterial disease characterized by narrowing or blockage of peripheral arteries, evaluated through angiography, CT angiography, or MR angiography.

name: Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD)
definition: A chronic circulatory disorder characterized by narrowing or blockage of peripheral arteries, typically affecting the legs. Radiological imaging helps assess arterial stenosis, calcification, and blood flow disruption.

name: Peripheral Nerve Stimulation (PNS)
definition: A neuromodulation technique involving electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to manage chronic pain. Radiological techniques help guide precise nerve stimulation placement.

name: Peritoneal Carcinomatosis
definition: Widespread metastatic spread of cancer cells within the peritoneal cavity, visible through imaging as multiple nodular lesions. CT and MRI are crucial for detecting and staging peritoneal carcinomatosis.

name: Peritoneal Carcinomatosis (from CRC)
definition: Metastatic spread of colorectal cancer specifically to the peritoneal surfaces, characterized by multiple nodular lesions detectable through cross-sectional imaging techniques.

name: Peritoneal Mesothelioma
definition: A rare malignant tumor originating from peritoneal mesothelial cells, characterized by diffuse nodular lesions visible on CT and MRI imaging.

name: Peritoneal tuberculosis
definition: Tuberculous infection of the peritoneum, presenting as inflammatory changes, adhesions, and potential calcifications detectable through radiological imaging.

name: Peritonitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the peritoneal membrane characterized by fluid accumulation, wall thickening, and potential abscess formation visible on imaging studies.

name: Periventricular hemorrhagic infarction
definition: Hemorrhagic brain lesions occurring near the ventricles, typically in premature infants, characterized by bleeding and tissue destruction visible on neuroimaging.

name: Periventricular Heterotopia
definition: Neuronal migration disorder where gray matter neurons fail to migrate correctly, appearing as nodular cortical thickening on neuroimaging.

name: Periventricular Leukomalacia
definition: Focal necrotic brain lesions near the ventricles, commonly seen in premature infants, characterized by white matter softening and cystic changes on neuroimaging.

name: Periventricular Leukomalacia (PVL)
definition: Focal necrotic brain lesions near the ventricles, commonly seen in premature infants, characterized by white matter softening and cystic changes on neuroimaging.

name: Peroneal Spastic Flatfoot
definition: Foot deformity characterized by flattened arch and eversion, potentially associated with neurological or muscular conditions detectable through imaging.

name: Persistent Pulmonary Hypertension (PPHN)
definition: Sustained high blood pressure in the pulmonary arteries, detectable through imaging techniques like CT and echocardiography showing vascular changes.

name: Pes Anserinus Bursitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the bursa near the pes anserinus tendon group, visible as soft tissue swelling and inflammation on imaging studies.

name: PET
definition: Positron Emission Tomography (PET) is a nuclear medicine functional imaging technique that uses radioactive tracers to visualize metabolic processes and detect abnormalities in the body.

name: PET/CT
definition: A hybrid imaging technique combining Positron Emission Tomography (PET) and Computed Tomography (CT) in a single examination. Provides metabolic and anatomical information simultaneously, allowing for precise localization of metabolically active lesions.

name: PET/CT (F-18 FDG)
definition: PET/CT using Fluorodeoxyglucose (F-18 FDG) as a radioactive tracer. Primarily used for oncologic imaging, inflammation detection, and metabolic activity assessment of various tissues.

name: PET/CT (Ga-68 DOTATATE)
definition: PET/CT using Gallium-68 DOTATATE, a somatostatin receptor-based radiotracer. Specifically used for neuroendocrine tumor imaging and detection of somatostatin receptor-positive lesions.

name: PET/CT (Ga-68 PSMA)
definition: PET/CT using Gallium-68 PSMA (Prostate-Specific Membrane Antigen) as a radiotracer. Specialized imaging technique for detecting and staging prostate cancer metastases.

name: Peutz-Jeghers Syndrome (PJS)
definition: Genetic disorder characterized by intestinal hamartomatous polyps and mucocutaneous pigmentation, detectable through gastrointestinal imaging and genetic studies.

name: Peyronie Disease
definition: A condition characterized by fibrous plaques in the penis causing curvature and potential erectile dysfunction. Radiologically, it may be identified through ultrasound or MRI showing tissue calcification and scarring.

name: PFTs, Clinical History
definition: Pulmonary Function Tests (PFTs) that assess lung capacity, airflow, and gas exchange. Provides quantitative data about respiratory system performance and potential pathological conditions.

name: Pheochromocytoma
definition: A rare neuroendocrine tumor of the adrenal medulla that secretes excessive catecholamines. On imaging, it appears as a well-defined adrenal mass with characteristic enhancement patterns.

name: Phleboliths
definition: Calcified venous thrombi typically found in pelvic veins, appearing as round, dense calcifications on radiographic imaging. Often incidental findings with no clinical significance.

name: Phlegmon
definition: An inflammatory condition characterized by diffuse tissue inflammation without clear abscess formation. Radiologically presents as areas of increased soft tissue density and decreased fat planes.

name: Phlegmon (Diverticular Phlegmon)
definition: A localized inflammatory process associated with diverticular disease, typically seen in the sigmoid colon. Radiographically characterized by increased soft tissue density and inflammatory changes around diverticula.

name: Phyllodes tumor
definition: A rare fibroepithelial breast tumor with potential for malignant transformation. Radiologically appears as a large, well-defined mass with complex internal architecture.

name: Physeal bar formation
definition: A pathological condition where growth plate (physeal) tissue becomes ossified, interrupting normal bone growth. Radiographically seen as a transverse linear opacity across the growth plate.

name: Physeal fracture
definition: A fracture involving the growth plate (physis) of a developing bone. Radiographically classified using the Salter-Harris classification system with distinct fracture patterns.

name: Physiologic hydronephrosis (e.g., pregnancy)
definition: Mild dilation of the renal pelvis and calyces during pregnancy due to hormonal and mechanical changes. Typically bilateral and resolves postpartum, visible on ultrasound or CT.

name: PI-RADS >= 4 Lesion
definition: A prostate lesion with high suspicion of clinically significant cancer on multiparametric MRI, indicating a need for potential biopsy. Scoring 4 or 5 on the PI-RADS v2 scale.

name: PICC Line Malposition
definition: Incorrect positioning of a peripherally inserted central catheter (PICC) line, which can be detected through radiographic imaging and may require repositioning.

name: PICC Line Occlusion
definition: Blockage or inability of blood flow through a peripherally inserted central catheter (PICC) line, identifiable through imaging studies like venography or contrast studies.

name: Picture frame vertebra
definition: A radiographic appearance of vertebral bodies with increased density at the margins, resembling a picture frame. Often associated with certain metabolic or neoplastic conditions.

name: Pigment Stones
definition: Gallstones composed of calcium bilirubinate, appearing dark on imaging and often associated with chronic hemolytic conditions or liver disease.

name: Pilocytic Astrocytoma
definition: A slow-growing, typically benign brain tumor most common in children, usually located in the cerebellum. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, cystic mass with characteristic imaging features.

name: Pilocytic Astrocytoma (JPA)
definition: A slow-growing, typically benign brain tumor most common in children, usually located in the cerebellum. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, cystic mass with characteristic imaging features.

name: Pineal Cyst
definition: A fluid-filled sac within the pineal gland, typically benign and often incidental finding on neuroimaging. Most pineal cysts are asymptomatic and do not require intervention.

name: Pineal Masses (Germinoma, Pineoblastoma)
definition: Rare tumors arising from the pineal region, with germinomas being malignant germ cell tumors and pineoblastomas being highly aggressive embryonal tumors. These masses can be detected through MRI and CT imaging.

name: Pineoblastoma
definition: A highly malignant embryonal tumor of the pineal gland, characterized by aggressive growth and poor prognosis. Typically appears as a heterogeneous mass on neuroimaging with potential calcifications.

name: Pineocytoma
definition: A rare, typically benign tumor of the pineal gland with low malignant potential. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, relatively homogeneous mass on neuroimaging.

name: Piriformis Syndrome (Sciatic Nerve Entrapment)
definition: A neuromuscular condition involving compression or irritation of the sciatic nerve as it passes through the piriformis muscle. Imaging can help identify muscle abnormalities or nerve entrapment.

name: Pituitary adenoma
definition: A benign tumor arising from the pituitary gland, which can be classified as functioning or non-functioning. Typically detected through MRI with characteristic appearance and potential mass effect.

name: Pituitary Apoplexy
definition: A sudden hemorrhage or infarction within a pituitary tumor, causing acute symptoms and potential gland destruction. Characterized by rapid changes in size and signal intensity on neuroimaging.

name: Pituitary Infarction
definition: A condition where the pituitary gland experiences sudden loss of blood supply, leading to tissue death. Radiologically appears as areas of non-enhancement and signal changes on MRI.

name: Pituitary Macroadenoma
definition: A pituitary adenoma larger than 10mm in diameter, typically causing significant mass effect and potential visual disturbances. Clearly visible on neuroimaging with well-defined borders.

name: Placenta Accreta Spectrum (PAS)
definition: A spectrum of placental attachment disorders characterized by abnormal placental invasion into the uterine wall. Ultrasound and MRI can help diagnose and grade the severity of placental adherence.

name: Placenta Previa
definition: A pregnancy complication where the placenta partially or completely covers the cervical opening. Diagnosed through transvaginal ultrasound with potential implications for delivery.

name: Placental Abruption
definition: A serious pregnancy complication involving premature separation of the placenta from the uterine wall. Ultrasound can help identify hemorrhage, retroplacental clot, and placental disruption.

name: Plantar Fasciitis
definition: A common cause of heel pain involving inflammation of the plantar fascia, the thick band of tissue connecting heel to toes. Ultrasound and MRI can reveal soft tissue thickening and inflammation.

name: Plastic Bronchitis
definition: A rare respiratory condition characterized by formation of thick, tree-like mucus casts in the bronchial tree. Chest imaging can reveal bronchial obstruction and abnormal mucus formations.

name: Plastic deformation
definition: A biomechanical process where a structure permanently changes shape under stress without fracturing. In radiology, often observed in bone and soft tissue deformation patterns.

name: Pleomorphic adenoma
definition: A benign salivary gland tumor characterized by mixed cellular components and variable architectural patterns. On imaging, it typically appears as a well-defined, heterogeneous soft tissue mass with potential calcifications.

name: Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma (PXA)
definition: A rare, low-grade astrocytic brain tumor typically occurring in children and young adults. Radiologically, it presents as a superficial cortical tumor with potential calcifications and cystic components.

name: Pleural effusion
definition: Abnormal fluid accumulation in the pleural space, visible on radiographic imaging as blunting of costophrenic angles or fluid density adjacent to lung parenchyma. Can be detected through chest X-ray or CT scan.

name: PML-IRIS
synonyms: Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome
definition: Inflammatory immune reconstitution syndrome occurring in HIV patients after initiating antiretroviral therapy, potentially causing neurological complications. Radiologically characterized by brain lesions and inflammatory changes.

name: Pneumatosis Intestinalis (PI)
definition: Presence of gas or air within the intestinal wall, detectable on imaging as linear or bubbly lucencies within the bowel wall. Can indicate serious underlying conditions like bowel ischemia or infection.

name: Pneumomediastinum
definition: Presence of air in the mediastinal compartment, typically seen as linear or bubbly lucencies on chest radiographs. Can result from various traumatic or spontaneous causes.

name: Pneumonia
definition: Inflammatory lung condition characterized by infection causing airspace consolidation, visible on chest radiographs as patchy or diffuse opacities. Can be caused by bacterial, viral, or fungal pathogens.

name: Pneumonia/Atelectasis
definition: Radiographic finding combining lung collapse (atelectasis) and inflammatory lung changes (pneumonia), typically presenting as areas of decreased lung volume and increased opacity.

name: Pneumoperitoneum
definition: Presence of free air within the peritoneal cavity, detected on imaging as lucent areas or gas collections beneath the diaphragm. Often indicates serious intra-abdominal pathology like perforation.

name: Pneumothorax
definition: Abnormal air collection in the pleural space causing lung collapse, visible on chest radiographs as decreased lung volume and increased lucency on the affected side.

name: Pneumothorax with tension
definition: Severe form of pneumothorax where air accumulation creates significant pressure, causing mediastinal shift and potential cardiovascular compromise. Requires immediate medical intervention.

name: Pneumothorax/Empyema
definition: Combination of pneumothorax with purulent fluid collection in the pleural space, presenting complex radiographic findings of air and fluid levels.

name: Polycystic kidney disease
definition: Genetic disorder characterized by multiple cysts in kidneys, visible on imaging as multiple fluid-filled spaces replacing normal renal parenchyma.

name: Polycystic Kidney Disease (PKD)
definition: Genetic disorder characterized by multiple kidney cysts, detectable through imaging as multiple fluid-filled spaces replacing normal renal parenchyma.

name: Polymicrogyria
definition: Neurological malformation characterized by excessive small gyri in brain cortex, visible on MRI as abnormal cortical folding and thickening patterns.

name: Poor cardiac function
definition: Reduced ability of the heart to pump blood effectively, typically assessed through imaging techniques like echocardiography or cardiac MRI. Characterized by decreased ejection fraction and abnormal cardiac wall motion.

name: Poor image quality
definition: Radiographic images with suboptimal visual clarity, resolution, or diagnostic utility due to technical factors, patient movement, or equipment limitations.

name: Poor renal function
definition: Impaired kidney performance characterized by reduced glomerular filtration rate and compromised ability to filter waste products, often evaluated through imaging and functional studies.

name: Popliteal Artery Entrapment Syndrome
definition: Rare vascular condition where the popliteal artery is compressed or entrapped by surrounding muscular or tendinous structures, potentially causing reduced blood flow to the lower extremity.

name: Popliteal cyst
definition: Fluid-filled sac located behind the knee, typically associated with joint inflammation or underlying knee pathology, visible on ultrasound or MRI.

name: Porcelain Gallbladder
definition: Calcified gallbladder wall with extensive dystrophic calcification, typically identified on CT or X-ray imaging, often associated with chronic inflammation.

name: Porencephalic cysts
definition: Focal cerebral cavitary lesions resulting from localized brain tissue destruction, typically appearing as fluid-filled spaces on neuroimaging studies.

name: Porencephaly
definition: Congenital or acquired brain condition characterized by cerebral cortical destruction and cyst formation, typically identified through neuroimaging techniques.

name: Portal Hypertension
definition: Increased blood pressure within the portal venous system, typically assessed through imaging techniques like ultrasound or CT, often indicating underlying liver disease.

name: Portal Vein Thrombosis
definition: Blood clot formation within the portal venous system, detected through imaging modalities such as CT or ultrasound, potentially causing significant hepatic complications.

name: Positron Emission Tomography
definition: Nuclear medicine imaging technique that uses radioactive tracers to visualize metabolic processes in the body. Provides functional information about tissue metabolism and cellular activity.

name: Post-Ablation Changes (Liver/Kidney)
definition: Imaging findings following therapeutic ablation procedures in liver or kidney, characterized by treated lesion changes, potential scarring, and altered tissue appearance.

name: Post-biopsy bleed
definition: Bleeding complication occurring at the site of a medical biopsy, potentially visible on imaging studies as localized hemorrhage or hematoma.

name: Post-biopsy hematoma
definition: Localized blood collection forming at a biopsy site, typically identified through ultrasound or CT imaging as a well-defined fluid collection.

name: Post-Contrast Acute Kidney Injury (PC-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury (CI-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Nephropathy (CIN)
definition: Acute kidney injury occurring after contrast media administration during radiographic procedures, characterized by temporary reduction in renal function.

name: Post-hemorrhagic hydrocephalus
definition: Accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid within brain ventricles following hemorrhagic events, typically identified through neuroimaging techniques.

name: Post-inflammatory Strictures
definition: Narrowing of a tubular structure due to inflammatory scarring, visible on imaging as a focal luminal narrowing or irregularity. Radiological assessment helps evaluate the extent and impact of the stricture.

name: Post-operative complication
definition: Unintended medical issue arising after a surgical procedure, detectable through various imaging modalities. Radiological evaluation helps identify and characterize potential complications.

name: Post-operative fluid collection
definition: Accumulation of fluid at a surgical site, identifiable on imaging studies as a well-defined collection with specific radiographic characteristics. CT and ultrasound are key diagnostic tools.

name: Post-operative Leak (Bariatric Surgery)
definition: Unintended breach in surgical anastomosis or tissue integrity following bariatric surgery, detectable through contrast studies and cross-sectional imaging.

name: Post-operative Pancreatic Fistula (POPF) - Whipple
definition: Abnormal pancreatic fluid drainage following Whipple procedure, characterized by persistent pancreatic secretions detectable through imaging techniques.

name: Post-polypectomy bleed
definition: Bleeding complication occurring after polyp removal, identifiable through radiological studies as localized hemorrhage or contrast extravasation.

name: Post-PVE Liver Regeneration
definition: Compensatory liver tissue growth following portal vein embolization, observable through volumetric imaging studies showing increased hepatic parenchymal volume.

name: Post-radiation Fibrosis
definition: Radiation-induced tissue scarring and hardening, visible on imaging as increased tissue density and architectural distortion in irradiated regions.

name: Post-renal obstruction (hydronephrosis)
definition: Kidney swelling caused by urinary tract obstruction, characterized on imaging by dilated renal collecting systems and potential parenchymal changes.

name: Post-RFA Ablation Zone
definition: Tissue region demonstrating thermal ablation effects following radiofrequency ablation, identifiable as a distinct zone with specific imaging characteristics.

name: Post-Roux-en-Y Hernia (Peterson's Hernia)
definition: Hernia occurring at specific anatomical location following Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, detectable through cross-sectional imaging studies.

name: Post-surgical (pyloroplasty)
definition: Surgical modification of pyloric region, observable through imaging studies showing altered gastric anatomy and potential structural changes.

name: Post-surgical stricture
definition: Narrowing of a surgical site or organ due to scarring, identifiable through imaging as a focal luminal or structural constriction.

name: Post-Thrombotic Syndrome (PTS)
definition: Chronic venous insufficiency resulting from deep vein thrombosis, characterized by specific imaging findings of venous structural changes.

name: Post-traumatic Arthritis
definition: Joint degeneration occurring subsequent to traumatic injury, detectable through radiographic studies showing characteristic degenerative changes.

name: Post-traumatic syrinx
definition: A fluid-filled cavity within the spinal cord, typically resulting from trauma or spinal cord injury. Radiologically characterized by a tubular, elongated cystic lesion within the spinal cord parenchyma.

name: Posterior Fossa Hemorrhage (mimicked)
definition: Bleeding within the posterior cranial fossa, often involving the cerebellum or brainstem. Radiologically detected through CT or MRI showing hemorrhagic changes in the posterior fossa region.

name: Posterior Fossa Stroke
definition: Ischemic event affecting the blood supply to the posterior fossa structures, including the cerebellum and brainstem. Characterized on imaging by restricted diffusion and signal changes in the affected region.

name: Posterior Reversible Encephalopathy Syndrome (PRES)
definition: A reversible neurological condition characterized by vasogenic edema, typically affecting the posterior cerebral regions. Radiologically identified by symmetric white matter edema on MRI, predominantly in the parietal and occipital lobes.

name: Posterior subcapsular cataracts
definition: A type of cataract forming at the back of the lens, often associated with systemic conditions or radiation exposure. Radiologically observed as a dense opacity at the posterior lens surface.

name: Posterior Urethral Valves
definition: Congenital obstructive membrane in the male urethra causing urinary tract obstruction. Radiologically identified through voiding cystourethrography showing characteristic urethral narrowing.

name: Posterior urethral valves (males)
definition: Congenital obstructive membrane in the male urethra causing urinary tract obstruction. Radiologically identified through voiding cystourethrography showing characteristic urethral narrowing.

name: Posterolateral Corner (PLC) Injury
