definition: Ligamentous injury involving the posterolateral knee structures, including the fibular collateral ligament and popliteal tendon. Radiologically assessed through MRI showing ligament discontinuity or abnormal signal.

name: Posterolateral Corner (PLC) Knee Injuries
definition: Ligamentous injury involving the posterolateral knee structures, including the fibular collateral ligament and popliteal tendon. Radiologically assessed through MRI showing ligament discontinuity or abnormal signal.

name: Postoperative Abscess
definition: Localized infection developing after surgical intervention, characterized by fluid collection and inflammatory changes. Radiologically detected through CT or ultrasound showing fluid collection with peripheral enhancement.

name: Postpartum thyroiditis
definition: Inflammatory thyroid condition occurring in the postpartum period, characterized by transient thyroid dysfunction. Radiologically evaluated through thyroid ultrasound showing glandular changes.

name: Pott's Puffy Tumor (complication of Sinusitis)
definition: Subperiosteal abscess of the frontal bone associated with sinusitis, typically seen in children. Radiologically characterized by soft tissue swelling and bone changes on CT.

name: Pregnancy-Associated Breast Cancer
definition: Breast cancer diagnosed during pregnancy or within one year postpartum. Radiologically challenging due to physiological breast changes, typically assessed through mammography and ultrasound.

name: Pregnancy-Associated Breast Cancer (PABC)
definition: Breast cancer diagnosed during pregnancy or within one year postpartum. Radiologically challenging due to physiological breast changes, typically assessed through mammography and ultrasound.

name: Pregnancy Failure
definition: Unsuccessful pregnancy resulting in non-viable embryo or fetus. Radiologically confirmed through ultrasound showing absence of cardiac activity or appropriate gestational sac development.

name: Prenatal US
definition: Ultrasound imaging performed during pregnancy to assess fetal development, anatomy, and potential abnormalities. Provides real-time visualization of the fetus and maternal reproductive structures.

name: Presence of Ferromagnetic Implants
definition: Metallic objects within the body that can cause significant risks during MRI imaging, potentially causing tissue heating, image artifacts, or physical displacement of the implant. Requires careful screening and potential contraindication for magnetic resonance procedures.

name: Priapism (Ischemic/Low-Flow)
definition: Prolonged, painful penile erection lasting over 4 hours, characterized by reduced blood flow and potential tissue ischemia. Radiological assessment focuses on vascular evaluation and potential complications.

name: Priapism (Non-Ischemic/High-Flow)
definition: Prolonged penile erection with maintained arterial blood flow, typically caused by arterial injury or vascular malformation. Radiological evaluation involves assessing vascular integrity and potential underlying pathology.

name: Primary Adrenal Insufficiency
definition: Adrenal gland dysfunction resulting from direct destruction of the adrenal cortex, often autoimmune in nature. Radiological imaging can reveal adrenal gland atrophy or calcifications.

name: Primary Adrenal Tumor
definition: Neoplastic growth originating within the adrenal gland, which can be benign or malignant. Radiological characterization involves assessing tumor size, morphology, and potential metastatic spread.

name: Primary aldosteronism
definition: Autonomous aldosterone production by adrenal glands, leading to hormonal imbalances. Radiological evaluation focuses on identifying adrenal adenomas or hyperplasia.

name: Primary Angiitis of the Central Nervous System (PACNS)
definition: Rare inflammatory condition affecting central nervous system blood vessels, characterized by granulomatous inflammation. Radiological findings include cerebral vasculitis and potential parenchymal changes.

name: Primary Biliary Cholangitis
definition: Chronic autoimmune liver disease causing progressive destruction of bile ducts. Radiological imaging can reveal biliary tract changes and potential complications.

name: Primary Bone Lymphoma
definition: Rare malignant lymphoma primarily involving bone tissue. Radiological assessment includes identifying bone lesions, potential soft tissue involvement, and metastatic spread.

name: Primary bone tumors
definition: Neoplastic growths originating within bone tissue, which can be benign or malignant. Radiological evaluation involves detailed characterization of bone lesion morphology, margins, and potential aggressive features.

name: Primary ciliary dyskinesia
definition: Genetic disorder affecting ciliary function in respiratory and reproductive systems. Radiological findings include bronchiectasis, situs inversus, and potential chronic inflammatory changes.

name: Primary CNS Lymphoma (PCNSL)
definition: Malignant lymphoma specifically involving the central nervous system. Radiological imaging reveals characteristic brain parenchymal lesions with specific enhancement patterns.

name: Primary Hyperparathyroidism (pHPT)
definition: Endocrine disorder characterized by excessive parathyroid hormone production. Radiological assessment includes evaluating bone mineral density, potential skeletal changes, and parathyroid gland abnormalities.

name: Primary lung cancer
definition: Malignant neoplasm originating in lung tissue, with various histological subtypes. Radiological evaluation involves detailed characterization of tumor size, location, and potential metastatic spread.

name: Primary pulmonary hypertension
definition: Progressive pulmonary vascular disease characterized by increased pulmonary arterial pressure without clear underlying cause. Radiological findings include pulmonary arterial enlargement and potential right heart changes.

name: Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis
definition: A chronic liver disease characterized by progressive inflammation and scarring of bile ducts, leading to biliary strictures and potential imaging findings of irregular bile duct walls and luminal narrowing.

name: Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis (PSC)
definition: A chronic liver disease characterized by progressive inflammation and scarring of bile ducts, leading to biliary strictures and potential imaging findings of irregular bile duct walls and luminal narrowing.

name: Probably Benign Breast Lesions (BI-RADS 3)
definition: Breast lesions with a low probability of malignancy (less than 2% risk), typically appearing as stable, well-defined masses on mammography and recommended for short-interval follow-up.

name: Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML)
definition: A rare viral brain infection causing demyelination, typically seen in immunocompromised patients with characteristic multifocal white matter lesions on MRI.

name: Progressive Supranuclear Palsy
definition: A rare neurodegenerative disorder characterized by progressive brain cell damage, presenting with distinctive midbrain atrophy and specific movement disorders on neuroimaging.

name: Progressive Supranuclear Palsy (PSP)
definition: A rare neurodegenerative disorder characterized by progressive brain cell damage, presenting with distinctive midbrain atrophy and specific movement disorders on neuroimaging.

name: Prolonged fasting
definition: A metabolic state resulting from extended periods without food intake, potentially causing changes in metabolic imaging studies and affecting diagnostic interpretation.

name: Pronator teres syndrome
definition: A compression neuropathy of the median nerve as it passes through the pronator teres muscle, potentially visible through soft tissue changes on advanced imaging.

name: Prostate Abscess
definition: A localized collection of pus within the prostate gland, typically appearing as a complex, heterogeneous fluid collection on imaging studies.

name: Prostate Cancer
definition: A malignant tumor of the prostate gland, typically visualized on multiparametric MRI with characteristic signal changes, suspicious lesions, and potential extracapsular extension.

name: Prostate Cancer (Adenocarcinoma)
definition: A malignant tumor of the prostate gland, typically visualized on multiparametric MRI with characteristic signal changes, suspicious lesions, and potential extracapsular extension.

name: Prostate Cancer (PCa)
definition: A malignant tumor of the prostate gland, typically visualized on multiparametric MRI with characteristic signal changes, suspicious lesions, and potential extracapsular extension.

name: Prostate cancer with necrosis
definition: A prostate cancer variant characterized by areas of cellular death within the tumor, typically appearing as heterogeneous regions with variable signal intensity on imaging studies.

name: Prostate Lesion (PI-RADS >=3)
definition: Prostate lesions with moderate to high suspicion of malignancy on PI-RADS scoring system, requiring further investigation and potential biopsy.

name: Prostatic Abscess
definition: A localized collection of pus within the prostate gland, typically appearing as a complex, heterogeneous fluid collection on imaging studies.

name: Prostatitis
definition: Inflammation of the prostate gland that can be acute or chronic, often presenting with urinary symptoms and potential imaging findings of glandular swelling or abnormal signal intensity on MRI.

name: Prosthetic Device Infection (e.g., hip/knee replacements)
definition: Infection involving an implanted medical device such as a hip or knee replacement, characterized by potential radiographic signs of soft tissue inflammation, bone changes, and implant loosening.

name: Prosthetic Joint Infection
definition: Infection occurring in an artificial joint replacement, typically detected through radiographic evidence of bone destruction, soft tissue changes, and potential implant loosening or migration.

name: Prosthetic Joint Infection (PJI)
definition: Infection occurring in an artificial joint replacement, typically detected through radiographic evidence of bone destruction, soft tissue changes, and potential implant loosening or migration.

name: Prosthetic joint loosening
definition: Radiographic finding of decreased bone-implant interface integrity in joint replacements, characterized by increased radiolucent zones and potential implant migration.

name: Proximal obstruction
definition: Blockage or obstruction occurring at the beginning or nearest point of a tubular structure, potentially visible on imaging studies as a point of narrowing or complete occlusion.

name: Proximal Tubal Obstruction (PTO)
definition: Blockage in the proximal segment of the fallopian tube, detectable through hysterosalpingography or other imaging techniques, potentially causing fertility issues.

name: Pseudo-Jones (Dancer's) Fracture
definition: Avulsion fracture of the base of the fifth metatarsal, typically near the styloid process, often seen in athletes and dancers, visible on radiographic imaging.

name: Pseudo-Jones Fracture
definition: Avulsion fracture of the base of the fifth metatarsal, typically near the styloid process, often seen in athletes and dancers, visible on radiographic imaging.

name: Pseudo-obstruction
definition: Clinical condition mimicking intestinal obstruction without actual mechanical blockage, potentially detectable through radiographic studies showing dilated bowel segments.

name: Pseudoaneurysm
definition: Localized blood-filled outpouching adjacent to an artery, appearing as a contained blood collection without complete vessel wall integrity on imaging studies.

name: Pseudoaneurysm (PSA)
definition: Localized blood-filled outpouching adjacent to an artery, appearing as a contained blood collection without complete vessel wall integrity on imaging studies.

name: Pseudoaneurysms
definition: Localized blood-filled outpouchings adjacent to arteries, appearing as contained blood collections without complete vessel wall integrity on imaging studies.

name: Pseudoangiomatous Stromal Hyperplasia (PASH)
definition: Benign breast lesion characterized by proliferation of stromal tissue, typically identified on mammography or ultrasound as a non-mass-like breast tissue change.

name: Pseudocirrhosis
definition: Radiographic appearance mimicking liver cirrhosis without actual underlying chronic liver disease, characterized by nodular liver contour and altered parenchymal texture.

name: Pseudocirrhosis (Metastatic breast cancer)
definition: A radiological finding in metastatic breast cancer where liver appears cirrhosis-like with nodular contour and architectural distortion. Characterized by diffuse liver involvement mimicking cirrhotic changes on imaging studies.

name: Pseudocyst
definition: A fluid-filled, non-inflammatory collection typically occurring in pancreas or other organs, characterized by well-defined walls without true epithelial lining. Radiologically appears as a round or oval fluid collection with distinct margins.

name: Pseudodefect of the Capitellum
definition: A radiographic appearance of a focal defect in the capitellum of the humerus that mimics a true bone lesion but represents a normal variant or imaging artifact.

name: Pseudomyxoma Peritonei (PMP)
definition: A rare condition characterized by widespread mucinous tumor implants in the peritoneal cavity, typically originating from appendiceal tumors. Radiologically presents as multiple gelatinous masses with peritoneal spread.

name: PSMA PET
definition: Prostate-Specific Membrane Antigen Positron Emission Tomography, a specialized molecular imaging technique for prostate cancer detection and staging.

name: PSMA PET/CT
definition: Combined PET and CT imaging using PSMA radiotracer, providing both functional and anatomical information for prostate cancer evaluation.

name: Psoas Abscess
definition: An infection causing fluid collection and inflammation within the psoas muscle, typically visible on CT or MRI as a complex fluid collection with surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Psoriatic arthritis
definition: An inflammatory arthritis associated with psoriasis, characterized by joint inflammation and potential bone erosions visible on radiographic imaging.

name: Psoriatic Arthritis (PsA)
definition: An inflammatory arthritis associated with psoriasis, characterized by joint inflammation and potential bone erosions visible on radiographic imaging.

name: Psychiatric Disorders
definition: Mental health conditions potentially affecting brain structure and function, detectable through advanced neuroimaging techniques like MRI and functional brain scans.

name: Puberty Disorders (Delayed Puberty)
definition: A condition of late onset of puberty, potentially revealing underlying endocrine or developmental abnormalities through hormonal and radiological assessments.

name: Puberty Disorders (Precocious Puberty)
definition: A condition of early onset of puberty, potentially revealing underlying endocrine or developmental abnormalities through hormonal and radiological assessments.

name: Pudendal Neuralgia
definition: A chronic pain condition affecting the pudendal nerve, potentially requiring advanced imaging to rule out structural causes or nerve compression.

name: Pulmonary alveolar proteinosis
definition: A rare lung disorder characterized by abnormal accumulation of lipoproteic material in alveoli, visible on chest radiographs as diffuse, ground-glass opacities.

name: Pulmonary Artery Growth Abnormality
definition: Congenital or acquired abnormalities in pulmonary artery development or morphology, detectable through chest imaging techniques.

name: Pulmonary Aspiration
definition: Inhalation of foreign material into the lungs, visible on chest radiographs as focal or diffuse infiltrates, consolidation, or atelectasis.

name: Pulmonary edema
definition: Accumulation of fluid in lung interstitial and alveolar spaces, appearing on radiographs as diffuse, bilateral opacities with potential air bronchograms.

name: Pulmonary edema (from PDA)
definition: Accumulation of fluid in lung tissue due to left-sided heart failure, typically appearing as bilateral symmetric opacities on chest radiographs. Radiologically characterized by increased interstitial and alveolar markings.

name: Pulmonary Embolism
definition: Blockage of pulmonary arterial blood flow by a blood clot, typically appearing as wedge-shaped peripheral opacities or filling defects on CT pulmonary angiography. Radiographically associated with perfusion defects and potential lung infarction.

name: Pulmonary Embolism (PE)
definition: Blockage of pulmonary arterial blood flow by a blood clot, typically appearing as wedge-shaped peripheral opacities or filling defects on CT pulmonary angiography. Radiographically associated with perfusion defects and potential lung infarction.

name: Pulmonary fibrosis
definition: Progressive scarring and thickening of lung interstitial tissue, radiographically characterized by reticular, linear, or honeycomb patterns with reduced lung volumes.

name: Pulmonary Hamartoma
definition: Benign tumor-like malformation of lung tissue composed of normal mature cellular elements, typically appearing as a well-defined, solitary nodule on chest imaging.

name: Pulmonary Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within lung tissue or airways, radiographically presenting as ground-glass opacities, consolidations, or diffuse alveolar infiltrates depending on severity.

name: Pulmonary hypertension
definition: Increased blood pressure in pulmonary arterial circulation, radiographically characterized by enlarged pulmonary arteries, right ventricular enlargement, and potential secondary lung changes.

name: Pulmonary Hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment or incomplete lung tissue formation, radiographically demonstrating reduced lung volume, abnormal lung architecture, and potential associated congenital anomalies.

name: Pulmonary infarction
definition: Area of lung tissue death due to compromised blood supply, typically appearing as wedge-shaped peripheral consolidation on chest radiographs or CT scans.

name: Pulmonary Interstitial Emphysema
definition: Abnormal air accumulation in lung interstitial spaces, typically seen in premature infants, radiographically presenting as cystic lucencies and air tracking along bronchovascular structures.

name: Pulmonary Nodule
definition: Small, localized round opacity in lung tissue, typically less than 3 cm in diameter, which may represent various pathological processes like granuloma, metastasis, or benign tumor.

name: Pulmonary Nodules
definition: Multiple small, localized round opacities in lung tissue, typically less than 3 cm in diameter, which may represent various pathological processes like granulomas, metastases, or benign tumors.

name: Pulmonary veno-occlusive disease
definition: Rare disorder characterized by progressive obstruction of pulmonary veins, radiographically showing diffuse interstitial changes, ground-glass opacities, and potential pulmonary hypertension.

name: Pulmonic Stenosis (PS)
definition: Narrowing of pulmonary valve causing obstruction to right ventricular outflow, radiographically characterized by post-stenotic dilatation of pulmonary artery and potential right ventricular hypertrophy.

name: Pure ischemic processes
definition: Pathological conditions resulting from reduced blood supply to tissue, typically manifesting as areas of decreased perfusion or tissue necrosis on imaging studies.

name: Purulent peritonitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the peritoneum characterized by the presence of pus within the abdominal cavity. Radiologically, it presents with fluid collections, inflammatory changes, and potential loculations.

name: Pus
definition: Thick, whitish-yellow fluid containing dead white blood cells, tissue debris, and bacteria. In radiology, pus appears as a fluid collection with specific density and potential air-fluid levels.

name: PXA (Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma)
definition: Rare, low-grade brain tumor typically occurring in children and young adults, characterized by pleomorphic cells with xanthomatous features. Radiologically identified through specific MRI and CT imaging characteristics.

name: Pyelonephritis
definition: Bacterial infection of the kidney involving inflammation of the renal pelvis and parenchyma. Radiological findings include renal swelling, perinephric stranding, and potential abscess formation.

name: Pyloric stenosis
definition: A radiographic finding of narrowing or obstruction of the pyloric channel, typically visualized on upper GI series or CT. Most commonly associated with infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis.

name: Pylorospasm
definition: Involuntary spasm of the pyloric muscle causing obstruction of gastric emptying. Radiologically characterized by narrowing or obstruction of the pyloric region.

name: Pyogenic abscess
definition: Localized collection of pus resulting from bacterial infection. Radiologically identified as a well-defined fluid collection with surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Pyonephrosis
definition: Severe kidney infection with pus accumulation and obstruction of the urinary tract. Radiological findings include renal enlargement, fluid collections, and potential hydronephrosis.

name: Pyonephrosis (Infected obstruction)
definition: Severe kidney infection with obstruction, characterized by pus accumulation and potential destruction of renal tissue. Radiologically shows significant renal damage and inflammatory changes.

name: Quadriceps tendinopathy
definition: Degenerative condition of the quadriceps tendon characterized by structural changes and potential partial or complete tears. Radiologically assessed through ultrasound and MRI.

name: Quench hazards
definition: Potential safety risks associated with sudden cooling or shutdown of MRI equipment's magnetic field. Radiological safety concern during imaging procedures.

name: Radial Head Fracture
definition: Fracture involving the proximal radius at the elbow joint. Radiologically identified through X-ray and CT imaging, showing disruption of the radial head.

name: Radial Scar
definition: Benign breast lesion with radiating scar-like appearance on imaging. Characterized by central stellate configuration with surrounding architectural distortion.

name: Radial Scar / Complex Sclerosing Lesion (CSL)
definition: Complex breast lesion with stellate configuration and multiple architectural distortions. Radiologically appears as a complex sclerosing lesion with potential malignancy risk.

name: Radiation-Induced Bone Changes
definition: Structural and functional alterations in bone tissue resulting from radiation exposure. Radiologically characterized by density changes, sclerosis, and potential fracture risk.

name: Radiation-Induced Breast Changes
definition: Morphological and structural modifications in breast tissue following radiation therapy. Radiologically observed as tissue density changes, fibrosis, and potential architectural distortions.

name: Radiation-Induced Cancers
definition: Cancers that develop as a result of exposure to ionizing radiation, detectable through various imaging modalities. These malignancies can occur years after radiation exposure and are characterized by specific radiological features.

name: Radiation-induced cardiotoxicity
definition: Damage to cardiac tissues caused by radiation therapy, observable through cardiac imaging techniques. Characterized by progressive vascular and myocardial changes that can lead to functional impairment.

name: Radiation-induced fibrosis (cardiac)
definition: Progressive scarring and hardening of cardiac tissues following radiation exposure, detectable through cardiac imaging. Results in reduced cardiac compliance and potential functional impairment.

name: Radiation-Induced Lung Changes
definition: Structural and functional alterations in lung tissue resulting from radiation exposure, identifiable through chest radiographs and CT scans. Can range from acute inflammatory changes to chronic fibrotic processes.

name: Radiation-induced osteochondroma
definition: Benign bone and cartilage tumor that develops in radiation-exposed tissues, typically detectable through radiographic imaging. Characterized by abnormal bone and cartilage growth at radiation-affected sites.

name: Radiation-induced xerostomia
definition: Radiation-induced dry mouth condition affecting salivary gland function, observable through imaging techniques. Characterized by reduced salivary gland volume and function.

name: Radiation Enteritis (Acute)
definition: Immediate inflammatory response in intestinal tissues following radiation exposure, detectable through gastrointestinal imaging. Characterized by acute mucosal inflammation and potential tissue damage.

name: Radiation Enteritis (Chronic)
definition: Long-term progressive intestinal damage following radiation exposure, identifiable through gastrointestinal imaging. Involves fibrosis, vascular changes, and potential structural alterations.

name: Radiation necrosis
definition: Localized tissue death resulting from radiation exposure, detectable through various imaging modalities. Characterized by cell death, tissue destruction, and potential structural changes.

name: Radiation Pneumonitis
definition: Acute inflammatory response in lung tissue following radiation exposure, observable through chest radiographs and CT scans. Characterized by pulmonary inflammation and potential functional changes.

name: Radiation Sickness
definition: Systemic response to high-dose radiation exposure, with potential radiological manifestations across multiple organ systems. Characterized by acute cellular damage and potential multi-organ dysfunction.

name: Radiation Therapy Changes (General)
definition: Comprehensive imaging-detectable modifications in tissues resulting from radiation therapy. Encompasses structural, functional, and cellular alterations across different organ systems.

name: Radicular Pain
definition: Nerve root-related pain typically associated with nerve compression or inflammation, detectable through neuroimaging techniques. Characterized by specific radiological nerve root involvement.

name: Radiography
definition: Medical imaging technique using ionizing radiation to create two-dimensional images of internal body structures. Provides detailed visualization of bones, soft tissues, and potential pathological changes.

name: Ranula
definition: Mucus-containing cyst typically occurring in salivary glands, detectable through imaging techniques. Characterized by fluid-filled lesion with specific radiological appearance.

name: Rapid Gastric Emptying
definition: Accelerated gastric emptying process resulting in rapid food transit through the stomach, potentially detectable through gastrointestinal imaging studies. Characterized by altered gastric motility.

name: Rasmussen Aneurysm
definition: A rare mycotic aneurysm typically occurring in the pulmonary artery, often associated with tuberculosis and characterized by localized vessel wall weakening and potential rupture. Radiologically, it appears as a focal outpouching or dilation of the pulmonary vasculature.

name: Rasmussen Encephalitis (RE)
definition: A rare, progressive neurological disorder characterized by chronic inflammation of one cerebral hemisphere, causing seizures and neurological deterioration. Radiologically, it presents as progressive hemispheric atrophy and signal changes on MRI.

name: Rathke cleft cyst
definition: A benign cystic lesion arising from embryonic remnants of the Rathke's pouch, typically located in the sellar or suprasellar region. On imaging, it appears as a well-defined cystic mass near the pituitary gland.

name: Rathke Cleft Cyst (RCC)
definition: A benign cystic lesion arising from embryonic remnants of the Rathke's pouch, typically located in the sellar or suprasellar region. On imaging, it appears as a well-defined cystic mass near the pituitary gland.

name: RBUS
definition: Renal Ultrasound, a non-invasive imaging technique to evaluate kidney structure, size, and potential abnormalities.

name: Reactive Adenopathy
definition: Lymph node enlargement in response to inflammatory or infectious processes, characterized by increased nodal size and altered signal characteristics on imaging studies.

name: Reactive Adenopathy (Hyperplasia)
definition: Lymph node enlargement characterized by increased cellular proliferation in response to inflammatory or infectious stimuli, typically showing uniform nodal enlargement on imaging.

name: Reactive arthritis
definition: An inflammatory joint condition triggered by infection, characterized by joint inflammation and potential radiographic changes such as soft tissue swelling, periarticular osteopenia, and joint space narrowing.

name: Reactive Arthritis (ReA)
definition: An inflammatory joint condition triggered by infection, characterized by joint inflammation and potential radiographic changes such as soft tissue swelling, periarticular osteopenia, and joint space narrowing.

name: Reactive lymphadenopathy
definition: Lymph node enlargement in response to inflammatory or infectious processes, characterized by increased nodal size and altered signal characteristics on imaging studies.

name: Recent surgery
definition: A post-procedural condition that may cause temporary imaging changes, including soft tissue swelling, altered tissue density, and potential surgical markers or clips.

name: Rectal Cancer
definition: A malignant neoplasm of the rectum, typically appearing as a mass, wall thickening, or irregular soft tissue lesion on CT, MRI, and other cross-sectional imaging studies.

name: Recurrence
definition: The reappearance of a previously treated disease or tumor, detectable through various imaging modalities showing new or progressive lesions at the original or different anatomical sites.

name: Recurrence of Breast Cancer
definition: The reappearance of breast cancer after initial treatment, detectable through mammography, ultrasound, or cross-sectional imaging showing new or progressive breast lesions.

name: Recurrent Acute Pancreatitis
definition: Repeated episodes of pancreatic inflammation characterized by imaging findings such as pancreatic parenchymal changes, peripancreatic fat stranding, and potential ductal irregularities.

name: Recurrent Pyogenic Cholangitis
definition: A chronic inflammatory condition of the biliary tract characterized by recurrent cholangitis and potential imaging findings of bile duct strictures, stones, and inflammatory changes.

name: Reduced birth weight
definition: A condition where an infant's birth weight is below the 10th percentile for gestational age. In radiology, this may be assessed through fetal ultrasound measurements and growth tracking.

name: Refractory Ascites
definition: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity that does not respond to standard medical treatment. Radiological imaging like CT and ultrasound can help assess the underlying cause and volume of ascites.

name: Refractory Sprue
definition: A malabsorption syndrome characterized by persistent diarrhea and nutritional deficiencies that do not respond to standard treatments. Radiological studies can help evaluate intestinal changes and complications.

name: Regenerating Nodules
definition: Nodular liver lesions that represent areas of hepatic tissue regeneration, often seen in chronic liver disease. Radiological imaging helps characterize these nodules and distinguish them from potential malignancies.

name: Regenerative Nodule
definition: A single nodular area of regenerative hepatic tissue, typically associated with chronic liver disease. Radiological assessment helps evaluate size, characteristics, and potential malignant transformation risk.

name: Rejection
definition: An immune-mediated response against transplanted organ or tissue, detectable through various imaging modalities that show structural changes or functional alterations.

name: Renal abscess
definition: A localized collection of pus within the kidney, typically identified through CT or ultrasound imaging showing a fluid-filled cavity with surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Renal activity
definition: Functional assessment of kidney performance through various imaging techniques that evaluate blood flow, filtration, and metabolic processes.

name: Renal Anomalies
definition: Congenital variations or structural abnormalities of the kidney detected through imaging techniques like ultrasound, CT, or MRI.

name: Renal artery aneurysm
definition: A localized dilation of the renal artery wall, typically identified through CT angiography or MR angiography, which can pose risks of rupture or thrombosis.

name: Renal Artery Dissection
definition: A tear or separation within the layers of the renal artery wall, typically diagnosed through CT angiography or MR angiography, which can compromise blood flow.

name: Renal artery occlusion
definition: Complete blockage of blood flow in the renal artery, detected through vascular imaging techniques that show interruption of blood supply to the kidney.

name: Renal Artery Stenosis
definition: Narrowing of the renal artery that can reduce blood flow to the kidney, typically identified through CT angiography, MR angiography, or ultrasound.

name: Renal Artery Stenosis (RAS)
definition: Narrowing of the renal artery that can reduce blood flow to the kidney, typically identified through CT angiography, MR angiography, or ultrasound.

name: Renal artery thrombosis
definition: Formation of a blood clot within the renal artery, detected through vascular imaging techniques that show interruption or reduced blood flow.

name: Renal Calculi
definition: Stone or mineral deposit within the kidney that can be visualized on radiographic imaging. These calculi appear as dense, hyperattenuating structures on CT scans and can cause obstruction or urinary tract complications.

name: Renal Cell Carcinoma
definition: Malignant kidney tumor originating from renal tubular epithelial cells, typically appearing as a solid, enhancing mass on CT or MRI. Radiographic features include heterogeneous enhancement and potential vascular invasion.

name: Renal cell carcinoma (especially fat-poor AML)
definition: Rare renal tumor with minimal fat content, characterized by subtle radiographic features that can mimic other renal masses. Typically requires careful evaluation using multimodal imaging techniques.

name: Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC)
definition: Malignant kidney tumor originating from renal tubular epithelial cells, typically appearing as a solid, enhancing mass on CT or MRI. Radiographic features include heterogeneous enhancement and potential vascular invasion.

name: Renal Cell Carcinoma with venous extension
definition: Renal cell carcinoma with tumor extension into the renal vein or inferior vena cava, visible on imaging as tumor thrombus extending through venous structures.

name: Renal cyst
definition: Fluid-filled sac within the kidney, typically appearing as a well-defined, round, anechoic structure on ultrasound and CT imaging. Most are benign and require minimal follow-up.

name: Renal Cysts
definition: Fluid-filled sacs within the kidney, typically appearing as well-defined, round, anechoic structures on ultrasound and CT imaging. Most are benign and require minimal follow-up.

name: Renal Cysts (Bosniak II)
definition: Simple renal cyst classified in the Bosniak system as having minimal complexity, with thin walls and no internal septations or calcifications. Generally considered benign on radiographic evaluation.

name: Renal cysts (Complex)
definition: Renal cysts with more complex features, including thick walls, internal septations, or calcifications, requiring careful radiographic assessment to rule out malignancy.

name: Renal Doppler Ultrasound
definition: Ultrasound imaging of kidney blood flow and vascular structures using Doppler technology. Assesses renal hemodynamics and potential vascular pathologies.

name: Renal Failure
definition: Impaired kidney function detectable through various imaging findings, such as reduced kidney size, parenchymal thinning, or altered renal vascularity on CT, ultrasound, or nuclear medicine studies.

name: Renal infarct
definition: Area of reduced blood flow or tissue death within the kidney, appearing as a wedge-shaped region of decreased enhancement on contrast-enhanced CT imaging.

name: Renal infarction
definition: Process of tissue death within the kidney due to reduced blood flow, appearing as a wedge-shaped region of decreased enhancement on contrast-enhanced CT imaging.

name: Renal Injury
definition: Damage to kidney tissue from trauma or other causes, detectable through various radiographic findings such as contusions, lacerations, or vascular disruption.

name: Renal Lymphoma (Secondary)
definition: Secondary lymphoma involvement of the kidney, typically appearing as multiple hypoattenuating lesions or masses on CT and MRI imaging.

name: Renal Oncocytoma
definition: Benign renal tumor composed of oncocytes, appearing as a well-defined, homogeneous mass on imaging with characteristic radiographic features distinct from renal cell carcinoma.

name: Renal Osteodystrophy
synonyms: Chronic kidney disease-mineral and bone disorder (CKD-MBD)
definition: A metabolic bone disorder in chronic kidney disease characterized by abnormal bone mineral metabolism and structural changes. Radiographically presents with bone demineralization, cystic lesions, and skeletal deformities.

name: Renal Papillary Necrosis (RPN)
definition: A condition of kidney tissue death involving the renal papillae, typically caused by ischemia, diabetes, or analgesic abuse. Radiographic findings include papillary calcifications and architectural distortion.

name: Renal Scarring (Reflux Nephropathy)
definition: Permanent kidney tissue damage resulting from recurrent urinary tract infections or vesicoureteral reflux. Radiographically characterized by irregular kidney contours, reduced kidney size, and focal scarring.

name: Renal stone
definition: A radiographic finding of a calcified or dense structure within the kidney or urinary tract, detectable on X-ray, CT, or ultrasound. Can cause urinary obstruction and associated complications.

name: Renal Stones
definition: Solid crystalline deposits formed in the kidney that can be visualized through various imaging modalities. Radiographic techniques like CT are highly sensitive in detecting renal calculi.

name: Renal stones (Nephrolithiasis)
definition: Medical term for kidney stones representing mineral and salt deposits within the urinary tract. Radiographically identifiable through their characteristic density and location.

name: Renal transplant rejection
definition: Immune-mediated damage to a transplanted kidney, characterized by inflammatory changes and potential graft dysfunction. Radiographic findings include increased kidney size, reduced perfusion, and potential structural alterations.

name: Renal Transplant Viability/Complications
definition: Assessment of transplanted kidney's functional status and potential complications through imaging techniques. Radiographic evaluation focuses on vascular patency, structural integrity, and signs of rejection or infection.

name: Renal Trauma
definition: Physical injury to the kidney from external forces, potentially causing vascular, parenchymal, or collecting system damage. Radiographic assessment using CT or ultrasound helps grade injury severity.

name: Renal Vein Anomalies (Circumaortic or Retroaortic Left Renal Vein)
definition: Anatomical variations in renal venous drainage, such as circumaortic or retroaortic left renal vein configurations. Radiographic identification is crucial for surgical and interventional planning.

name: Renal vein thrombosis
definition: Formation of blood clots within the renal venous system, potentially causing kidney dysfunction. Radiographic diagnosis involves contrast-enhanced CT or venography.

name: Renal Vein Thrombosis (RVT)
definition: Formation of blood clots within the renal venous system, potentially causing kidney dysfunction. Radiographic diagnosis involves contrast-enhanced CT or venography.

name: Renovascular Hypertension (RVH)
definition: High blood pressure caused by renal artery stenosis or kidney-related vascular abnormalities. Radiographic techniques like angiography help identify underlying vascular pathologies.

name: Residual shunts
definition: Persistent abnormal vascular connections or blood flow pathways following surgical intervention. Radiographic detection typically involves specialized vascular imaging techniques.

name: Respiratory Distress Syndrome
definition: Acute lung condition in newborns characterized by insufficient surfactant production, leading to alveolar collapse. Chest radiographs show characteristic ground-glass opacity and reduced lung volumes.

name: Respiratory Distress Syndrome (RDS)
definition: Acute lung condition in newborns characterized by insufficient surfactant production, leading to alveolar collapse. Chest radiographs show characteristic ground-glass opacity and reduced lung volumes.

name: Respiratory Distress Syndrome (RDS) / Hyaline Membrane Disease (HMD)
definition: A neonatal lung disorder characterized by insufficient surfactant production, leading to alveolar collapse and respiratory failure. On chest radiographs, it presents with diffuse ground-glass opacities and air bronchograms.

name: Retained products of conception
definition: Remaining pregnancy tissue within the uterus after incomplete miscarriage or abortion, detectable on ultrasound or CT as soft tissue density. Can lead to potential complications if not completely evacuated.

name: Retained Secretions
definition: Accumulation of mucus or other bodily fluids in airways or tissues, potentially visible on imaging as increased density or localized fluid collections. Can indicate underlying infection or inflammatory process.

name: Retinal Angioma (Retinal Hemangioblastoma)
definition: Rare vascular tumor of the retina characterized by abnormal blood vessel growth, typically appearing as well-defined, contrast-enhancing lesions on specialized retinal imaging studies.

name: Retinal Detachment
definition: Separation of retinal layers from underlying tissue, visible on specialized ophthalmologic imaging as a raised or undulating retinal surface. Can be detected through ultrasound, optical coherence tomography, or fundus photography.

name: Retinoblastoma
definition: Malignant pediatric eye tumor originating in the retina, typically appearing as a calcified mass on CT or MRI scans. Often detected through characteristic intraocular calcifications.

name: Retinoblastoma (RB)
definition: Malignant pediatric eye tumor originating in the retina, typically appearing as a calcified mass on CT or MRI scans. Often detected through characteristic intraocular calcifications.

name: Retrolisthesis
definition: Posterior displacement of a vertebral body relative to the adjacent vertebra, visible on lateral spine radiographs as abnormal posterior positioning of vertebral segments.

name: Retroperitoneal fibrosis
definition: Inflammatory condition causing fibrotic tissue proliferation in the retroperitoneal space, typically appearing as soft tissue density with potential encasement of surrounding structures on CT imaging.

name: Retroperitoneal Fibrosis (RPF)
definition: Inflammatory condition causing fibrotic tissue proliferation in the retroperitoneal space, typically appearing as soft tissue density with potential encasement of surrounding structures on CT imaging.

name: Retroperitoneal Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within the retroperitoneal space, typically appearing as fluid density or heterogeneous collections on CT scans. Can result from trauma, vascular disorders, or spontaneous bleeding.

name: Retroperitoneal Hemorrhage (RPH)
definition: Bleeding within the retroperitoneal space, typically appearing as fluid density or heterogeneous collections on CT scans. Can result from trauma, vascular disorders, or spontaneous bleeding.

name: Retroperitoneal Hemorrhage (Wunderlich syndrome)
definition: Spontaneous bleeding into the retroperitoneal space, typically associated with renal pathology, appearing as fluid density or heterogeneous collections on CT scans.

name: Retropharyngeal abscess
definition: Deep neck space infection located behind the pharynx, typically appearing as a fluid collection or soft tissue swelling on CT or MRI with potential airway compromise.

name: Retropharyngeal Cellulitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the retropharyngeal soft tissues without definitive abscess formation, characterized by soft tissue edema and potential contrast enhancement on imaging studies.

name: Retropharyngeal Phlegmon
definition: An inflammatory process in the retropharyngeal soft tissues characterized by fluid collection and edema without definitive abscess formation. On imaging, it appears as soft tissue thickening and increased density in the retropharyngeal space.

name: Reversible Cerebral Vasoconstriction Syndrome (RCVS)
definition: A reversible cerebrovascular disorder characterized by segmental narrowing of cerebral arteries, typically presenting with thunderclap headaches and potential stroke-like symptoms. Imaging reveals multifocal, segmental arterial constrictions in cerebral vasculature.

name: RF-induced burns
definition: Thermal injuries caused by radiofrequency energy during medical procedures, resulting in localized tissue damage. Radiologically evident as areas of skin or tissue burn with potential associated inflammation.

name: Rhabdomyosarcoma
definition: An aggressive soft tissue sarcoma originating from primitive muscle cells, commonly occurring in children. Radiologically appears as a soft tissue mass with heterogeneous enhancement and potential infiltrative characteristics.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
definition: A chronic inflammatory autoimmune disorder causing progressive joint destruction and deformity. Radiographic findings include joint space narrowing, periarticular osteopenia, and erosive changes.

name: Rhombencephalosynapsis
definition: A rare congenital brain malformation characterized by fusion of cerebellar hemispheres and abnormal midline neural structures. Radiologically identified through distinctive cerebellar and brain midline anatomical variations.

name: Rib notching
definition: A radiographic sign of localized indentation or erosion of the ribs, often indicating chronic underlying pathological processes like vascular malformations or chronic lung disease.

name: Rickets
definition: A metabolic bone disease caused by vitamin D deficiency, characterized by inadequate mineralization of growing bone. Radiographic findings include metaphyseal cupping, fraying, and decreased bone density.

name: Rickets (osteopenia)
definition: A condition of reduced bone mineral density associated with decreased bone mass and increased fracture risk. Radiologically characterized by decreased bone density and trabecular thinning.

name: Right-to-left shunt
definition: A pathological condition where deoxygenated blood bypasses normal pulmonary gas exchange, resulting in systemic arterial hypoxemia. Radiologically observed through abnormal vascular shunting patterns.

name: Right heart failure
definition: A cardiac condition where the right ventricle cannot effectively pump blood to the lungs, leading to systemic venous congestion. Radiographic findings include cardiac chamber enlargement and potential pulmonary vascular changes.

name: Right Heart Failure (CHF)
definition: Chronic heart failure specifically involving right ventricular dysfunction, characterized by impaired cardiac output and venous congestion. Radiologically evident through cardiac chamber enlargement and vascular changes.

name: Right Lobe Liver Lesion
definition: A focal hepatic abnormality located specifically in the right liver lobe, which may represent various pathological processes such as tumors, cysts, or inflammatory lesions.

name: Ring-enhancing brain lesion
definition: A brain lesion characterized by a central hypodense or necrotic core surrounded by a peripheral contrast-enhancing rim. Commonly associated with infections, tumors, or inflammatory processes.

name: Ring-enhancing lesion
definition: A radiographic appearance of a lesion with a central non-enhancing area surrounded by a ring of contrast enhancement. Commonly seen in brain lesions like metastases or abscesses.

name: Rosette-forming Glioneuronal Tumor (RGNT)
definition: A rare, low-grade glioneuronal brain tumor with distinctive histological rosette formations. Radiologically appears as a well-circumscribed, typically supratentorial brain lesion.

name: Rotator cuff tear
definition: A partial or complete disruption of the rotator cuff tendons in the shoulder, typically involving supraspinatus tendon. Radiologically identified through ultrasound or MRI showing tendon discontinuity or abnormal morphology.

name: Rubella
definition: Viral infection causing distinctive rash and potential congenital abnormalities. In radiology, can show characteristic calcifications in fetal brain and abnormal bone development.

name: Ruptured Implant
definition: Radiographic evidence of breast implant disruption or breach of implant integrity. Imaging can reveal implant rupture, leakage, or deformation.

name: RVT
definition: Radiological finding of retinal vascular thrombosis, typically observed through vascular imaging techniques showing vessel occlusion or blockage.

name: Sacrococcygeal Teratoma (SCT)
definition: Congenital tumor arising at the base of the tailbone, visible on imaging as a complex mass with multiple tissue components. Radiographic evaluation is crucial for diagnosis and staging.

name: Sacroiliitis
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting sacroiliac joints, typically visible on radiographs and MRI as joint space narrowing, erosions, or sclerotic changes.

name: Salivary gland carcinoma
definition: Malignant tumor originating in salivary gland tissue, characterized by various radiographic appearances depending on tumor type and stage.

name: Salivary Gland Oncocytoma
definition: Benign salivary gland tumor composed of oncocytes, typically appearing as a well-defined mass on imaging studies.

name: Salivary gland tumor
definition: Neoplastic growth occurring in salivary gland tissue, which can be benign or malignant and requires radiological characterization.

name: Salivary Gland Tumors
definition: Neoplastic growths in salivary glands, encompassing various types of tumors with different radiographic characteristics.

name: Salter-Harris Fracture Type I
definition: Pediatric growth plate fracture involving separation of the growth plate from the metaphysis, typically seen in children's long bone radiographs.

name: Salter-Harris Fracture Type II
definition: Pediatric growth plate fracture involving metaphyseal fragment separation, commonly observed in pediatric orthopedic radiographic studies.

name: Salter-Harris Fracture Type IV
definition: Complex pediatric growth plate fracture involving articular surface and growth plate, requiring detailed radiographic assessment.

name: Salter-Harris Fractures (Pediatric Growth Plate Injuries)
definition: Classification of pediatric growth plate injuries with varying patterns of bone and cartilage involvement, crucial for radiological interpretation.

name: Sarcoidosis
definition: Multisystem inflammatory disorder characterized by granuloma formation, often showing distinctive radiographic findings in lungs, lymph nodes, and other organs.

name: Sarcoma
definition: Malignant tumor arising from connective tissue, with varied radiographic appearances depending on tissue of origin and tumor characteristics.

name: SBFT
definition: Small Bowel Follow-Through, a radiographic examination using contrast material to visualize the small intestine's anatomy and potential pathological conditions.

name: Scaphoid Fracture
definition: Fracture of the scaphoid bone in the wrist, often caused by fall on an outstretched hand. Radiographically characterized by disruption of bone continuity and potential displacement.

name: Scaphoid Non-union
definition: Failure of a scaphoid fracture to heal properly, resulting in persistent bone discontinuity. Radiographically evident by lack of bone bridging and potential avascular changes.

name: Scaphoid Non-union Advanced Collapse (SNAC wrist)
definition: Progressive degenerative wrist condition following untreated scaphoid non-union, characterized by progressive carpal collapse and arthritis. Radiographically shows progressive joint space narrowing and bone deformity.

name: Scapholunate Advanced Collapse (SLAC) Wrist
definition: Progressive degenerative wrist condition resulting from scapholunate ligament injury, leading to predictable pattern of carpal joint arthritis. Radiographically demonstrates characteristic progressive joint changes.

name: Scarring
definition: Fibrous tissue replacement following tissue injury, visible on imaging as altered tissue density and potential architectural distortion.

name: Schatzki Ring (B-Ring)
definition: Mucosal ring at gastroesophageal junction causing narrowing, radiographically visible as a circumferential narrowing on barium studies.

name: Schistosomiasis
definition: Parasitic infection causing inflammatory changes in various organs, detectable through calcifications, granulomas, and tissue alterations on imaging.

name: Schizencephaly
definition: Rare congenital brain malformation characterized by abnormal cortical development with cerebrospinal fluid-filled clefts extending from cerebral ventricles to cortical surface.

name: Schwannoma
definition: Benign nerve sheath tumor arising from Schwann cells, typically appearing as well-circumscribed soft tissue mass on imaging.

name: Schwannoma/Neurofibroma
definition: Benign peripheral nerve sheath tumors with distinct imaging characteristics, often showing soft tissue mass with variable enhancement.

name: Scimitar syndrome
definition: Rare congenital cardiovascular anomaly characterized by partial anomalous pulmonary venous return, typically detected through chest imaging.

name: SCIWORA (Spinal Cord Injury Without Radiographic Abnormality)
definition: Spinal cord injury without demonstrable radiographic evidence of vertebral or ligamentous damage, typically identified through clinical presentation.

name: Scleroderma
definition: Systemic autoimmune connective tissue disorder characterized by skin and internal organ fibrosis, with distinctive imaging findings of tissue thickening and calcifications.

name: Scleroderma esophagus
definition: Esophageal manifestation of scleroderma, characterized by smooth muscle atrophy and fibrosis, visible on imaging as narrowing and reduced motility.

name: Sclerosing Adenosis
definition: Benign breast lesion characterized by proliferation of small acini, typically appearing as subtle architectural distortion on mammographic imaging.

name: Sclerosing Mesenteritis
definition: A rare inflammatory condition of the mesentery characterized by fibrosis, inflammation, and fatty tissue changes. Radiologically, it presents with mesenteric thickening, stranding, and potential calcifications on CT or MRI.

name: Scottie dog sign
definition: A radiographic sign on oblique lumbar spine imaging where the pedicle, transverse process, and facet joint form a shape resembling a Scottie dog. Used to assess spinal alignment and pathology.

name: Scurvy
definition: Vitamin C deficiency causing hemorrhagic and degenerative changes in connective tissues. Radiographic findings may include periosteal reactions, subperiosteal hemorrhages, and bone demineralization.

name: Secondary Adrenal Insufficiency
definition: Impaired adrenal hormone production due to pituitary or hypothalamic dysfunction. Imaging may show reduced adrenal gland size or abnormal contrast enhancement on CT or MRI.

name: Secondary Biliary Cirrhosis
definition: Liver cirrhosis resulting from chronic bile duct obstruction. Radiological features include biliary tract dilatation, liver parenchymal changes, and potential portal hypertension signs.

name: Secondary Bone Involvement (Lymphoma)
definition: Lymphoma-related bone metastases characterized by destructive lesions, soft tissue masses, and potential pathological fractures. Typically identified on CT, MRI, or PET scans.

name: Secondary Chondrosarcoma
definition: A rare malignant bone tumor developing secondary to pre-existing benign cartilaginous lesions. Radiographically presents with destructive bone changes and soft tissue extension.

name: Secondary Hemosiderosis
definition: Excessive iron deposition in tissues secondary to chronic blood transfusions or underlying pathology. Radiological findings may include iron signal changes on MRI and potential organ damage.

name: Secondary Osteoarthritis
definition: Degenerative joint disease developing as a consequence of prior joint injury or underlying condition. Radiographic hallmarks include joint space narrowing, osteophyte formation, and subchondral sclerosis.

name: Secondary Osteoporosis (e.g., due to steroid use, hyperparathyroidism)
definition: Bone density reduction caused by underlying medical conditions or medications. Radiological assessment via DEXA scan or CT demonstrates reduced bone mineral density and increased fracture risk.

name: SEGA (Subependymal Giant Cell Astrocytoma)
definition: Benign brain tumor associated with tuberous sclerosis, typically located near lateral ventricles. Radiologically characterized by characteristic appearance on MRI with potential calcifications.

name: Seizure
definition: Abnormal electrical brain activity resulting in sudden, uncontrolled neurological event. Neuroimaging may reveal underlying structural causes or post-ictal changes.

name: Seizures
definition: Abnormal electrical brain activity resulting in sudden, uncontrolled neurological events. Neuroimaging may reveal underlying structural causes or post-ictal changes.

name: Seminal vesicle abscess
definition: Infectious collection within seminal vesicles, typically identified through cross-sectional imaging showing localized inflammation and potential fluid collection.

name: Seminoma
definition: Radiosensitive testicular germ cell tumor with characteristic appearance on imaging, typically showing homogeneous soft tissue mass with potential calcifications.

name: Sentinel Lymph Node
definition: First lymph node receiving primary lymphatic drainage from a tumor site, crucial for staging and potential metastatic evaluation. Identified through specialized imaging techniques.

name: Sepsis
definition: Life-threatening organ dysfunction caused by dysregulated host response to infection. In radiology, sepsis can manifest with various imaging findings indicating systemic inflammatory response and potential organ involvement.

name: Septic Arthritis
definition: Bacterial infection of a joint space causing inflammatory destruction of joint structures. Radiological findings typically include joint effusion, soft tissue swelling, and potential bone erosions.

name: Septic Arthritis (SA)
definition: Bacterial infection of a joint space causing inflammatory destruction of joint structures. Radiological findings typically include joint effusion, soft tissue swelling, and potential bone erosions.

name: Septic Shock
definition: Severe form of sepsis characterized by profound cardiovascular dysfunction and persistent hypotension. Radiological findings may include signs of multi-organ dysfunction and tissue hypoperfusion.

name: Septo-optic dysplasia
definition: Congenital developmental disorder affecting the optic nerve and midline brain structures. Radiological evaluation typically involves brain MRI to assess hypothalamic, pituitary, and optic nerve abnormalities.

name: Septooptic Dysplasia (SOD)
definition: Congenital developmental disorder affecting the optic nerve and midline brain structures. Radiological evaluation typically involves brain MRI to assess hypothalamic, pituitary, and optic nerve abnormalities.

name: Serology/Clinical History
definition: Medical assessment involving analysis of blood serum for diagnostic purposes, including antibody detection, infection markers, and immune response evaluation.

name: Seroma
definition: Fluid collection that develops after surgical procedures or trauma, containing clear serous fluid. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, non-inflammatory fluid collection adjacent to surgical site.

name: Serous Cystadenoma
definition: Benign cystic tumor of the pancreas characterized by multiple small cysts. Radiological imaging reveals a well-circumscribed, microcystic lesion with characteristic 'honeycomb' appearance.

name: Serous Cystadenoma (SCN)
definition: Benign cystic tumor of the pancreas characterized by multiple small cysts. Radiological imaging reveals a well-circumscribed, microcystic lesion with characteristic 'honeycomb' appearance.

name: Serum PTH and Calcium levels
definition: Laboratory measurement of parathyroid hormone (PTH) and calcium levels to assess endocrine and metabolic disorders affecting bone and mineral metabolism.

name: Severe Achondroplasia
definition: Extreme form of achondroplasia with significant skeletal growth restrictions. Radiological findings include pronounced bone growth abnormalities and disproportionate skeletal development.

name: Severe cerebral hypoperfusion
definition: Significant reduction in blood flow to the brain causing potential neurological damage. Radiological assessment involves perfusion imaging demonstrating reduced cerebral blood flow.

name: Severe HPT
definition: Severe hyperparathyroidism causing significant metabolic and skeletal changes. Radiological findings include bone demineralization, cystic bone lesions, and potential pathological fractures.

name: Severe Hydrocephalus
definition: Significant accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid within brain ventricles causing increased intracranial pressure. Radiological evaluation shows enlarged ventricles and potential brain parenchymal compression.

name: Severe ischemia
definition: Significant reduction of blood flow to tissues causing potential cellular damage. Radiological assessment involves perfusion imaging and evaluation of tissue blood supply.

name: Shattered Spleen
definition: Traumatic splenic injury resulting in complete fragmentation or destruction of splenic tissue. Radiological findings include splenic parenchymal disruption and potential active bleeding.

name: Sheehan Syndrome
definition: A pituitary gland disorder caused by ischemic necrosis following severe postpartum hemorrhage. Radiological imaging can reveal pituitary gland atrophy and empty sella syndrome.

name: Shin Splints
definition: Inflammatory condition causing pain along the tibia's anterior or medial surface, typically seen in athletes. Radiographic findings may include periosteal reaction and soft tissue edema.

name: Short Bowel Syndrome
definition: Malabsorption syndrome resulting from surgical removal or significant loss of small intestine. Radiological evaluation can demonstrate altered bowel anatomy and potential complications.

name: Shoulder Impingement (External/Subacromial)
definition: Mechanical compression of rotator cuff tendons against the acromion, visible on imaging as subacromial space narrowing and soft tissue inflammation.

name: Shoulder Impingement (Internal/Posterosuperior)
definition: Impingement caused by internal anatomical variations affecting rotator cuff, detectable through advanced imaging demonstrating posterior superior glenoid impingement.

name: Shoulder Impingement (Subcoracoid)
definition: Impingement occurring beneath the coracoid process, identifiable through specialized shoulder imaging techniques showing soft tissue compression.

name: Shoulder Impingement Syndrome
definition: Comprehensive shoulder pathology involving mechanical compression and inflammation of rotator cuff structures, characterized by radiographic signs of soft tissue compromise.

name: Shoulder Instability
definition: Condition involving abnormal shoulder joint movement beyond normal physiological range, detectable through various imaging modalities showing ligamentous laxity or structural abnormalities.

name: Shoulder Tumor
definition: Neoplastic growth within shoulder region, identifiable through multiple imaging techniques including X-ray, CT, and MRI with varying characteristics based on tumor type.

name: Shunt Disconnection
definition: Radiographically detectable separation or interruption of a previously placed medical shunt, potentially causing clinical complications.

name: Shunt Dysfunction
definition: Impaired shunt performance identifiable through imaging studies showing mechanical or physiological irregularities in shunt system.

name: Shunt Kinking
definition: Mechanical obstruction of shunt pathway due to tube bending or compression, observable through radiographic imaging techniques.

name: Shunt Migration
definition: Unintended movement of medical shunt from its original placement, detectable through comparative radiographic imaging.

name: Sialadenitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of salivary glands, characterized by radiographic signs of glandular swelling and potential calcifications.

name: Sialolithiasis
definition: Presence of calcified stones within salivary gland ducts, identifiable through various imaging modalities showing characteristic radiopaque structures.

name: Sickle Cell Crisis
definition: Acute painful episode in sickle cell disease characterized by vaso-occlusive crisis causing bone and joint pain. Radiographic findings may include bone infarcts, osteonecrosis, and soft tissue swelling.

name: Sickle Cell Disease
definition: Inherited hemoglobin disorder causing red blood cells to become sickle-shaped, leading to vascular occlusion and tissue damage. Radiographic manifestations include bone infarcts, lung changes, and skeletal complications.

name: Sigmoid Volvulus
definition: Twisting of the sigmoid colon around its mesentery, causing bowel obstruction. Radiographic findings include dilated, twisted sigmoid colon with characteristic 'coffee bean' appearance on imaging.

name: Simple Bone Cyst (SBC) / Unicameral Bone Cyst
definition: Benign, fluid-filled bone lesion typically found in children, most commonly in long bones. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, radiolucent lesion within the bone.

name: Simple Cyst
definition: Fluid-filled, thin-walled, benign cavity without internal complexity or septations. Typically found in various organs and soft tissues, appearing as a round, anechoic structure on imaging.

name: Simple edema
definition: Accumulation of fluid in soft tissues, appearing as soft tissue swelling without specific underlying pathology. Radiographically manifests as increased soft tissue density or volume.

name: Simple renal cyst
definition: Benign, fluid-filled cavity in the kidney, typically asymptomatic and found incidentally. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, thin-walled, anechoic lesion without internal complexity.

name: Sinding-Larsen-Johansson syndrome
definition: Chronic inflammation of the patellar tendon insertion at the inferior pole of the patella, often seen in adolescents. Radiographically shows calcification or fragmentation at the patellar tendon origin.

name: Sinonasal Undifferentiated Carcinoma (SNUC)
definition: Rare, aggressive malignant tumor of the sinonasal tract with poor prognosis. Radiographically shows invasive mass with potential destruction of adjacent structures.

name: Sinusitis (Acute)
definition: Inflammatory condition of the paranasal sinuses with rapid onset, typically caused by viral or bacterial infection. Radiographically shows mucosal thickening, fluid levels, and potential sinus opacification.

name: Sinusitis (Chronic)
definition: Prolonged inflammation of the paranasal sinuses lasting more than 12 weeks. Radiographically demonstrates persistent mucosal thickening, potential polyps, and sinus structural changes.

name: Sjogren's syndrome
definition: Autoimmune disorder causing dry eyes and mouth, with potential systemic manifestations. Radiographically may show salivary gland enlargement or calcifications.

name: Sjgren's syndrome
definition: Autoimmune disorder causing dry eyes and mouth, with potential systemic manifestations. Radiographically may show salivary gland enlargement or calcifications.

name: Skeletal Metastases
definition: Spread of cancer to bone, causing destructive lesions. Radiographically appears as osteolytic, osteoblastic, or mixed bone lesions with potential pathological fractures.

name: Skeletal Survey
definition: A comprehensive radiographic examination of the entire skeletal system, typically used to detect bone abnormalities, metastases, or systemic diseases. Involves multiple X-ray images of different body regions to provide a complete skeletal overview.

name: Skin biopsy
definition: A diagnostic procedure where a small sample of skin tissue is removed and examined under a microscope to diagnose skin conditions or evaluate suspicious lesions. Often guided by imaging techniques for precise sampling.

name: Skin erythema
definition: Reddening of the skin due to increased blood flow or inflammation. Radiographically may be visible as soft tissue color changes or increased soft tissue density.

name: Skull base fractures
definition: Fractures involving the base of the skull, often complex and challenging to diagnose radiographically. These fractures can involve multiple bones and may have significant neurological implications.

name: Skull base infection
definition: Infectious process involving the bones and soft tissues of the skull base, typically diagnosed through CT or MRI with contrast. These infections can be life-threatening and require prompt radiological evaluation.

name: Skull base tumor
definition: Neoplastic growth located at the base of the skull, which can be benign or malignant. Radiological imaging is crucial for characterizing size, extent, and potential invasion of surrounding structures.

name: Skull Fracture
definition: Break or discontinuity in the bone of the skull, typically identified through X-ray, CT, or MRI. Radiological assessment helps determine fracture type, severity, and potential complications.

name: SLAC wrist
definition: Degenerative wrist condition characterized by specific radiographic changes in carpal bone alignment, leading to progressive arthritis. Typically diagnosed through plain radiographs and advanced imaging.

name: SLAP Tear (Shoulder)
definition: Tear or injury to the superior labrum of the shoulder joint, often detected through MRI. Radiological findings help characterize the extent and location of the labral damage.

name: SLAP Tear (Superior Labrum Anterior to Posterior)
definition: Specific type of shoulder labral tear extending from anterior to posterior aspects of the superior labrum. Typically diagnosed through detailed MRI shoulder imaging.

name: Slipped Capital Femoral Epiphysis (SCFE)
definition: Developmental hip disorder where the femoral head slips on the femoral neck, typically seen in adolescents. Radiographic diagnosis involves specialized hip X-rays and assessment of epiphyseal displacement.

name: Small Bowel Bleed
definition: Bleeding within the small intestine, typically identified through specialized radiological techniques like CT enterography or nuclear medicine studies.

name: Small bowel feces sign
definition: A radiographic sign indicating the presence of fecal material within the small bowel, suggesting intestinal obstruction or abnormal bowel function.

name: Small Bowel Obstruction
definition: Blockage of the small intestine preventing normal passage of intestinal contents, diagnosed through abdominal radiographs, CT scans showing dilated bowel loops and air-fluid levels.

name: Small Bowel Obstruction (SBO)
definition: Blockage of the small intestine preventing normal passage of intestinal contents, diagnosed through abdominal radiographs, CT scans showing dilated bowel loops and air-fluid levels.

name: Small Bowel Obstruction (SBO) (Post-operative)
definition: Postoperative small bowel obstruction, characterized by radiographic evidence of bowel dilation and potential adhesions following surgical intervention.

name: Small Cell Lung Cancer (SCLC)
definition: Aggressive form of lung cancer originating from neuroendocrine cells, typically identified through chest CT and characterized by rapid growth and early metastasis.

name: Small left colon syndrome
definition: Congenital condition characterized by abnormally small colon size, typically diagnosed through pediatric radiological studies like contrast studies or MRI.

name: Small lesions (<1cm)
definition: Radiologically challenging small lesions under 1 cm, requiring high-resolution imaging techniques for accurate characterization and potential diagnostic intervention.

name: Small Lesions (obscured by artifact)
definition: Small lesions that are difficult to visualize due to imaging artifacts, which can obscure or distort the true appearance of underlying pathology. These artifacts may result from technical limitations or patient-related factors.

name: Small pulmonary nodule
definition: A small, round or oval-shaped abnormal growth in the lung typically less than 3 cm in diameter. These nodules can be benign or potentially malignant and are often detected incidentally on chest imaging.

name: Small vessel disease
definition: Pathological changes affecting the small blood vessels, characterized by narrowing, occlusion, or structural alterations that can be visualized through various imaging modalities. Often associated with chronic conditions like diabetes or hypertension.

name: Smoking-related Pancreatitis
definition: Pancreatic inflammation and damage associated with chronic tobacco use, characterized by specific imaging findings of pancreatic parenchymal changes and potential structural alterations.

name: SMV Thrombosis
definition: Blood clot formation within the superior mesenteric vein, which can be detected through cross-sectional imaging techniques. This condition can lead to potential complications in mesenteric circulation.

name: Snowman sign
definition: A radiographic sign representing a dilated pulmonary artery resembling a snowman's body and head. Typically associated with congenital heart disease or pulmonary hypertension.

name: Soft tissue infection
definition: Inflammatory process involving soft tissue structures, typically characterized by edema, increased density, and potential abscess formation on imaging studies.

name: Soft tissue sarcoma
definition: Malignant tumor originating from mesenchymal tissues, appearing as a soft tissue mass with variable imaging characteristics depending on its specific subtype and location.

name: Soft Tissue Sarcoma (STS)
definition: Malignant tumor originating from mesenchymal tissues, appearing as a soft tissue mass with variable imaging characteristics depending on its specific subtype and location.

name: Soft Tissue Tumor
definition: An abnormal growth or mass within soft tissue structures, which can be benign or malignant. Characterized by distinct imaging features and potential structural variations.

name: Solid Mass
definition: A discrete, three-dimensional abnormal tissue growth with defined borders, typically evaluated through various imaging modalities to assess its characteristics and potential pathology.

name: Solid organ injuries (liver/spleen/kidney)
definition: Traumatic damage to parenchymal organs such as liver, spleen, or kidney, characterized by specific imaging findings of disruption, hemorrhage, or structural compromise.

name: Solid pseudopapillary neoplasm
definition: A rare, low-grade pancreatic neoplasm typically occurring in young women, characterized by distinctive imaging features of a well-circumscribed mass with mixed solid and cystic components.

name: Solid renal mass
definition: An abnormal growth within the kidney parenchyma, typically detected through cross-sectional imaging and requiring further characterization to determine its benign or malignant nature.

name: Solitary fibrous tumor/hemangiopericytoma
definition: A rare mesenchymal tumor with variable imaging appearances, characterized by spindle cell proliferation and potential hemangiopericytoma-like features.

name: Solitary pulmonary nodule
definition: A single, discrete lung nodule typically less than 3 cm in diameter, detected on chest imaging and requiring further evaluation to determine its nature.

name: Solitary Pulmonary Nodule (SPN)
definition: A single, small, round lung lesion typically detected on chest radiographs or CT scans. These nodules can be benign or malignant and require careful radiological evaluation and follow-up.

name: Some breast malignancies
definition: Radiologically characterized breast lesions showing abnormal cellular growth with potential for invasive behavior, typically detected through mammography, ultrasound, or MRI with distinct imaging features.

name: Sotos Syndrome (Cerebral Gigantism)
definition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by excessive growth and distinctive facial features, typically identified through neuroimaging showing disproportionate brain and skull development.

name: SPECT
definition: Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography, a nuclear imaging technique that produces 3D images by detecting gamma rays emitted by a radioactive tracer. Provides detailed functional information about organs and tissues.

name: SPECT (I-123)
definition: A SPECT imaging technique using Iodine-123 as a radioactive tracer to evaluate specific physiological processes or organ functions. Commonly used in thyroid and brain imaging studies.

name: SPECT (In-111 WBC)
definition: A SPECT imaging technique using Indium-111 labeled white blood cells to detect inflammation, infection, or assess white blood cell migration and activity.

name: SPECT (Tl-201 chloride)
definition: A SPECT imaging technique using Thallium-201 chloride to evaluate cardiac perfusion and myocardial viability. Frequently used in cardiac stress testing and assessing heart muscle function.

name: SPECT/CT (Tc-99m MDP)
definition: A hybrid nuclear medicine and CT imaging technique using Technetium-99m MDP to provide both functional and anatomical information, typically used in bone and joint studies.

name: Spermatocele
definition: A benign, fluid-filled cyst located near the epididymis, typically appearing as a well-defined, smooth-walled structure on scrotal ultrasound.

name: Sphincter of Oddi dysfunction
definition: A functional disorder of the biliary sphincter characterized by abnormal pressure and motility, typically evaluated through advanced imaging techniques like MRCP or ERCP.

name: Spiculated mass
definition: A radiological finding characterized by a mass with irregular, sharp, pointed projections extending from its margins. Often indicates potential malignancy in breast or lung imaging.

name: Spinal Cement Leakage
definition: Unintended extravasation of bone cement during vertebral augmentation procedures, visible on post-procedural radiographic imaging as cement extending beyond intended vertebral boundaries.

name: Spinal cord abscess
definition: An infectious process within the spinal cord parenchyma, typically appearing as a focal lesion with associated inflammation and potential signal changes on MRI.

name: Spinal cord contusion
