definition: A traumatic injury to the spinal cord characterized by localized tissue damage without complete transection, typically demonstrating signal abnormalities on MRI.

name: Spinal cord infarction
definition: A localized area of ischemic damage within the spinal cord, typically presenting as a focal signal abnormality on MRI with restricted diffusion.

name: Spinal Cord Infarction (SCI)
definition: A localized area of ischemic damage within the spinal cord, typically presenting as a focal signal abnormality on MRI with restricted diffusion.

name: Spinal Cord Injury (SCI)
definition: Comprehensive term for traumatic damage to the spinal cord, encompassing various degrees of neurological impairment and structural disruption.

name: Spinal cord lesion
definition: An abnormal area within the spinal cord visualized on MRI or CT, potentially indicating pathology such as demyelination, tumor, or inflammation.

name: Spinal cord tumor
definition: An abnormal cellular growth within the spinal cord, detectable through MRI with characteristic signal changes, contrast enhancement, and potential structural distortion.

name: Spinal cord tumor with cystic degeneration
definition: A spinal cord tumor exhibiting internal cystic changes, typically demonstrating complex signal characteristics and potential heterogeneous enhancement on MRI.

name: Spinal Dural AV Fistula (SDAVF/Type I)
definition: An abnormal vascular connection between spinal dural arteries and veins, typically identified through specialized vascular imaging techniques showing aberrant blood flow.

name: Spinal Dysraphism
definition: A congenital malformation involving incomplete or abnormal closure of the neural tube during embryonic development, often detected through advanced neuroimaging.

name: Splenomegaly
definition: Abnormal enlargement of the spleen, typically detected on imaging studies such as CT or ultrasound. Radiological findings include increased spleen size and potential associated parenchymal changes.

name: Splenosis
definition: Benign implantation of splenic tissue in abnormal locations, often following abdominal trauma or surgery. Radiologically appears as multiple small nodular soft tissue densities within the peritoneal cavity.

name: Splenule
definition: Small accessory splenic nodules that appear as discrete soft tissue densities on imaging studies. Typically benign and often incidental findings.

name: Spoke wheel pattern
definition: A radial, wheel-like pattern of contrast or enhancement seen in certain tumors or vascular lesions. Suggests a central nidus with radiating branches.

name: Spondylitis
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting the vertebral bodies, characterized by bone destruction, sclerosis, and potential joint space narrowing on radiographic imaging.

name: Spondylolisthesis
definition: Anterior displacement of one vertebra relative to another, typically visualized on lateral radiographic views. Can cause spinal canal narrowing and potential neurological compromise.

name: Spondylolysis
definition: Defect or fracture in the pars interarticularis of the vertebral arch, often seen in lumbar spine imaging. Can predispose to spondylolisthesis.

name: Spontaneous abortion
definition: Unintended pregnancy loss before 20 weeks of gestation, potentially detectable through ultrasound or radiographic evidence of non-viable pregnancy.

name: Spontaneous Bacterial Peritonitis (SBP)
definition: Bacterial infection of the peritoneal fluid in patients with cirrhosis, typically diagnosed through imaging and fluid analysis. Radiological findings may include ascites and potential inflammatory changes.

name: Spontaneous Intracranial Hypotension (SIH)
definition: Condition characterized by low intracranial pressure, often resulting in postural headaches. Radiological findings include pachymeningeal enhancement and potential cerebrospinal fluid leakage.

name: Sprengel Deformity
definition: Congenital shoulder girdle deformity characterized by high-riding, underdeveloped scapula. Radiographically demonstrates abnormal scapular position and potential skeletal asymmetry.

name: Squamous Cell Carcinoma
definition: Malignant epithelial tumor arising from squamous cells, characterized by irregular masses and potential invasion on imaging studies.

name: Squamous Cell Carcinoma (of the bladder)
definition: Malignant epithelial tumor occurring in bladder mucosa, typically appearing as irregular bladder wall thickening or mass on radiographic imaging.

name: Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC)
definition: Malignant epithelial tumor arising from squamous cells, characterized by irregular masses and potential invasion on imaging studies.

name: Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC) transformation of IP
definition: Malignant transformation of intraepithelial neoplasia into invasive squamous cell carcinoma, detectable through progressive changes in cellular morphology and tissue architecture.

name: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
definition: Malignant epithelial tumor of the cervix, typically visualized through imaging as irregular cervical masses, potential invasion, and lymph node involvement.

name: Stable Coronary Artery Disease (CAD)
definition: Chronic condition characterized by narrowing of coronary arteries with stable plaque formation, typically assessed through imaging techniques like coronary CT angiography or cardiac catheterization. Radiological findings include calcified plaques, luminal narrowing, and potential arterial wall thickening.

name: Steatohepatitis (NASH)
definition: Liver condition involving fat accumulation and inflammation, characterized by steatosis, hepatocellular injury, and potential fibrosis. Radiological imaging reveals fatty liver changes, parenchymal heterogeneity, and potential architectural distortion.

name: Steatosis
definition: Abnormal fat accumulation within liver cells, visible on imaging as increased hepatic echogenicity and decreased parenchymal density. Radiological findings include increased liver brightness on ultrasound and decreased attenuation on CT.

name: Stenosis
definition: Abnormal narrowing of a tubular structure, such as blood vessels, airways, or ducts, detected through various imaging modalities. Radiological assessment involves measuring the degree of luminal narrowing and its potential hemodynamic significance.

name: Stenosis (at anastomosis sites)
definition: Localized narrowing at surgical connection points between two structures, typically evaluated through cross-sectional imaging to assess potential complications or reduced flow.

name: Stenosis (related to tunneled catheter)
definition: Narrowing or obstruction around a surgically placed catheter, detected through imaging techniques that evaluate the catheter's surrounding tissue and potential inflammatory changes.

name: Sterile fluid collection
definition: Localized fluid accumulation without active infection, typically appearing as a well-defined, homogeneous collection on imaging studies. Radiological characteristics include distinct margins and absence of inflammatory changes.

name: Sterile Inflammation
definition: Inflammatory process occurring without microbial involvement, characterized by tissue changes visible on imaging without evidence of active infection.

name: Sterile vegetations
definition: Abnormal tissue growths on heart valves or surfaces without infectious etiology, detectable through advanced imaging techniques like echocardiography or cardiac CT.

name: Stochastic risks (cancer induction)
definition: Probabilistic cancer risks associated with radiation exposure, involving potential long-term genetic mutations that may develop randomly over time.

name: Stone/ligation (abrupt cutoff)
definition: Radiological finding of abrupt luminal interruption, typically associated with obstructive processes like stones or ligatures, visible as a sudden cessation of contrast or signal.

name: Stones
definition: Solid, calcified deposits within body structures like kidneys, gallbladder, or urinary tract, detectable through various imaging modalities with characteristic radiological appearances.

name: Stress-induced Adrenal Hemorrhage
definition: Spontaneous hemorrhage within adrenal glands, typically associated with significant physiological stress, detectable through cross-sectional imaging showing characteristic bleeding patterns.

name: Stress Fracture
definition: Microscopic bone damage caused by repetitive mechanical loading, visible on advanced imaging as subtle bone marrow edema or cortical irregularities.

name: Stress fractures
definition: Microscopic bone damage caused by repetitive mechanical loading, visible on advanced imaging as subtle bone marrow edema or cortical irregularities.

name: Stress reaction
definition: A bone pathology representing early skeletal response to repetitive mechanical stress, characterized by bone marrow edema and potential precursor to stress fracture. Radiologically detectable through MRI or bone scintigraphy.

name: Stress Shielding
definition: A biomechanical phenomenon where an implant or prosthesis reduces mechanical loading on surrounding bone, leading to bone density reduction and potential structural weakening. Commonly observed in orthopedic implants.

name: Stricture
definition: An abnormal narrowing or constriction of a tubular anatomical structure, typically observed in blood vessels, airways, or gastrointestinal tract. Radiologically characterized by luminal narrowing.

name: Stricture/extrinsic compression (tapering)
definition: A radiological finding where external compression causes tapering or narrowing of a tubular structure, often seen in vascular or gastrointestinal imaging studies.

name: Strictures
definition: Pathological narrowing of multiple tubular structures, potentially involving different organ systems. Radiologically characterized by consistent luminal reduction.

name: Strictures (Post-operative)
definition: Luminal narrowing occurring as a consequence of surgical intervention, often observed in gastrointestinal or urological imaging studies.

name: Stroke
definition: A cerebrovascular event causing sudden neurological deficit due to interrupted blood supply to brain tissue, characterized by ischemic or hemorrhagic changes on neuroimaging.

name: Stroke (acute)
definition: An acute cerebrovascular event characterized by sudden loss of blood flow to a brain region, resulting in neurological deficits. Identified through CT or MRI imaging.

name: Stroke Mimics (e.g., seizure, migraine)
definition: Clinical conditions that present similarly to stroke but are not actual cerebrovascular events, requiring careful differential diagnosis through neuroimaging.

name: Struvite calculus
definition: A type of kidney stone composed of magnesium ammonium phosphate, typically associated with urinary tract infections. Radiologically identifiable through CT or X-ray imaging.

name: Stunned Myocardium
definition: A temporary myocardial dysfunction following acute ischemic event, characterized by reduced contractility despite restored blood flow. Detectable through cardiac imaging techniques.

name: Sturge-Weber Syndrome (SWS)
definition: A neurocutaneous disorder characterized by facial port-wine stain and neurological abnormalities, often demonstrating characteristic radiological findings in brain imaging.

name: Subacute hematoma
definition: A stage of hemorrhage occurring between acute and chronic phases, typically 3-7 days post-injury, with specific signal characteristics on MRI.

name: Subacute Hemorrhage
definition: A stage of bleeding characterized by specific radiological signal changes, typically occurring between 24-72 hours after initial injury.

name: Subacute Thyroiditis
definition: An inflammatory thyroid condition causing transient thyroid dysfunction, often with characteristic imaging findings of glandular inflammation and edema.

name: Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
definition: A serious neurological condition involving bleeding into the subarachnoid space, typically detected through CT or MRI with characteristic blood distribution.

name: Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (SAH)
definition: Bleeding into the subarachnoid space surrounding the brain, typically detected on CT scan as hyperdense fluid in the subarachnoid cisterns. Often caused by aneurysm rupture or head trauma.

name: Subchondral insufficiency fracture
definition: Stress fracture occurring in the bone underlying joint cartilage, typically seen in weight-bearing joints and characterized by bone marrow edema on MRI. Commonly associated with osteoarthritis and repetitive joint loading.

name: Subcortical Band Heterotopia
definition: Neuronal migration disorder characterized by abnormal cortical development with heterotopic gray matter bands beneath the normal cortex, visible on neuroimaging as parallel bands of gray matter.

name: Subdural Hematoma
definition: Accumulation of blood between the brain's dura mater and arachnoid membrane, typically appearing as a crescent-shaped hyperdense collection on CT scan. Can be acute, subacute, or chronic.

name: Subdural Hematoma (SDH)
definition: Accumulation of blood between the brain's dura mater and arachnoid membrane, typically appearing as a crescent-shaped hyperdense collection on CT scan. Can be acute, subacute, or chronic.

name: Subependymoma
definition: Rare, slow-growing benign tumor arising from the ependymal cells near the ventricular system, typically appearing as a well-circumscribed, non-enhancing lesion on neuroimaging.

name: Subfalcine Herniation
definition: Displacement of brain tissue beneath the falx cerebri due to increased intracranial pressure, typically seen on CT or MRI as midline shift and compression of brain structures.

name: Subjective Cognitive Decline
definition: Self-reported decline in cognitive function without objective neuropsychological evidence, often detected through patient-reported symptoms and subtle changes in neuroimaging.

name: Sublabral Foramen (Recess)
definition: Anatomical variant or defect in the labral rim of a joint, typically observed in shoulder or hip imaging, potentially mimicking or predisposing to labral tears.

name: Subluxation
definition: Partial displacement of a joint surface, where bones partially lose contact but remain partially aligned, visible on radiographic imaging as abnormal joint positioning.

name: Subluxation/Dislocation (Long Head of Biceps Tendon - LHBT)
definition: Displacement or abnormal positioning of the long head of the biceps tendon, typically observed in shoulder imaging as tendon instability or abnormal course.

name: Subungual exostosis
definition: Benign bone tumor occurring beneath the nail bed, typically appearing as a bony projection on radiographic imaging and potentially causing nail deformity.

name: Successful Occlusion (Post-Embolization)
definition: Complete blockage or closure of a blood vessel or abnormal vascular structure following an embolization procedure, confirmed through post-procedural imaging.

name: Summation Artifact
definition: Radiographic artifact caused by overlapping structures, creating false density or signal changes that can mimic or obscure pathological findings.

name: Sunburst periosteal reaction
definition: A radiographic bone finding showing irregular, sunburst-like periosteal reaction with radiating bone spicules. Often associated with aggressive bone lesions or malignancy.

name: Super Scan (Diffuse Metastatic Disease)
definition: Radiographic appearance of diffuse bone metastases where the entire skeleton appears uniformly dense and lacks normal bone trabeculation, indicating widespread malignant involvement.

name: Superficial Siderosis
definition: A rare neurological condition characterized by hemosiderin deposition on the surface of the brain and spinal cord due to chronic blood exposure. Radiologically, it appears as low-signal rim deposits on gradient-echo MRI sequences.

name: Superficial Siderosis (SS)
definition: A rare neurological condition characterized by hemosiderin deposition on the surface of the brain and spinal cord due to chronic blood exposure. Radiologically, it appears as low-signal rim deposits on gradient-echo MRI sequences.

name: Superficial thrombophlebitis
definition: Inflammation of a superficial vein with associated blood clot formation, typically visible on ultrasound as a non-compressible, hyperechoic venous segment with surrounding soft tissue edema.

name: Superior Mesenteric Vein (SMV) Thrombosis
definition: A blood clot formation in the superior mesenteric vein that can lead to bowel ischemia, typically diagnosed on CT or MR venography with evidence of venous occlusion and potential surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Superior Mesenteric Vein Thrombosis (SMVT)
definition: A blood clot formation in the superior mesenteric vein that can lead to bowel ischemia, typically diagnosed on CT or MR venography with evidence of venous occlusion and potential surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Superior Semicircular Canal Dehiscence (SSCD)
definition: A congenital or acquired defect in the temporal bone where the superior semicircular canal of the inner ear is abnormally thin or absent, potentially causing hearing and vestibular symptoms, visible on high-resolution CT imaging.

name: Superior Vena Cava (SVC) Syndrome
definition: A clinical condition caused by obstruction or compression of the superior vena cava, often visible on CT or MRI as venous distension, collateral vessel formation, and potential mediastinal masses.

name: Supracondylar Fracture
definition: A fracture occurring above the condyles of the femur or humerus, typically involving the metaphyseal region, often seen on X-ray or CT with characteristic displacement and angulation patterns.

name: Surgical ligation
definition: A surgical technique of closing a blood vessel or structure by tying it off, which may appear as a surgical marker or clip on radiographic imaging.

name: Surgical Scar
definition: A radiographically visible mark of previous surgical intervention, typically appearing as a linear or geometric soft tissue density with potential associated tissue distortion.

name: Susceptibility Artifact
definition: A type of image artifact in MRI caused by magnetic field inhomogeneities near metallic objects or tissues with different magnetic properties, resulting in signal loss or distortion.

name: Suspicious breast calcifications
definition: Breast calcifications that have irregular, heterogeneous, or clustered morphology raising concern for potential malignancy, typically identified on mammography.

name: Suspicious Breast Lesions (BI-RADS 4)
definition: Breast lesions with moderate suspicion of malignancy in the BI-RADS classification system, typically requiring further investigation or biopsy.

name: Suspicious calcifications
definition: Radiographic detection of abnormal calcium deposits within tissue that may indicate potential underlying pathology, such as tumors or degenerative processes.

name: Suture
definition: A medical device used to approximate or hold tissue edges together, visible on radiographic imaging as a linear metallic or non-metallic marker.

name: SVC Obstruction
definition: Blockage or narrowing of the superior vena cava, often visible on imaging studies as venous distension, collateral vessel formation, and potential underlying cause.

name: SWI MRI (for small fragments), CT (for general detection and HU measurement)
definition: Advanced imaging techniques for detecting and measuring small fragments or subtle tissue changes. SWI MRI provides high-resolution soft tissue contrast, while CT offers precise density measurements.

name: Swyer-James syndrome
definition: A rare unilateral lung hyperlucency syndrome characterized by decreased lung volume, reduced vascularity, and air trapping on imaging. Radiographically appears as a small, hyperlucent lung with diminished vascular markings.

name: Syndesmosis Injury (AITFL/PITFL Tear)
definition: A ligamentous injury involving the anterior (AITFL) or posterior (PITFL) tibiofibular ligaments, typically seen in ankle sprains. Radiographic findings include widening of the ankle mortise and potential syndesmotic disruption.

name: Syndesmotic Sprain
definition: Ligamentous injury of the syndesmosis in the ankle, causing instability and potential widening of the ankle mortise. Radiographically characterized by increased tibiofibular clear space and potential ligament disruption.

name: Syndesmotic Sprain (High Ankle Sprain)
definition: A severe ankle sprain involving the syndesmotic ligaments above the ankle joint. Radiographic findings include increased tibiofibular distance and potential ligamentous disruption.

name: Synovial Cyst (Juxtafacet Cyst)
definition: A fluid-filled cyst arising near facet joints of the spine, typically associated with degenerative changes. Radiologically appears as a well-defined, fluid-containing lesion adjacent to facet joints.

name: Synovial Cysts (Facet Joints)
definition: Fluid-filled cystic lesions developing from facet joints in the spine, often related to degenerative changes. Typically seen on MRI as well-defined cystic structures near spinal joints.

name: Synovial Sarcoma
definition: A rare soft tissue sarcoma arising near joints, characterized by malignant epithelial and spindle cell components. Radiographically appears as a soft tissue mass with variable enhancement and potential calcifications.

name: Synovitis
definition: Inflammation of the synovial membrane lining joints, causing joint effusion and soft tissue swelling. Radiographically characterized by joint effusion, soft tissue edema, and potential joint space narrowing.

name: Syntelencephaly
definition: A rare congenital brain malformation involving incomplete separation of cerebral hemispheres. Radiologically characterized by abnormal brain development and potential fusion of brain structures.

name: Syringomyelia
definition: A chronic spinal cord disorder characterized by fluid-filled cavities within the spinal cord. Radiographically identified on MRI as longitudinal intramedullary cystic lesions.

name: Systemic diseases (e.g., scleroderma, amyloidosis)
definition: Conditions affecting multiple organ systems with radiographic manifestations across different body regions. Characterized by diverse imaging findings reflecting specific disease processes.

name: Systemic Vasculitis
definition: A group of inflammatory disorders causing blood vessel wall inflammation and potential vessel damage. Radiographically characterized by vessel wall thickening, stenosis, and potential vessel wall enhancement.

name: T2 Shine-through
definition: A T2-weighted MRI artifact where high signal intensity structures appear bright due to prolonged T2 relaxation times. Represents signal persistence in certain tissue types.

name: Takayasu Arteritis
definition: A rare chronic inflammatory condition affecting large arteries, particularly the aorta and its major branches. Radiographically characterized by vessel wall thickening, stenosis, and potential vessel wall enhancement.

name: Target sign
definition: A concentric, multi-layered appearance on imaging resembling a target or bullseye. Can indicate various pathological processes in different organ systems.

name: Tarlov Cyst (Perineural Cyst)
definition: Benign cerebrospinal fluid-filled cysts located adjacent to spinal nerve roots. Radiologically appear as small, well-defined fluid-filled sacs near nerve root sleeves.

name: Tarsal Coalition
definition: Congenital fusion of tarsal bones causing restricted joint motion and potential foot deformity. Radiographically characterized by abnormal bone continuity and reduced joint space between affected tarsal bones.

name: TB meningitis
definition: Tuberculous infection of meninges causing inflammatory changes in brain coverings. Radiologically presents with basilar meningeal enhancement, hydrocephalus, and potential infarctions.

name: Telangiectatic osteosarcoma
definition: Rare aggressive variant of osteosarcoma with prominent vascular spaces and hemorrhagic regions. Radiographically demonstrates mixed lytic and blastic lesions with significant soft tissue extension.

name: Temporal Bone Fracture (General)
definition: Traumatic fracture involving temporal bone structures, potentially affecting middle and inner ear. Radiologically classified into longitudinal and transverse types with distinct imaging characteristics.

name: Temporary sterility (testes)
definition: Reversible testicular dysfunction causing reduced fertility. Radiologically may show testicular atrophy or reduced volume during active phase.

name: Tendinitis/Tendinosis (Long Head of Biceps Tendon - LHBT)
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting long head of biceps tendon causing pain and potential structural changes. Radiologically characterized by tendon thickening, signal alterations, and potential surrounding fluid.

name: Tendinopathy
definition: Chronic degenerative tendon condition involving structural changes without significant inflammation. Radiologically demonstrates altered tendon signal intensity and potential structural disruption.

name: Tendinosis
definition: Chronic tendon degeneration characterized by collagen breakdown without active inflammation. Radiologically shows altered tendon signal and potential structural changes.

name: Tendon Tear
definition: Partial or complete disruption of tendon fibers. Radiologically characterized by discontinuity, signal changes, and potential retraction of tendon.

name: Tension pneumothorax
definition: Life-threatening condition with progressive air accumulation in pleural space causing lung collapse and cardiovascular compromise. Radiologically demonstrates mediastinal shift and lung volume loss.

name: Teratogenic effects
definition: Developmental abnormalities caused by exposure to harmful substances during pregnancy. Radiologically may demonstrate congenital malformations or developmental anomalies.

name: Teratoma
definition: Rare tumor containing tissues from multiple embryonic layers. Radiologically demonstrates complex mixed solid and cystic mass with calcifications.

name: Terminal Myelocystocele
definition: Rare congenital spinal dysraphism involving herniation of terminal spinal cord and associated cystic structure. Radiologically demonstrates abnormal spinal cord termination and associated cystic components.

name: Terrible Triad of the Elbow
definition: Complex elbow injury involving radial head fracture, coronoid process fracture, and lateral collateral ligament disruption. Radiologically demonstrates multiple concurrent traumatic changes.

name: Testicular Abscess
definition: Localized infectious collection within testicular tissue. Radiologically demonstrates focal hypoechoic/hypodense area with potential peripheral enhancement and surrounding inflammatory changes.

name: Testicular Appendage Torsion
definition: A painful condition involving twisting of the appendage of the testicle, causing acute scrotal pain and potential swelling. Radiologically characterized by localized testicular swelling and potential color Doppler ultrasound findings of reduced blood flow.

name: Testicular Cancer
definition: Malignant tumor originating in the testicles, typically detected through imaging studies like ultrasound, CT, or MRI. Radiological evaluation is crucial for staging, characterizing tumor type, and assessing potential metastasis.

name: Testicular Germ Cell Tumors
definition: Malignant tumors arising from germ cells within the testicle, characterized by specific radiological features on ultrasound, CT, and MRI. These tumors can be seminomatous or non-seminomatous.

name: Testicular lymphoma
definition: Rare malignant lymphoid tumor occurring in the testicle, typically identified through cross-sectional imaging and characterized by diffuse infiltration or mass-like lesions.

name: Testicular Microlithiasis
definition: Incidental finding of small calcifications within the testicle, typically detected on ultrasound. May be associated with increased risk of testicular cancer and requires careful radiological follow-up.

name: Testicular Torsion
definition: Surgical emergency involving twisting of the spermatic cord, leading to compromised testicular blood supply. Urgent radiological evaluation using color Doppler ultrasound is critical for diagnosis and potential salvage.

name: Testicular tumor
definition: Abnormal growth or mass within the testicle, which can be benign or malignant. Radiological imaging is essential for characterization, size measurement, and potential biopsy guidance.

name: Tethered Cord
definition: Congenital spinal cord condition where the spinal cord is abnormally attached to surrounding tissues, potentially causing neurological complications. Radiological evaluation using MRI is crucial for diagnosis and surgical planning.

name: Tethered Cord Syndrome (TCS)
definition: Neurological disorder characterized by tethered spinal cord causing progressive neurological symptoms. MRI is the primary imaging modality for diagnosis and assessment of cord attachment.

name: Tetralogy of Fallot
definition: Congenital cardiac malformation involving four specific anatomical defects: pulmonary stenosis, ventricular septal defect, overriding aorta, and right ventricular hypertrophy. Diagnosed through cardiac imaging techniques.

name: Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF)
definition: Congenital cardiac malformation involving four specific anatomical defects: pulmonary stenosis, ventricular septal defect, overriding aorta, and right ventricular hypertrophy. Diagnosed through cardiac imaging techniques.

name: TFCC Tear
definition: Injury or degenerative condition of the Triangular Fibrocartilage Complex in the wrist, typically evaluated through MRI or ultrasound to assess soft tissue damage.

name: TFCC Tear (Wrist)
definition: Injury or degenerative condition of the Triangular Fibrocartilage Complex specifically in the wrist joint, assessed through detailed radiological imaging.

name: Thanatophoric Dysplasia
definition: Severe, lethal skeletal dysplasia characterized by disproportionate short limbs and specific radiological features of bone development. Diagnosed through detailed skeletal imaging.

name: Thermal injury
definition: Tissue damage caused by exposure to extreme heat, characterized by varying degrees of tissue destruction. Radiological evaluation helps assess depth, extent, and potential complications of burn injuries.

name: Thermal Injury (RF-induced heating)
definition: Tissue damage caused by excessive radiofrequency-induced heating, typically characterized by cellular protein denaturation and potential tissue destruction. In radiology, thermal injury can occur during interventional procedures or imaging-guided treatments.

name: Thoracic outlet syndrome
definition: Compression syndrome affecting the neurovascular structures in the area between the neck and shoulder, often visible on imaging studies. Radiological techniques can help identify anatomical variations and compression points.

name: Thromboembolism
definition: Blockage of a blood vessel by a blood clot that has traveled from its original formation site. Radiological imaging is crucial for detecting, localizing, and assessing the extent of embolic events.

name: Thrombosis
definition: Formation of a blood clot within a blood vessel, which can obstruct blood flow and potentially lead to serious complications. Radiology plays a key role in identifying and characterizing thrombotic lesions.

name: Thrombosis (DVT)
definition: Blood clot formation within a deep vein, most commonly occurring in the legs, which can potentially lead to pulmonary embolism. Imaging techniques like ultrasound and CT are essential for diagnosis and monitoring.

name: Thrombosis (PICC-related)
definition: Blood clot formation associated with a peripherally inserted central catheter, which can be detected and monitored through various radiological imaging techniques.

name: Thrombosis (related to tunneled catheter)
definition: Blood clot formation around or within a surgically placed tunneled catheter, detectable through radiological imaging methods that assess vascular patency.

name: Thrombotic Budd-Chiari Syndrome
definition: Obstruction of hepatic veins by thrombosis, leading to hepatic congestion and potential liver dysfunction. Radiological imaging is critical for diagnosis and assessment of venous patency.

name: Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (TTP)
definition: Rare blood disorder characterized by blood clot formation in small blood vessels, leading to platelet consumption and potential organ damage. Radiological imaging helps evaluate systemic involvement.

name: Thrombus
definition: A blood clot formed within a blood vessel, which can be detected and characterized through various radiological imaging techniques.

name: Thrombus (mimicked by artifact)
definition: Potential misinterpretation of imaging artifacts as a blood clot, requiring careful radiological assessment and differentiation.

name: Thrombus within the vein
definition: Blood clot specifically located within a vein, detectable through various imaging modalities that assess vascular integrity.

name: Thymic carcinoma
definition: Rare malignant tumor originating in the thymic epithelial cells, typically detected and characterized through advanced radiological imaging techniques.

name: Thymic cysts
definition: Benign fluid-filled sacs within the thymus gland, identifiable through radiological imaging techniques that assess mediastinal structures.

name: Thymoma
definition: Benign tumor originating in the thymus gland, typically detected and characterized through advanced radiological imaging techniques.

name: Thyroglossal Duct Cyst
definition: A congenital developmental cyst arising from remnants of the thyroglossal duct, typically located in the midline of the neck. Radiologically, these cysts appear as well-defined, fluid-filled masses that can be evaluated using ultrasound or CT imaging.

name: Thyroglossal Duct Cyst (TGDC)
definition: A congenital developmental cyst arising from remnants of the thyroglossal duct, typically located in the midline of the neck. Radiologically, these cysts appear as well-defined, fluid-filled masses that can be evaluated using ultrasound or CT imaging.

name: Thyroid abnormalities
definition: Structural or functional disorders of the thyroid gland detectable through imaging techniques such as ultrasound, CT, and nuclear medicine scans. These can include structural changes, size variations, and functional abnormalities.

name: Thyroid adenoma
definition: A benign tumor of the thyroid gland characterized by autonomous hormone production, typically appearing as a well-defined, solid nodule on radiological imaging. Ultrasound and nuclear medicine scans are crucial for characterization.

name: Thyroid cancer
definition: Malignant neoplasm originating in the thyroid gland, detectable through various imaging modalities including ultrasound, CT, MRI, and nuclear medicine scans. Radiological features help differentiate between papillary, follicular, medullary, and anaplastic thyroid cancers.

name: Thyroid cyst
definition: A fluid-filled lesion within the thyroid gland, typically evaluated using ultrasound to determine characteristics such as size, wall thickness, and internal complexity. Can be simple, complex, or hemorrhagic.

name: Thyroid Eye Disease (TED)
definition: An autoimmune inflammatory condition affecting orbital tissues associated with thyroid dysfunction, characterized by extraocular muscle enlargement and soft tissue changes visible on CT and MRI imaging.

name: Thyroid Eye Disease (TED) / Graves' Ophthalmopathy / Thyroid-Associated Orbitopathy
definition: An autoimmune inflammatory condition affecting orbital tissues associated with thyroid dysfunction, characterized by extraocular muscle enlargement and soft tissue changes visible on CT and MRI imaging.

name: Thyroid goiter
definition: Abnormal enlargement of the thyroid gland detectable through imaging techniques, which can be diffuse or nodular. Ultrasound and CT scans help evaluate size, structure, and potential underlying pathology.

name: Thyroid Hrthle Cell Neoplasm
definition: A rare thyroid tumor composed of Hrthle cells (oncocytic cells), which can be benign or malignant. Radiological evaluation using ultrasound and nuclear medicine scans helps characterize these neoplasms.

name: Thyroid nodule
definition: A discrete lesion within the thyroid gland detectable through ultrasound, characterized by distinct margins and different echogenicity compared to surrounding thyroid tissue. Can be solid, cystic, or mixed.

name: Thyroid Nodule (Benign)
definition: A non-cancerous thyroid nodule typically showing benign imaging characteristics on ultrasound, such as smooth margins, regular shape, and absence of suspicious features.

name: Thyroid Nodule (Malignant)
definition: A thyroid nodule with imaging features suggestive of potential malignancy, including irregular margins, microcalcifications, increased vascularity, and specific ultrasound characteristics.

name: Thyroid nodule (Suspicious)
definition: A thyroid nodule with high suspicion of malignancy based on specific ultrasound features, requiring further investigation and potential biopsy.

name: Thyroid Nodule (TI-RADS Classification)
synonyms: Thyroid Imaging Reporting and Data System
definition: A standardized risk stratification system for thyroid nodules using ultrasound characteristics to estimate malignancy risk, categorizing nodules from TR1 (benign) to TR5 (high suspicion of malignancy).

name: Thyroid Nodule (TIRADS 4-5)
definition: A solid or fluid-filled growth within the thyroid gland, detectable through imaging techniques like ultrasound. TIRADS 4-5 indicates higher suspicion of potential malignancy requiring further investigation.

name: Thyroid Nodule Malignancy
definition: Potential cancerous transformation of a thyroid nodule, characterized by abnormal cellular growth and potential invasive characteristics. Radiological assessment helps determine malignancy risk.

name: Thyroid nodules
definition: Abnormal growths or lumps within the thyroid gland, detectable through various imaging modalities. Can be solid or fluid-filled and vary in size and characteristics.

name: Thyroid Nodules (General)
definition: Abnormal growths within the thyroid gland, ranging from benign to potentially malignant. Characterized by distinct imaging features and potential clinical significance.

name: Thyroid oncocytoma
definition: A rare, typically benign thyroid tumor composed of oncocytic cells with abundant mitochondria. Characterized by distinctive cellular morphology on imaging and pathological examination.

name: Thyroid Papillary Carcinoma
definition: Most common type of thyroid cancer, characterized by distinctive papillary growth pattern and typically good prognosis. Identifiable through specific radiological and cytological features.

name: Thyroid Studies
definition: Comprehensive radiological and diagnostic imaging examinations of the thyroid gland to assess structure, function, and potential pathological changes.

name: Thyroiditis
definition: Inflammatory condition of the thyroid gland causing potential structural and functional changes, detectable through various imaging techniques.

name: Thyroiditis (Subacute)
definition: Acute inflammatory condition of the thyroid gland, typically viral-induced, characterized by pain and potential imaging-detectable changes in gland structure.

name: Tibial tubercle avulsion fracture
definition: Avulsion fracture involving the tibial tubercle, typically seen in adolescent athletes, characterized by separation of the tibial tubercle apophysis.

name: Tight Filum Terminale
definition: Congenital neurological condition involving abnormal tension or attachment of the filum terminale, potentially causing spinal cord tethering.

name: TIPS Shunt
definition: Transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt, a radiologically-placed procedure connecting portal and hepatic venous systems to manage portal hypertension.

name: TIPS Stenosis
definition: Narrowing or obstruction of a previously placed transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt, detectable through specialized imaging techniques.

name: Tissue Heating
definition: Thermal energy absorption by biological tissues during medical imaging or treatment, potentially causing temperature elevation.

name: Tissue Heating (due to excessive SAR)
definition: Excessive tissue heating caused by high specific absorption rate (SAR) during magnetic resonance imaging, potentially leading to thermal injury.

name: Tissue Necrosis
definition: Tissue death characterized by cellular degradation and loss of tissue architecture, often appearing as areas of low density or signal intensity on imaging studies. Radiologically, necrotic tissue may show characteristic changes such as gas formation, calcification, or irregular margins.

name: Toddler's fracture
definition: A type of pediatric tibial fracture typically occurring in children aged 1-3 years, often presenting as a subtle, non-displaced longitudinal fracture of the tibia. Radiographically, it may be challenging to detect and requires careful evaluation.

name: Tongue Base Tumor (obscured)
definition: A mass or tumor located at the base of the tongue, which may appear as a soft tissue density or mass on imaging studies. Radiological assessment typically involves CT or MRI to evaluate size, extent, and potential invasion.

name: Tonsillar Herniation
definition: A serious neurological condition where brain tissue is displaced downward through the foramen magnum, typically seen on imaging as downward displacement of cerebellar tonsils. Radiologically evident on MRI or CT with specific cerebellar positioning.

name: TORCH Infections
definition: A group of congenital infections that can cause significant fetal abnormalities, detectable through various imaging modalities. Radiological findings may include calcifications, brain malformations, and other structural anomalies.

name: Torsion of testicular appendage
definition: A pediatric condition involving twisting or rotation of a small appendage of the testicle, typically appearing as a small, painful mass on ultrasound. Radiologically characterized by swelling and potential color Doppler changes.

name: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return
definition: A rare congenital heart defect where pulmonary veins connect abnormally, appearing on imaging as unusual venous drainage patterns. Radiographically detected through cardiac CT, MRI, or echocardiography.

name: Total Anomalous Pulmonary Venous Return (TAPVR)
definition: A rare congenital heart defect where pulmonary veins connect abnormally, appearing on imaging as unusual venous drainage patterns. Radiographically detected through cardiac CT, MRI, or echocardiography.

name: Total Parenteral Nutrition (TPN)
definition: Intravenous nutritional support that can cause various radiological changes, including potential hepatic steatosis or cholestasis. Imaging may reveal central venous catheter placement and associated metabolic alterations.

name: Total parenteral nutrition (TPN)-induced cholestasis
definition: A metabolic complication of prolonged total parenteral nutrition, characterized by potential biliary changes and hepatic alterations. Radiologically evident through ultrasound or CT showing hepatic steatosis or biliary abnormalities.

name: Toxic Adenoma
definition: An autonomous functioning thyroid nodule that produces excessive thyroid hormones, typically appearing as a hyperfunctioning nodule on nuclear medicine thyroid scans.

name: Toxic multinodular goiter
definition: A condition of the thyroid gland with multiple hyperactive nodules producing excessive thyroid hormones. Radiologically characterized by multiple nodular changes on ultrasound or nuclear medicine scans.

name: Toxic Multinodular Goiter (TMNG)
definition: A condition of the thyroid gland with multiple hyperactive nodules producing excessive thyroid hormones. Radiologically characterized by multiple nodular changes on ultrasound or nuclear medicine scans.

name: Toxic Multinodular Goiter (Toxic MNG)
definition: A condition of the thyroid gland with multiple hyperactive nodules producing excessive thyroid hormones. Radiologically characterized by multiple nodular changes on ultrasound or nuclear medicine scans.

name: Toxic nodule
definition: An autonomous functioning thyroid nodule that produces excessive thyroid hormones, typically appearing as a hyperfunctioning nodule on nuclear medicine thyroid scans.

name: Toxoplasmosis
definition: Parasitic infection caused by Toxoplasma gondii that can affect multiple organ systems. In radiology, it is characterized by distinctive calcifications and potential brain lesions on imaging studies.

name: Tracheal stenosis
definition: Abnormal narrowing of the trachea that can be visualized on CT and X-ray imaging. Often results from scarring, inflammation, or external compression.

name: Tracheobronchial Injury
definition: Traumatic damage to the trachea and bronchial tree, typically identified through CT scans and chest imaging. Can involve tears, ruptures, or structural disruptions.

name: Transient Epileptic Amnesia
definition: Rare neurological condition characterized by transient memory loss, typically identified through neuroimaging studies that rule out other potential causes.

name: Transient Global Amnesia
definition: Sudden, temporary episode of memory loss with no identifiable cause, typically evaluated through neuroimaging to exclude other pathologies.

name: Transient Global Amnesia (TGA)
definition: Sudden, temporary episode of memory loss with no identifiable cause, typically evaluated through neuroimaging to exclude other pathologies.

name: Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA)
definition: Brief interruption of blood flow to the brain, detectable through various neuroimaging techniques. Characterized by temporary neurological symptoms without permanent brain damage.

name: Transient osteoporosis of the hip
definition: Temporary bone density reduction in the hip joint, typically identified through MRI and radiographic imaging. Characterized by localized bone marrow edema and potential bone changes.

name: Transient spinal cord injury
definition: Temporary neurological dysfunction affecting the spinal cord, typically evaluated through MRI to assess potential structural changes or inflammation.

name: Transient Tachypnea of the Newborn (TTN)
definition: Temporary respiratory condition in newborns characterized by rapid breathing, typically identified through chest radiographs showing mild lung fluid retention.

name: Transient Tachypnea of the Newborn (TTN) / Wet Lung
definition: Temporary respiratory condition in newborns characterized by rapid breathing, typically identified through chest radiographs showing mild lung fluid retention.

name: Transition zone
definition: A radiological region representing the interface between normal and abnormal tissue, often used to characterize tumor margins or pathological changes.

name: Transitional cell carcinoma (TCC)
definition: Malignant tumor originating in the transitional epithelium, commonly found in the urinary tract and visualized through various imaging modalities like CT and ultrasound.

name: Transitional Cell Carcinoma (Urothelial Carcinoma)
definition: Malignant tumor originating in the transitional epithelium, commonly found in the urinary tract and visualized through various imaging modalities like CT and ultrasound.

name: Translational Instability
definition: Abnormal movement or displacement of anatomical structures, typically assessed through imaging to evaluate potential joint or skeletal instability.

name: Transmesenteric Hernia
definition: Rare type of internal hernia occurring through the mesentery, typically identified through CT scans as an abnormal bowel loop protrusion.

name: Transposition of Great Arteries (TGA)
definition: Congenital heart defect where the two main arteries leaving the heart are reversed from their normal anatomical position. Radiological imaging helps diagnose and assess the structural abnormality.

name: Transverse Ligament Rupture
definition: Disruption of the transverse ligament of the atlas, which can cause significant cervical spine instability. Radiographic imaging is crucial for detecting and assessing the extent of ligamentous injury.

name: Transverse Myelitis
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting the spinal cord, causing neurological symptoms. Radiological techniques like MRI are essential for visualizing spinal cord inflammation and lesions.

name: Transverse Myelitis (TM)
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting the spinal cord, causing neurological symptoms. Radiological techniques like MRI are essential for visualizing spinal cord inflammation and lesions.

name: Transverse Temporal Bone Fracture
definition: A type of temporal bone fracture that runs horizontally across the bone. Radiographic imaging is critical for identifying and characterizing the fracture pattern.

name: Trauma
definition: Physical injury or damage to body tissues caused by external force. Radiological imaging helps assess the extent and nature of traumatic injuries.

name: Trauma (Blunt/Penetrating)
definition: Physical injury caused by either blunt force or penetrating objects. Radiological techniques are used to evaluate the specific type and extent of tissue damage.

name: Traumatic Adrenal Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within the adrenal gland resulting from significant physical trauma. CT and MRI are primary imaging modalities for detecting and characterizing the hemorrhage.

name: Traumatic Bile Duct Injury
definition: Damage to the bile duct caused by physical trauma. Radiological imaging helps identify the location and extent of the injury.

name: Traumatic Brain Injury
definition: Disruption of normal brain function due to external physical force. Neuroimaging techniques like CT and MRI are crucial for assessing brain damage and complications.

name: Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)
definition: Disruption of normal brain function due to external physical force. Neuroimaging techniques like CT and MRI are crucial for assessing brain damage and complications.

name: Traumatic fracture
definition: Bone break resulting from significant external force or impact. Radiographic imaging is essential for diagnosing and characterizing the fracture.

name: Traumatic Fractures
definition: Bone breaks resulting from significant external force or impact. Radiographic imaging is essential for diagnosing and characterizing the fractures.

name: Traumatic Globe Rupture
definition: Severe eye injury involving complete or partial disruption of the eye's outer wall. Radiological imaging helps assess the extent of ocular damage.

name: Traumatic Hemorrhagic Contusions
definition: Brain tissue bruising caused by significant physical trauma. CT and MRI are critical for identifying and evaluating the location and severity of these lesions.

name: Traumatic pseudoaneurysms
definition: A localized, blood-filled outpouching of a blood vessel wall caused by trauma, which appears as a focal vascular abnormality on imaging studies. These pseudoaneurysms can rupture and are typically detected using CT or ultrasound.

name: Traumatic SAH
definition: Bleeding into the subarachnoid space resulting from head trauma, characterized by blood distribution around the brain's surface on CT or MRI scans. Often indicates significant intracranial injury and potential neurological complications.

name: Traumatic vertebral fracture
definition: A fracture involving the vertebral body caused by significant mechanical force or trauma, typically visualized on X-ray, CT, or MRI with characteristic bone disruption, displacement, or compression.

name: Triangular Fibrocartilage Complex (TFCC) Tear
definition: A complex soft tissue injury involving the wrist's fibrocartilage stabilizing structure, typically detected through MRI with signs of tear, degeneration, or structural disruption.

name: Tricuspid Atresia
definition: A congenital heart defect characterized by the absence of the tricuspid valve, resulting in abnormal blood flow between the right atrium and right ventricle, typically diagnosed through echocardiography and cardiac imaging.

name: Tricuspid Regurgitation (TR)
definition: A cardiac condition where the tricuspid valve does not close properly, allowing blood to flow backward from the right ventricle to the right atrium, typically identified through echocardiographic imaging.

name: Trilateral Retinoblastoma
definition: A rare, aggressive form of retinoblastoma involving bilateral retinal tumors and an additional midline brain tumor, typically diagnosed through comprehensive neuroimaging techniques.

name: Triplane Ankle Fracture
definition: A complex ankle fracture involving three distinct fracture planes, typically seen in adolescents and diagnosed through multi-view radiographic imaging or CT scans.

name: True vascular stenosis
definition: A genuine narrowing of a blood vessel's lumen caused by pathological changes, identifiable through angiographic imaging techniques showing significant vessel diameter reduction.

name: TRUS
definition: Transrectal ultrasound, a diagnostic imaging technique that uses high-frequency sound waves to visualize the prostate, rectum, and surrounding structures. Commonly used in prostate cancer screening and evaluation.

name: TSH-receptor antibody mediated hyperthyroidism
definition: An autoimmune thyroid condition characterized by excessive thyroid hormone production due to TSH-receptor antibodies, typically evaluated through thyroid imaging and hormonal studies.

name: TTE
definition: Transthoracic echocardiography, a non-invasive ultrasound technique used to examine the heart's structure, function, and blood flow through the chest wall.

name: Tubal spasm
definition: A temporary, involuntary contraction of the fallopian tube causing temporary narrowing, typically observed during hysterosalpingography or other reproductive imaging studies.

name: Tuberculosis
definition: An infectious disease caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, characterized by granulomatous lesions in various organs, typically identified through chest radiography, CT, or specialized imaging techniques.

name: Tuberculosis (TB Peritonitis)
definition: A form of tuberculosis affecting the peritoneal cavity, characterized by inflammatory changes and potential adhesions, typically diagnosed through abdominal CT or ultrasound imaging.

name: Tuberculosis Sequelae
definition: Radiographic evidence of previous tuberculosis infection, including calcified lymph nodes, lung scarring, or other residual structural changes from past TB disease.

name: Tuberous Sclerosis
definition: A genetic disorder characterized by benign tumor growth in multiple organ systems, typically identified through comprehensive imaging studies showing characteristic hamartomatous lesions in brain, kidneys, and other tissues.

name: Tuberous Sclerosis Complex (TSC)
definition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by benign tumor growth in multiple organ systems, with distinctive radiological findings including cortical tubers, subependymal nodules, and renal angiomyolipomas. Imaging plays a crucial role in diagnosis and monitoring of disease progression.

name: Tuberous Sclerosis Complex (TSC)-associated Angiomyolipoma (AML)
definition: A benign renal tumor associated with Tuberous Sclerosis Complex, composed of blood vessels, smooth muscle, and fat cells. Radiologically characterized by a classic triad of components with distinctive appearance on CT and MRI.

name: Tubo-ovarian Abscess
definition: A serious inflammatory condition involving the fallopian tube and ovary, typically presenting as a complex fluid collection with potential abscess formation. Radiological findings include complex adnexal masses with irregular walls and internal septations.

name: Tubo-ovarian abscess (TOA)
definition: A serious inflammatory condition involving the fallopian tube and ovary, typically presenting as a complex fluid collection with potential abscess formation. Radiological findings include complex adnexal masses with irregular walls and internal septations.

name: Tumefactive demyelination
definition: A rare inflammatory demyelinating condition characterized by large, mass-like lesions in the brain that mimic tumors. Radiologically presents as a large, solitary demyelinating lesion with significant mass effect and potential enhancement.

name: Tumefactive Demyelination (Tumefactive Multiple Sclerosis)
definition: A rare inflammatory demyelinating condition characterized by large, mass-like lesions in the brain that mimic tumors. Radiologically presents as a large, solitary demyelinating lesion with significant mass effect and potential enhancement.

name: Tumefactive MS
definition: A rare inflammatory demyelinating condition characterized by large, mass-like lesions in the brain that mimic tumors. Radiologically presents as a large, solitary demyelinating lesion with significant mass effect and potential enhancement.

name: Tumor
definition: An abnormal mass of tissue characterized by uncontrolled cell growth, which can be benign or malignant. Radiological evaluation involves assessing size, location, margins, enhancement patterns, and potential metastatic spread.

name: Tumor-related Adrenal Hemorrhage
definition: A hemorrhagic condition occurring within an adrenal mass, characterized by internal bleeding and potential complications. Radiologically identified by heterogeneous appearance and signal changes on imaging studies.

name: Tumor (Glioblastoma)
definition: An aggressive primary brain tumor with high malignancy, characterized by rapid growth, necrosis, and irregular margins. Radiologically presents as a heterogeneous mass with central necrosis and significant surrounding edema.

name: Tumor (primary or metastatic)
definition: A neoplastic growth that can originate within an organ or metastasize from another site, requiring comprehensive radiological evaluation to determine origin, extent, and potential treatment approach.

name: Tumor Recurrence
definition: The reappearance of a previously treated tumor, detectable through imaging studies showing new or enlarging lesions in the original tumor site or adjacent regions.

name: Tumor with cystic/necrotic components
definition: A tumor characterized by areas of fluid-filled or necrotic regions within its structure, typically indicating advanced disease or aggressive growth. Radiologically identified by heterogeneous appearance with distinct cystic or necrotic components.

name: Tumor with necrosis
definition: A tumor exhibiting areas of cell death and tissue breakdown, often indicating aggressive biological behavior. Radiologically characterized by heterogeneous appearance with non-enhancing central regions.

name: Tumoral Calcinosis
definition: A rare disorder characterized by massive calcium deposits in soft tissues near joints, typically around the hips and shoulders. Radiologically presents as large, well-defined calcific masses adjacent to joints.

name: Tumors
definition: Abnormal mass of tissue where cells grow and divide uncontrollably, appearing as distinct lesions on imaging studies. Tumors can be benign or malignant and are characterized by their size, shape, and enhancement patterns on radiological scans.

name: Tumors (DNET, Ganglioglioma)
definition: Rare, benign brain tumor typically occurring in children and young adults, characterized by slow growth and mixed neuronal and glial cell components. On imaging, these tumors often appear as well-defined, low-grade lesions with distinctive radiographic features.

name: Tumors (e.g., Glioma)
definition: Primary brain tumor originating from glial cells, appearing as infiltrative lesions on neuroimaging with variable contrast enhancement and signal characteristics. Gliomas range from low-grade to high-grade malignancies with distinct radiological presentations.

name: Tumors (General)
definition: Abnormal tissue growths characterized by uncontrolled cell proliferation, detectable through various imaging modalities. Tumors can be classified based on their location, size, and radiographic appearance.

name: Tumors (general, oncology)
definition: Pathological tissue growths studied in oncology, identifiable through multiple imaging techniques such as CT, MRI, and PET scans. Tumors are evaluated for size, location, metastasis, and potential malignancy.

name: Turcot Syndrome (Type 1)
definition: Rare genetic syndrome associated with colorectal polyposis and brain tumors, characterized by specific genetic mutations detectable through genetic and radiological screening.

name: Turcot Syndrome (Type 2)
definition: Genetic disorder characterized by colorectal cancer predisposition and brain tumor development, identifiable through genetic testing and advanced imaging techniques.

name: TVUS
definition: Transvaginal ultrasound, a diagnostic imaging method using a probe inserted into the vagina to visualize pelvic organs, including the uterus, ovaries, and surrounding structures.

name: Typhlitis (Neutropenic Colitis)
definition: Inflammatory condition of the cecum typically occurring in immunocompromised patients, characterized by wall thickening, edema, and potential complications visible on CT and ultrasound imaging.

name: UGI
definition: Upper Gastrointestinal series, a radiographic examination of the esophagus, stomach, and upper small intestine using contrast material to visualize structural and functional abnormalities.

name: Ulcerative Colitis
definition: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting the colon, characterized by continuous mucosal inflammation detectable through endoscopy and imaging studies like CT and MRI.

name: Ulnar Collateral Ligament (UCL) Injury
definition: Ligament damage in the elbow's medial collateral complex, typically seen in overhead throwing athletes, detectable through MRI and ultrasound imaging.

name: Ulnar impaction syndrome
definition: Degenerative condition of the wrist causing ulnar-sided pain, characterized by abnormal ulnar head articulation and cartilage changes visible on radiographic imaging.

name: Ulnar Impaction Syndrome (Wrist)
definition: Degenerative wrist condition involving abnormal ulnar head loading and joint changes, detectable through radiographic and advanced imaging techniques.

name: Ulnar neuritis
definition: Inflammation of the ulnar nerve causing pain and potential compression, identifiable through electromyography and advanced imaging techniques.

name: Ulnar Neuropathy
definition: Compression or damage to the ulnar nerve causing sensory and motor dysfunction, detectable through electrodiagnostic studies and advanced imaging.

name: Ultrasonography
definition: A diagnostic imaging technique using high-frequency sound waves to create real-time images of internal body structures. Provides non-invasive, radiation-free visualization of organs and tissues.

name: Ultrasound
definition: A medical imaging technique using high-frequency sound waves to produce visual images of internal body structures. Provides real-time, non-invasive diagnostic information.

name: Ultrasound (Duplex Doppler)
definition: An ultrasound technique that combines traditional imaging with Doppler flow measurements to assess blood flow, velocity, and direction in blood vessels.

name: Ultrasound (US)
definition: A non-invasive imaging technique using high-frequency sound waves to visualize internal body structures in real-time. Provides dynamic imaging with no radiation exposure.

name: Ultrasound (US) or CT
definition: Two complementary cross-sectional imaging modalities using different technologies to visualize internal body structures. CT uses X-rays, while ultrasound uses sound waves.

name: Ultrasound Features for Diverticulitis
definition: Specific ultrasound characteristics indicating diverticular inflammation, including bowel wall thickening, pericolonic fat stranding, and potential abscess formation.

name: Ultrasound, Mammography
definition: Imaging techniques used for breast evaluation, with ultrasound providing dynamic soft tissue assessment and mammography offering detailed breast tissue visualization.

name: Ultrasound, MRI
definition: Advanced cross-sectional imaging techniques using different technologies: ultrasound for real-time soft tissue visualization and MRI for detailed anatomical and functional imaging.

name: Ultrasound/CT/MRI
definition: Comprehensive cross-sectional imaging approach utilizing multiple modalities to provide comprehensive diagnostic information about internal body structures.

name: Ultrasound/Venography
definition: Imaging techniques combining ultrasound with venography to evaluate venous structures and blood flow characteristics.

name: Uncal Herniation
definition: A severe form of brain herniation where the medial temporal lobe (uncus) is displaced through the tentorial notch, causing compression of brainstem structures and critical neurovascular pathways. Radiologically characterized by midline shift and compression of midbrain and posterior cerebral structures.

name: Uncomplicated Diverticulitis
definition: Inflammatory condition of diverticula in the colon without significant complications such as abscess or perforation. Radiologically appears as localized wall thickening and inflammatory changes in the colonic wall without extensive pericolonic inflammation.

name: Undifferentiated Pleomorphic Sarcoma
definition: A rare, aggressive soft tissue sarcoma with no specific cellular differentiation, characterized by pleomorphic cellular appearance. Radiologically presents as a large, heterogeneous soft tissue mass with variable contrast enhancement and potential areas of necrosis.

name: Undifferentiated Spondyloarthritis
definition: A group of inflammatory rheumatic diseases affecting the spine and sacroiliac joints with unclear specific classification. Radiologically characterized by inflammatory changes in the spine, sacroiliac joints, and potential syndesmophyte formation.

name: Unilateral brain tumor
definition: A brain tumor located on one side of the brain, not crossing the midline. Radiologically identified as a focal mass with distinct borders, showing characteristic signal changes and potential mass effect on adjacent brain structures.

name: UPJ obstruction
definition: Blockage or narrowing at the junction between the renal pelvis and ureter, impeding urine drainage from the kidney. Radiologically characterized by hydronephrosis, dilated renal pelvis, and potential parenchymal thinning.

name: UPJ Obstruction (Ureteropelvic Junction Obstruction)
definition: Blockage or narrowing at the junction between the renal pelvis and ureter, impeding urine drainage from the kidney. Radiologically characterized by hydronephrosis, dilated renal pelvis, and potential parenchymal thinning.

name: Upper GI Bleed
definition: Gastrointestinal bleeding originating from the upper digestive tract, including esophagus, stomach, and duodenum. Radiologically evaluated using contrast studies, CT angiography, or nuclear medicine techniques to localize bleeding source.

name: Upper GI Bleeding
definition: Gastrointestinal bleeding originating from the upper digestive tract, including esophagus, stomach, and duodenum. Radiologically evaluated using contrast studies, CT angiography, or nuclear medicine techniques to localize bleeding source.

name: Upper GI Bleeding (UGIB)
definition: Gastrointestinal bleeding originating from the upper digestive tract, including esophagus, stomach, and duodenum. Radiologically evaluated using contrast studies, CT angiography, or nuclear medicine techniques to localize bleeding source.

name: Upper GI Series
definition: Radiographic examination of the upper gastrointestinal tract using contrast material to visualize the esophagus, stomach, and proximal small intestine.

name: Ureteral Obstruction
definition: Blockage or narrowing in the ureter preventing normal urine flow from kidney to bladder. Radiologically characterized by hydroureteronephrosis, potential stone or stricture visualization, and altered urinary tract morphology.

name: Ureteral Stones
definition: Calcified deposits forming within the ureter, causing potential obstruction and urinary tract complications. Radiologically identified using CT, ultrasound, or X-ray with characteristic dense calcific opacities.

name: Ureteral Stricture
definition: Narrowing or scarring of the ureter limiting normal urine passage. Radiologically characterized by focal or segmental narrowing, potential wall thickening, and altered ureteral caliber.

name: Ureteral Stricture (Malignant)
definition: Severe ureteral narrowing caused by malignant tumor invasion or progression. Radiologically presents as irregular, asymmetric stricture with potential mass effect and surrounding tissue infiltration.

name: Ureteritis cystica
definition: Rare inflammatory condition of the ureter characterized by cystic changes in the mucosal lining. Radiologically appears as multiple small, round, intraluminal filling defects within the ureteral wall.

name: Ureterocele
definition: A congenital urinary tract abnormality where the ureter dilates and herniates into the bladder, often appearing as a cystic dilation on imaging studies. Radiologically, it can be detected through ultrasound, CT, or voiding cystourethrogram.

name: Ureteropelvic junction (UPJ) obstruction
definition: A blockage at the junction between the renal pelvis and ureter, typically causing hydronephrosis and reduced kidney function. Radiological imaging like CT and ultrasound can help diagnose and assess the severity of the obstruction.

name: Ureteropelvic junction obstruction
definition: A blockage at the junction between the renal pelvis and ureter, typically causing hydronephrosis and reduced kidney function. Radiological imaging like CT and ultrasound can help diagnose and assess the severity of the obstruction.

name: Urethral Cancer
definition: A rare malignant tumor originating in the urethra, detectable through various imaging techniques like CT, MRI, and PET scans. Radiological evaluation helps in staging and treatment planning.

name: Urethral Stricture
definition: A narrowing of the urethra that can be visualized through imaging techniques like retrograde urethrography and CT scans. Radiological assessment helps determine the location, length, and severity of the stricture.

name: Urinary Obstruction
definition: A blockage in the urinary tract that impedes normal urine flow, detectable through various imaging modalities like ultrasound, CT, and X-ray. Radiological studies help identify the location and cause of obstruction.

name: Urinary tract activity (bladder, ureters)
definition: Evaluation of urinary system function and dynamics using nuclear medicine techniques like renal scintigraphy. Radiological assessment helps determine kidney function, drainage, and potential obstructions.

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
definition: A bacterial infection of the urinary tract, often detectable through imaging techniques like CT, ultrasound, and nuclear medicine studies. Radiological findings can help identify complications like abscess formation.

name: Urinoma
definition: A collection of urine outside the urinary tract, typically resulting from trauma or surgical complications. Radiological imaging like CT and ultrasound can help detect and characterize the urinoma.

name: Uroflowmetry
definition: Diagnostic test measuring urine flow rate and pattern to assess urinary tract and bladder function using specialized equipment.

name: Urolithiasis
definition: The presence of stones in the urinary tract, detectable through various imaging techniques like X-ray, CT, and ultrasound. Radiological studies help determine stone location, size, and composition.

name: Urolithiasis (Kidney Stones)
definition: The presence of stones in the urinary tract, detectable through various imaging techniques like X-ray, CT, and ultrasound. Radiological studies help determine stone location, size, and composition.

name: Urothelial Carcinoma
definition: A malignant tumor originating in the urothelial cells of the urinary tract, detectable through imaging techniques like CT, MRI, and cystoscopy. Radiological evaluation helps in staging and treatment planning.

name: Urothelial Carcinoma (UC)
definition: A malignant tumor originating in the urothelial cells of the urinary tract, detectable through imaging techniques like CT, MRI, and cystoscopy. Radiological evaluation helps in staging and treatment planning.

name: US
definition: Non-invasive imaging technique using high-frequency sound waves to visualize internal body structures in real-time.

name: US (but insensitive)
definition: Ultrasound imaging with limited diagnostic sensitivity, requiring additional confirmatory imaging techniques.

name: US (Doppler)
definition: Specialized ultrasound technique measuring blood flow direction and velocity using frequency shift of reflected sound waves.

name: US (first in pregnancy)
definition: Primary imaging modality for early pregnancy assessment, providing real-time visualization of fetal development and maternal reproductive structures.

name: US (for <30), Mammography + US (for >=40)
definition: Age-specific breast imaging strategy using ultrasound for younger patients and combined mammography with ultrasound for older patients.

name: US (initially), XR (after 4-6 months), MRI (complex cases)
definition: Staged imaging approach using multiple modalities to progressively evaluate and diagnose specific medical conditions.

name: US (Penile Doppler)
definition: Specialized ultrasound technique evaluating penile blood flow and vascular characteristics, often used in erectile dysfunction assessment.

name: US (prenatal), XR (postnatal)
definition: Ultrasound used for prenatal imaging to assess fetal development and health. X-ray used for postnatal skeletal and chest imaging after birth.

name: US (TCD)
definition: Transcranial Doppler ultrasound used to evaluate blood flow in cerebral arteries and assess potential neurological conditions.

name: US Elastography
definition: Advanced ultrasound technique that measures tissue stiffness to help diagnose liver fibrosis, tumors, and other soft tissue abnormalities.

name: US, MRI
definition: Complementary imaging modalities used to provide detailed anatomical and functional information across different body systems.

name: US, NM
definition: Combination of ultrasound and nuclear medicine imaging techniques for functional and anatomical assessment.

name: US/CT/MRI
definition: Comprehensive imaging approach using multiple modalities to provide comprehensive diagnostic information.

name: US/Mammography
definition: Specialized imaging techniques for breast evaluation combining ultrasound and mammographic technologies.

name: Usual Ductal Hyperplasia
definition: A benign proliferative condition of breast ducts, characterized by increased number of cell layers. Radiological imaging helps in differentiating from other breast lesions.

name: Uterine Adenomyosis
definition: A benign condition where endometrial-like tissue grows into the muscular wall of the uterus, detectable through imaging techniques like ultrasound and MRI. Radiological studies help assess the extent and impact of the condition.

name: Uterine Fibroids
definition: Benign smooth muscle tumors of the uterus that appear as well-defined masses on imaging. Radiographically characterized by distinct borders and variable signal intensity on MRI.

name: Uterine Fibroids (Leiomyomas)
definition: Benign smooth muscle tumors of the uterus that appear as well-defined masses on imaging. Radiographically characterized by distinct borders and variable signal intensity on MRI.

name: Uterine Sarcoma
definition: Rare malignant tumors of the uterus originating from connective tissue, appearing as heterogeneous masses with irregular borders and potential areas of necrosis on imaging.

name: Valve calcification
definition: Abnormal deposition of calcium in heart valve leaflets, appearing as dense, bright areas on radiographic imaging that indicate structural valve changes.

name: Valve Pathology
definition: Structural and functional abnormalities of heart valves detected through imaging techniques, revealing morphological changes and potential hemodynamic disruptions.

name: Valvular disease
definition: Structural and functional abnormalities of heart valves detected through imaging techniques, revealing morphological changes and potential hemodynamic disruptions.

name: Valvular Heart Disease
definition: Comprehensive cardiac condition involving structural and functional valve abnormalities, characterized by imaging findings of valve deformities, stenosis, or regurgitation.

name: Variant Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease (vCJD)
definition: Rare, fatal neurodegenerative prion disease with potential neuroimaging findings of brain atrophy and signal changes in specific brain regions.

name: Variceal Hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding from dilated veins in the gastrointestinal tract, typically identified through endoscopic or radiographic visualization of abnormal vascular structures.

name: Varices
definition: Abnormally dilated veins visible on imaging, typically appearing as tortuous, enlarged vascular structures in specific anatomical regions.

name: Varicocele
definition: Abnormal dilation of veins in the pampiniform venous plexus of the testicle, appearing as tortuous, dilated vessels on ultrasound imaging.

name: Varies depending on cancer type
definition: Imaging modalities selected based on specific cancer type, location, and diagnostic requirements.

name: Vascular calcification
definition: Abnormal calcium deposits within blood vessel walls, appearing as dense, bright areas on radiographic imaging indicating arterial wall changes.

name: Vascular Calcifications (Atherosclerosis/Mnckeberg sclerosis)
definition: Pathological calcium deposition in blood vessel walls, representing different types of arterial calcification with distinct radiographic characteristics.

name: Vascular Complications (Post-operative)
definition: Potential adverse vascular events occurring after surgical procedures, detectable through various imaging modalities revealing thrombosis, stenosis, or other vascular alterations.

name: Vascular Dementia
definition: Cognitive decline resulting from reduced blood flow to brain regions, characterized by neuroimaging findings of multiple small vessel infarcts and white matter changes.

name: Vascular Dementia (VaD)
definition: A type of dementia caused by reduced blood flow to the brain, characterized by progressive cognitive decline due to multiple small vessel strokes or ischemic changes. Radiologically identified through brain imaging showing multiple infarcts, white matter changes, and cerebrovascular pathology.

name: Vascular disease
definition: Pathological conditions affecting blood vessels, including arterial and venous abnormalities that can cause narrowing, blockage, or structural changes. Radiological evaluation typically involves CT, MRI, and angiographic techniques to assess vessel morphology and blood flow.

name: Vascular Dissection
definition: Separation or tearing of a blood vessel wall, which can occur spontaneously or due to trauma. Radiological diagnosis involves cross-sectional imaging to identify vessel wall disruption and potential complications.

name: Vascular Graft Infection
