definition: Infection occurring in surgically implanted vascular grafts, characterized by inflammatory changes and potential graft compromise. Radiological assessment includes identifying signs of infection, fluid collections, and potential graft failure.

name: Vascular Injury
definition: Damage to blood vessels resulting from trauma, causing potential vessel rupture, occlusion, or pseudoaneurysm formation. Radiological evaluation uses contrast-enhanced imaging to assess vessel integrity and potential complications.

name: Vascular Malformation
definition: Abnormal development of blood vessels characterized by structural irregularities in vessel formation. Radiological diagnosis involves detailed vascular imaging to characterize the malformation's morphology and potential hemodynamic effects.

name: Vascular Malformations (AVMs, Cavernomas)
definition: Abnormal vascular structures including arteriovenous malformations (AVMs) and cavernous malformations, characterized by atypical vessel connections and potential hemorrhagic risk. Radiological assessment uses specialized angiographic and cross-sectional imaging techniques.

name: Vascular Parkinsonism
definition: A form of parkinsonism caused by cerebrovascular disease, characterized by motor symptoms resulting from multiple small vessel brain infarcts. Radiological findings include multiple ischemic changes and white matter lesions.

name: Vascular Stenosis (mimicked)
definition: Potential misrepresentation of vessel narrowing on imaging, requiring careful differential diagnosis and multiple imaging modalities to confirm true stenotic changes.

name: Vascular Stenosis/Occlusion
definition: Narrowing or complete blockage of blood vessels, identified through radiological techniques showing reduced vessel diameter or complete vessel obstruction. Typically assessed using CT, MRI, and angiographic imaging.

name: Vasculitis
definition: Inflammatory condition affecting blood vessel walls, causing vessel wall thickening, potential narrowing, and altered vessel morphology. Radiological diagnosis involves detailed vascular imaging to characterize inflammatory changes.

name: Vasospasm
definition: Sudden, transient constriction of blood vessels causing reduced blood flow. Radiologically identified through dynamic imaging showing vessel diameter changes and potential hemodynamic alterations.

name: Vasospasm (following Subarachnoid Hemorrhage)
definition: Pathological vessel constriction occurring after subarachnoid hemorrhage, potentially causing secondary ischemic complications. Radiological monitoring involves serial angiographic assessments to track vessel diameter changes.

name: VCUG
definition: Voiding cystourethrogram, a radiographic examination of bladder and urethra during urination to assess structural abnormalities.

name: VCUG (for VUR)
definition: Specialized VCUG technique focused on detecting and evaluating vesicoureteral reflux in pediatric patients.

name: Vein of Galen Malformation (VGAM)
definition: Rare congenital vascular malformation involving the vein of Galen, characterized by abnormal arteriovenous connections. Radiological diagnosis requires specialized pediatric neuroimaging techniques.

name: Veno-occlusive Disease (VOD)
definition: Pathological condition causing progressive vessel occlusion, typically affecting hepatic or pulmonary vasculature. Radiological assessment involves detailed vascular imaging to characterize vessel changes.

name: Venography
definition: Radiographic technique using contrast agents to visualize veins and detect potential vascular abnormalities.

name: Venography/CT/MRI
definition: Comprehensive vascular imaging approach combining multiple modalities for detailed evaluation of venous structures.

name: Venous angioma
definition: A rare vascular malformation characterized by abnormal venous vessel clustering, typically appearing as a focal collection of dilated veins on imaging studies. Radiologically, these are often incidental findings with minimal clinical significance.

name: Venous Disease (DVT)
definition: A blood clot formation within a deep vein, typically in the legs, visible on imaging studies such as ultrasound or CT venography. Characterized by vessel wall thickening, luminal narrowing, and potential clot visualization.

name: Venous Edema
definition: Fluid accumulation in soft tissues due to impaired venous drainage, appearing as increased soft tissue density and potential tissue swelling on radiographic images. Often associated with venous obstruction or insufficiency.

name: Venous insufficiency
definition: A condition where veins struggle to return blood to the heart, characterized by impaired venous valve function and retrograde blood flow. Radiologically evident through dilated veins, reflux, and potential collateral vessel formation.

name: Venous Malformation (VM)
definition: A congenital vascular anomaly characterized by abnormal venous vessel development and potential malformation, typically appearing as irregular, dilated venous structures on imaging studies.

name: Venous Sinus Thrombosis (VST)
definition: A thrombotic condition affecting the cerebral venous sinuses, visible on MRI or CT as vessel wall enhancement, filling defects, or potential hemorrhagic changes within the dural venous sinuses.

name: Venous stenosis
definition: Narrowing of a venous vessel, typically observed on imaging as reduced vessel diameter, wall thickening, or luminal compromise. Can be detected through various radiographic techniques.

name: Venous Stenosis (Hemodialysis Access)
definition: Narrowing of vascular access sites used for hemodialysis, typically identified through ultrasound or angiographic imaging. Characterized by reduced vessel diameter and potential flow limitations.

name: Venous Stenosis or Occlusion
definition: Partial or complete blockage of a venous vessel, observable through imaging as vessel narrowing, complete occlusion, or altered blood flow patterns.

name: Venous Thromboembolism (VTE)
definition: A condition involving blood clot formation that can travel through the venous system, potentially causing pulmonary embolism or other systemic complications. Detectable through various imaging modalities.

name: Venous thrombosis (DVT, portal vein thrombosis)
definition: Formation of a blood clot within a vein, potentially occurring in various anatomical locations. Radiologically characterized by vessel wall changes, luminal narrowing, and potential clot visualization.

name: Ventricular Dysfunction
definition: Impaired heart ventricle performance, observable through cardiac imaging techniques like echocardiography or cardiac MRI. Characterized by reduced ejection fraction and potential structural changes.

name: Ventricular pacing
definition: Electrical stimulation of heart ventricles through an artificial pacemaker, detectable through cardiac imaging and electrical monitoring techniques.

name: Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD)
definition: A congenital heart defect involving an abnormal opening in the wall separating the heart's ventricles, visible through echocardiography or cardiac imaging techniques.

name: Ventriculomegaly
definition: Abnormal enlargement of the brain's ventricles, typically observed through CT or MRI neuroimaging. Can indicate various neurological conditions or developmental abnormalities.

name: Vertebral Artery Dissection
definition: A tear in the inner lining of the vertebral artery wall causing blood to enter and separate the arterial wall layers. On imaging, this appears as a focal narrowing, dissection flap, or pseudoaneurysm formation.

name: Vertebral body fracture with nonunion
definition: A vertebral body fracture that fails to heal properly, resulting in incomplete bone union and potential ongoing structural instability. Radiographically characterized by persistent fracture line and lack of bone bridging.

name: Vertebral Compression Fracture (VCF)
definition: A fracture of the vertebral body caused by osteoporosis, trauma, or metastatic disease, resulting in vertebral height loss and potential anterior wedging. Typically seen on X-ray, CT, and MRI as vertebral body collapse.

name: Vertebral Hemangiomas
definition: Benign vascular tumors within vertebral bodies characterized by increased vascularity and signal intensity changes on MRI. Typically appear as expansile, well-defined lesions with characteristic signal characteristics.

name: Vertebral Metastases
definition: Cancerous lesions that have spread to vertebral bones from primary tumors elsewhere in the body. Radiographically appear as destructive, often multiple lesions with variable enhancement and potential pathological fractures.

name: Vertebral Osteomyelitis
definition: Infectious inflammation of the vertebral bone and bone marrow, typically caused by bacterial infection. Radiographically characterized by vertebral body destruction, disc space involvement, and potential abscess formation.

name: Vertebral subluxation
definition: Abnormal displacement or misalignment of vertebral bodies relative to each other, potentially causing neurological compromise. Radiographically identified through misalignment and altered joint relationships.

name: Vesicoureteral reflux (VUR)
definition: Abnormal backward flow of urine from bladder to ureters or kidneys, potentially causing recurrent infections. Diagnosed through specialized radiographic studies like voiding cystourethrogram.

name: Vestibular Schwannoma
definition: Benign tumor arising from Schwann cells of the vestibular nerve, typically located in the cerebellopontine angle. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, contrast-enhancing mass near the internal auditory canal.

name: Vestibular Schwannoma (Acoustic Neuroma)
definition: Benign tumor arising from Schwann cells of the vestibular nerve, typically located in the cerebellopontine angle. Radiographically appears as a well-defined, contrast-enhancing mass near the internal auditory canal.

name: Villous Adenoma
definition: Benign epithelial tumor of the colon mucosa with finger-like projections. On imaging, may appear as a soft tissue mass with potential surface irregularities.

name: VIPoma
definition: Rare pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor producing excessive vasoactive intestinal peptide. Radiographically may appear as a pancreatic mass with potential metastatic spread.

name: Viral Hepatitis
definition: Inflammatory liver disease caused by viral infection, characterized by hepatic parenchymal changes. Radiographically shows altered liver texture, potential nodularity, and variable enhancement patterns.

name: Viral Meningitis
definition: Inflammation of the meninges caused by viral infection. Radiographically may show subtle leptomeningeal enhancement and potential cerebrospinal fluid changes.

name: Virilizing/Feminizing Tumors
definition: Endocrine tumors causing abnormal sex hormone production leading to masculinization or feminization. Radiographically identified as masses in endocrine organs with potential metastatic spread.

name: Vital Signs
definition: Basic physiological measurements including heart rate, blood pressure, temperature, and respiratory rate.

name: Volvulus
definition: A twisting of the intestine around its mesenteric axis, causing obstruction and potential vascular compromise. Radiologically characterized by a distinctive 'whirlpool sign' on imaging studies.

name: Volvulus (cecal/midgut)
definition: Specific type of volvulus involving the cecum or midgut, causing intestinal obstruction and potential ischemia. Characterized by a dilated, twisted bowel segment on radiographic imaging.

name: Von Hippel-Lindau (VHL)
definition: Genetic syndrome characterized by multiple tumor types, including hemangioblastomas, renal cell carcinomas, and pheochromocytomas. Radiologically identified through multiple organ imaging for tumor detection.

name: von Hippel-Lindau (VHL) disease
definition: Inherited cancer syndrome with multiple tumor predispositions, detectable through comprehensive radiological screening of various organ systems. Characterized by multiple benign and malignant neoplasms.

name: VP Shunt Malfunction
definition: Malfunction of a ventriculoperitoneal shunt used to treat hydrocephalus, potentially causing increased intracranial pressure. Radiologically diagnosed through CT or MRI showing shunt displacement or obstruction.

name: Vulvar Cancer
definition: Malignant neoplasm of the vulvar region, detectable through imaging techniques like MRI and CT for staging and assessment of local invasion.

name: VUR
definition: Vesicoureteral reflux, a condition where urine flows backward from the bladder to the ureters or kidneys. Diagnosed through radiological studies like voiding cystourethrogram (VCUG).

name: Wartenberg syndrome
definition: Radial sensory nerve entrapment causing pain and sensory disturbances in the hand. Radiologically assessed to rule out other potential causes of neurological symptoms.

name: Warthin's tumor
definition: Benign salivary gland tumor typically found in the parotid gland, characterized by a distinctive appearance on imaging studies. Typically shows a well-circumscribed mass on CT or MRI.

name: Warthin tumor
definition: Benign salivary gland tumor typically found in the parotid gland, characterized by a distinctive appearance on imaging studies. Typically shows a well-circumscribed mass on CT or MRI.

name: Washout
definition: A dynamic imaging phenomenon where contrast material rapidly clears from a lesion, suggesting specific characteristics of vascularity or tumor metabolism.

name: Watershed Infarction
definition: Ischemic brain injury occurring at the border zones between major cerebral arterial territories. Radiologically identified through CT or MRI showing characteristic peripheral cortical infarctions.

name: Watershed Infarcts
definition: Ischemic brain injuries occurring at the border zones between major cerebral arterial territories. Radiologically identified through CT or MRI showing characteristic peripheral cortical infarctions.

name: Wear (Arthroplasty)
definition: Mechanical degradation of joint replacement components over time, detectable through radiographic imaging showing surface changes or material breakdown.

name: Wegener's Granulomatosis
definition: Systemic vasculitis affecting multiple organ systems, characterized by granulomatous inflammation. Radiologically identified through imaging of affected organs showing characteristic inflammatory changes.

name: Well-circumscribed mass
definition: A radiographic finding of a mass with clear, smooth, and distinct borders, typically suggesting a benign or less aggressive lesion.

name: Wernicke Encephalopathy (WE)
definition: Neurological disorder caused by thiamine deficiency, characterized by brain changes detectable on MRI, typically showing symmetric signal abnormalities in specific brain regions.

name: Westermark sign
definition: A radiographic sign indicating a region of decreased perfusion in the lung, often associated with pulmonary embolism.

name: Wilms tumor
definition: A rare pediatric kidney tumor originating from embryonic kidney tissue. Radiologically characterized by a heterogeneous renal mass with potential calcifications and variable contrast enhancement.

name: Wilms Tumor (Nephroblastoma)
definition: A rare pediatric kidney tumor originating from embryonic kidney tissue. Radiologically characterized by a heterogeneous renal mass with potential calcifications and variable contrast enhancement.

name: Wilson's disease
definition: A genetic disorder of copper metabolism causing abnormal copper accumulation in various organs. Radiologically may show liver cirrhosis, brain calcifications, and basal ganglia changes.

name: Wilson disease
definition: A genetic disorder of copper metabolism causing abnormal copper accumulation in various organs. Radiologically may show liver cirrhosis, brain calcifications, and basal ganglia changes.

name: Wormian bones
definition: Small irregular bones found within cranial sutures, representing additional ossification centers. Radiologically seen as extra osseous fragments within skull suture lines.

name: X-Linked Adrenoleukodystrophy (X-ALD)
definition: A rare X-linked genetic disorder causing progressive neurological deterioration and adrenal insufficiency. Radiologically characterized by cerebral white matter demyelination and adrenal gland changes.

name: X-ray
definition: Radiographic imaging technique using ionizing radiation to create two-dimensional images of internal body structures.

name: X-ray/CT
definition: Comprehensive radiographic approach combining traditional X-ray and computed tomography for enhanced diagnostic capabilities.

name: Xanthogranulomatous Pyelonephritis
definition: A rare, severe form of chronic kidney infection characterized by destructive inflammatory changes. Radiologically shows kidney enlargement, perinephric stranding, and potential gas formation.

name: XR
definition: Conventional radiography using X-rays to create two-dimensional images of internal body structures. Provides basic visualization of bones, lungs, and other anatomical regions.

name: XR (Digital Mammography)
definition: Specialized X-ray imaging technique focused on breast tissue examination. Uses digital technology to capture detailed breast images for cancer screening and diagnostic purposes.

name: XR (Fluoroscopy)
definition: Real-time X-ray imaging technique that allows continuous visualization of internal structures during a medical procedure. Enables dynamic observation of anatomical movement and interventional processes.

name: XR, Bone Scan
definition: Nuclear medicine imaging technique using radioactive tracers to detect bone metabolism, inflammation, or metastatic disease. Provides whole-body assessment of skeletal abnormalities.

name: XR, MRI
definition: Combination of X-ray and Magnetic Resonance Imaging for comprehensive diagnostic imaging. Provides complementary anatomical and soft tissue information.

name: XR/CT
definition: Integrated radiological approach combining X-ray and Computed Tomography for detailed anatomical visualization. Offers enhanced diagnostic capabilities across multiple imaging techniques.

name: XR/CT/MRI
definition: Comprehensive multi-modal imaging approach integrating X-ray, Computed Tomography, and Magnetic Resonance Imaging. Provides comprehensive diagnostic assessment using multiple imaging technologies.

name: Zika Virus
definition: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing potential neurological complications. Radiologically may show brain calcifications, microcephaly, and white matter abnormalities in congenital cases.

name: Zika Virus Infection
definition: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing potential neurological complications. Radiologically may show brain calcifications, microcephaly, and white matter abnormalities in congenital cases.
